story:
This is a documentary about America’s most popular sport: Football.

But its not about the men who play - its about the women - WOMEN WITH BALLS! 

From homicide detectives to correctional officers to CEOs and secretaries. This film will explore the underground world of women’s full contact football. 

Chronicled through a year on the gridiron with the D.C. DIVAS, we’ll witness the blood, sweat and tears as these fearless women battle for the 2015 Championship in the Women’s Football Alliance (the biggest league in America).

We’ll witness the sisterhood - on and off the field. 

We’ll witness the fights, the fallouts, the passion, the losers, and the winners. Plus a chorus of highly engaged coaches all gunning for a winner's ring. 

This film will be about EMPOWERMENT, community, EQUALITY and powerful women.

WOMEN WITH BALLS! 


This game is everything but powderpuff.

The DIVAS are more than just girls.

They’re WOMEN…WITH BALLS, leveling the playing field. 

ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS

Producer and Director ROBERT MAC is the Co-Creator and Executive Producer of Fat, Sick & Nearly Dead, a breakthrough health documentary that has reached an audience of more than 20 million people. 

He previously directed and produced The Small Poppies—a project commissioned by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation that chronicles the staging of a play created by Academy Award winning actor Geoffrey Rush—and several award-winning shorts, many of which have premiered at international film festivals, including Sundance and the Montreal Comedy Festival.

Joining this project as Executive Producer is actor and filmmaker Paul Blackthorne from the hit television series Arrow.  

Last fall Paul appeared in Dumb and Dumber To. His other credits include the Oscar-nominated epic sports drama Lagaan, The Dresden Files, Lipstick Jungle, and recurring roles in ER and 24. Paul’s directorial debut, the road trip documentary This American Journey was released in 2013. In the film Paul and Australian photographer Mister Basquali drive across America interviewing Americans they meet along the way about the state of the country and the future of the American Dream, ultimately exploring the question: what makes us truly happy?


ABOUT THE DIVAS

The D.C. DIVAS was founded in 2000, making it the third-longest running franchise in women’s football history after the Minnesota Vixen and the New York Sharks. The 2015 roster is comprised of women from hugely diverse backgrounds. While the average NFL player makes $1.9 million per year, these women play for nothing—but the love of the game.

For more information on the DC DIVAS and how you can support their 2015 season, please visit www.dcdivas.com.


ABOUT THE WFA

The Women’s Football Alliance (WFA) is the most competitive women’s football league in the United States. Over 40 of the nation’s strongest women’s football teams belong to the WFA—including the D.C. DIVAS—making it the biggest women’s football league in the world today.

Based in Exeter, California, the WFA is co-owned by the wife-and-husband team of Lisa and Jeff King. Lisa, a Forensic Psychologist by day, is a wide receiver for the Central Cal War Angels; Jeff, a teacher and football coach, is a former semi-pro football player who was inducted into the Minor League Football News Hall of Fame. 

Lisa was a kicker on Jeff’s semi-pro team when she learned about women playing football. They started the WFA with the goal of making the sport more competitive by lowering the league fees so that younger athletes could afford to play.

For more information on the WFA, please visit www.wfafootball.net.


PROJECT HISTORY

Last August, WFA league owner Lisa King invited Robert to attend the 2014 Championship game in Chicago where the Boston Militia faced off against the San Diego Surge. He watched from the sidelines and immediately fell in love with this phenomenal game and the stories of the amazing players. What he saw in these women was their incredible spirit; each was living life to the fullest expression of who she was, regardless of whatever arbitrary expectations society has in store for them. 

It was an inspiring afternoon. 

Robert returned to Washington and got involved with his local team, the D.C. DIVAS, and realized that the most effective way to tell the story of women’s football was through the DIVAS’ experience of the game, on and off the field.

He started filming the preseason and is now primed to hit the road and capture the DIVAS’ unique camaraderie, sisterhood, and athleticism over the course of the entire 2015 season.  

The filmmakers’ goal is to travel across America with the D.C. DIVAS, filming each game with four cameras to elevate the captured footage to NFL standards, an artistic benchmark these players fully deserve.

They are passionate about this project and believe that—with your help—they can make a unique documentary about Americas most popular sport. 

WOMEN WITH BALLS will be an inspiring film about self-belief, self-acceptance, community, courage, spirit, and ultimately—win, lose or tie—TRIUMPH of the human spirit.

Because sometimes in life, you’ve just gotta grow a pair.

Thank you for your support!

story:
eCommerce: The Rise of The Internet Entrepreneur

Who Will Be In This Documentary?

We have an incredible line up to feature in this documentary. Here are a few of the faces you can expect to see:
 

John Lee Dumas & Kate Erickson - Entrepreneur on Fire

EntrepreneurOnFire was awarded Best Of iTunes in 2013 because of their dedication to serve entrepreneurs and share incredible insights to help guide people like you on your Entrepreneurial journey.

You can subscribe to their podcast and gain incredible insights into becoming an internet entrepreneur at EntrepreneurOnFire.com

 

Cynthia & Michael Jamin - TwirlyGirl

Cynthia Jamin, an actor and CEO of TwirlyGirl started making custom dresses for her daughters because she could not find what they wanted.

Michael Jamin, a showrunner working in Los Angeles helps her with marketing and operations while working in Hollywood.In 2007 Cynthia founded TwirlyGirl, the original reversible twirly dress for girls. Based in the fashion district of Los Angeles, Cynthia hand picks all of her materials and hand sews these dresses so other little girls can express themselves and twirl to their hearts desire saying, "Every child on this planet is vibrant and extraordinary. I'm proud to create clothing that can help them feel that way."

To learn more about TwirlyGirl and see their selections go to TwirlyGirl


Brad Cabanilla - RaverSwag.com

RaverSwag.com has one mission: fulfilling our customer’s desire to be unique. To accomplish this we operate a website that offers apparel and accessory items specifically aggregated for creating outfits to wear to music festivals, raves, concerts, parties, and other social events. The website is constantly updated with new product offerings from dozens of the best suppliers on Earth. RaverSwag also carries out on-site sales at various festivals and events, while sponsoring multiple dance teams, DJs, and other various groups. Consider the party brought.

To learn more, check out RaverSwag.com


JonesTshirts.com - Scott Jones

JonesTshirts.com is a leading provider of wholesale blank T-shirts, polos, hoodies and other apparel. The founder's original attempt at eCommerce was selling tie-dye t-shirts and baby onesies made in their basement. It soon became apparent that the more traffic and sales the site brought in, the more time spent in the basement cranking out the hand made merchandise. That's when they decided to turn their attention to blank printable apparel that could be sourced as is which gave more time to focus on building the business and expanding the online marketing.

JonesTshirts.com was launched in January of 2006 as a side job on nights and weekends. In 2010 the owner took the plunge and quit his day job and now there is a staff of 10 workers in an office in Provo, UT taking care of all the customers needs and constantly expanding the product line and enhancing the customer's online experience.

Eric Waddington & Nicholas Yust - Modern Crowd inc

Modern Crowd was conceived after many years of representing a modern artist and sculptor by the name of Nicholas Yust. As the admiration and success continues through our representation of Nicholas' niche modern metal art, Nicholas and Eric partnered together to expand their own art and fabrication capabilities, and also represent a select group of extremely talented artisans specializing in other mediums - such as high end contemporary woodwork, unique/original canvas paintings, ultra modern acrylic decor, and more.

You can learn more and see their art at ModernCrowd.com

Marcos & Paislea - WhiteFauxTaxidermy.com

From the crowded streets of SoHo to the busy nightlife of Tokyo, White Faux Taxidermy products have adorned the walls of thousands upon thousands of clients, businesses, hotels, and so much more. Sought after by well known interior designers from six of the seven continents, WFT has created a highly talked about and creative culture for not only the fashionable, but also the animal lover in every one of us.

To see their amazing products and learn more visit WhiteFauxTaxidermy.com

 

Chris & Kareena Watkins - HatchesAndAxes.com

HatchetsAndAxes.com is a specialty retailer focusing on a wide variety of niche products for the outdoors and sporting industry. They have products for beginners to advanced, throwing tomahawks to survival kits, and premium products for serious competitors. They've learned that not all throwing axes are created equal and have perfected the product line to bring you unbeatable control and performance.
To check out their products and learn more about the manly world of hatchet and axe throwing visit HatchetsAndAxes.com


Elite Ops

EliteOps.com is a premiere fulfillment warehouse based in Spanish Fork, Utah. Not only do they provide eCommerce fulfillment, they also help with a plethora of options for any business including inventory management, Third Party Logistics, Returns Management, and more.

To learn more about their services and see how a fulfillment warehouse can change your business, check out EliteOps.com

And Many More!

What is this Documentary about?

eCommerce: The Rise of the Internet Entrepreneur is an in depth look at how the world of commerce has changed because of the internet. We will be presenting the history of this "Wild Wild West" of commerce as well as interviewing working entrepreneurs who are dedicated to surviving and thriving in business online.

Here are a few of the topics we will be covering in this documentary:

  • How did the Internet pave the way for new business?
  • What opportunities lie in wait for the brave entrepreneur?
  • What pitfalls and struggles loom in this world?
  • How you can get started?
  • Who really calls the shots (Google, Amazon, Ebay, etc.)
  • How does this change your life as opposed to a 9-5 Job?
  • How does it effect the family?

How Will This Documentary Film Be Presented?

This incredible world will be brought to light at a professional level using the following techniques:

  • Animated Segments - breaking down complex theories in understandable tidbits.
  • In Office Interviews - and conversations with Internet Entrepreneur's in Salt Lake City, Las Vegas, and Los Angeles.

Our team consists of several amazingly talented filmmakers - who will be traveling to document the stories of these amazing people, including an incredibly talented animator who will be help bring the informational pieces of our documentary to life in an entertaining and beautiful way.

What Makes Us Suited To Tell This Story?

My name is Phil Hudson and I have held almost every job imaginable in the world of Internet Marketing. Those jobs included fielding phone calls, selling Internet Marketing packages, managing fulfillment and support for those clients as an account manager (Fortune 500 companies as well as small local businesses), owning and operating ecommerce websites, working as an in-house internet marketing director, speaking at conferences in Las Vegas in front of hundreds of Real Estate brokers, and running an Internet Marketing agency.

The Kicker:I come from a family of 5 kids, divorced parents, and a life of poverty, I'm technically a college dropout, & I don't know how to code or program. Why does that matter? Because that means ANYONE can change their life with an online business, if you know how and what to do. I want to show the world exactly that.

The point is, for the last five years I have ate, slept, drank, and breathed Internet Marketing. It fascinates me still and consumes my thoughts, dictating the very way I analyze everything in life. It has provided a living for me far greater than I could have ever imagined.

Now, stepping back from that world to pursue a career in filmmaking (my first true love), it dawned on me that so few people know about this hidden opportunity lying just under the surface of our every day interactions with the internet. I NEED to tell this story and I have some amazing people I am able to interview and document to provide real world examples of success in online business.

I want to educate people just like you.

How Will YOUR Funds be Spent

We need roughly $3000 to make this documentary. We are leveraging favors with families and friends in most of the areas we are traveling to in order to make this as cheap as possible while providing a professional look and feel. Here is where those funds are going:

  • Animation - We have an incredible animator who is going to do some incredible work bringing the educational parts of this documentary to life. This is the most important technical piece of our documentary at this point. We have professional cameras and sound equipment for the interview portions of our documentary, but we need the animations to ensure we have it right.
  • Post Production - Along with the animation, we need to do some post production. Color correction,
  • Music Scoring & Composition - We don't want to use stock music or anything common, so we are working with a team of composers to come up with a solid score for this film.
  • Travel Expenses - We are going to be in San Diego, Los Angeles, Las Vegas, and Utah. We need to get there and eat, but we are cutting costs as much as possible.

Obviously, the more we have the more we can do, but we are confident we can produce an interesting, educational, and professional documentary with our target goal.

The Perks

Of course we want to give back to you for your support. So here is a list of perks we want to give back to you:

  • Professional Consulting - For some of our donors I will be offering free consulting hours for your business. That means audits, reports, recommendations, training, whatever you want!
  • Producer Titles - Some donors will get an Producer, Executive Producer, or Associate Producer titles, meaning IMDB credit. That's right, you will be on IMDB.
  • Digital Copies of the Documentary - Delivered via Dropbox and on Custom made Jump Drives
  • Webinar Training Series - a seven week course on the basics of launching an ecommerce site.
  • Ebooks - Written and prepared by a professional SEO company.
  • Much Much More - Of course more, but you just need to head to the PERKS tab and check them out, and then donate!

What We Hope To Do

What would you do with an additional $600 a month? What about $6000? There is opportunity to live the American Dream. Most people just don't know that the opportunity is there. We want to bring that opportunity to light and show others they too can be successful, and how to protect themselves if they do have the courage to pursue their dream.

Risks & Challenges

We will be making a documentary with real people. That means we may get some amazing stuff, and we may not. Knowing the people we are going to be interviewing and with the vast knowledge on the subject that we have, we are confident that those risks are mitigated and minor.

From a technical standpoint, we have an incredible team that is particularly suited to film, capture sound, animate, score, and produce a documentary we can all be proud of.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the funds? That is okay, we understand! Please do us the favor of sharing this with your social networks. If this is at all interesting to you, please help us by spreading the word. We want to make something we can all be proud of. Help us do that in any way you can. Either way, we thank you!

Habla Espanol?

story:
Genesis House in Olean has been doing a tremendous job organizing a reuse program that has aimed to receive home improvement and household donations which are then sold in an auction in order to raise money to fund some of its operations. The Genesis House Reuse Program seeks to find space to house the donated items and conduct the summer yard and garage sales that it hopes to conduct once in summer and once in the fall. The reuse program is inviting you to be part of this noble cause that will see Genesis House make a great deal of difference in the lives of the rural homeless. We hope to raise 7500$ annually for the next five years. Your contribution will go a long way in helping to:

  1. Rent a space for Reuse operations

  2. Conduct marketing and publicity for the auctions

  3. Create banners and advertising materials for the auction

All the proceeds of course go towards Genesis House programs.

Where we are now:

We have been getting donated space for our work courtesy of  Crisafuli’s on 4 mile Road for the past three years we have been in operation. This space, though it has been an immense blessing for us is only available for a limited time and is in use as a busy engineering warehouse. We seek to get a more central location that has a bigger space for the donations and hopefully be able to run an all year operation. We acknowledge the many of you have been part of this effort helping Genesis House meet its noble goals of giving a helping hand to the rural homeless in Cattaraugus County. Now as Genesis House marks its 20 years of existence, we are reaching out to you all that have not had an opportunity to be an integral part of our  noble and necessary endeavor.

home improvement and household donations which are then sold in an auction in
order to raise money to fund some of its operations. The Genesis House Reuse Program
seeks to find space to house the donated items and conduct the summer yard and
garage sales that it hopes to conduct once in summer and once in the fall. The
reuse program is inviting you to be part of this noble cause that will see Genesis
House make a great deal of difference in the lives of the rural homeless. We
hope to raise 7500$ annually for the next five years. Your contribution will go a
long way in helping to: 

Rent a
space for Reuse operations 
Conduct
marketing and publicity for the auctions
Create
banners and advertising materials for the auction 

All the proceeds of course go
towards Genesis House programs. 
Where
we are now: 
We have been getting donated
space for our work courtesy of  Crisafuli’s on 4 mile Road for the past three years we have been in
operation. This space, though it has been an immense blessing for us is only
available for a limited time and is in use as a busy engineering warehouse. We
seek to get a more central location that has a bigger space for the donations
and hopefully be able to run an all year operation. We acknowledge the many of you
have been part of this effort helping Genesis House meet its noble goals of
giving a helping hand to the rural homeless in Cattaraugus County. Now as Genesis
House marks its 20 years of existence, we are reaching out to you all that have not had an opportunity to be an integral part of our  noble and necessary endeavor.

story:
WHAT

In Love Interdicted, a universe - both inner and outer - centred on prostitution is revealed through a story.

Contrary to a current affairs or documentary-like approach, Love Interdicted´s glimpse at a certain milieu and way of life is openly subjective, partial and subordinated to a dramatic (or tragic) storyline, which is at least as important in the film as the milieu portrayed. The milieu-portrait part emerges as an impromptu, deranged, flash journey that no viewer will forget.

That said, Love Interdicted is entirely based on real experiences and long conversations, as well as on written exchanges over the years. Love Interdicted is terribly true.

Love Interdicted aims to challenge viewers’ preconceived ideas and stereotypes of a certain type of sex work, as well as inviting them to visit unexplored worlds. In fact, stereotypes and limited points of view are most current, even in some of the most remarkable examples of literary or film works portraying the world of prostitution and its inhabitants.

The project draws its energy from discontent, a will to offer new points of view, shake our fragile certainties and be truthful. It draws its strength from a long period of maturation and confidence developed with real people from the milieu. And draws inspiration from many sources and references, where Hölderlin, Quignard, Laure (George Bataille’s tragic love), Sylvia Plath or Joyce are likely to be more relevant than Sade, Maupassant or the painters of maisons closes and filles de joie.

Behind Love Interdicted, its characters, plots and settings, there are people. Women. Most of them will never know that they contributed to and shaped my desire to paint a certain picture of human existence via an image of a strange, maybe self-revealing, often self-destructive way of life, a perilous job, like poetry.

Thus Love Interdicted has a meaning and impact that far exceeds a film or an ephemeral series. It also concerns the dignity of all those who, behind the scenes, nourished this project and shared so much, beyond good and evil, beyond beautiful and ugly. That is why your contribution means so much.

READ MORE: https://loveinterdicted.com

 

WHAT FOR

Love Interdicted is a multi-outcome film writing and production project, based on years of research and exchanges.

This fundraising campaign supports a specific stage of the project’s life cycle, expected to last 6-8 months (depending on the level of funding obtained) and delivering:

  • An advanced writing and IP development process leading to a pre-production package (concept, final treatment, draft screenplay, approach, financing and production strategy) for a long form work. The final decision on the most appropriate format of this work (i.e., feature film or limited-run series) will be based on development itself.
  • A short film that will serve as a test, a partial proof of concept for what comes next and the first visible output for all those who support the project;
  • Possibly, spin-offs, some exclusively for supporters, depending on the level of funding obtained.

The next stage (expected 2021) is the last, pre-production development phase. Additional funding sources and partners will join at this point, which includes the preparation of a pre-production version of a bible/screenplay, a pilot, teasers and finalizing the business/financing strategy for production/co-production.

READ MORE: https://loveinterdicted.com

 

WHO

Author and team

My name is Nuno Fonseca and I have been developing this project for many years now.

Since 1997, I have been active on the policy/public funding side of the film industry, at national and European/international level, both as a public representative and as an individual expert.

Focusing on funding and coproduction, I have gained a wide experience in  screenplay and project analysis and selection, teaching and training. I have the privilege and joy of being able to discover and follow budding talent almost every day! 

I’ll be coordinating the writing and development process, with a small, talented group (writing and production) and the short film to be produced during stage 2 will be created and co-directed by this core team. Depending on the level of funding obtained for this development stage, we will consider involving young talent with international reach.

We will update you on the Team as this campaign develops.

Decisions on creative talent, including director(s) for the long form work will be taken after and based on the current development stage.

 

HOW MUCH, WHAT FOR (funding)

For reasons explained in the project’s website, crowdfunding is a critical part of our financing plan and the only way to ensure full creative independence and control over content, and respect and protection of our sources.

 

Draft budget and financing plan

Estimated costs of stage 2 of the project’s lifecycle (see BASICS) total 54,500 euros.

 

The provisional financial plan is the following:

 

 

Overfunding/underfunding

This a very spartan budget, and overfunding is very unlikely to happen, except if crowdfunding and other revenue grow beyond our expectations. Should overfunding occur, we put more production value into the short film and/or pursue screenwriting/development work beyond the foreseen 6-month period and/or with a larger team.

Underfunding may occur, particularly if the outcome of the crowodfunding campaign does not meet our goal. In that case, we will try to increase revenue from partnerships/sponsoring or equity and, if necessary, reduce the (6-month) screenwriting/development period and/or reduce production costs of the short film. In such an event, we will inform our backers about our options and their implications.

 

WHAT WE OFFER

Love Interdicted is neither a sequel, comics-based action film, nor a sensationalist TV documentary. We need sensitive, visionary people who can realize its originality, strength and potential at this early stage. 

We truly believe in the importance of the “community” dimension of crowdfunding. We want to offer you the chance to really engage and participate in a project from an early stage, to share with us the experience of film creation, film funding and film production.

Therefore, our perks policy offers opportunities for combining entertainment and the satisfaction of supporting a project with other benefits, such as “soft” training/learning, different levels of interaction and a de facto first access to future investment perspectives resulting from this development stage. 

See Seven especially good reasons to participate in Love Interdicted

 

Contributions/rewards scheme

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Perhaps you would like to support the project, but you can't afford to contribute. This doesn't mean you can't help. You can actively support us by sharing our campaign with potentially interested people.

Indiegogo provides a “referrals” system, and we intend to use it to reward our non-financial supporters, our messengers, by offering them perks equivalent to the contributions we get from people you referrered us to. This means possible free upgrades of your rewards! Example: you contribute with 180€ (Full Exp pack) and share our page; people you refer us to contribute a total of 1400€; YOUR reward is consequently upgraded from Full Exp to PATRON (worth 1200€)!

IMPORTANT: The Indiegogo referrals tracking system applies only when you share using the Indiegogo share tools in this campaign page! (top right, under number of backers).

We need all of you!

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Wir sind die Organisatoren vom "TOO DRUNK TO WATCH" Punkfilmfest Berlin. Im Jahr 2017 geht dieses besondere Filmfestival in die 6. Runde. Wie jedes Jahr  zeigen wir diesmal im März/April an 5 Tagen im Moviemento (älteste Kino Deutschlands) mehr als 18 Filme von, mit und über Punk, Anarchie und Widerstand.

Das Programm umfasst auch Punk-Akustik-Live-Shows von verschiedenen Künstlern im Kino, Autorenlesungen und einen Solibrunch am Sonntag, ebenfalls im Kino. Die Einnahmen aus diesem Brunch gehen an eine antirassistische Initative.

Um das einzigartige Festival auch 2017 wieder durchführen zu können, brauchen wir eure Hilfe.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Die Einnahmen aus der Crowdfunding Kampagne sollen für 4 Sachen genutzt werden.

1. Einladung von Regisseuren und Hauptdarstellern von gezeigten Filmen.

2. Einladung von Autoren für Lesungen von Büchern über Punk und Widerstand.

3. Preisgeld für den besten Film (Audience Choice Award) von 150 €! (Wenn entsprechend mehr Funding reinkommt, dann werden auch 2. und 3. Plätze vergeben.)

4. Einkauf der Zutaten für den Solibrunch! Herstellung von Merchandise, dieses Jahr zum 1. Mal auch Hoodies!

5. Wenn der gesamte Betrag reinkommt, dann sponsoren wir ein Trikotsatz für eine Kinder-Fussball-Mannschaft. Dann gibt es natürlich auch Trikots mit dem Punkfilmfest-Logo!

 

Das Filmfestival

Das Punkfilmfest Berlin geht nun schon in die 6. Runde und wird von Anfang an im DIY-Ethos (Do It Yourself) organisiert. Wir sind 3 Leute, die das Festival hauptsächlich tragen und bekommen keine Unterstützung von Stadt, Land oder ähnlichen Einrichtungen.

Einzig ein Bier- bzw. Cidersponsor stellt jährlich ein paar Kisten bereit, daher ist es uns auch möglich, die Flaschen für je 1,-€ im Kino anzubieten.

Wir möchten das Punkfilmfest noch lange fortsetzen, weil die Filme, die wir  im Kino zeigen, viel zu selten aufgeführt werden.

    Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

    Ihr könnt uns gerne auf Facebook liken und allen Freunden von uns erzählen.

story:
2015 Summer Girls Justice Institute

20 high school age girls will be awarded Social Change Fellowships to spend eight days building social change campaigns addressing Gender Justice.  The  20 Fellows will explore the components of activism through participatory/gender transformative action research, media presentations and community organizing.   


The Girls Justice League is a girls’ rights organization dedicated to taking action for social, educational, and economic justice for girls, young women and those who identify as female in Philadelphia.

The Summer Institute is a cornerstone in deepening the capacity of the League's collective of young women and their allies to identify and confront the disparities based on gender, race, ethnicity, class, and gender identity in the systems that affect their futures. 

Reflections from the 2014 Summer Institute

“The summer institute was the best for me.  It was so fun, every day we did cool activities with other girls, learned new things in interactive workshops, and we could create campaigns against ending sexism and oppression and stuff.  It was awesome for me because I am very passionate about gender inequality in Philly and in our country.  I felt like I actually had a say in things I thought were unfair in society.”

“At first I was apprehensive about hanging out with girls all day for a week, I was always taught that girls can’t work together and I always thought that they wouldn’t get along.  At the summer institute that changed for me.  I learned that girls can work together for the bigger picture, and it was actually really fun staying with them for a week.  It felt like a summer camp almost, we did a lot of empowerment activities and the adults there don’t invade much, it’s a really for-girls, by girls thing.  The cool part is that I still talk to a lot of them now.”


See what happens when girls take charge! This short video on body image was created by girls during a workshop on media and activism at the 2014 Girls Justice Summer Institute. 


GJL is committed to providing the space and support for girls and young women to bring their voices and experiences into the social justice arena in order to challenge, disrupt, and destabilize prevailing narratives about girls, young women and those who identify as female. Listen to some League voices...


Be sure to check out GJL in the news! GJL member Melanie is featured in the Atlantic Magazine article Black Girls Should Matter, Too           


Please Give Today - Take a look at our perks, and see how you can support girls and social justice! 

If you are interested in spreading the word about this campaign please share this page!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Aero Lillian Olok, I am from  central Uganda, Wakiso district. I am a single mother, graduate of social work and community development, an entrepreneur and a philanthropy. I am so passionate about solving the pressing problem in my community such as empowering of single mothers and widows economically and supporting young girls who are victims of sexual abuse, domestic violence and teenage mothers.

Atwero which means I Can, is a sub-project that i want to start in 2015 and this will be concentration on community rehabilitation for families of girl who are victims of sexual abuse and domestic violence and child marriages. I want to carry out a campaign in the schools to change the mind set of teachers, students and the school authorities toward throwing out the pregnant girls out of school. I want to carry out rehabilitation for girls who are sexually abused, victims of domestic violence and they are teenage mothers. I believe that these girls can continue with school despite what has happened to them. this will help to bring an end to the high illiteracy level of women in my country, it will help to reduce on the high percentage of poverty amongst the young mothers and give them a brighter future. 

Your contribution towards this project will help the girls to bond again with their families through the family counseling, It will help the teenage mothers go back to school and realize their dreams once again. It will help in training of the teachers to change their mind set towards these girls. Above all your contribution will bring an end to child marriages in Wakiso Uganda. The Money will be Used to make a curiculum that will be designed for the parenting counseling for the families and communities, For the teachers and the school students and also for the girls to boost their self Esteem and confidence.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • As Atwero Team, we need 5000 USD, this will be used for curriculum development, buying equipments that can be used during the school trainings such as a projector, Cameras, Transportation for the social workers and the counselors who will be doing the activities in the communities. Part of the money will also be used to ensure that the girls who are sexually abused and the pregnant mothers are in good health.
  • We have a team of mentors, we will be doing a community rehabilitation for these girls to show the community that these girls are able to continue with their studies and even perform well despite of the condition they are in of being pregnant or sexually abused or coming from a domestic violence back ground.
  • What ever amount of money that will be gotten here if we do not meet our target we will put it in research to know what happens to the lives of these girls 5 years after they are thrown out of school. What becomes of them if they do not get good education.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • 25% of girls in Uganda are thrown out of school due to pregnancy according to FAWEU report 2014. This contributes to the high rate of school drop out of girls, which leads to the 57% of the high illiteracy level among the women in Uganda and poverty at the same time. so with my project i am advocating to the families of the victimized girls, the schools that throw them Out and the communities and families that support these girls to go into marriages at the age of 12, 13, 14, 15. This is not going to help develop our country instead its only keeping us in poverty. so its Our responsibility to support these girls to stay in school no matter the condition they are in they can still study and have a brighter future.
  • In 2009, i started up a project for single mothers and widows to empower then to become economically dependent and it has been success full out of the 200 women reached 56 of them started up their own sustainable projects.
  • Personally i was a victim of sexual abuse in 2000, when i was 15, i was abused and i became pregnat and i gave birth to my child, four years later i went back to school, In October 29, 2014 it was reported by The Hindu, a story of a 16 year old girl who was sexually abused and she got pregnant, she hid her pregnancy and she continued to go to school, till she gave birth on 24 October 2014. This is some thing that is not only happening in my country, but its a global problem that we need to find a solution to it as soon as possible. Lets openly support these girls to stay in school and not punish them by ruining their future for the rest of their lives.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • The need for this project in the community helps me to be able to over come the huddles and also my personal story and stories of the other successful girls who were given the opportunity to go back to school after they are found pregnant.
  • I plan to work with the Ministry of Gender labor and social development the department of children, Youth and women. The ministry of Health and Education too. I plan to involve the parents of the girls in a dialogue for us to be able to come up with solutions that will better the future of these girls.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I would like to request each and every one of us to spread this word wide and far, any contribution that you can make, even if its in Kind, it will make a difference in the lives of these girls. Lets join our hands for the betterment of their Future.
  • Please do not forget to Use the Indiegogo tool.

And that's all there is to it.

Part of the money will also be used to ensure that the girls who are sexually abused and the pregnant mothers are in good health.
We have a team of mentors, we will be doing a community rehabilitation for these girls to show the community that these girls are able to continue with their studies and even perform well despite of the condition they are in of being pregnant or sexually abused or coming from a domestic violence back ground.
 What ever amount of money that will be gotten here if we do not meet our target we will put it in research to know what happens to the lives of these girls 5 years after they are thrown out of school. What becomes of them if they do not get good education.
    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:  25% of girls in Uganda are thrown out of school due to pregnancy according to FAWEU report 2014. This contributes to the high rate of school drop out of girls, which leads to the 57% of the high illiteracy level among the women in Uganda and poverty at the same time. so with my project i am advocating to the families of the victimized girls, the schools that throw them Out and the communities and families that support these girls to go into marriages at the age of 12, 13, 14, 15. This is not going to help develop our country instead its only keeping us in poverty. so its Our responsibility to support these girls to stay in school no matter the condition they are in they can still study and have a brighter future. 
 In 2009, i started up a project for single mothers and widows to empower then to become economically dependent and it has been success full out of the 200 women reached 56 of them started up their own sustainable projects. Personally i was a victim of sexual abuse in 2000, when i was 15, i was abused and i became pregnat and i gave birth to my child, four years later i went back to school, In October 29, 2014 it was reported by The Hindu, a story of a 16 year old girl who was sexually abused and she got pregnant, she hid her pregnancy and she continued to go to school, till she gave birth on 24 October 2014. This is some thing that is not only happening in my country, but its a global problem that we need to find a solution to it as soon as possible. Lets openly support these girls to stay in school and not punish them by ruining their future for the rest of their lives.
    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  The need for this project in the community helps me to be able to over come the huddles and also my personal story and stories of the other successful girls who were given the opportunity to go back to school after they are found pregnant. I plan to work with the Ministry of Gender labor and social development the department of children, Youth and women. The ministry of Health and Education too. I plan to involve the parents of the girls in a dialogue for us to be able to come up with solutions that will better the future of these girls.
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  I would like to request each and every one of us to spread this word wide and far, any contribution that you can make, even if its in Kind, it will make a difference in the lives of these girls. Lets join our hands for the betterment of their Future.
 Please do not forget to Use the Indiegogo tool.
   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Film director and Emmy award winning makeup artist, Dean C. Jones (Dark Awakening, Coffin Baby) is back with his most disturbing film yet "Asylum Nights". In order to maintain full creative control and give fans the type of horror film they deserve, Dean and his producing team need your help!



  "Asylum Nights" Plot Summary:

 

  Andy Roberts becomes head physician of the night shift at Evergreen Asylum after his predecessor is found dead in the main hall. What seems like a great opportunity for Andy, quickly turns tragic as one of the night guards unleashes a wave of violence against the helpless patients. When Andy's only friend, a night-shift nurse, is slain by the maniac guard, he turns to Leon, a large, gentle giant for help. Together they set out to put a stop to the violence but Leon has his own reasons for being in the asylum and these reasons are just as bloody!   


Bringing the Asylum to life:


 "Asylum Nights" can best be described as a mix between "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest", "Seven",  and  Tod Browning's "Freaks".  This film will push on every emotion and is a rare gem, with your help we'll deliver a new chapter in 21st century terror!  Members of the Asylum's production team already include:

Dean C. Jones  (Star Trek, Pirates of the Caribbean, A Haunted House ) 
Filmography: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0427896/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1
Michele Weisler  (The Ring, Street Kings, Stir of Echoes) 
Filmography: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0918833/?ref_=ttfc_fc_cr7
Starr Jones  (The Abyss, Lincoln, Dark Awakening)
Filmography: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0429275/?ref_=ttfc_fc_cr3
Liliana Kligman- Roitman (Dark Awakening, Fit As a Pro)
Filmography: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5907226/?ref_=ttfc_fc_cr4
Robbie Little ( An American Haunting, The Prophecy 2, Titus)
Filmography: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0514655/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

                               CASTING NEWS:

Horror icon and Lon Chaney award winner, Bill Oberst Jr. (Abraham Lincoln vs. Zombies, Criminal Minds, Take this Lollipop, Circus of the Dead) is officially attached to star in "Asylum Nights"!

Filmography: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2454994/

 


Now, we want to bring you on board!

                             

 

 "Asylum" needs your support to raise $150,000 and in exchange we have some exciting perks available from apparel and IMDB credit to full Hollywood monster makeups! If you can't contribute monetarily please spread the word on our upcoming film  production. Thanks in advance for your support and reading over our campaign!      

                                         Dean C. Jones Facebook Page:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Dean-C-Jones/295554177264472

Atlantic & Pacific Pictures  Facebook Page:

https://www.facebook.com/AtlanticPacificPictures

Actor Bill Oberst Jr. Facebook Page:

https://www.facebook.com/ActorBillOberstJr

                                             Horror Society Article:
                   http://www.horrorsociety.com/2014/12/16/apart-asylum-nights/
                           
                                              LeglessCorpse.com Article:
http://leglesscorpse.us/asylum-nights-starring-horror-icon-bill-oberst-jr/

story:
Getting Unstuck

In January 2016 two daring South African women - Ronet & Jeanne - decided to sell most of their belongings in search of adventure, needing to escape a comfort zone that kept them from reaching and living their full potential.

The goal was to travel through as many of the 48 contiguous United States as possible within a 5 month period, with a camper van of some sort.

They managed to leave South Africa on August 30th 2016 en route to America. In Michigan (basecamp) they bought a van and finally got on the road on September 11th 2016.

Being filmmakers they naturally filmed their journey as they went along. Enchanted by the vastness and beauty, the legends and the mystery of American roads, the documenting of their trip quickly turned into a well rounded travel documentary. What they did not expect is how much their Van had a personality of her own. She turned into a third character in the film - more like the leading lady.

They named her Jessie after the "whodunnit" enigma Jessica Fletcher, from "Murder She Wrote".

 

Jessie

Jessie was born in 1983, the handiwork of Henry Ford. She is pretty solid for a 34 year old van but bought with 77,500 miles on the clock she was bound to need a few fixes. She broke down twice and needed a few initial repairs but managed to drive her 2 allies all the way through the 48 contiguous states. 

Jessie is a wise old one, the crew covered a whopping 17,134 miles (27,574 km) but nothing compared to Jessie's 95,000 odd miles. She knows the US road network like very few creatures on earth does. With 34 years of travel behind her she is a seasoned traveller that can tell you things about these roads that very few can.

 

The Roads

At 4.2 million miles, the road network in the USA is the largest in the world connecting 323 million people. When seen from the air the roads can make one think of the veins in a human body and the people that use it is the blood. Blood gushing through veins every day pulsing with endless possibility. Every day these roads play an integral part in every American's life. It takes on many duties and personalities, it becomes whatever we need it to be. Roads are the purveyors of food and beverage. It takes us away and brings us back home. Keeps us from danger or brings danger to us, saves lives and takes away life. It's used to commit crime and to fight it. It leads to the wonders of billions of years ago and to the possibility of travelling the universe in the future. It holds legends and mysteries that defy what we thought we knew.

 

Production Team

The production team behind the film is Ronet van der Walt and Jeanne Marethe Prinsloo. As we get closer to completion we will make use of the best graphics, online and audio artists that South Africa has to offer.

Ronet is behind the creative and editorial aspects of the film whilst Jeanne made sure we stayed on the road, in budget and intact. We shared filming responsibilities - whomever wasn't driving was filming. A huge team effort by a tiny team to make a film with a massive heart.

 

Ronet van der Walt

I've worked on over 150 hours of programming as senior editor in the factual film making genre across the globe. In 2011 I took on the role as co-director on the film "Surviving Shark Night" for National Geographic and in 2014 as co-producer for the multi award winning independent film "Spirit Creatures". "Jessie, a little van in a very big country", is my first solo directorial effort, combining my love for travel, a steady angle, smooth transitions and a well crafted story. The first of many indie films I intend to produce.

 

Jeanne Marethe Prinsloo

I have been in the film industry for the past 12 years in all phases of production. I have fulfilled various roles from production co-ordinator, accountant and post producer in South Africa and abroad in Qatar. I'm very proud and humbled to be part of the team behind "Jessie, a little van in a very big country" where I could share my production skills and my passion for documentaries and photography.

 

Style

The film will have 2 treatments with 2 distinct voices:

1) Reality. This part of the film centres around 2 South African women breaking away from their comfort zone, getting and keeping Jessie on the road and trying their utmost to reach their end goal despite endless challenges. This includes them saying farewell to Jessie - a surprising and moving end to their journey.

2) Factual documentary. This section will cover the American road network - the mystery, legends, secrets and revealing facts as narrated by Jessie. 

The US road network is at the centre of this film. Ronet & Jeanne are witness to this extraordinary story as told by "Jessie, a little van in a very big country".

 

 

Production

Shot with Go-Pro Hero cameras versions 4 & 5 to get those near impossible angles on the move and a Canon 70D to cover some exceptional time-lapses. We've unfortunately driven over one of our cameras whilst trying to get that extra daring angle. This film is predominantly made from Jessie's viewpoint. All shots - bar a few wide scenics - will either include Jessie's interior or exterior. The crew Ronet & Jeanne will feature as they keep Jessie on the road.

We will also make use of aerial stock footage to hit home the enormity and vastness of the US road network.

 

Post Production

Ronet van der Walt has started the assembling of the film and will complete the edit at the end of April 2017. The real editorial challenge will be to give Jessie a personality, we want to anthropomorphise Jessie. Anthropomorphise means you give an animal or object human qualities, like "Herbie the Love Bug".

The Roads we drive on will also have a personality but this will constantly change depending on it's function in our film. At times dark, menacing and mean and at other times open, gentle and inspiring.

Another major factor in the post production will be music. Any good road trip must have great music. The more money we can raise the better our soundtrack will be and the more immersive the viewing experience will be. If we can afford it we'd like Jessie's theme song to be "Fast Car" by Tracy Chapman and the newer version by Jonas Blue ft. Dakota.

 

Funding

We funded the project and film by selling basically everything we own. The funds we need to raise through Indiegogo will first and foremost pay for the finishing costs. See breakdown below (as of 18 March):

1 -  $ 1,500 - Audio Library

2 -  $ 1,500 - Graphics (changed 18 March)

3 -  $ 5,000 - On & Offline Edit & Facility Cost

4 - $ 1,500 - Stock Footage (changed 18 March)

5 -  $ 2,000 -  Audio Mix

6 -  $ 0 - Online Distribution (changed 18 March)

We will continue to raise funds beyond our $ 11,500 goal. We will use these extra funds to get the best possible soundtrack and to recoup funds spent in the past 6 months of production. This will also enable us to get going with our next project.

 

What if we don't reach our Indiegogo goal?

If we don't reach our Indiegogo goal by the 30th of April 2017 - we will still complete the film on time as scheduled and recoup our funds with either broadcast deals and/or our video on demand sales. Bottom line, everyone is getting what they paid for, no matter the final funding amount. The important thing for us is to keep moving forward and keep making inspirational films.

 

Why are we making this film?

For us this experience has been an extremely scary one. Not only from the first moment we climbed into Jessie but from the day in January 2016 we decided to go on this journey. For us it has been a daring move to positive change. While making this film and making many other ones, we hope to inspire people in a positive way with - Jessie, a little van in a very big country.

Keep Moving

We've braced a huge rainstorm in Washington, winter storm Decima in Arizona and the vicious snowstorm Helena in Clinton Oklahoma. We fought off a rat infestation in New Mexico, had two breakdowns, lost a few parts and bought a few brand new ones. Jessie nearly got us arrested in front of the White House and we almost got Jessie decapitated under a bridge in New York. But we made it through all 48 states in one piece. This journey is all about leaving behind what no longer works and keeping on moving forward against all odds.

At times philosophical, at times reality, at times even a bit gripping but always entertaining. Join Jessie and crew as they take you on a road trip through America as you've never seen it before. 

Our Next Project

Our next project will be about the driving mentality on South African roads. While driving in America we realised how dangerous our South African roads are and how aggressive our drivers are. We're fascinated by the psychology playing out on our roads. While it is not the highest death rate in the world it is pretty high up on the list. We'll continue to do our research and we're planning on filming after we finish up the post production on Jessie.

 

SEE.BELIEVE.CHANGE

Sincerely

Jessie, Ronet & Jeanne

story:
What is Deehubs

Deehubs is the social network where people directly post in streets. We connect your online and physical world by the help of billboards and projectors. 

You are no longer limited with your Facebook friends or Twitter followers. Here we have new communication channel where you can spread your voice across the streets. Cities are new beautiful feed!

Check out the web site to see how it works: www.deehubs.com. 

One month ago we started Deehubs in Seattle and have already published 10,000 peoples' messages in streets. Now we want to bring our movement to every major U.S. city through our road-trip. Help us to get a car & gasoline.

Why we made Deehubs

Cause 1: In this world we have soldiers who fight without weapons all they have is their word. We want more people to hear their voice, SO WE MADE DEEHUBS

Below is the post published by one of the Deehubs' users on Dec 27, 2014: 

Cause 2: In this world we are all beautiful but not everyone realizes that. We need bigger mirrors to see, SO WE MADE DEEHUBS

Below is the selfie published by one of the Deehubs' users on Dec 21, 2014: 

Cause 3: In this world sometimes we are walking like machines. We will make you stop, activate your brain even just for a second, SO WE MADE DEEHUBS

Below is the status published by one of the Deehubs' users on Dec 22, 2014: 

Cause 4: We want to make streets more beautiful, SO WE MADE DEEHUBS

Below is the art published by one of the Deehubs' users on Dec 16 2014: 


Who We Are 

Three years ago we started Deehubs in our home country Georgia. We did not know how to write a single line of code and every single day we were drawing thousands of sketches. Our team gave up boring corporate lives, took loans and moved abroad to make Deehubs alive. 

When we started Deehubs in Seattle we had no connections, zero marketing budget and all the projectors were donated from strangers. We did not even have time to get permissions from property owners so we kept projecting until they liked it. Neverthless this is the best journey we had. 

Now we are close than ever to make our dreams come true. Everything depends on your contribution. 

Please Contribute 

One of our users posted on Seattle wall "Right now my message is in a better place than me"... Deehubs is not the social network, it is the public stage where people feel important.

Seattle is great but we want our users to Own the American Streets and to spread their word everywhere. So we expand our movement and bring Deehubs to 25 U.S. cities through our road trip. People from all over the world will be able to publish their messages in the most popular U.S. cities. 

Please contribute and help us to get a car & gasoline. In exchange check amazing perks we offer to you.   

Below are places we cover with Deehubs road trip: 

Media Coverage

  • Geekwire - Link
  • King5 Television - link
  • Komo News Radio - link
  • Mynorthwest - link
  • Advertising Age - link
  • Skynews - link
  • Time Out London - link
  • Digital Marketing - link
  • Geektime - link

Info About our Perks 

Publish Post in Each U.S. City - $10 (Perk #1) 

Send us your message or picture and we will broadcast it in streets of each city we visit. At the end of the road trip we will send you photo collage of how your message appeared in live in all cities. 

 Your post will appear in Las Vegas, Miami, NYC, Washington D.C., Chicago, Grand Canyon, Los Angeles, San Francisco and etc. (see full list on the map)


Personal Deehubs Mug  - $15 (Perk #2) 

The classic black mug with your personalized Deehubs message. This is our way to say thank you for your contribution.

One Day Post in Hollywood and Time Square  - $20 (Perk #3) 

One whole day only your message will be broadcasted on Times Square (NYC) and in Hollywood (LA). We will make video and photo collage of how your message appeared live and include interviews of passers by about what they think of it. This is the best way to spread your voice and to say something very important for you.
Post will be broadcasted from 5 PM to 9 PM (Deehubs operational hours).

Poster of Your Live Message  - $25 (Perk #4) 

We all love and have posters of city views. But with this perk you will have the poster of U.S. landmarks shown along with your message/picture. You send us your post via email, choose your favorite city and at the end of the road-trip you will receive our special poster signed by Deehubs founders and passers by.
  

Very Personal Deehubs Notebook  - $30 (Perk #5) 

Good notebook is a cover picture of your personality. So we offer you the notebook that is personally designed for you by Paul Oaks. All the pages will be labeled with your name while leather hardcover will be design upon your Deehubs post. 
Details: 10.5x15.5cm, Page #80 *Shipping not included 

Road-trip Souvenir Basket - $40 (Perk #6)

We will collect the souvenirs from each city we visit (more than 20) and create gift basket for you. It will include things specific for each place like chocolates, cups, postcards, caps and everything else we will love on our road. This basket will be full of unexpected surprises and sweet memories. Each basket will be very unique and different from one another. 

Be With Us During the Trip - $50 (Perk #7)

Do your remember those scenes from the movie "Up in the Air"? We will do exactly same for you. We will carry life-size cutout cardboard of your personal picture and take photos of it near the landmarks of each city we visit. At the end of the road trip you will get photo collage of you standing next to the Empire State, Caesar Palace, Hollywood sign and etc. This is fun and pleasant present for your or for your friend.

1 Days Post in 5 major U.S. cities - $75 (Perks #8) 

One whole day only your message will be broadcasted in streets of New York City, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Las Vegas and Chicago. We will make video and photo collage of how your message appeared live and include interviews of passers by about what they think of it. This is the best way to spread your voice all around the U.S.

This is the one of the most important perks for us that can make Deehubs happen. 

Posts will be broadcasted from 5 PM to 9 PM (Deehubs operational hours).


Special Edition Whiskey Barrel With Your Name & Message - $250 (Perks #9) 


We are offering you limited edition of Jameson Whiskey in wooden barrel, engraved with your message and your name on it. We hope you keep this beautiful toy safe and take care of it. This is a very special souvenir and both your message and good old whiskey should complete each other. (picture above is used as an example)

 *P.S. Drink moderately and shipping not included.

Road Trip Sponsorship - $499 (Perks #10)

Deehubs already has over 100,000 pageviews, 60,000 users, and 10,000 displayed messages - this is one month one city stats. Road trip brings 20 more cities and it is perfect exposure opportunity for businesses. So get exposed with us. Our offer includes: 

1.  Online Ads - Video Commercials and Logo on Deehubs web & mobile

2. Outdoor Ads - In the city of your choice all user messages will appear with
your company logo. We take photos of each displayed message and send them to respective users. These messages are then circulated on users’  social media accounts and we also put them on our Facebook page and web site. Thus its not only an outdoor ad but great online advertisement.

3. Roll Up Banners scattered around projection area

4. Media Coverage & Promo Video

5. Gallery - At the end of the road trip we will have exhibition of best published messages. During the event you will be mentioned as one of the organizers. 

 For the detailed information please see presentation on the link below: 

  • ENG - Link Here
  • პრეზენტაცია ქართულად (GEO) - Link Here

Your Fireworks and Exhibition - $600 (Perks #11)

After the road trip Deehubs will arrange exhibition of the best displayed messages in Impact Hub in Seattle or San Francisco. The exhibition will be named upon you. Example: “Deehubs Public Stages By Josh Buckley”. Also at the end of the event there will be special fireworks in your name. The whole event will be video recorded and specifically edited for you. 
(picture above is used as an example)

Deehubs Car - $6000 (Perk #12)

The most iconic object in our road trip will be our car. During our journey we ask people to write personal wishes and messages on it. So it will not be the car but Deehubs memory on wheels. 
 By the end of the road trip this iconic car will be yours. We will personally make sure to deliver this car to your garage with champaign all over it. Your name will be forever mentioned on every Deehubs paltforms. 

Thank you
story_txt:
What is Deehubs





Deehubs is the social network where people directly post in streets. We connect your online and physical world by the help of billboards and projectors. 
You are no longer limited with your Facebook friends or Twitter followers. Here we have new communication channel where you can spread your voice across the streets. Cities are new beautiful feed!

Check out the web site to see how it works: www.deehubs.com. 
One month ago we started Deehubs in Seattle and have already published 10,000 peoples' messages in streets. Now we want to bring our movement to every major U.S. city through our road-trip. Help us to get a car & gasoline.



Why we made Deehubs

Cause 1: In this world we have soldiers who fight without weapons all they have is their word. We want more people to hear their voice, SO WE MADE DEEHUBS

Below is the post published by one of the Deehubs' users on Dec 27, 2014: 


Cause 2: In this world we are all beautiful but not everyone realizes that. We need bigger mirrors to see, SO WE MADE DEEHUBS
Below is the selfie published by one of the Deehubs' users on Dec 21, 2014: 






Cause 3: In this world sometimes we are walking like machines. We will make you stop, activate your brain even just for a second, SO WE MADE DEEHUBS
Below is the status published by one of the Deehubs' users on Dec 22, 2014: 



Cause 4: We want to make streets more beautiful, SO WE MADE DEEHUBS

Below is the art published by one of the Deehubs' users on Dec 16 2014: 



Who We Are 


Three years ago we started Deehubs in our home country Georgia. We did not know how to write a single line of code and every single day we were drawing thousands of sketches. Our team gave up boring corporate lives, took loans and moved abroad to make Deehubs alive. 

When we started Deehubs in Seattle we had no connections, zero marketing budget and all the projectors were donated from strangers. We did not even have time to get permissions from property owners so we kept projecting until they liked it. Neverthless this is the best journey we had. 

Now we are close than ever to make our dreams come true. Everything depends on your contribution. 






Please Contribute 

One of our users posted on Seattle wall "Right now my message is in a better place than me"... Deehubs is not the social network, it is the public stage where people feel important.
Seattle is great but we want our users to Own the American Streets and to spread their word everywhere. So we expand our movement and bring Deehubs to 25 U.S. cities through our road trip. People from all over the world will be able to publish their messages in the most popular U.S. cities.

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys thank you for taking an interest in our short film. If you got this far then you must already have some experience with the board game Risk or have at least heard about it?

I have to admit I only played the game for the first time this year despite how old the game was and after playing my first game (and losing...badly) I knew I just had to make a story out of it. The fact that the game is hardly if ever referenced in pop culture or the media was baffling to me. If you thought Monopoly tears friends and family apart then oh boy you have got to play Risk. Think of a board game version of Game of Thrones where instead of being betrayed by Jaime Lannister's luscious locks you just got betrayed and kicked out of Australia by your best mate from school. Why James!?! Why?!?

Needless to say I jumped at the opportunity to turn this into a short and after a few more games and some heavy research I finally completed a script that I believe both fans of the game and story tellers can watch and enjoy. This will be the most intense film I have ever made and I knew that a pocket money budget was simply not enough to tell the story I wanted to tell. Compared with my previous films I decided to go a completely different route this time and I wasn't willing to compromise a great story to make my bank balance more pleasant to look at. Just like Risk you either fight and win or you fail and die. 

What We Need & What You Get

Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.

We are looking for £600 to fund our short film. 30% of the funds will go towards the hiring of the studio location and it works on an hourly basis so we may have to reduce the amount of time of production if our 30% goal isn't reached. 

No one can work on an empty stomach (I certainly dont) so 5% of the funds will go to feeding the cast and crew. This is incredibly important for obvious reasons and I wont cheat my actors and fellow filmmakers and believe that good grub creates good work.

55% of the funds will go towards expenses for the cast and crew. These people have given up their time and money for the production, the very least I can do is repay the favour. If we exceed the budget amount I will pay them extra for their hard work as Im a firm believer that no one should have to work for free. 

The remaining 10% will go towards film festival distribution as some of them require significant funding to qualify for a screening. We will of course send the film to as many festivals as we can, including free film festivals to get as much exposure as possible. Who knows maybe we will win a few awards but I will equally be as happy if people were just able to see it. 

Which brings me onto the perks. First off everyone who contributes will get a chance to see the film when it is finished. Please leave your email so that I can send you the link to the finished film. Some festivals require that I keep the film off the internet before sending it to festivals and although this policy is rare in most instances I cant guarantee that I wont attempt at a few of these as they're great exposure festivals but the delay will be minor at best and I will let everyone that has funded know about the delay to the films online viewing.

The £5 perk gives you a special thanks credit at the end of the film.

The £20 perk in addition of the £5 perk will get you a personal email from myself thanking you for contributing to the film.

The £50 perk in addition of the previous two perks grants you access to the set! You will get an all expenses paid trip to the production (provided you live in England) and get to hang out with the cast and crew for the day. 

The £100 perk in addition of the previous three perks makes you an executive producer on the film. You get to remain updated on the film right through to the end of film festival distribution. You also get to join us on the set and give creative input on the film to see how your money is being spent.

 

The Impact

I have the intention to send this short film to as many film festivals as humanly possible. Some are thankfully free of charge whilst others require a small fee so again your money really does help us to reach more people and more festivals. There hasnt been a short film quite like this one before so we are aiming for the highest exposure possible.

 

Risks & Challenges

Im not going to lie, this film will be the most challenging film I have made to date as my budget usually consists of whats currently in my wallet on the day. The challenges regarding location costs and a larger than normal cast and crew expenses list will constantly eat away at me. However I am passionate and determined to make this film a success regardless of my goal and I will finish it the way I had envisioned it. Funding or no funding this film will be made. Although the quality of the production is up to you guys.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cant spare a single penny we strongly urge you to share our campaign online to as many people as you can. Even if its just one person. If you are unable to help with funding then Im sure there is someone you know who would be interested in funding. Maybe someone you know whos played RISK before, maybe someone who is interested in short filmmaking or maybe even someone who is just filthy stinking rich ;)

Unlike Tesco, every little bit really does help with our project and I cannot wait to show you the finished film. We are all very excited.

story:
Why?

Hello, my name is David Amburgey and I am the founder and creative director for UmbrellaCafe. About six months ago, while filming a short over at Chicago’s Buckingham Fountain, I had the pleasure of meeting an amazing street-performer. Her name was Emily, but many people know her by her performance persona, the Perkulator. Once I wrapped up filming for my project, I captured some video of the Perkulator performing, and, being the life spectator I am, I was amazed with how she manipulated up to 5 hoops in a single setting with the grace and skill of a lioness driving down on-top of a kill. 

I soon came to learn there were so many other talented performers throughout the city, and many of them liked to perform with fire in ways I never had seen before. Needless to say, after dipping my foot into the pool of fire and flow-art, I was hooked. I went from being a mere spectator and began producing highlight videos for anyone I could film, including the Perkulator, Eric Sipos, Tar-Foot, and the troupe performers from Night Magic Designs. 

I do admit that I love filming and editing videos for these different performers. Not only do I get to witness some amazing art in motion, I also get to share these performances with so many other people. But, the inner storyteller in me has been whispering for a while about doing something better, something bigger, something that tells a more complete story about these amazing performance artists. 

That is why I want to produce a full-length documentary showcasing many of Chicago’s talented flow-artists, and why I want to deliver a story told by them that highlights these performers hopes and dreams while also examining the sacrifices many of these artists make to simply perform.  

Other ways you can help...

If you can't contribute, please spread the word, let your friends and families know. Send emails, share it on Facebook, Twitter, Google plus (using Indiegogo share tools) or wherever you prefer. A couple of minutes of your time will make the difference and helping us reach as large an audience as possible with this campaign will further allow us to reach a much larger audience with the documentary once it is finished.
