story:
HOLEY MATRIMONY

                      Website, www.HMfilm.org 

In 2014 I made my first full length feature film, HOLEY MATRIMONY. It is a fun-filled romantic twists and turns 1948 period comedy with a triple surprise ending!  Not only was I Producer and Director but I am one of the stars and wrote the screenplay.  Two family friendly film distributors wanted the movie after seeing the trailer but I decided to keep control of the film for now.  Another distributor can place my movie in over 200 select theaters nationwide.  My film is already  completed, I would need to have it made into the DCP format necessary for commercial theaters to show.  Also, some of the best film festivals require a DCP rather then just a DVD or streaming to view.  THIS is where I need your help.  A professionally made DCP can cost between $3000 to $5000 each. 

https://www.facebook.com/HoleyMatrimony

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3390762/combined

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5897141/

In 2013 Royal Realm Productions was created to produce my family friendly movies promoting women of various ages and body types and to give talented actors the opportunity to perform in a real film with a real chance of distribution.

https://www.facebook.com/RoyalRealmProductions

http://www.imdb.com/company/co0459386/?ref_=fn_al_co_1


 Drawing upon my extensive background in music and  theater I brought together one of the most talented group of actors to make Holey Matrimony what is sure to be one of the biggest hits in the independent film market.  Three distributors wanted the project.  The third is offering theatrical distribution to at least 200 theaters nationwide but I need to have two professional DCP's made of the movie.  (We are maintaining control of the film, we own 100% all rights).

Holey Matrimony is family friendly and filmed to look like an older movie of the 1940's. Not HD.  I,  Diana Lenska, supervised all costumes, wardrobe, hair and makeup for the entire cast to be sure Holey Matrimony captured the feel of the period.  Add the fabulous costumes, locations,  period cars and a historic movie theater seen in the film and a sure fire winner is in the making.  Yet, this movie was made on a micro-budget.

What We Need & What You Get

The movie is finished and edited.  Our website is up.  We had a pre-release Premiere in November of 2014 to fantastic reviews.  Now we want to market and distribute our film.

http://www.thewashingtondailynews.com/2014/11/14/film-premieres-at-turnage-tonight/

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Holey-Matrimony-Premiere/455916431213373I

I want to give this film a chance to be seen in select theaters but it needs to be made into the correct format for the major theater chains.  We need to have two professionally formatted DCP's made of Holey Matrimony. (DCP stands for Digital Cinema Package.  It is a collection of digital files used to store and convey Digital Cinema (DC) audio, image, and data streams.  Simply put a DCP is the digital equivalent of a 35mm film print. DCP is the standard for all commercial theaters.)  We also need a professional Apple Pro-Res trailer created.  This is where the bulk of the money raised will go.  If we raise the full $12,550 we will also have enough to go into some festivals and create press kits.

I am offering 100 first-cut signed and numbered DVD's of Holey Matrimony for a donation of $100.00 each.  An autographed Premiere Ticket and background chart of Holey Matrimony is included for the donation.


      HOLEY MATRIMONY Limited Edition DVD  $100.00  (postage paid)  USA


Twenty five large 24 x 36 movie posters will be given for a donation of $50.00 each.  T- shirts with the Holey Matrimony logo are available for a donation of $40.00 each and comes in sizes S, M, and L.  Ten mugs with the Holey Matrimony logo are being given for a donation of $30.00 each.  One hundred autographed Premiere Tickets will be given for a $10.00 donation each.  These are actually like mini posters.


       HOLEY MATRIMONY 24 x 36 Movie Poster $50.00 (postage paid) USA


   HOLEY MATRIMONY MUG (With handle)  $30.00  (postage paid) USA


    HOLEY MATRIMONY T-shirt $40.00 sizes S,M, and L (postage paid) USA



Autographed PREMIERE TICKET $10.00 (postage paid) USA


The Impact

We can only make it into the theaters if we have Holey Matrimony made into the DCP's needed .  The film is made, the work done now we just need to get to the next stage.  IF, we do not raise all the funds needed to create the DCP's we will go the DVD route, TV, followed by streaming.  So this movie will be distributed one way or another.  We still have the DVD distributor offers on the table.

By helping fund this project you will be helping bring more family friendly films to the theaters and the movie market.  You will also be supporting a woman film maker in this most difficult of markets to gain recognition. If one is female and not connected to Hollywood, one must work harder for their work to be recognized.  Being an independent film maker is one of the most challenging yet rewarding fields.  Your support will help a lifetime dream and years of hard work finally bear fruit. 

Risks & Challenges

 Since this is a completed film ready to be marketed and distributed the risks are minimal,  the rewards tremendous.  Let us challenge you to be part of this incredible project to bring Holey Matrimony into theaters this year. Help us make the DCP's a reality. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help with a donation, PLEASE share this campaign with friends and family who may be willing to support this project and help bring Holey Matrimony into a theater near you.
story_txt:
HOLEY MATRIMONY
                      Website, www.HMfilm.org 
In 2014 I made my first full length feature film, HOLEY MATRIMONY. It is a fun-filled romantic twists and turns 1948 period comedy with a triple surprise ending!  Not only was I Producer and Director but I am one of the stars and wrote the screenplay.  Two family friendly film distributors wanted the movie after seeing the trailer but I decided to keep control of the film for now.  Another distributor can place my movie in over 200 select theaters nationwide.  My film is already  completed, I would need to have it made into the DCP format necessary for commercial theaters to show.  Also, some of the best film festivals require a DCP rather then just a DVD or streaming to view.  THIS is where I need your help.  A professionally made DCP can cost between $3000 to $5000 each. 
https://www.facebook.com/HoleyMatrimony
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3390762/combined
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5897141/
In 2013 Royal Realm Productions was created to produce my family friendly movies promoting women of various ages and body types and to give talented actors the opportunity to perform in a real film with a real chance of distribution.
https://www.facebook.com/RoyalRealmProductions
http://www.imdb.com/company/co0459386/?ref_=fn_al_co_1


 Drawing upon my extensive background in music and  theater I brought together one of the most talented group of actors to make Holey Matrimony what is sure to be one of the biggest hits in the independent film market.  Three distributors wanted the project.  The third is offering theatrical distribution to at least 200 theaters nationwide but I need to have two professional DCP's made of the movie.  (We are maintaining control of the film, we own 100% all rights).

story:
Idrissa Kargbo (24) is from Sierra Leone, a country that has been fighting a devastating Ebola outbreak for more than a year. He holds the national record for the marathon at 2 hrs 32 minutes despite having no regular coach and no source of funding. Over the past few years Idrissa has competed in several international marathons including London, New York and Liberia, all funded through crowdsourcing and support from friends. 

Idrissa on his trip to New York

If first met Idrissa when I went to Sierra Leone in response to the Ebola epidemic. The country was reeling from the effects of the disease but Idrissa kept on smiling. When his job evaporated with the sliding economy he kept on running but more than that he became a hero of the Ebola response by volunteering to go house to house spreading vital information about the disease.

Me in Sierra Leone


Ebola is slowly disappearing, Sierra Leone is finding its feet and Idrissa wants to return his focus to his talent and passion – marathon running. His big dream now is to qualify for the Olympic Games in Rio in 2016 but to do that he needs to train and to race.

I visited Iten the village where Idrissa will train

Your donation will help him travel to Kenya to train with elite athletes in Iten village, the home of multiple marathon champions. He will then compete at the Cape Town Marathon in September. This race is fast becoming the biggest and most popular marathon in Africa. It attracts a world class field of elite athletes from across the continent and the globe. This race will give Idrissa the exposure and experience he needs and it could be his springboard to achieving the qualifying time to get to Rio.

Please help a talented athlete realise his dream and run on a world stage.

This is Nathan Naibei who has a marathon personal best of 2 hrs and 8 minutes. Nathan has kindly agreed to train Idrissa while he is in Kenya.

story:
EN ESPAÑOL: http://theflyingexplorers.wordpress.com/aqui-e...

RECOMPENSAS: http://theflyingexplorers.wordpress.com/recompensas/

INTRODUCTION

The Iberian Peninsula is riddled with small corners exuding history, art, beauty and exquisite gastronomy. Beyond the general vision of Spain that one has both within and outside its borders, the intention of our team is to approach places which are overlooked both by natives and foreigners.

It is true that the Sagrada Familia, the Roman Aqueduct of Segovia and the Alhambra in Granada are wonders worthy of the best history books, and the sight before the eyes of those who observe will surely fill them with awe with all their detail; or that some Spanish dishes and restaurants have become world-famous. However, the genuine explorer is not the one who takes a look at a travel guide book and goes to the most highlighted places: that is a tourist.

The genuine explorer is the one who spends time with the locals, the one who tries to understand and merge into the culture and go all over the terrain looking for that point in time and space whose je ne sais quoi activates all of his senses; the points which, for any other, would normally go unnoticed.

We want to give a slightly different point of view. We cannot guide you in your exploration, since this is a personal thing, but what we can indicate, in a special, interesting way, are good paths to start it with.


THE IDEA

Several months ago, pilot Fernando García and documentary maker Jesús Boyero (i.e.: us) made a recreational flight above the Castilian Meseta. In the course of barely an hour and half flying, we came across some 14th to 18th century churches and a castle built in the 10th century, as the Spanish terrain is interspersed with artistic representations and places of cultural, historic and gastronomic interest which date back to the origins of humanity.

We are talking about temples, fortresses, battlefields and monuments, separated by barely a few miles of land. And near these, not only are there rivers, gorges and dams, but also the vast fields, whose beautiful tonalities stretch as far as the horizon. We realized then that only a tiny part of the population has the possibility to habitually enjoy all of these from a bird's eye view.

It was then that the idea was born: to make a 6-episode miniseries in which the two friends, emulating the aviators who explored new territories at the beginning of the 20th century, will make visual missions all over the Spanish territory, to capture the beautiful images of a land that already captivated Phoenicians, Greeks, Carthaginians and Romans more than two thousand years ago.


THE PLANNED EXECUTION OF THE PROJECT

The total amount of donations will be allocated to capital goods, merchandising, operating expenses and to finance the extremely expensive flight hours. Threfore, ours is a non-profit project. The only thing we hope to achieve is a product which we can be proud of and you can appreciate and take delight in.

Our main vehicle will be the Cessna 172, for its good safety, performance and flight hour cost. You will be asking yourself, why 100 flight hours for 6 episodes? Well, to obtain the priceless footage of Spain, we calculated that the average lenght of the flight will be 1200 miles/episode (600 miles to go and 600 to return), plus some extra for the second plane that will be filming us in some parts and another part for the fluctuations in the prices of the aviation fuel, that in Spain are incredibly expensive, so we want to achieve 7200miles of flight across Spain plus the extra costs of the operation. However, if we achieve the funding needed, as a supplement we would include airplanes such as gliders or acrobatic aircrafts so that the spectators can experience the possibilities of sport aviation.

Regarding the flight style, the one we are qualified for is visual navigation. Making use of aeronautical charts and the Eventual Landing Fields Manual, our missions will consist of flying between 500 and 1.000 feet high (approx. 170-300 m.), overflying areas of special interest, while commentating on them. Navigation will be done the old-fashioned way: using a chart, a compass, a chronometer, and no GPS, to keep the true spirit of adventure alive. Throughout the missions, we will stop in small airfields, from which we will continue our exploration going deeper on land.

Since communication in the Spanish general aviation are carried out in the Spanish, we have decided to film the series in this language. However, considering the potential interest outside of our borders, at least we will subtitle them in English, and, in the case of achieving the total amount of donations for the project, dubbing to Shakespeare's mother tongue will be carried out.


EXPENSES BREAKDOWN

(We will do an episode for each 2500€)

Flight related costs: 12,500€

·  Cost per flight hour: minimum 120€ (120€ x a total of 100 flight hours = 12,000€)

·  Fees and unexpected costs: 500€

Transport and lodging for two people in six episodes: 1,000€

·  83€ per episode and person, including lodging and transport for one or two days of filming.

Video related costs: 500€

·  Rode Videomic Pro Microphone: 160€

·  DynaSun WT6104 Tripod: 65€

·  Panasonic VW-VBT380 Battery Pack: 120€

·  Extra camera: SJ4000 Wide-angle Full HD: 65€

·  Unexpected costs fund: 90€

Merchandising costs: 1,000€ (including shipping if possible)

Approximate total cost for six episodes: 15,000€ (2,500€ per episode).

story: We Decided to Quit our Fund. If anyone likes to donate that's cool. But other then that we are doing the film without Crowdfunding and just doing the film ourselves through the help of friends and family. And you know what? That is the lesson here. Sometimes a film doesn't need a huge budget to get a point across. Sometimes a very low-budget can make a film great if you have good direction and we do. We are glad that we are noticing that we rather make a good fun movie with people that care on a low-budget than a high budget film where we have people that don't care at all. But, if you want to see what we are doing check out a couple of the interviews and the previous stuff we've made:

story:
The War on the Rocks Story

In the summer of 2013, coming out of two major wars (or so people thought), we were disappointed as we surveyed the landscape of commentary and debate on defense and foreign policy. With so many veterans, officials, and scholars with real experience in the toughest wars and issues of our time, why weren't more of them being heard? We launched War on the Rocks because we thought we could do better. We carved out a small space on the internet where these voices could be heard, beginning in July 2013 (read our first anniversary note here). 

We never anticipated how much we would grow, Many of you craved the same experience-informed analysis that we did. We owe our success so far to our stable of experienced contributors and editors and all of you - our amazing readers and listeners out there who engage with us on a daily basis. 

War on the Rocks is special because it provides an authentic and authoritative perspective from people who have been there and done that in the fields of national security, defense, and foreign policy. And a drink is never far from our hand. 

It is time to take things to the next level and, just like our journey so far, we cannot do it without your help. 

What We Need

War on the Rocks has come all this way on the back of our original $5K Kickstarter 19 months ago. No one has ever collected a salary, to include Ryan Evans and John Amble - both of whom work full-time on War on the Rocks. As rewarding as these 19 months have been, in order to sustain War on the Rocks, we need more resources. 

To grow War on the Rocks and keep it going, we are looking to raise a minimum of $100K. That amount will:

  • Support a re-design of our website (Our modified free WordPress template is bursting at the seams behind the curtain. Don't worry! We will preserve the clean look and make navigation even easier);
  • Allow us to dramatically expand the amount of high-quality content you get to read, watch, and listen to at War on the Rocks;
  • And support part-time staffing costs that will allow all this to happen. 
Our real goal, however, is $150K. If we get there, we can:
  • Launch a jobs board and career events for all of you looking to make a difference in defense, foreign policy, and national security; 
  • Support longform content from some of the top doers and thinkers in the field;
  • Launch a regular video podcast series (think The View but about war and with more scotch).

The Impact

At the end of the day, the mission of War on the Rocks is to promote better strategic thinking. If we are to ask so much of the soldiers, sailors, airmen, and Marines working at the tactical level, we should be able to expect more from our leaders making decisions at the summit of national policy. 

That's what War on the Rocks is all about. A bigger, stronger, and more effective War on the Rocks is a reward on its own, but we also have some amazing and exciting perks to offer you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute funds yourself, we understand. We know what it is like to be under financial strain. But you can still help us out by spreading the word. Take to Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest and more. Tell anyone and everyone you know who thinks solid strategy is important and ask them to help us make it happen. 

We Can't Do it Without You

We exist for our readers and are truly grateful for your continued engagement and support.  We never expected to be where we are today and now we're asking you to help us increase the impact of War on the Rocks by supporting us in this raise.  We've been constantly impressed by what this community is capable of accomplishing and we are excited to see what we can accomplish as we expand with your help.

Lunch/Dinner Partners for our Perks

For some of our perks, we offer lunch/dinner with our contributors. Here are your possible dining partners:


Claude Berube: Annapolis, MD
Patrick Cronin: Washington, DC
Brian Fishman: Palo Alto, CA
Jason Fritz: Washington, DC
Daveed Gartenstein-Ross: Washington, DC
Thomas Gibbons-Neff: Washington, DC
Robert Haddick: Washington, DC
TX Hammes: Washington, DC
Frank Hoffman: Washington, DC
Van Jackson: Washington, DC
Karl Kadon: Chicago, IL and San Francisco, CA
Michael Kugelman: Washington, DC
Thomas Lynch: Washington, DC
Dave Maxwell: Washington, DC
Bryan McGrath: Easton, MD & Washington, DC
Kathleen McInnis: London, UK & Washington, DC
Mike Noonan: Philadelphia, PA
Douglas Ollivant: Washington, DC
Afshon Ostovar, Washington, DC
Mira Rapp-Hooper: NYC & Washington, DC
Stephen Rodriguez: NYC & Washington, DC
Anna Simons: Monterey, CA
Stan Sloan: Richmond, Vermont
Mark Stout: Washington, DC
Stephen Tankel: Washington, DC
Joshua Walker: Washington, DC
Ali Wyne: Washington, DC

That amount will:  Support a re-design of our website (Our modified free WordPress template is bursting at the seams behind the curtain. Don't worry! We will preserve the clean look and make navigation even easier); Allow us to dramatically expand the amount of high-quality content you get to read, watch, and listen to at War on the Rocks;
And support part-time staffing costs that will allow all this to happen.  
Our real goal, however, is $150K. If we get there, we can:

Launch a jobs board and career events for all of you looking to make a difference in defense, foreign policy, and national security; 
Support longform content from some of the top doers and thinkers in the field;
Launch a regular video podcast series (think The View but about war and with more scotch).
   The Impact At the end of the day, the mission of War on the Rocks is to promote better strategic thinking. If we are to ask so much of the soldiers, sailors, airmen, and Marines working at the tactical level, we should be able to expect more from our leaders making decisions at the summit of national policy. 
That's what War on the Rocks is all about. A bigger, stronger, and more effective War on the Rocks is a reward on its own, but we also have some amazing and exciting perks to offer you.
















    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute funds yourself, we understand. We know what it is like to be under financial strain. But you can still help us out by spreading the word. Take to Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest and more. Tell anyone and everyone you know who thinks solid strategy is important and ask them to help us make it happen. 

We Can't Do it Without You
We exist for our readers and are truly grateful for your continued engagement and support.  We never expected to be where we are today and now we're asking you to help us increase the impact of War on the Rocks by supporting us in this raise.  We've been constantly impressed by what this community is capable of accomplishing and we are excited to see what we can accomplish as we expand with your help.
Lunch/Dinner Partners for our Perks
For some of our perks, we offer lunch/dinner with our contributors. Here are your possible dining partners:




Claude
  Berube: Annapolis, MD


Patrick Cronin: Washington, DC


Brian Fishman: Palo Alto, CA


Jason Fritz: Washington, DC


Daveed Gartenstein-Ross: Washington, DC


Thomas Gibbons-Neff: Washington, DC


Robert Haddick: Washington, DC


TX Hammes: Washington, DC


Frank Hoffman: Washington, DC


Van Jackson: Washington, DC


Karl Kadon: Chicago, IL and San Francisco, CA


Michael Kugelman: Washington, DC


Thomas Lynch: Washington, DC


Dave Maxwell: Washington, DC


Bryan McGrath: Easton, MD & Washington, DC


Kathleen McInnis: London, UK & Washington, DC


Mike Noonan: Philadelphia, PA


Douglas Ollivant: Washington, DC


Afshon Ostovar, Washington, DC


Mira Rapp-Hooper: NYC & Washington, DC


Stephen Rodriguez: NYC & Washington, DC


Anna Simons: Monterey, CA


Stan Sloan: Richmond, Vermont


Mark Stout: Washington, DC


Stephen Tankel: Washington, DC


Joshua Walker: Washington, DC


Ali Wyne: Washington, DC

story:
Short Summary

The Watergate Story is a documentary produced by Black Jacket Productions.  It will cover the development, construction, and impact of the Watergate Complex.  Richard Nixon’s scandal is widely known, but there are far more interesting stories around the Watergate’s creation than people realize.  The Watergate is an Italian-American work of art, which took over a decade to fully realize.  We will be working alongside Giuseppe Cecchi, the original project manager of the Watergate, to tell the story.  He will be the audience’s guide through the challenges faced in the nearly decade-long construction, opposition from the Washington DC government, the influence of the complex, and more.  The documentary will be shot in Washington DC, with post-production done in Chicago, Illinois.  Shooting is slated for Summer 2015, with a target completion by the end of 2015, in order to coincide with the 50th anniversary of the Watergate East opening.  Once the documentary is complete we plan to enter it into film festivals and sell it as an educational video.

People will plan to interview include:

Giuseppe Cecchi - Project Manager

Bill Graff - Architect

David Rainey - Engineer

John Attus - Co-owner of Watergate Pastries

Gigi Winston - Daughter of Henry Winston, salesman of Watergate apartments

Black Jacket Productions is a film production company in Chicago, IL, owned by Brandon Rackowski, a graduate of the Illinois Institute of Art - Chicago.

Other team members include Thomas Rackowski (producer), Don Reed (assistant director, research leader), Matthew Kakaris (director of photography), Freddie Benitez (assistant camera, motion graphics), Manal Hilana (makeup), Jenan Diab (researcher), Pat Locke (researcher) Jonathan Fairfield (editor), Natalie Gottinger (editor), Phillip Kissane (sound), Megan Tallman (researcher),  and Jacob Hagley (storyboard artist).

What We Need & What You Get

In order for this documentary to succeed, Black Jacket Productions will need to raise a budget to cover the costs of equipment rentals, crew, research team, travel expenses, copyright clearances, marketing costs, festival submissions, and more.  We have already raised enough funds to cover our pre-production costs. The money we raise from this campaign will go towards principal photography, equipment rentals, travel costs, and some post-production costs.

Our perks include production updates, a Black Jacket Productions t-shirt, a DVD copy of the finished documentary, and more coming soon.

The Impact

The Watergate Story is about more than just a group of buildings.  It is an exploration into what it took to bring a work of art to life, what challenges were faced from Washington DC's 1960's environment, and the impact it has had on American history.  Our documentary will shed light on these little known facts.  Since 2015 is the 50th anniversary of the opening of Watergate East, many of the original architects, workers, and commissioners are no longer with us.  This documentary will visually preserve the legacy of those who are still alive, as well as honor the memory and work of those who have passed on.

Risks & Challenges

As part of the pre-production process for The Watergate Story we are tracking down the key players in the development and construction of the Watergate for interviews.  In addition to finding the people involved, our research team will have to dig through multiple archives for photographs and stories of the Watergate during its construction period.  Since it has been 50 years since the grand opening, there are many team members who are no longer with us.  We are proud that through Mr. Cechhi we have access to some of those who were involved with the Watergate’s development.  But we have to act fast.  If this documentary isn’t made now, we all run the risk of this story becoming lost history.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't forget to share our page with all your friends, and follow us on Facebook.  Spread the word to help preserve this piece of United States history.

story:
We are an independent film company Mutiny House Productions looking to fund our first Australian horror feature film, Detour / Theatre to be filmed in Sydney in November 2015.

Already with a fan base of over 1000 between facebook and twitter and with private investors on board, we are looking to raise half of our funds through this crowdfunding campaign to ensure this unique horror movie will be made and be brought to an international audience.

Created by brother team JM and Trevor Burdon and now with a team of over 30 actors and 20 crew members and an award winning script, Detour / Theatre is bound to be a staple amongst the horror genre film community and it is only through your help that our movie will move from pre-production to the filming stage and beyond. Hailed as a cross between Nightmare on Elm Street and Waiting For Guffman, we will do everything humanly possible to ensure this movie is made as we have dedicated ourselves to the team of professionals surrounding us who believe in this project as much as we do

The current cast of DETOUR / THEATRE and still growing! Do you see a familiar face? We need your help to bring their talent to the camera for this November otherwise the wait to the filming stage will be too long to sustain such a last cast!
We have fans from across the world including Hong Kong, Canada, USA, UK, New Caledonia, Germany, France, Italy, Australia and Spain to name a few already and we have every intention of ensuring this movie will be distributed on an international basis. This is a work two years in the making and it is only now we are ready to make the leap into the monumental task of filming and distributing this film to our audience.
A movie can take anything from 20 million to 30 million to make. We have a budget of $100,000 to raise which is extremely tight for a cinematic challenge but with support from our community we know we can do it.
Our camera department will be the team a Speed Jackson led by the award winning DOP Nathaniel C.T. Jackson whose first work 54 Days (www.54daysthemovie.com) won awards in the USA, Spain & Australia. Nathaniel also runs the website Any Camera Will Do, bringing information and guidance to filmmakers across Australia.
Our SFX Make Up Team will be led by Helen Tuck whose recent work includes Gods of Egypt, Infini and Red Rabbit Lodge.
Our editor is the award winning Ryan Cauchi whose short film, IT GROWS has been taking the short film horror world by storm. His editing skills provided the final video you see in this campaign.


We need your help to raise $50,000 which is half our estimated budget to ensure this movie will come to fruition.  We understand the magnitude of this sum but we have so much faith in our audience, fans and the film community we truly believe it can be done. If we can raise our desired amount, our private investors will match every cent, dollar for dollar bringing our total budget to $100,000 which is the minimum amount we need to ensure every facet of the movie is overseen from design to distribution.

By raising this sum we can ensure that all of our products including special effect make up, lighting, film equipment, generators, transport, site safety, armourers, sound, special in-camera effects, wardrobe and the crew themselves can be solidified for the shoot.
We can also ensure accommodation for all of our cast and crew as we are shooting in remote locations as well as ensuring our film can be distributed in the most effective manner to our fans.We can ensure all cast and crew can be treated in the way such professional creatives should be on set, hiring craft services for the team and finally ensuring that our main location will be safe and ready for filming in November. As a heritage listed site the majority of our funding will be working towards the correct licences to ensure filming will be a successful reality.
We understand no everyone is in a position to contribute or pledge money but we can use everyone's help in simply sharing this campaign with your fellow workers, colleagues, friends and family to ensure the word is spread about our venture.

In return, you can receive some fantastic perks including days on set, cast and crew meet and greets, free tickets to our premiere in 2016, signed copies of blue-ray and dvds of the film, special collector paraphenalia of the movie, featured extra and cameo appearances available and much more.

We hope you will come along for the ride and support us in our movie making venture, bringing old school horror back with a modern edge and supporting Australian independent film in general.
With recent budget cuts to the arts in Australia by our government, now more than ever, independent companies and artists such as ourselves must rely on the generosity of the community to help our dream become a reality! We truly cannot do this without you and we hope that you will contribute in any way you can to help us, (even a singe dollar pledged is not taken for granted by us),  achieve our goal of reaching our financial target to ensure our movie can go from page to stage (literally - this movie is set in a theatre!!)

story:
During the 1950s, a period obsessed with the idea of the perfect nuclear family, Lily, a conservative suburban housewife watches her identity and morality crumble as she fights to preserve her "perfect" life. Throughout the span of three decades, she faces perilous choices -- save her relationship with her daughter, her marriage, or her reputation?


Ernest Lesmana - Director 

Ernest was born in Jakarta, Indonesia. He is majoring in film production with a concentration in directing. During his high school years his plan was to pursue a degree in dentistry, but he shifted his professional goal to become a filmmaker as he realized his strength in visual arts. He has been working on "Lily" for over a year now. He is currently attending Emerson College in Boston and is enrolled in the Bachelor of Fine Arts program. 

Leanna Furtado - Producer

Leanna is a senior producing major at Emerson College. Leanna enjoys producing because she gets to follow a script from the beginning to the end of its journey.  When she started college she was torn between film and business, but found her true calling lying somewhere in between. She is passionate about "Lily" because of the story, its components and the crew involved. She plans on attending Emerson Los Angles in the fall and graduating in December. 

Liz LeMay - Co-Producer 

Originally from Pennsylvania, Liz is a Senior Film Production major at Emerson College. Liz enjoys studying film theory and likes to assistant direct on set, but her favorite part of filmmaking is producing. She loves being involved in the entire process - from choosing a great script to the moment it’s projected on the big screen. That’s why Liz has chosen to work on "Lily" and is very excited to be part of such an ambitious student film. She believes in hard work and collaboration, which are integral parts of filmmaking and in particular, "Lily".

Kimberly Kelmelis - Writer
 

Kim is a sophomore Film Production student at Emerson College. She has worked on set for various student productions as well as for Emerson Channel, the school’s television station. She has worked closely with the director to try to produce something very unique, inspiring, and relatable. Over the past couple months, the script has become an ongoing journey, and something she is very passionate about. Since the script holds the production together, it has become very important to form a solid story, in order to set the foundation for this ambitious and intricate production.

Michael Vitz-Wong - Director of Photography

Michael Vitz-Wong is a sophomore from Seattle, Washington. He loves light and learning how to manipulate it. When not on a film set he can be found making noise at a concert, making noise at a political rally, or making noise at a soccer game. His spirit animal is a river otter. 

Michael Chancellor - Production Designer

Michael Chancellor is attending Emerson College as a Theater Design & Technology major, with a minor in Dance, and is graduating this spring.  He has worked as a Set Designer on many plays and has recently started designing for TV Shows and films. He is excited for the challenge of showing the intimate progression of Lily across three decades and telling a visual story to accompany it.John Rosenkranz - Composer

John Rosenkranz, born and raised in Allentown New Jersey, is a composer currently in his last semester at Berklee College of Music pursuing a degree in Film Scoring. He has worked on a number of projects including "Child's Play" directed by Stephanie Mathews, and the indie video game "Satellites" from William De La Torre and Wynston Stanback to name more recent projects. John is eager to work on "Lily in Particular" and create music that defines the characters and story that Ernest and Kimberly so beautifully crafted.

Production Design: Since "Lily" is a period piece the production design is a major component to the story. We are going to see Lily's life through the 50's, 60's and 70's and how her environment changed along with other aspects of her life as well. 


Location: Since we are creating a set and filming in the Jackie Liebergott Black Box Theatre at Emerson College, our main location, Lily's house is there. But we have two other locations we need to pay for in order to complete the film and Lily's story. 

Food: We need to feed the crew and cast while on set to thank them for all of their hard work. 

Equipment: Although Emerson College supplies a lot of the equipment, we will still need to rent some equipment, like walkie talkies, a dolly, lights and lenses from an outside supplier. 

Development: This money goes toward paying actors who are SAG/AFTRA and unforeseen expenses. 

Transportation: Since we are recreating a home inside a theatre, we will need to rent trucks to transport the many props and  all of the equipment to the location. 

With any short film there are tons of risks.The fact that we are making a period piece is a large risk itself, but we are excited for the challenge.  Other possible risks include the locations might fall through, something could break, or we might not reach our funding goal. With this money we will be able to handle problems that might be out of our control. 

We understand that not everyone can contribute. Please pass this page along to your friends and family or share it on social networking platforms to help spread the word. Check out and pass along our Facebook page or Tumblr! 


Our production team thank you for your support and contributions!

story:
thanks for your time to see this campaign

                         one of the official posters that we will give you as gift


                                                IRANIAN HORROR


                                                          SHALAMROOD



We found the map of shalamrood and we are going on a journey to find it                                                                   

                                                           JOIN US





why 6500 $ ? why you should join us ?

answer is :

This film we're working on is on the range of 30-35 thousand dollars, and this 6.5 Thousand dollar that I've campaigned for is for special effects only, and because it's a horror film the special effects are very important for us.
To make this a better film, something special to my heart is that I would love it if I could share this process with you, & for each and one of you to be by my side as we go on the journey making my imagination into a film you can watch.
This is the only main reason for this campaign. Sharing our experience with you & hopefully making friends on the way!
Sharing & making friends is prior to everything.
We can do this with out you, but we would rather build a great friendship on our journey & make it extra special.


                                                                STORY OF SHALAMRROD




A group of men go in search of their childhood story to find the village of Shalamrood & the iconic Hasani, when they drive by to the located village they have mixed emotions about what the villagers say.
Some say Hasani is still alive & they've seen him, some say it's just a folklore & some say the villagers killed him, but all of them warned don't go looking for Shalamrood or you'll never come out.
The group of men keep to their journey to find Shalamrood an eerie isolated location, but what they endure is nothing what they would have imagined.

 

WHO AM I ?




  siavash tofighi : director / producer

Siavash Tofighi was born and raised in Iran, Tehran on February 2, 1984 to Nooshin Emrani, a psychologist who got her PHD from Oxford, and Naser Tofighi, a famous artist. He knew he had a passion for arts and films at an early age therefore he attended The High School of Arts of Seda o Sima, and afterwards studied graphic design in the University of Tehran with great accomplishments. He made a great status for himself throughout the years, and became close friends with writers, directors , and actors around the globe while finishing his BA, he then attended Oxford University majoring in interior design, but his passion for films and documentaries made him strive for the best in all aspects of art throughout his life so he then got his video production degree from York University finding his new gain of love in production Siavash Tofighi went on to produce films while writing , he still to this day will not make his writings public.

- IMDb Mini Biography By: sn 

FOR MORE INFORMATION MY IMDB
story_txt:
thanks for your time to see this campaign                          one of the official posters that we will give you as gift                                                 IRANIAN HORROR                                                           SHALAMROODWe found the map of shalamrood and we are going on a journey to find it                                                                                                                               JOIN USwhy 6500 $ ? why you should join us ?answer is :This film we're working on is on the range of 30-35 thousand dollars, 
and this 6.5 Thousand dollar that I've campaigned for is for special 
effects only, and because it's a horror film the special effects are 
very important for us.To make this a better film, something special 
to my heart is that I would love it if I could share this process with 
you, & for each and one of you to be by my side as we go on the 
journey making my imagination into a film you can watch.This is the only main reason for this campaign. Sharing our experience with you & hopefully making friends on the way!Sharing & making friends is prior to everything. We can do this with out you, but we would rather build a great friendship on our journey & make it extra special.                                                                STORY OF SHALAMRRODA group of men go in search of their childhood story to find the village
 of Shalamrood & the iconic Hasani, when they drive by to the 
located village they have mixed emotions about what the villagers say.Some
 say Hasani is still alive & they've seen him, some say it's just a 
folklore & some say the villagers killed him, but all of them warned
 don't go looking for Shalamrood or you'll never come out.The group 
of men keep to their journey to find Shalamrood an eerie isolated 
location, but what they endure is nothing what they would have imagined. WHO AM I ?  siavash tofighi : director / producer

          Siavash Tofighi was born and raised in Iran, Tehran on 
February 2, 1984 to Nooshin Emrani, a psychologist who got her PHD from 
Oxford, and Naser Tofighi, a famous artist. He knew he had a passion for
 arts and films at an early age therefore he attended The High School of
 Arts of Seda o Sima, and afterwards studied graphic design in the 
University of Tehran with great accomplishments. He made a great status 
for himself throughout the years, and became close friends with writers,
 directors , and actors around the globe while finishing his BA, he then
 attended Oxford University majoring in interior design, but his passion
 for films and documentaries made him strive for the best in all aspects
 of art throughout his life so he then got his video production degree 
from York University finding his new gain of love in production Siavash 
Tofighi went on to produce films while writing , he still to this day 
will not make his writings public.
          - IMDb Mini Biography By:

story:
JOIN US IN BRINGING AN INSPIRATIONAL STORY TO LIFE on this 71st Anniversary of the start of Maria's journey, March 19th. 

This film is based on the internationally known book, "Through Maria's Eyes" whose original adapted screenplay has already garnered quite a bit of recognition.

       

YOUR HELP AND SUPPORT IS MUCH APPRECIATED! In honor of our heroine's determination to help others, we will be donating a small percentage to UNITED WAY upon reaching our goal.


Inspired by TRUE events, Through Maria's Eyes is the story of Gizella, a poor young jewish woman, who takes on the identity of Maria in order to save her family and herself from persecution in 1944 Hungary. Her family's lives, as well as her own, depend on the callous exterior that Maria must maintain in the midst of unimaginable atrocities with only hope and determination illuminating her way as she fights for survival. 

Why this particular story?  We decided to crowd fund for this project because it is relatable and based upon actual people whose lives have reinforced that through adversity any of us have the ability to overcome obstacles.

There are so many people in this world that are living life with a daily struggle.   Our hope is to show others that there are many people from the past and in the present that have overcame similar or more extreme circumstances in order to better their lives.  

This film will allow those folks to see that there are always options as long as you don't stop looking for them.  These funds will allow us to begin our journey hand in hand with each of you to not only showcase an incredible story but to also help inspire others.

        This project was conceived by filmmaker/producer David Rich in homage to the real life person who the film is based on.  Upon further research he found that there weren't many true life heroine stories being told on film or in literary form that were based on these events.  As a producer and director of several feature films himself, he has taken it upon himself to bring the story of this family to the big screen.   A challenge that is guaranteed to take our contributors and general audience on an unexpected ride of emotions seen through the eyes of our heroin.

        Simply put, this project has heart and a story that yearns to be told.  There are a few movies that showcase seemingly similar stories from the past but what does this one have that they don't?  A strong team behind it that are currently working around the clock to create a film that's not your typical true story production.  We guarantee that our contributors will be proud to say they played a big part in making this feature film a reality and will be happy to share our successes with each and everyone of you.

  • Your donation will be used to allow us to make a film that is guaranteed to resonate with audiences worldwide.   The key word is "You", because without the aid of others like yourselves, this dream project may not be made.

  • We are currently looking to raise money to help pay for the INITIAL costs necessary to build the proper groundwork for success. 

Our groundwork will include Business Planning,  Expert Consultation Fees, Investor Meetings & Travel to solidify the estimated production budget of $20 million.

There are many hurdles to face when it comes to raising the necessary funds to make a film a reality.  This campaign is our first step in getting there but luckily we have many individuals with 30+ years of experience who are ready to start whenever our pre-production items are in place.  What are our risks and challenges?

  • Meeting our goal would be our first challenge.  If we don't meet it then we need to go back to the drawing board on how to bring in the remaining funds which takes additional time.
  • Another potential hiccup may be solidifying the polished script, production team, and cast.  Luckily for us your donation amount will help us to build a solid groundwork that each of the mentioned groups have asked to see. Just check out the author and see who she is.
  • Solidifying locations.  As this is a historic film, it goes with saying that authenticity is crucial for overall look and feel.  We have an experienced line producer who has already started documenting potential locales in preparation for the future.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

  • We know that not everyone has money to spare but there are other ways to assist.  Please SHARE our INDIEGOGO campaign via FACEBOOK, TWITTER, and EMAIL.  Our webpage links are below.

Another potential hiccup may be solidifying the polished script, production team, and cast.  Luckily for us your donation amount will help us to build a solid groundwork that each of the mentioned groups have asked to see. Just check out the author and see who she is. Solidifying locations.  As this is a historic film, it goes with saying that authenticity is crucial for overall look and feel.  We have an experienced line producer who has already started documenting potential locales in preparation for the future.

 We know that not everyone has money to spare but there are other ways to assist.  Please SHARE our INDIEGOGO campaign via FACEBOOK, TWITTER, and EMAIL.  Our webpage links are below.

story:
Summary

We are a small group of film students at Minneapolis Community & Technical College that just shot our final student film. We have spent that last two years learning and practicing a specific discipline within the filmmaking program and we will put all of our efforts together and made a great film. 

We completed filming this past weekend and it was grueling, but AMAZING!!! Now we just need to recoup some of the expenses.  

The Flick

Our film is a gritty thriller that explores the mental state of a rape victim and what happens to the person or people who are responsible.  


Set Photo's

 

The Cast

Meaghan McCarthy will be playing "Lily"

Andrew Stecker as "David"

Anna Larranaga will play "Alma"

Joel Peterson will play "Gabe"


Inspirations for this film

I am pulling inspiration from a lot of different films and directors but the most influential films for this will be the horror films of the 1980's. 


  
I also love a couple remakes of 80's horror films that I will draw inspiration from
"Maniac" for the colors and cinematography.

and the "Evil Dead" original and remake for the grittiness and use of practical effects.


What your money will go towards:

  • Food for the cast & crew.
  • Location fee's.
  • Equipment rental (lighting effects, fog machine, etc) 
  • Props/Set Decoration
  • Hair/Makeup & Costumes 


So if you're down with BIG ass sharks, EXPLOSIONS, exotic locations, and FAST cars, then, well.........sorry, our movie literally has NONE of that. Not even a single explosion.


BUT...

Here's what we do have:

  • BLOW UP dolls
  • Pumpkins
  • Ball GAGS
  • Friggin' LASER lights!

We are filming on THIS...

and editing on THIS...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the funds to spare, no sweat. You can help out by...

  • Spread the word by sharing this campaign.

Thank You!

Directors Previous Work

story:
Short Summary

Many of you know me, some may not. What started out as a challenge from my acting teacher has blossomed into something that is dying to be created. Even Steve is a story of a guy quite like me who, in an alternate universe, got divorced twice and pushed ahead with his desire to be a singer/songwriter.

My Biography from IMDb.com (http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3907797/)

"Film and stage actor Steve Brock was born in Los Gatos, California. He is the eldest of two sons of Donna Brock (Lecrivain), a teacher, and Les Brock, an electrical and computer engineer. He was involved in musical theater in high school and in college.

Steve has just finished a run of a musical review "Songalogues" at Lifebook Playhouse (2014) and "3060" at Two Roads Theater (2014). He is writing a play called "Facets" detailing struggles in serotonin spectrum disorder. In June, he performed a one man show called Uncovered, where he played original music and some arrangements with an amazing band.

He is also a singer/songwriter and has released a CD called "Cry By the Light of the Moon." (2014) He is training with Allen Levin at Lifebook Acting Academy in the advanced class where he is studying improvisation and scene study (2014-) He also is a graduate of Second City (2014)."

This campaign will help me create this pilot and perhaps keep moving on by bring it to series. This pilot has received great reviews from the table read that was performed at We Make Movies.

We're all super stoked for @SteveBrock who brought in his 1st Script EVER and impressed our pants off. Jealous now, eh? #wemakemovies

— We Make Movies (@WEMAKEMOVIEZ) February 19, 2015

@WEMAKEMOVIEZ #WeMakeMovies @SteveBrock Great writing! Really enjoyed!!

— Lisa Siewert (@Lisa_Siewert) February 19, 2015

Your assistance will help me get this script produced. I've budgeted this project to be as low cost as conceivable. You're donation will also prove that a quality show can be produced at a rock bottom budget.

I have amazing actors and a wonderful assistant producer. They are not only qualified to help me create this story, they are wonderfully enthusiastic about this project as well. We will be going into production on March 22, 2015, but we will continue to take donations to reach our production goal. If we go to series, each episode will feature an unsigned singer.

What we need and What You Get:

The challenge is to obtain the right amount of money to fully produce this project. I need money to pay my actors and crew. What you get is a high quality production at a shoestring budget. What a concept! Consider this project the "Hollywood Shuffle" of Online Television.

If I can't reach my full budget, I will still be able to complete the project with some deferred pay to a few actors, but the project will still be able to be awesome.

Risks & Challenges

I have learned a lot from my fellow filmmakers and have done what I can to avoid classic mistakes. I have an amazing cast. I have a great, and proven director of photography and sound director. I have succeeded in finding awesome locations.

However, there are obstacles that may still arise. Promoting my project after accomplishment is always a challenge for filmmakers. However, my experience in social media and my strong connections to the local communities such as We Make Movies are both invaluable and will allow me to over come this hurdle.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Social media: Ask your followers and friends to help out of you can't.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help as well. Put it on your website. Put it in your email.

story:
Short Summary

Hello My name is Simoné Loudd and I am from Oakland, CA. I am currently pursuing  my Masters Degree at the New York Film Academy in Burbank, CA ,and the film I would like you to donate to is my thesis. 

Although this film will determine my final grade  as a graduate student, this film means so much more to me than graduation. I put my life into this script and am allowing people to get a taste of some of the things I have experienced in my life which I am sure others will be able to relate to as well no matter what part of the world you are from. 

Your contribution to help me create Dream will do more than make my dreams come true, but will also allow me to be put into a position to help make inspiring artist like myself help their dreams come true as well. With this film I want to do more than submit to festivals. I want to open doors and create opportunities for those later down the line who find themselves struggling just like me. 

Logline: After being away from her hometown of Oakland, CA for a year pursuing her college degree, 19- year old Destiny is excited to return and reunite with past relationships, but she quickly comes to realize that what she left in the past is best left there. 

Since I am from Oakland and wanted to write a story that embraced the essence of my city as well as tell a relatable narrative. With this project, I want to connect with my Oakland community as a way to give back by offering the opportunity to be involved in all aspects of production from graphic designing to original music for a Dream EP. 


What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $8,000. 

For some that may not seem like much, but for me, I could use all the help I can get. All the money raised will go towards production and post production costs which include:

-Transportation expenses from LA to Oakland

-Hotel Accomodations for crew and cast

-Truck rental for equipment

- Wardrobe

-Hair & Make-up

-Production design

-Insurance

-Permits

- Catering and Craft services for 5 days of filming

-Location costs

-Graphic Design

-Director of Photography

-Sound Design

-Composer

-Festivals

As a reward for contributing to my film, whether it's $5 or $100, you will receive something in return.  FIRST 50 people to donate about $25 will receive an EXTRA gift from me. If you would like to make a donation less than $25 just go to my website: www.iamloudd.com/donate

The Impact

Have you ever been lied to ? Have you ever been cheated on? Have you ever felt as if you had no one you can trust? Have you ever felt as if you didn't  know where your life was going? Have you ever just wanted to escape reality to DREAM. 
This movie entails all these aspects and so much more. I want to do more than just tell a story. I want to make an impact. 

If you make a contribution to this film I promise you will not regret it. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If  you can't personally make a donation, that's okay! Share this with others who you believe may be interested in supporting. Thank you in advance.

story:
THE STORY
The 2015 Taekwondo World Championships will take place in Chelyabinsk, Russia in May of this year. This competition is the biggest event at the world stage, apart from competing at the Olympics. This is equivalent to the World Cup of Taekwondo!

In February, IMPACT elite athletes Keshena Waterford, Catherine Risbey and Nicole Men were successfully selected to be part of Australian Taekwondo team! This of one the highest honours an athlete can achieve, the opportunity to represent your country overseas at the world championships. 

But unlike many internationally represented sports, Taekwondo in Australia does not always have readily available funds to support all its athletes who are selected for such great honours. The financial burden can be excessive on athletes and their families.

For Keshena, Catherine and Nicole, and other elite IMPACT athletes, this is their job. They train twice a day, every day, sometimes more. They live on strict diets and fitness regimes. The also instruct and coach the junior athletes who are part of their IMPACT martial arts community. But they do not receive a salary for all this. They balance on top of all this, school or work or even both, and when they have to travel to compete, they have to take significant amount of time in leave. 

This campaign is a call out to the community, to help support these athletes. In return for your support,  they promise will fight with the Aussie spirit we have come to know well. They will wave the Australian flag proud, on behalf of all us cheering them on back home!


ABOUT THE ORGANISATIONS
ACT TKD in a non-profit sports organisation that supports Taekwondo across the state and promotes development from grass roots to future Champions and Olympians. ACT TKD has long been home to many of Australia’s top athletes. 

IMPACT Martial Arts practices many styles of Martial Arts including Taekwondo, Kenpo Karate, Kyusho Jitsu and Hapkido, with 4 big centres in Canberra, Australia.

WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS AND BEYOND

This crowd funding campaign is targeting the coming 2015 World Championships in Russia!

IMPACT Martial Arts with on going support of ACT Taekwondo, believes in all athletes of all grades and ability. We are a close community, that looks to support each other in any way we can, and foster the values of family and excellence. Every athlete deserves a chance to do their best, and whether there is success or a need for more work, we will continue to stand together as team IMPACT.

When the time comes to represent, we are committed to provide the best possible assistance we can. It is never about one person, or even three people, but the team and the community. Right now, four of our family will be travelling to Russia to represent our country, and your support, along with our own, will forever be part of their taekwondo journey.

But in time, other members of our club will take the next step in their own path, and will have a chance to represent, and we hope then we can provide similar assistance as we are now. 

This campaign is only the start. To continue the development of our elite team, money raised will form part of a funding pool, that if required, any IMPACT athlete can access.

So your support is not only helping Keshena, Catherine and Nicole, but every IMPACT elite athlete who has the opportunity to represent!

Impact Sparring Elite members



THE BUDGET
Our goal is to raise a minimum of $25,000AUD. 

The expenses include Travel, Accommodation, Food, Uniform and Equipment. This is just the bare minimum for the team. There are always other costs that we will have to cover ourselves, so this funding campaign alone is to help subsidizes costs we have already made, and costs we intend to make in the coming weeks and months.

Money raised will be pooled together, and shared amount the selected team IMPACT members for World Championships. 

In particular, if we break our target, all money that is continued to be contributed to this campaign by you, will support other activities such as:
  • International training camps
  • University Games
  • Pacific Games
  • Korean Open

Any IMPACT athlete who has qualified for these events or activities will have opportunity to access these funds!



THE REWARDS
To thank you for your support we have put together a number of reward levels.

**NEW REWARD*** 


Official IMPACT Martial Arts Pin! This item is available from $25 reward level onwards. If you have contributed $50 already, a pin will be added to your reward package automatically.








* Videos may be uploaded after the world championships, but before we return home.

* Only 5 training session available per trainer (unless more is made available). Bookings will be required after we return from the World Championships. 

*Only two showreels available.
 



* Only 5 dinner dates available. Dates to occur after World Championships and bookings essential. Dietary requirements may be requested at booking. 


*Sponsorship period includes time travelling to and from Russia. Logo placements outside of social media must comply with current sponsorship agreements, including any rules and regulations set by WTF, STA and TKDACT for the 2015 Taekwondo World Championships. Please contact us before selecting reward to receive full details of reward.
story_txt:
THE STORYThe 2015 Taekwondo World Championships will take place in Chelyabinsk, Russia in May of this year. This competition is the biggest event at the world stage, apart from competing at the Olympics. This is equivalent to the World Cup of Taekwondo!In February, IMPACT elite athletes Keshena Waterford, Catherine Risbey and Nicole Men were successfully selected to be part of Australian Taekwondo team! This of one the highest honours an athlete can achieve, the opportunity to represent your country overseas at the world championships. But unlike many internationally represented sports, Taekwondo in Australia does not always have readily available funds to support all its athletes who are selected for such great honours. The financial burden can be excessive on athletes and their families.For Keshena, Catherine and Nicole, and other elite IMPACT athletes, this is their job. They train twice a day, every day, sometimes more. They live on strict diets and fitness regimes. The also instruct and coach the junior athletes who are part of their IMPACT martial arts community. But they do not receive a salary for all this. They balance on top of all this, school or work or even both, and when they have to travel to compete, they have to take significant amount of time in leave. This campaign is a call out to the community, to help support these athletes. In return for your support,  they promise will fight with the Aussie spirit we have come to know well. They will wave the Australian flag proud, on behalf of all us cheering them on back home!
ABOUT THE ORGANISATIONSACT TKD in a non-profit sports organisation that supports Taekwondo across the state and promotes development from grass roots to future Champions and Olympians. ACT TKD has long been home to many of Australia’s top athletes. IMPACT Martial Arts practices many styles of Martial Arts including Taekwondo, Kenpo Karate, Kyusho Jitsu and Hapkido, with 4 big centres in Canberra, Australia.WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS AND BEYOND

This crowd funding campaign is targeting the coming 2015 World Championships in Russia!
IMPACT Martial Arts with on going support of ACT Taekwondo, believes in all athletes of all grades and ability. We are a close community, that looks to support each other in any way we can, and foster the values of family and excellence. Every athlete deserves a chance to do their best, and whether there is success or a need for more work, we will continue to stand together as team IMPACT.When the time comes to represent, we are committed to provide the best possible assistance we can. It is never about one person, or even three people, but the team and the community. Right now, four of our family will be travelling to Russia to represent our country, and your support, along with our own, will forever be part of their taekwondo journey.But in time, other members of our club will take the next step in their own path, and will have a chance to represent, and we hope then we can provide similar assistance as we are now. This campaign is only the start. To continue the development of our elite team, money raised will form part of a funding pool, that if required, any IMPACT athlete can access.So your support is not only helping Keshena, Catherine and Nicole, but every IMPACT elite athlete who has the opportunity to represent!
Impact Sparring Elite members




THE BUDGET

Our goal is to raise a minimum of $25,000AUD. The expenses include Travel, Accommodation, Food, Uniform and Equipment. This is just the bare minimum for the team. There are always other costs that we will have to cover ourselves, so this funding campaign alone is to help subsidizes costs we have already made, and costs we intend to make in the coming weeks and months.Money raised will be pooled together, and shared amount the selected team IMPACT members for World Championships. In particular, if we break our target, all money that is continued to be contributed to this campaign by you, will support other activities such as:



International training camps

University Games
Pacific Games

Korean Open

Any IMPACT athlete who has qualified for these events or activities will have opportunity to access these funds!

THE REWARDS
To thank you for your support we have put together a number of reward levels.**NEW REWARD*** Official IMPACT Martial Arts Pin! This item is available from $25 reward level onwards. If you have contributed $50 already, a pin will be added to your reward package automatically.









* Videos may be uploaded after the world championships, but before we return home.

* Only 5 training session available per trainer (unless more is made available). Bookings will be required after we return from the World Championships. 
*Only two showreels available. 




* Only 5 dinner dates available. Dates to occur after World Championships and bookings essential. Dietary requirements may be requested at booking. 


*Sponsorship period includes time travelling to and from Russia. Logo placements outside of social media must comply with current sponsorship agreements, including any rules and regulations set by WTF, STA and TKDACT for the 2015 Taekwondo World Championships. Please contact us before selecting reward to receive full details of reward.

story:
Please read the detailed perk descriptions in the updates section before contributing! Thanks.

Eflahfluflah!

It's a fairly simple story of good versus evil, but crammed full of funny animation and pop culture references, as well as private jokes even I'm not in on (such as the tiny sheep hidden in every storyboard panel and throughout the film!).

They've spent over 300 hours working on the project and have written a script, storyboarded it and had the dialogue professionally recorded. They've designed and animated characters using various techniques, from 2D to life size stop motion. Did I mention it's a very ambitious project?!

Who are we? How did this project even begin?

I'm a freelance animator and I've been volunteering with children and young people for over five years. A group of teenagers volunteer alongside me at the junior youth club, running the tuck shop, serving drinks and even washing up!

They kept volunteering, even when the senior club had to close. I felt they deserved rewarding, so began running this project in January 2015. Here they are on day one, pitching their story:

Well, you wouldn't want us to give away the whole plot! Sadly, the group was shut down in December. I changed venues but, unbelievably, I recently learned that the building we moved to will be closing down soon as well!

What We Need

I'll go into more detail in an update, but mainly I need to raise enough funds to pay someone to help me run the group, which could cost over £3000 for a year.

As well as working for free, I haven't charged them anything to take part and I'd like it to remain that way. I've covered material costs myself so far, but it would be nice if we could raise enough funds that I didn't have to!

I've also pledged my fee from a music video I recently made to the project, but again it would be nice if I didn't have to!

I'll also need to cover the cost of Indiegogo and other fees (almost 10%) and the perks we're offering.

PERKS!

Firstly, I've put a long lead time on some perks because many campaigns fail to meet their initial estimates - my aim is to deliver early! July 2018 will be the absolute cut-off point for this project because that's when the kids will finish high school. Hopefully the film will be finished much sooner!

Some perks will be sent immediately - before I even receive funds from Indiegogo - as a sign of trust.

Every contributor will receive a credit in the film. The kids will be creating some original artwork, which will also be available as T-shirts and posters. There will also be opportunities to appear in the film as caricatures.

They're also going to write some small roles into the film, so a select few will have the opportunity to join us at our next recording session to voice these extra characters.

There are a few live action scenes and for one we'll need an army of ninjas, so you could have the opportunity to appear in the film for real!

I'll also be offering my services at a huge discount. For example, for half the normal price, you could have a go at light painting using my Pixelstick to create images like this (100% in camera - no Photoshop here!):

We're going to add more perks later and every contributor will receive early access to our secret perks, which won't become publicly available for a few weeks.

So, why should you contribute?

I asked the kids to think about this so they did some brainstorming. They came up with a few compelling reasons (in their typically humorous fashion!):

  • Teenagers often get a bad rap, but these are good kids who have been volunteering for several years. They're willing to do even more in return for your help - they're not just looking for handouts:

Each time they reach a certain milestone, such as every £100 raised, they're willing to do some voluntary community service, such as litter picking.

Last year they put their project on hold to help me run a community event. More recently they helped me make a music video:

http://www.leedsinspired.co.uk/events/feel-9-videos-premiere

I help them so they want to help me in return, because they understand the meaning of gratitude. Here is just one of the ways they've shown their appreciation:

  • The group is mainly comprised of girls who are into technology and animation. This isn't just a fad; they've interested and engaged and have stuck to it for almost two years because this is what they're passionate about.
  • They need your help because nobody else has really helped them yet:

I haven't found any volunteers and couldn't find any grants I'm even eligible to apply for as an individual.

The church where they continue to volunteer has closed their youth club and the project I began to replace it. They're willing to let us use the building for free, which is very generous. But at the same time, this doesn't help much because I can't run the group alone.

Similarly, I was allowed to move the group to a council run youth club. But due to budget cuts, soon they "will no longer deliver any open access youth activities" meaning the building will soon be closing and there will be no provision for local young people at all.

  • If those reasons aren't compelling enough, here's a brief message from The Queen:
 

Erm, thanks for that, Queen Snail, but I think you may have misunderstood what we're trying to achieve here... [Did you spot the sheep?]

Risks & Challenges

These kids have already faced a number of challenges that couldn't have been anticipated, but they haven't given up yet.

Whatever we raise here it will help keep the project going that bit longer and as long as the kids remain interested and engaged, I'll continue looking into ways to keep the project running.

Worst case scenario, I'm willing to fund the project myself but this will be a huge sacrifice as I don't currently earn much. Firstly, I'll have to introduce fees to attend, and I'll have to give up all the other volunteering I do, so that I can take on more paid work to cover the cost.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realise not everyone can afford to contribute, so if you can't then please share this page with everyone you know instead.

Thanks in advance from:

Sam, Molly, Sarah, Emma, Katie, Codie, Charley and Richard!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
