story:
Update: our first mobile-friendly promo game is live! Play it here. 

Join a startup marketer and a team of high school students to stop the Trump campaign

I'm Eric, the producer. I'm a millennial-age startup marketer in the Bay Area, California. I support strong family values, small businesses, low taxes, and I'm usually not vocal about politics. I 'should' be voting Republican. But there’s no way I’m voting for Donald Trump.  

My partner production company, Enigma Films, is the most professional team I've ever worked with. They are as organized, thoughtful, and thorough as they come. They're also all in high school. They’re not old enough to vote, so they’re contributing through this provocative and shareable short film.

We’re using Trump’s tactics against him

The Trump campaign creates diehard fans by appealing primarily to emotion. Trump chooses the issues people care about the most and makes provocative claims they’ll never forget.

While Trump’s claims are more reminiscent of an elementary school student promising Pepsi in drinking fountains, we’re creating a visceral appeal with significantly more reason. Even our marketing and PR will turn emotion and instinct against the Donald.


Enter Ryan’s letter

In this open letter to his father, Ryan Holiday demonstrates that many of Trump's values and policies are actually un-American. In the letter, Ryan contrasts his own family’s heritage as immigrants with Trump’s controversial sentiments. He contrasts his father’s respect for soldiers with Trump’s flippant dismissal of heroes like John McCain. And he re-examines Trump’s creepy and questionable sentiments towards women.

We're making a mass-appeal short film for online distribution inspired by Ryan's letter. The film is designed to tug heartstrings and question the morality of a Trump presidency. 

So partner with us, the California startup marketer and the uber-professional high school students, to make a difference in this election.

You can find Eric on YouTube, Facebook, Linkedin, and Instagram.

You can find Enigma through their website, and on YouTube.


How your dollars help

Your contributions pay for additional crew:

As you know, we have an extremely short production cycle. If I (Eric) am going to focus on PR and marketing, and the Enigma team is going to focus on casting, location, costuming, and school, we’ll need some help. If we can pay an editor and director, Enigma can work on preproduction and I can spend my time promoting. Your donations mean more people will see the film.

Your contributions make the film unforgettable:

The story is everything. Your donations make this story shine. With more funding, we can pay for the perfect locations, costuming, and cast. These elements allow viewers to engage the story without distraction, and remember the message long after the video stops. The Trump campaign has been on the defensive in the past couple weeks, and we can add to the pressure to keep them there. 

Your contributions turn hearts and instincts against Trump:

We currently have a razor-thin marketing budget for this project (as in, less than $500), but we’re planning for national appeal. How? Through creating emotional and provocative spin that can’t be ignored. 

We’ve got two absurd mobile games in development that I (Eric) am bankrolling. We’d like to add things to the mix like a Virtual Reality mini-scene, and viral content outside the film like scene of a giant yellow wig rampaging San Francisco. Each of those concepts are easy fodder for press and incredibly shareable, but we can’t do them without your support.

Donate any amount for release notifications


The Impact

This is the perfect time for the project. With your help, we'll create content so compelling that both conservative and liberal media outlets can't help but talk about it. If we can seed viewers' hearts and minds with enough doubts about Donald Trump, we can make a difference this November. 

  • We want a country of unity and inclusion, not racism and division.
  • We want a country with free press, free religion, and free speech. 
We want a country with greater equality for all citizens, regardless of race, gender, or any persuasion.


What donations will pay for

  • We'd like to bring on a paid director and editor to pound out this project. We're budgeting $3,000 per position for a two-day shoot. That's $6,000.
  • Extras and cast! If we want to show deportation, or show Muslim-Americans in holding cells to create a more visceral experience for viewers, we need extras to act those parts. We’ll need to pay the extras, actors to play the principle roles, and provide food. We're budgeting $80 per extra per day, and $200 per principal per day — standard rates for non-union actors. With 15 to 20 extras, that's about $4,000.
  • Costuming and locations. We want the cast and set to look authentic such that it doesn't distract viewers from the story. This may mean purchasing uniforms for guards, clothes for actors without their own costumes, and renting appropriate spaces. We’re budgeting $3,000 to pay for wardrobe for up to 20 people, and to rent / license two to three locations. 
  • Stretch Goals: Marketing and PR material. I already mentioned absurd mobile games, and I’m paying for those out of my own pocket. But we’d also like to add the aforementioned VR and wig monster short. Virtual reality requires extreme specialization to produce, as does a CG monster movie scene. We’d bring in some Hollywood expertise for those. The VR scene would cost an estimated $10,000 to produce, edit, and publish, and the CG scene would cost an estimated $30,000. Once again, these are stretch goals. But we’d love to make them happen in time for November!

What's the deal with the oddball perks?

We'd be remiss to ask you to contribute without offering a tangible 'thank you' gift. The different perks are admittedly very random, and it's because our perks come from people all over the country in various industries.
We'll be adding more perks throughout the month. Donate now and you'll be able to change your perk selection in the coming weeks if you see something you like better. Instructions for changing perks can be found here.

(T-shirt design not final)


Risks & Challenges

Perhaps the biggest challenge our production faces is timing. To release before November and garner meaningful attention, we need to wrap shooting by the end of September. That means we need to finalize the script, scout locations, and cast the film by early September at the latest.

To ensure we can meet these deadlines, we're choosing locations that will be easy to shoot with minimal set builds, and we'll only progress to more intensive scenes if we have the financing to hire additional crew and talent.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, here are a few things you can do:

  • If you're an artist or a business owner, you can contribute a perk. Artwork, downloads, albums, discounts or free services all help the cause. As contributors donate, I'll add your perks to the list. You can contact me directly at eric@eric-mcclellan.com for directions.
  • You can share the campaign with friends or family who'd like to help. We've got a tight deadline and every share counts!

So partner with us, the unlikely startup marketer and the uber-professional high school students, to make a difference in this election.



Frequently Asked Questions

Why should I give my money to you? Wouldn’t donating to another candidate’s campaign be more effective?

A donation to our production would be MUCH more effective in generating emotion due to the disadvantages of a candidate’s official campaign. First, political campaigns involve bureaucracy, which eats up funds and slows things down. 

Second, our team can afford to be provocative in ways other candidates can’t. If candidates become extremely emotional, controversial or provocative, their ‘presidential character’ becomes questionable. We want reasoned, adult dignity from the leader of the free world, not silly, video-game producing, short-film directing eccentricity.  

Do you really think you can change the hearts and minds of the voting public?

Some people will never be swayed. But some either 1) haven't decided whom they're voting for or 2) are tentative Trump supporters who may be affected by a compelling message. Like Ryan in his article, I have family members who wax and wane in their support for Trump. Those that can be influenced by our message will be influenced. This one’s for you, Dad!!!

Wait, I’m a Republican, and by discouraging support for Trump, aren't you in fact strengthening Hillary's campaign?

Hillary's campaign becomes stronger with each of its own supporters, not its detractors. If you don't vote for Trump and don't vote for Hillary, your vote contributes to neither.

I like your campaign but none of your perks are compelling to me. What should I do?

Donate and go buy yourself an ice cream. Or donate and I'll buy you an ice cream. Or donate and enjoy the treat of a Trump-free Oval Office.

I like all your perks and want them all! What should I do?

Donate lots and lots of money. I'll send you all the perks and I'll buy you ice cream.

You mentioned phone games. Really?

Yep. Really. At the time of writing, I've got two in development. Donate any amount to receive release notifications.

You mentioned virtual reality. Really?

Yep. We're currently discussing possibilities with a VR production company.

We’ve got two absurd mobile games in development
that I (Eric) am bankrolling. We’d like to add things to the mix like a Virtual
Reality mini-scene, and viral content outside the film like scene of a giant yellow wig
rampaging San Francisco. Each of those concepts are easy fodder for press and
incredibly shareable, but we can’t do them without your support.Donate any amount for release notifications
    
The Impact 
This is the perfect time for the project. With your help, we'll create
content so compelling that both conservative and liberal media outlets can't help but
talk about it. If we can seed viewers' hearts and minds with enough doubts
about Donald Trump, we can make a difference this November. 

We want a country of unity and
     inclusion, not racism and division.
We want a country with free press,
     free religion, and free speech. 


We want a country with greater equality for all citizens, regardless of
race, gender, or any persuasion.







What donations will pay for




We'd like to bring on a paid director and editor to pound out this project. We're budgeting $3,000 per position for a two-day shoot. That's $6,000.


Extras and cast! If we want to show deportation, or show Muslim-Americans in holding cells to create a more visceral experience for viewers, we need extras to act those parts. We’ll need to pay the extras, actors to play the principle roles, and provide food. We're budgeting $80 per extra per day, and $200 per principal per day — standard rates for non-union actors. With 15 to 20 extras, that's about $4,000.


Costuming and locations. We want the cast and set to look authentic such that it doesn't distract viewers from the story. This may mean purchasing uniforms for guards, clothes for actors without their own costumes, and renting appropriate spaces. We’re budgeting $3,000 to pay for wardrobe for up to 20 people, and to rent / license two to three locations. 


Stretch Goals: Marketing and PR material. I already mentioned absurd mobile games, and I’m paying for those out of my own pocket. But we’d also like to add the aforementioned VR and wig monster short. Virtual reality requires extreme specialization to produce, as does a CG monster movie scene. We’d bring in some Hollywood expertise for those. The VR scene would cost an estimated $10,000 to produce, edit, and publish, and the CG scene would cost an estimated $30,000. Once again, these are stretch goals. But we’d love to make them happen in time for November!




What's the deal with the oddball perks?
We'd be remiss to ask you to contribute without offering a tangible 'thank you' gift. The different perks are admittedly very random, and it's because our perks come from people all over the country in various industries.


We'll be adding more perks throughout the month. Donate now and you'll be able to change your perk selection in the coming weeks if you see something you like better. Instructions for changing perks can be found here.



(T-shirt design not final)




   Risks & Challenges  
Perhaps the biggest challenge our production faces is timing. To release before November and garner meaningful attention, we need to wrap shooting by the end of September. That means we need to finalize the script, scout locations, and cast the film by early September at the latest.
To ensure we can meet these deadlines, we're choosing locations that will be easy to shoot with minimal set builds, and we'll only progress to more intensive scenes if we have the financing to hire additional crew and talent.

   Other Ways You Can Help 
If you can't contribute financially, here are a few things you can do:

If you're an artist or a business owner, you can contribute a perk. Artwork, downloads, albums, discounts or free services all help the cause. As contributors donate, I'll add your perks to the list. You can contact me directly at eric@eric-mcclellan.com for directions.


You can share the campaign with friends or family who'd like to help. We've got a tight deadline and every share counts!

So partner with us, the unlikely startup marketer and the uber-professional high school students, to make a difference in this election.Frequently Asked QuestionsWhy should I give my money to you? Wouldn’t donating to another candidate’s campaign be more effective?A donation to our production would be MUCH more effective in generating emotion due to the disadvantages of a candidate’s official campaign. First, political campaigns involve bureaucracy, which eats up funds and slows things down. Second, our team can afford to be provocative in ways other candidates can’t. If candidates become extremely emotional, controversial or provocative, their ‘presidential character’ becomes questionable. We want reasoned, adult dignity from the leader of the free world, not silly, video-game producing, short-film directing eccentricity.  Do you really think you can change the hearts and minds of the voting public?Some people will never be swayed. But some either 1) haven't decided whom they're voting for or 2) are tentative Trump supporters who may be affected by a compelling message. Like Ryan in his article, I have family members who wax and wane in their support for Trump. Those that can be influenced by our message will be influenced. This one’s for you, Dad!!!Wait, I’m a Republican, and by discouraging support for Trump, aren't you in fact strengthening Hillary's campaign?Hillary's campaign becomes stronger with each of its own supporters, not its detractors. If you don't vote for Trump and don't vote for Hillary, your vote contributes to neither.I like your campaign but none of your perks are compelling to me. What should I do?Donate and go buy yourself an ice cream. Or donate and I'll buy you an ice cream. Or donate and enjoy the treat of a Trump-free Oval Office.I like all your perks and want them all! What should I do?Donate lots and lots of money. I'll send you all the perks and I'll buy you ice cream.You mentioned phone games. Really?Yep. Really. At the time of writing, I've got two in development. Donate any amount to receive release notifications.You mentioned virtual reality. Really?Yep. We're currently discussing possibilities with a VR production company.

story:
Click here for English Version
Se não tiver conta paypal, pode contribuir através de transferência bancária. Basta enviar e-mail com a informação do valor transferido, a origem e a recompensa pretendida. O seu contributo será mais tarde adicionado por nós à campanha :)

IBAN PT50 0035 0995 0063 2329 9306 4
Destinatário Inês Lebreaud Leitão Gonçalves
E-mail ines_lebreaud@hotmail.com

Pedro vive fechado em casa, reprimido pela fobia de ser engolido pelo céu. O filme é uma jornada interior e centra-se na complexidade emocional do protagonista.

Apesar da simplicidade do plot, O Céu não chega aos peixes é um projecto complexo e exigente. É sobre solidão, mas vive de diálogos. Não é um filme de fantasia, mas passeia longe da realidade. E à materialização de fortes influências da arquitectura, pintura, literatura e música do século XX, a imaginação de Pedro apenas acrescenta riqueza visual.
O guião teve a sua primeira versão em 2010. Viveu fechado do mundo e amadureceu. Voltou a respirar e foi terminado em 2015, para finalmente ser concretizado este verão.
As rodagens vão ter lugar na cidade de Coimbra, na segunda quinzena de Agosto deste ano.

A equipa por trás deste projecto é jovem mas tem um longo historial de colaboração e bons resultados. Este é um projecto final de mestrado em Cinema na UBI - o primeiro filme da realizadora, após oito anos a fazer cinema.

O nosso elenco é composto por caras pouco conhecidas e cheio de talento. A narrativa do filme perderia a força se o espectador reconhecesse as pessoas atrás das personagens. Ainda o guião não estava terminado e já estava decidido que assim seria.

Igor Lebreaud e Maria João Robalo são actores profissionais de teatro n'A Escola da Noite, em Coimbra. E estão a prescindir das suas férias anuais para poderem trabalhar connosco. Inês Mingote e João de Almeida são actores amadores, com alguma experiência em teatro e cinema, que se dispuseram a colaborar neste projecto e a ver o seu talento moldado e trabalhado sob a direção da realizadora.

Este é um filme com enorme investimento no departamento de arte e que prevê muito trabalho de pós-produção. O apoio do ICA, através da UBI, é o maior da história da universidade, mas cobre menos de metade do orçamento. Através da boa vontade de amigos e apoiantes, já foi angariado algum dinheiro. O objectivo é que esta nova angariação de fundos garanta o valor restante necessário à rodagem e arranque da pós-produção.


Ninguém pretende lucrar com este filme. Todo o orçamento se destina apenas a cobrir os custos necessários à sua concretização. O valor estimado permite fazer o filme bonito que imaginamos e queremos mostrar-vos, com limitações que terão de ser contornadas pela criatividade de todos.
Cada corte é um pequeno impacto na qualidade do filme.
Já estamos a trabalhar há vários meses neste projecto. Já ultrapassámos inúmeras barreiras. O empenho da equipa promete a concretização de todos os objectivos propostos. Em nenhum momento ponderamos desistir. Mas continuamos a precisar de ajuda para garantir as necessidades do projecto.

Se não puder contribuir financeiramente, há outras formas de ajudar.

A nossa equipa precisa de material para trabalhar. Vidros ou espelhos para o departamento de imagem. Mobiliário e peças de decoração dos anos 60-80, roupa, tecidos e material de construção para o departamento de arte. A doação ou simples empréstimo de objectos que se enquadrem nesta listagem pode ser uma grande ajuda. Se achar que pode ajudar, por favor contacte-nos por mensagem - aqui ou no facebook.

Por fim, precisamos de visibilidade. Quanto mais pessoas conhecerem o nosso projecto, melhor para nós. Por favor divulguem e partilhem através das ferramentas do Indiegogo.

Obrigada! :)


______________________________________________________________________

English version

The sky has an overwhelming beauty and in its worst days is gloomy and destructive.

Pedro lives locked in his house, repressed by a phobia of being swallowed by the sky. The film is an inner journey and focuses on the emotional complexity of the main character.

Despite the simplicity of the plot, The Sky is reaching for the fish is a complex and demanding project. It's about loneliness, but breaths dialogue. It's not fantasy, but wanders far from reality. And to the strong influences of the twentieth century architecture, painting, literature and music, Pedro's imagination only adds visual richness.

The team behind this project is young but has a long history of collaboration and good results. This is the final project of a MA in Film - the director's first film, after eight years making films.

The script had its first version in 2010. It lived and matured closed from the outside world, to breath again and be completed in 2015. And finally being shot this summer.

The shooting will take place in the city of Coimbra, Portugal, next August.

Our cast is made of less known faces and full of talent. The narrative wouldn't work as well if the public recognized the people behind the characters. The script wasn't even finished and this was already decided.

Igor Lebreaud and Maria João Robalo are professional theater actors from A Escola da Noite, in Coimbra. And they are prescinding their anual vacations to work with us. Inês Mingote and João de Almeida are amateur actors with some experience in theater and cinema who are willing to collaborate in this project and see their talent explored by the director.

This is a film that requires a huge investment in the art department and a lot of post-production work. The project is sponsored by the university and got the highest value in the MA history. Although, it covers less than half the budget. The idea is for the remaining amount to be achieved through this fundraising.


Nobody wants to profit from this film. The entire budget is only intended to cover the costs of its making. The estimated value allows us to make the beautiful movie we imagine and want to show you, with already some limitations being circumvented by our creativity.

Every cut has a small impact on the quality of the film.

We've been working in this project for several months. We overcame countless barriers. The team's commitment promises to achieve all the presented goals. We won't quit. But we still need help to ensure the needs of the project.


If you like the project but cannot contribute financially, there are other ways to help. We need visibility. The more people know about our project, the better. Please spread the news and share it on your social networks through Indiegogo tools.

Thank you! :)

A doação ou simples empréstimo de objectos que se enquadrem nesta listagem pode ser uma grande ajuda. story:
WHY ANOTHER ZOMBIE THING? 

Zombies are literally everywhere. You can find them groaning and shuffling their way through our daily lives, whether it be in television, movies, video games, or even books. We all know what zombies are and what they do. We all know that the only way to kill a zombie is by destroying it's brain. We've all seen it done a million times... And so have Tribulation's protagonists.

The web series takes place in a world where zombies exist in pop culture. The show's teenage leads know exactly what they're getting into when the news mentions a contagious virus that leads to cannibalism.

Besides, I like to think of Tribulation as more of a coming of age drama series than anything else. It's center characters are young and have not yet even experienced adulthood. They are still finding themselves, and now have to do that in a world where death is always lingering right around the corner... In the form of a pale, flesh eating monster who looks just like your lively next door neighbor, Bill.

Oh wait, that is Bill... And he doesn't look so lively.

MEET THE CREATORS

Put two zombie obsessed actors/filmmakers in a room and you're bound to get some kind of zombie based creation in return.

Cole Daniel Hills (14 years old) is a young independent filmmaker who, in his past, has won the 'best movie' award in an east coast film competition for the film, AGE OF KAOS. He has been writing stories since he was six years old and screenplays since he was nine. 

James Achille (24 years old) is a veteran actor from New York. If his charm and charisma weren't already enough to make Tribulation a success, his newfound interest in writing and behind-the-camera work are sure to make everybody a happy zombie.

Between the two of these successful entrepreneurs, you will see great directing, writing, editing, cinematography, musical scores, and fantastic gore effects... For the horror lovers. 

They will also introduce some great music from up and coming indie artists that deserve the recognition.

WHERE YOUR DONATIONS WILL GO

  • Camera & equipment
  • Costumes
  • Sound
  • Music
  • Effects

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Don't have the money to donate? It's all good. There's other ways you can help!

Follow and share us with your friends on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/tribulation.webseries/...

Also follow the creators and stars on Instagram: 

@coledanielhills, @king_james_24, @miranduhhart

story:
Why You Should Support This

Hi! I'm Daisy Burroughs!

I was born in Columbia, SC and lived the for the majority of my life with my mom, older sister, and younger brother.  I moved to York County in 2010 to attend Winthrop University and earned my Bachelor's degree in Mass Communication in 2014.

While at Winthrop, I served my campus community as a Peer Mentor, Winthrop Ambassador, Resident Assistant, Orientation Leader, Student Coordinator of Leadership Initiatives, President of the Xi Beta Chapter of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc., and 2013 Homecoming Queen. When not on campus, I volunteered with a number of community organization but spent the most time with the United Way of York County with students entering the 6th grade and Youth Corps, a youth leadership development program I participated in as a sophomore at Spring Valley High School.

Youth Corps empowered me to know that I could be a leader.  Through participating in that program, I overcame being bullied, having no self-esteem, and a sense of shame from having witnessed domestic violence at home.  I was able to connect with peers in a way that allowed for lifelong friendships. It was an eye-opening experience that I was afforded through the sponsorship from First Citizens Bank.

I am a living testimonial of the impact great role models & leadership development can have on an impressionable teenager. I am forever indebted to First Citizens and Youth Corps for taking a shy and insecure girl and instilling her with the tools and confidence to impact others.

Now, it's my turn! Currently, I'm 24 years old. I will graduate with my Master of Business Administration degree in December 2016. I serve on the Board of Directors for the Greater York Chamber of Commerce. I am also a Community Ambassador for the Boys & Girls Club of York County. I want to show other young people who think they may be too shy or too awkward to follow their dreams that nothing is holding them back!

 My dream is to compete in my first pageant and I need your help (and prayers) to make that happen!

The goal for this campaign is $2400. Any funding left in excess of pageant expenses will be used to sponsor a 9th or 10th grader to participate in Youth Corps during the 2017-2018 academic year (as participants for the 2016-2017 class have already been selected).

I know that with your help, this dream will become a reality! Please support my journey!

Thank you! 

Want to Place an Ad in the Pageant Program? 

If you or your company would like to place an ad in the pageant program, please email me at daisylburroughs1@gmail.com. A portion of the ad price will be contributed to my overall pageant participation fee. Ads must be received by the RPM office by October 7, 2016.

Ad sizes and prices are listed below.  The first price is if your ad is ready to send. The second price is if you need your ad to be created.

  •  Business Card: $100, $125
  • Quarter-Page: $220, $270
  • Half-Page: $300, $350
  • Full-Page: $450, $500-550
  • Double-Page: $900, $950-1000

Other Ways You Can Help

I need your support even if you are not able to contribute at this time. Please help me get the word out about my campaign! 

Indiegogo has several great share tools that will allow you to help get this message in front of our friends and neighbors! I appreciate all of the support, encouragement, and prayer you are willing to share!

story:
High-Quality Urban Entertainment

HUETV is a group of Film Makers and innovators who want to make a difference and give people of color a voice in the media. HUETV is developing an online network of news, web-series and shareable shorts for social media. HUETV aims to bring viewers the news that matters and provide well informed stories that can be relied upon to tell the truth, not fabricate information to make investors happy.

HUETV already has established links with Hollywood producers and broadcasters and each one has turned down the opportunity to fund our mission. According to them, there is no money to be made from catering to the needs of the world’s Black, Hispanic, Indian, and Asian communities (to name just a few) who are all grossly underrepresented (or unfairly represented) in mainstream media. Which is why HUETV aims to change that, one show at a time, bringing viewers exciting new content without the stereotypes.

To achieve this goal, HUETV is looking for start-up investments to film a web series called “In the Sea”, and bring together a news team to report on the news our viewers care about. We are asking for your help to raise $20,000 dollars which will be the first step in this news and entertainment revolution.

NEWS

HUETV will rid the news of stereotypes and one-sided reporting. There will be no more mis-information to deceive the public. HUETV will ensure people of color are well represented in the media by getting the facts from reporters who look and sound like the people they report for. HUETV will develop timely coverage of breaking news, and provide educated commentary for a diverse America.

Web-series and Films

HUETV will be acquiring indie content and welcomes every film that fits with our values. First and foremost will be the (first of many) web-series “In The Sea”. So many great films are being developed with people of color that Hollywood is turning down. HUETV will acquire those films and give viewers a choice. HUETV will give film makers with great dramas, thrillers, documentaries, or whatever type of indie film, a place to showcase their work, gain reviews and grow their fan base.

SO WHAT ARE YOU GUYS DOING EXACTLY?

HUETV is creating a streaming website that will show news, web-series, and, later, movies developed by people of color, with access to 24-hour news from anchors that look like all of America not just a portion of it. The more contributions, the quicker HUETV can fill the studio with awesome actors, design a beautiful set, and begin filming the first of many shows that will challenge the mainstream programming status quo.

HOW WE WILL USE YOUR MONEY

(MORE MONEY=MORE WEB SERIES+COOLER PERKS)

Every single dollar will go into creating the best streaming website ever developed and creating and shipping the incentives listed below. It will also cover production of the web-series, acquisition of content and marketing.


THE BEST WEBSITE

The #1 goal is to create GREAT INDEPENDENT WEBSERIES SHOWS that will entertain you and have you wanting more and more as you indulge with your friends. Once we begin developing and acquiring more web-series for you to watch we will begin with video feeds for you to watch news on a daily basis as news is #1 on our list but also the most expensive of the list but with your help it can get our first foot forward.

Here’s what that means for you!

Web-series with people of color that don’t fall under the same old stereotypes where people of color play real characters with real backgrounds.

Awesome drama, thriller, action, comedy series you won’t see anywhere else

Review sections for each film you watch

Social Page for Film Makers, Film Lovers, or people that just like to talk and be seen

We Hire Actors, Directors, to produce more content for you to enjoy

More Indie web series

Popular web series yes we will give them an opportunity to be shown too

Free Subscription prizes

AWESOME PERKS

So let’s be frank I know you love giving your precious money away for free but what makes it worth it is when you receive something for your hard earned dollar.  So we have created cool perks for every little cent you give us. 

Perks

$1

HUGE THANK YOU!!!

Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project. You’ve made a statement to the world about something that is important to you and your voice will be heard!!!!!

$3 THANK YOU THANK YOU!!!

You’re so awesome HUETV is going to develop an awesome short video we will send to you and only you

$7 WRIST BAND

Receive TWO super cool silicone color filled wrist band with the inscription of HUETV.

$10 Digital Download

Before anyone sets eyes on our first web-series “In The Sea”, your eyes will receive the first episode before anyone else. You will receive a code for a digital download of the web-series. As well we will post you on our Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook with a big thank you!

$20 Lights

You will get to stream our complete first web series “In The Sea “as much as you want in hi-def on our website (HUETV.NET) before it is available to the public. Plus, we will share funders only commentary by the writers (Patrick and Courtney) for every episode.  Plus, everything at the THANK YOU level.

$25 Camera

You get a DVD or Blu-ray of the complete series of “In The Sea”. We will Send Our surveys for your disc preference when the campaign closes.  This is a stand-alone perk you can contribute to in addition to any existing perks you may have claimed. Canadian Funders please add $5 to your pledge for shipping. Funders outside of U.S or Canada please add $15 for shipping.

25$ Subscribe

In The Sea” is one of many web series we will be developing with your help we will give you one year of premium access on our website with the opportunity to see every web series we bring out over the next two years and you will also receive everything at the LIGHTS level.

$50 Action

“In The Sea” is one of many web series we will be developing with your help we will give you two yea  HUI’;

of premium access on our website with the opportunity to see every web series we bring out and acquire over the next two years and you will also receive everything at the LIGHTS level.

$60 Biggest Fan

You get an exclusive HUETV T-shirt plus everything at the LIGHTS Level! Canadian Funders please add $5 to your pledge for shipping. Funders Outside US or Canada please add $10 for shipping when pledging.

$100 Super Dope Fan

“In The Sea” Poster SIGNED by the Cast and writers Patrick and Courtney. The HUETV Shirt! Plus everything in Action Level. Canadian Funders please add $10 to your pledge for shipping. Funders Outside US or Canada please add $15 for shipping when pledging.

$125 Super Fan

 A HUETV Shirt and a Thank You in the credits in the show! Plus “In The Sea” Poster SIGNED by the Cast and writers Patrick and Courtney. You also get everything else included in the Action Level. Canadian Funders please add $10 to your pledge for shipping. Funders Outside US or Canada please add $15 for shipping when pledging.

$150 Super Fan Enhanced

Are signatures not enough? Get a PERSONALIZED POSTER with a message made out just to you`` Thank You in the credits in the show! Plus “In The Sea” Poster SIGNED by the Cast and writers Patrick and Courtney. You also get everything else included in the Action Level. Canadian Funders please add $10 to your pledge for shipping. Funders Outside US or Canada please add $15 for shipping when pledging.

$200 Paying It Forward

This is a stand-alone perk where you will be purchasing 4 subscriptions to HUETV. We will provide some to those who are unable to pay for the subscription and we will have contests to give away other subscriptions Pay it Forward for Your future HUETV fans!

$500 Become an Extra

A stand-alone perk you would be a FEATURED EXTRA on HUETV web series “In The Sea”. You’ll hang out behind the scenes, hang out on set, have lunch with us and appear in a scene. You’ll get some selfies, autographs, memories.

*Travel and accommodations not included

*More details in FAQ

$1000 A-C-T-O-R

Though this probably won’t air on a major network we will give you all our perks beginning at “ACTION” because you are totally cool for doing this and give you a speaking role in our web series “In The Sea”. It probably be a one Liner like (plastic or paper) who knows but you be a Star and can tell all your friends you’re in web series and we will vouch for you.

*production planned for Winter Houston,TX 2016

*Travel/accommodations not included

*check FAQ for details

$1000 DIRECTOR

Plus, All Perks after Action

So since we have like three directors directing our web series you wouldn't actually be the director but we will be able to visit the set yell “ACTION” hang with the crew and we even have a DIRECTORS CHAIR WITH YOUR NAME ON IT.

*production planned for Winter Houston,TX 2016

*Travel/accommodations not included

*check the FAQ for the Full Info

$1000 JUST FOR YOU

This is a stand-alone perk where we will develop a funny or dramatic thirty second to two-minute video for you. You can give us a short script or we can develop one for you based on the genre you want and we will make a video for you and you only.

*check the FAQ for the full info

$25,000 Private Screening

Receive all rewards plus the opportunity to organize a screening once the web series is finished.  The producers and actors will attend to do an Q & A with you and your audience

*check the FAQ for the full info

* If outside of Houston,TX please add $2000 for airfare and lodge sorry this perk is unavailable for anyone outside of the U.S. 


FAQ

How does the LIGHTS perk work?

We will give you a code on our website to stream the complete series. We have not worked out the specifics but you will either be able to stream the whole series or download the whole series.

When will I get my T-SHIRT?

The OFFICIAL HUE TV T-SHIRT will be sent out about 4-6 weeks before “IN THE SEA” is released which should be sometime early 2017. We will email you size request shortly after the campaign ends.

If I get the BE AN EXTRA/ACTOR perk, what will I get to say/do in the movie?

The final scripts aren’t finalized but don’t worry we will select something that you will enjoy. Your roll will be enough to have all your friends see your acting debut.

If I get the BE AN DIRECTOR perk, what will I do?

We will give you some dates we are filming and you can come out and spend a day with the crew we will allow you to say quiet on a set a few takes and sit in your very own director chair.

How does the JUST FOR YOU perk work?

This would be if you wanted a low budget green screen or white screen background with some of our actors reading out a script you developed. Or you can say I want you guys to give me something about love we will create something for you. Nothing extravagant but we will do our best just for you.

How does the Private Screening work?

You have the opportunity to throw your very own HUE TV party we will screen at least three episodes of “In The Sea”, at your event we will try to invite all of the main cast and producers depending on their schedules we promise to get you at least one producer and main character at the screening.  We will give you finished episode dates then you can organize a location and time.

story:
Smooth Seas

By: Gavin Diviney & Samuel Quijano

My first movie, hopefully of many. 

When a depressed young adult with no clear goal in life is given real purpose for the first time, how would they handle it?

 

Brief History

this project began last august, on the 22nd. We've been working tirelessly on this script for almost a whole year, we've worked on several projects before this, and we hope that this is the one.

The script was originally planned to be a parody on clichés in the movie industry, specifically in dramas involving depression, and death. (yeah, we scrapped that idea early on.)

Was originally planned to be a web series filmed with our own resources: Phones, Go-Pros, USB Microphones, 32-bit laptop etc. We then shifted the goal to be a short film, but we realized if we were to film it at a natural pace, it would easily reach a feature length time-frame. and if we were going to do that, we didn't want to put our names on it, because it would be so low-quality, we feared it would be immediately judged, and have the story be ignored.

A very important aspect we tried our hardest to keep alive is being grounded to the story, not to reality. Our main goal is to do something new, which I feel there is far too little people doing in the movie industry.

 

Where your money will go

Right off the bat, we'll be honest and just say that we actually only need about $8,000 to fund the project. we went a little overboard for the sake of physical perks, distribution, and the fact that indiegogo takes 5%

Here is exactly where your money is going:

Cameras: $900

lighting: $200

Microphones: $500

64-bit windows, with Vegas Pro (Editing & Computer): $1500

Locations: $1500

Costumes: $100

Make-up: $300

Props, Set-building: $2,000

Travel Expense: $500 

Misc. $500

Again, The rest will go towards your perks, and taken by Indiegogo's required 5%.

Risks & Challenges

We only have a limited time to film and produce this project. Most people who have signed on as either cast or crew have other things coming in the next year, and I will have to rebuild everything up to this point again. So, we need to work quickly and efficiently to get this done, and to have it look like something worth showing to the public. 

 

 

In-Depth Production

 

Story

About a young man, Billy, who has no clear goal in life, and has successfully floated through life thus far is approached with new challenges, and shifts in his life that will leave him unable to continue living as he does. 

Jasmine (Jazz, for short), a newcomer in his life, attempts to help him figure it all out, but nothing they do goes as smoothly as intended.

 

Music

Music is a heavy aspect of the film, as most of the story is told through actions between characters. Most of the music has already been written, you can find most of it on soundcloud, in its incomplete form. and we're getting help from a local band "Pluto Is Still a Planet"

URLS:

Smooth Sea's Soundtrack: https://soundcloud.com/user718365616/sets/smoot...

Pluto's Still a Planet - Rock Bottom: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lL387xo0ENE

Pluto's Still a Planet - Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/PlutosSAP/

 

Filming/Storyboard/Direction

The directing is inspired by a combination Edgar Wright, Wes Anderson, and Steven Spielberg. in the sense of regularly  fast forwarding through mundane tasks, and using Symmetry, and Oners.

We do have each scene fairly planned out, but we will have to deal with having to switch up ideas while on location, as our ideas may be different than where we end up with.

 

Conclusion

We know we're an enormous risk, with nothing to really show as proof that we can do this. But, I promise that we do extensive research into each and every aspect of film making, And I desperately want to show what we have to offer, So i'm asking you to give us one shot. I promise that I will not throw away my shot.

 

Our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/SmoothSeas/?notif_t=pa...

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are Sly and Justina and we are the founders of Herkimer Production. Being raised in the South Bronx inspired the idea of wanting to spread this message to the community and more.  This message is near and dear to our hearts because it could have been our lives had we not decided to dream big and seek more. This is our very first film as Directors. 

In order to get it out there we need your lending hand to be able to finish the post production process which includes color grading, post sound, marketing. We shot this entire short on film super 16mm and it took our budget away for post production and now we need your help to see this all the way through. Even if you cannot donate any money we absolutely appreciate a share of this page. We are in great gratitude and are two filmmakers wanting to make change and inspire others as others have inspired us. 

Please visit our website to see more! 

http://slymaldonado.wixsite.com/trapped

and follow us on Instagram 

@trapped_10454

Thank you and we can't wait to share this with you all!

Short Summary Hi! We are Sly and Justina and we are the founders of Herkimer Production. Being raised in the South Bronx inspired the idea of wanting to spread this message to the community and more.  This message is near and dear to our hearts because it could have been our lives had we not decided to dream big and seek more. This is our very first film as Directors. 
In order to get it out there we need your lending hand to be able to finish the post production process which includes color grading, post sound, marketing. We shot this entire short on film super 16mm and it took our budget away for post production and now we need your help to see this all the way through. Even if you cannot donate any money we absolutely appreciate a share of this page. We are in great gratitude and are two filmmakers wanting to make change and inspire others as others have inspired us. 
Please visit our website to see more! 
http://slymaldonado.wixsite.com/trapped
and follow us on Instagram 
@trapped_10454
Thank you and we can't wait to share this with you all!

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

I'm Actor/Entertainer Mell Bowser(The Have and the Have Nots, Dear White People).. Through the acting and entertaining I've been blessed to make it out of circumstances a lot of at risk youth fall victim to. I truly believe once you make it out, you have to reach back and pull others out.

Back in 2016 I released a project called "All The Wrong Places" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n23lWJ3oDTY&list=PLUZ2StaGWG8DSusXa00hnQ-NYwDA4NiqQ. That project set me up for this one because it was a learning experience on how to make a film.

This project is different with it being an inspirational piece that I have hopes of motivating youth, or anyone for that matter, to listen to their heart and chase their passions because that is truly how you free yourself.

This project means so  much to me because it will be the first project I get to go home and shoot with the youth of MY city. Giving them a perspective on a career choice they've never seen while keeping them busy. 

Its also loosely based on MY life and journey to Hollywood!

What We Need & What You Get

We will need at least $20,000  to pull this off.

That money will go towards;

  • Paying for cast and crew(which includes the youth i'll hire)
  • Hotel room bookings
  • Food
  • Transportation(flights from LA for some cast & crew)
  • Fees for rentals such as lights & cameras
  • Location dues

Honestly, I will make this project with whatever I have by a certain date(yet to be determined but aiming for September/August 2017) but the more the merrier!

Keep in mind that all donations are a TAX WRITE OFF!

The Impact

Your donation will make a change in many of children's lives around the world! We are visual creatures and kids need positive sights to know that ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE no matter where you come from. This project will be that visual.

Lets change a child's life! WE have that power and obligation to make this world better for the ones who come after us!

Risks & Challenges

With anything great, the risks and challenges arent too far behind.. or ahead.

Funding is usually the biggest obstacle filmmakers have when making a project. Once we get this out of the way it will definitely push the project to the next stage.

What I learned from my other project is; things never go as planned but I will stay ready for whatever challenges come to us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute financially, PLEASE share this post and tell at least one person about it! Every little bit helps.

Also if you are looking to invest or would like to talk business, I speak that language. Please reach out for more info.

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!!

story:
OUR STORY

Shortly after graduating from Vancouver Film School in 1998, Mark Schwab founded Diamond in the Rough Films. Working with two key collaborators, Mark Balunis (a friend and fellow filmmaker since high school) and Robert Sean Campbell (graduate of Santa Clara University and the London Academy of  Music and Dramatic Art) they produced numerous short films and three feature films which played film festivals from San Jose to New York City. They formally made Diamond in the Rough Films an official LLC Partnership with the production of their 2012 feature film S.E.R.P.  With each film/project we have challenged ourselves to set a higher goal and Shadows In Mind  is exactly that since we are now going beyond just film festival screenings to making a truly commercial product that sells to distributors worldwide.

This is our first major crowdfunding campaign and a critical first step for us to enter the business of film.  Although we have been successful completing film festival-quality feature films on micro-budgets, we are now in connection with professional sales and distribution agents and that requires higher production values. This is where you can directly help us as an active contributor.

OUR CAMPAIGN

The goal of our campaign is to raise $20,000. 

Here is a breakdown of how the funds raised will be dispersed: 

40% Cast & Crew - The majority of the funds we will raise with this campaign will go towards running an efficient, professional set, including compensating our cast and crew for all of their hard work. Even though most of our crew will be working at discounted rates, it is of the utmost importance to our team to provide them with the best wage possible based on our budget.  This includes a great cinematographer, brilliant actors, and a kick-ass sound recordist.

15% Post Production - Great sound and great editing will be important in maintaining flow and production value for this film.

15% Production Equipment - It is essential to our team to shoot on a top-of-the-line camera and lenses, providing our film with the look it deserves. 

10% Location Fees - Though this film is set in today's world, location informs the action on the screen.  Everything needs to be cohesive.

10% Wardrobe & Art Department - The actors need to be wearing clothes...mostly...

5% Insurance - Production insurance will be necessary for film. 

5% Final Print & Admin Fees - The goal is to effectively and efficiently produce this film for the American Film Market.  There will be marketing fees associate with a Press kit for that event.

The creative team is the most important aspect of any production and we need your help to hire, pay, and feed those amazing people.

WHY THIS FILM?

An LGBT/Thriller is an extremely underrepresented genre in an otherwise saturated marketplace. Shadows In Mind covers topical subjects of cyber exploitation, suicide, sexual boundaries and revenge in a technology-centric age wrapped in a tense, race-against-time plot. 

We are motivated to follow in the footsteps of Gus Van Sant, Todd Haynes and Gregg Araki - true indie film pioneers when they made their films Mala Noche, Poison and The Living End. They have blazed a clear trail of groundbreaking LGBT genre cinema for us to embark upon and aspire to.

WHY THIS CAMPAIGN?

Completing a feature film is a tremendous challenge, regardless of budget. We are organized, focused and confident problem-solvers who have worked together on indie films for over fifteen years.  Every film we have developed has always been completed on time and on budget. Our films have screened in festivals, winning critical praise and awards while working with tiny 4-figure budgets. 

We got tired of people telling us, “I can’t wait to see what you guys can do with a real budget!” That time is now.  We are expanding our community and breaking down any last-standing barriers to gaining commercial distribution for our work - most importantly by working with and planning a specific, post-film sales strategy with proven professionals before we shoot one pixel of footage.

This campaign represents a massive and exciting shift in filmmaking perspective for us. By being an important part of it, you will not only be helping create a unique and provocative LGBT film...you'll be literally changing our team's lives, goals and futures.

We’ve never been more ready for the next step. We look forward to your help in us taking it.

THE TEAM

FAQ

Q: Money is tight! I can't contribute.

A: We've all been there. Heck, we ARE there which is exactly why we are reaching out. But we also know that if we believed in "I CAN'T" we wouldn't be asking for your support. Just go ahead and donate...it allows you to share in the creation of making the movie without actually having to make the movie! We'll do all the work - you can have the fun. :-)

Q:  What is the timeline?

A: At the conclusion of this campaign, we will be kicking off principal photography.  The goal is to have a rough cut put together by September 30th of this year for our sales agent to represent at the American Film Market.

Q: What are the long term goals of this film?

A: To sell it at the American Film Market and any other ancillary markets both foreign and domestic.

Q: What if you don't hit your goal?

A: Regardless of the attainment to our funding goal, the funds received will go towards making the film.  The more money we can raise, the better chance we have of getting the film seen on a world-wide scale.  The funds raised will be distributed in the following order: cinematographer, actors, sound recordist, on-set food, location permits.

Every project Diamond in the Rough Films has ever started has been completed. We have every confidence in raising enough funds to make Shadows In Mind  a sellable feature film. 

Q: I'd love to be a part of your production! How can I get in touch with you?

A: Our production team can be reached by email at: contactditrfilms@gmail.com. You can also visit the DITRFilms official website at: www.ditrfilms.com

And that's a wrap!

story:
Story

Rosewood Ledge captures the intersection between a woman whose life is shattering around her and a young couple in a destructive relationship. 

The couple, a model and her photographer boyfriend, are shooting on a lake upstate when the property owner exhibits unusual behavior.

Although their meeting is serendipitous, the choices they make while together force them to confront who they really are.

Director's Statement

Rosewood Ledge centers around three unlikely but intertwined themes: image obsession, burnt-out romance, and alcoholism. As the characters developed, I focused on understanding what motivated their troubled behaviors, and discovered a strangely beautiful irony. For all of the pain in the character’s narratives, there is equally as much humor and lightness in them.

Whether this story is a comedy or tragedy depends on how it’s told, and my goal is to tell it as both. I believe that real life is full of this duality and reflecting that is the most honest form of storytelling I can do. I hope that viewers will watch Rosewood Ledge and see the beauty in narratives with this dark and light irony, and  perhaps see their own experiences reflected in the characters' struggles and triumphs.

Creatives

TREY CHAPMAN (Director, Writer, Co-Producer)

Trey is a New York-based filmmaker. He made his first movie at age 10 that critics say was overly (or not enough?) inspired by Pirates of the Caribbean. He acknowledges that he might have peaked with that one, but continues shooting films nonetheless. He holds a BA with Honors from Connecticut College and also studied filmmaking at the Film and TV Academy in Prague. His films are typically classic character dramas with a modern edge, and have screened at festivals across the United States.  Other experience includes crewing on Going Places (dir. John Turturro) and a position in rentals at AbelCine.

MICHAEL BONINI (Actor, Co-Producer)

Michael Bonini is a New York City based actor and ensemble member of the Michael Howard Studios Professional Acting Company. In addition to his theatrical credits, Michael has appeared in films including The Divergent Series and Yes, God, Yes featuring Stranger Things star Natalie Dyer. His credits also include commercials and multiple television shows including History Channel’s Hamilton: Building America and NBC’s Pilot: Pope. Michael recently completed filming a feature called Hurricane Aaron, a psychological thriller, produced by Country Road Films. 

KRISTIN RUDRÜD (Actress)

Kristin Rudrüd played William H Macy's wife, Jean Lundegaard, in the Academy award winning film, Fargo. Other favorite film and television roles include: Pleasantville (Mary) and Drop Dead Gorgeous (Connie Rudrud) and Chicago Hope (Amelia Robling). She has also performed with Ian McKellen on Broadway in "Amadeus," with Al Pacino in a Public Theatre reading of "Othello" and with David Hyde Pierce and Tony Goldwyn at the Williamstown Theatre Festival. She is a member of Shakespeare And Company and a founding member of the Fargo Film Festival.

DANIEL CONTALDO (Cinematographer)

Daniel Contaldo is a cinematographer/interactive filmmaker from Florence, Italy, currently based in Brooklyn. He shoots narrative and documentary work, and is currently in post with his first virtual reality film. He studied at FAMU (Czech Film Academy) in Prague, where he shot the 35mm short 10:10, which was screened at the Toronto LGBT Film Festival and British Film Institute: London LGBT Film Festival ’16.   www.danielcontaldo.com

Where the Money Goes

For us to tell this story right, we’re going to need a gorgeous lake house, top-of-the-line camera gear, and the most talented cast and crew we know. Filmmaking adds up fast, and even if we reach our our goal of $15k we'll have to be very careful with distributing funds so each department gets what it needs.

The biggest allocations go towards locations, equipment, and post production, since we can't cut any corners with these departments if we want the film to look incredible. We have an exceptionally talented cast and crew who have agreed to work on the project for very generous "friend-discounted" rates,  but even so these fees accumulate, and we feel it's important that we compensate our team to the best of our ability. The other stuff (food, travel, and IndieGoGo Fees) are necessary costs that we'll have to be as frugal as possible with so we can spend more in the creative departments.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution helps us get one step closer to reaching our goal, no matter how much it is. You can also help us out by spreading the word, since we never know who might be interested!

Thanks for reading.

story:
THIS IS NOT JUST A SHORT FILM

This film is truly a wonderful opportunity to create awareness in our local community as well as internationally amongst both men and women. It's ability to change and create a better understanding about one of the many aspects of male grief is extremely unique. It reflects one of humanity's most human experiences and is a topic that is relatable and accessible to all.

 

"As the filmmakers of this narrative, we have a rare chance to help contribute to a cultural shift in the way we all view male grief." Samantha Chisari

 

This is a journey we can all take together and with the support of the wonderful men’s organizations we have engaged with and your help we look forward to making a meaningful and socially relevant film.

We hope that you will join us on “The Road” and help us start a movement of change we can all be proud of for many years to come!

 

MOOD BOARD: THE LOOK

 

FUNDING FROM BACKERS

We need your help and support to build our wonderful Motel room set where one of the most impactful scenes of the film comes to life.  The funds will also go to our Camera equipment, Production expenses; such as Location Permits, Insurance, and Transportation. All the money we receive will go on screen! We are very fortunate to have part of our budget but we need an extra push to start filming and that's where you come in! ​​

THIS IS AN ISSUE THAT AFFECTS REAL PEOPLE 

These men could be your Friends, Fathers, Brothers, Lovers and for them Grief is raw, heartbreaking, and soul defining. Join us in exploring how life's most inevitable emotion is shaping masculinity today.

          

 

MEET THE TEAM

Lead actor: Brendan Fletcher

Director/Producer: Samantha Chisari

Producer: Sarah Long

Writer: Daniel Biagi

DOP: Jeff Zwiker

Editor : Tyler Roucco 

Composer: Matthew Chung

WAYS YOU CAN HELP SPREAD THE WORD

If you can’t afford to make a financial contribution, there are other truly valuable ways you can help. Here's how you can help spread the word about this project's campaign!

  • Send this Indiegogo link to your friends and colleagues
  • Talk about the project to everyone you know!
  • Follow us on Twitter @TheRoad2017
  • Join our Facebook page @TheRoadMovie2017 and Share Share Share

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nina Cudic and I am a writer, actress and a producer of The Airport. This is the second short film I wrote but the first one to shoot. Originally from Croatia, I have been acting in NYC for about three years now, and have experience in theater and film and am currently in the longest running play in NYC called ''Line'' which takes place at 13th St Repertory Theater in NYC. 

The Airport short film is an emotional drama which takes place at the airport in its entirety. It is the story about the airport and the life that goes on there. It shows the diversity of life that can take place at the airport throughout one night. It follows seven stories of seven main characters whose paths are intertwined throughout one night at the New York airport.

This film is important to me because through it I want to express the intensity, vulnerability, unpredictability, uncertainty, diversity, ups and downs of life which can all be found at one place - the airport. The airport is a magical place which goes through hundreds of emotions on a daily basis. It is so compelling and emotionally rich. I also want to express the compassion, constant movement and the unity of human beings through this film. 

If you contribute to this film with your desired donation, it would help me and my fellow crew members to make this powerful piece come to life and it would be a dream come true! We have very creative ideas about how to make this story work and express itself in the most artistic, yet realistic way. We have everything planned, how to develop the story, which location to use etc. but we need your help, especially for the location needs because it is so unique and crucial to this story! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to collect 32,500$ by November 2nd 2016. The location cost is 16,000$ for three days of shooting. Equipment cost is around 5,000$. We need a crew of about 15 people and 5 actors and around 6,500$ is for their payment. The rest, about 5,000$ is for transportation and meals for cast, crew and extras. We need a crew of about 15 people, 5 actors and 30 extras. 

Everything stated above is for 3 days (nights) of shoot in November this year.

We offer some unique perks for our contributors such as imdb credits, ''thank you'' credits, producer, co-producer, associate producer and executive producer credits if you donate certain amounts. We also offer any video or acting reel editing, professional photo sessions, headshot photo sessions, make up and hair styling services, set visit during the shoot and many more! Check out the ''perks'' section for more!

If we don't reach the entire goal, the money will still go to the movie making, but we will have to postpone the shoot in order to raise/get more money for it. We have the November date set already and it is very important to shoot the film then because we want to submit it to one New York based Film Festival before the last December deadline expires. We stated the amounts that are crucial to the making of this film and without them we will not be able to do it.

The Impact

We hope that with this project we will bring attention to what really airport means: It is a place where so many heartbreaking, thrilling and exciting things happen and the perfect location to show the diversity of life and life situations that can occur within one night at the same place. We want to show the diversity of people and their vulnerable human nature we can all relate to.

We plan to submit this project to one big film festival. The last deadline for that festival is in the beginning of December. That is our first goal. Then, we also plan to apply it to the film festivals throughout the globe. We really hope our art can reach and touch as many people as possible. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges we may face are not reaching our goal and having to cancel or postpone the project. That is why we want to reward our contributors with different perks and are willing to satisfy our contributors. By that I mean that for certain given amounts to this project, our contributors will be able to choose between the variety of the perks offered. We offer perks for both men, women, actors and non actors, nationally and internationally.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean that you can't help!

It would be immensely helpful to us if you could get the word out and make some noise about our campaign, meaning that you could share with your family, friends and others our project on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, through email or any other social network! I repeat, that would be extremely helpful to us! We also have official Facebook page ''The Airport Short Film'' which you can like and use as a tag.

And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for participating in this adventure with us!
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Nina Cudic and I am a writer, actress and a producer of The Airport. This is the second short film I wrote but the first one to shoot. Originally from Croatia, I have been acting in NYC for about three years now, and have experience in theater and film and am currently in the longest running play in NYC called ''Line'' which takes place at 13th St Repertory Theater in NYC. 
The Airport short film is an emotional drama which takes place at the airport in its entirety. It is the story about the airport and the life that goes on there. It shows the diversity of life that can take place at the airport throughout one night. It follows seven stories of seven main characters whose paths are intertwined throughout one night at the New York airport.
This film is important to me because through it I want to express the intensity, vulnerability, unpredictability, uncertainty, diversity, ups and downs of life which can all be found at one place - the airport. The airport is a magical place which goes through hundreds of emotions on a daily basis. It is so compelling and emotionally rich. I also want to express the compassion, constant movement and the unity of human beings through this film. 
If you contribute to this film with your desired donation, it would help me and my fellow crew members to make this powerful piece come to life and it would be a dream come true! We have very creative ideas about how to make this story work and express itself in the most artistic, yet realistic way. story:
My name İs Enea, İ am an Albanian ,with some Slavian riots , Greek name and living in Turkey. İ am 22 years old just got graduated from film school and willing to be a great film director. During April and May I shot a documentary which is based on the histories of Syrian refugees which are stuck in Greece and waiting to reach the Europe. İ Hitchhiked all the way from Turkey to Netherlands. I slept and ate with refugees at refugee camps. I suffered, starved and got exhausted just to be able to document how Syrians suffer , starve and get exhausted.

 

  All what I need is a small money , which can help me to show my self to the world and to show the suffering of refugees to the people who don't really know them and don't know what those people are facing. I spent a lot of time energy and finished all my money I had just to make the documentary and now I am sitting not able to send my film to the festivals.

Most of the serious festivals wants 20-150 dollars as a submitt fee and I am not able to send my film to many festivals.

Please help me, and together lets be the voice of refugges

 

Your contribution will not only make the dreams of a talented young filmmaker become true, at the same time your contribution will be the voice of refugees suffering in the camps.İf you can not contribute by donating money, please share my campaign.

story:
Thank you so much for visiting our page and taking the time to read this. The three of us - Christopher, Brian, and Sandy - are so excited and proud of this project, and invite you to become part of this film.  The Luring is about a man who returns to his family vacation home, where a murder took place during his 10th birthday party, hoping to finally resolve a memory gap that has been plaguing him for years. 

Written by horror enthusiast Christopher Wells, this psychological thriller is unique due to it’s plot, character development, and subtle foreshadowing.

We, the film-makers, are determined to make the best damn horror film that we possibly can.  Further, we strive to not mistake horror for cheap gore but rather have social commentary and intelligence be evident throughout.

We have already filmed the ten minute opening scene of The Luring and on this page, all of you can see the trailer that we have cut from what we have filmed (click here for the full site and trailer - https://www.theluring.com/ ).  We would challenge anyone viewing the trailer to state that it seems anything less than Hollywood quality.  We can make that challenge because of the pride and hard work we are bringing to this project.  None amongst the three of us would accept anything less!

The Luring is a movie crafted through an intricate plot involving scenes that masterfully tell a story.  Nothing in The Luring is cliche or predictable. We are true horror fans who want to produce a film that we ourselves want to see. The bottom-line is, this film has been engineered to shock, challenge, move, and scare the viewer in ways that most horror films do not and can not. 

We are currently in pre-production to film the remainder of the movie, after having already filmed the opening scene.  The rest of the entirety of the movie will be filmed over April and May, 2017. 

Your support will help to guarantee that we can complete this film exactly as we have intended to.  We are so sure of this films success, that we the filmmakers personally have invested over $40,000, and in addition have raised $65,000 through private investors, who also strongly believe in our vision.  But that is not good enough for us.  As mentioned, we have every intention of making the horror film that horror-fans have always wanted to see and we want to ensure that no corners are cut.

As with all parts of this project, we have spent considerable time crafting even this page on this site in the hope of earning your interest and raising your desire to help us, while revealing only what is absolutely necessary about The Luring.  When the movie is complete, we want you to be able to enjoy it with almost complete interest and surprise.  With all of the above stated, we truly hope that you enjoy the trailer for The Luring and become part of our team in helping to back this project in whatever ways that you can. 

Update: We just got into the Daily Dead. We're excited. 

 

 

Christopher Wells - Writer/Director. Coming off the success of his short horror film ‘Cynthia’ with over 525,000 views on YouTube and 2 Best Documentary awards for his feature documentary ‘Romantic Realism, The Art of Roderick A. Wells,’ he now embarks on his 2nd feature The Luring. Christopher is the owner of Kaleidoscope Pictures, a Brooklyn based production company established in 2003 and has produced work for a variety of clients. However, he is most proud of the videos he’s directed and produced for Candlelighters NYC an organization that helps kids with cancer. Chris likes to direct work that has purpose which is why he also directed a very important video, produced by Sandy Ayesh, that was in direct response to the Orlando shooting.

Brian Berg and Chris share a very similar vision on what makes a horror film great and both of them will be applying their feature film experience and knowledge on The Luring.

When writing the script, Christopher most wanted to scare himself, but to also have the opportunity to direct a film horror fans, like himself, would one day regard as a film-makers film.

 

Brian Berg - Producer. Brian has written, directed, produced, and starred in the feature film, Exhibit A, which was produced through Brian's production company, HawkeyeMedia. Exhibit A was accepted into and won first place in multiple film festivals.

Also, Brian has written a novel, and finds pleasure in helping to provide guidance to burgeoning  creators of art.

Brian and Chris have been friends for some time and greatly enjoy working collaboratively with one another. 

Brian, who is also an attorney, helps to ensure that all requirements are met both behind the scenes and in front of the camera to achieve the highest quality production standards.  

 

Sandy Ayesh - Producer. Born and raised in Brooklyn, New York, Sandy was always enthusiastic about Art and Film. She produced and starred in a few projects with award winning director Christopher Wells and is currently producing The Luring with him and his team. She's excited to work on this Film, not only for it's amazing cast and crew, but also because it's not your typical Horror Film. The powerful script has more of a psychological thriller feel to it that is excitingly unpredictable. Sandy is an NYC trained Bellydancer who currently teaches young children the Art of Bellydance. She is also finalizing her first children's book called, Sandy Road, and resides in Queens where she is managing a successful dental practice. The Film world will always be Sandy's greatest passion, and she's excited to bring her insight and hard work in producing The Luring.

 

 

While this is most definitely an independent film, we are making a movie that will in no way seem 'independent'.  Only the highest quality actors, crew, story-line, editing, music, etc will be accepted and used in this project.  Along those lines, we also have retained lawyers, accountants, marketing teams, and all of the other necessary functions required to make and distribute a film. As we have continually stated, this is the horror film that you have always wanted to see.  And yes, we know that filmmakers often like to boast and promise the world, but this is the real deal. 

Much as the character of John Hammond states in Jurassic Park, 'Spare no expense', we intend to do exactly the same but opposite - watch every expense and produce a movie on a defined budget that looks and feels as if multiples of the actual budget were spent.

Our total budget is $130,000, of which $105,000 has been contributed and/or raised.  That leaves $25,000 to go and we hope that you can help us reach that goal!

The budget covers all aspects of making this film - including using SAG actors, the most highly qualified crew we could assemble for this movie, scouting ideal locations, forming an LLC, post production, marketing, insurance, etc. - and we have done everything in our power to make sure that the budget will put the necessary pressure on us, the filmmakers, to be as artistic and imaginative as possible, while also making the most high-quality film possible.

We can further promise that any money raised in excess of $130,000, will go directly to the making of The Luring and will help to ensure its high quality nature, and methods of distribution.

Thank you again and please be sure to see the side panels for the 'thank yous' that we will provide at different levels of contributions.

story:
About the Film

"The Reunion" tells the story of a woman who's 10th wedding anniversary falls on the same weekend as her 25th High School Class Reunion. Her marriage in peril, her mind wanders as she remembers her high school sweetheart and the sweet love they shared. The question of the film is whether she will allow herself to be caught up in nostalgia and risk her family for a single moment in time. 

About Tracey Michae'l

As a writer and content creator, Tracey Michae’l Lewis-Giggetts offers those who read her work an authentic experience; an opportunity to plumb both the heights and depths of the human experience. Among other subjects, she teaches screenwriting in her Creative Writing courses as a professor at the Community College of Philadelphia. This author of nine books is also the founding publisher at NewSeason Books, an independent press based out of the metro Philadelphia Area. You may have read some of Tracey's freelance work as she has been published in print and online publications such as The Guardian, The Chronicle for Higher Education, Philadelphia Weekly, Ebony.com, TheRoot.com, and more.  Most recently, Tracey was honored by SheKnows Media as one of the "2016 Voices of the Year" for her writing on mental health, PTSD, and self-care.

Having written several screenplays including "The Reunion," this is Tracey's directorial debut.

About Creative Thought Media

Creative Thought Media is a Philly-based independent production company led by writer/director, Christina Faith. The organization provides a creative co-working space in order to create an artistic community that will give birth to creative content that will influence culture. Their most recent project is the critically-acclaimed web series, Single and Anxious.
