story:
Help fund our Feature Film.

BLACKSTONE PICTURES is raising money for our new Feature Film STEELTOWN.
STEELTOWN is an action Suspense Thriller to be filmed in New Castle Pennsylvania starting in September 2017.

STEELTOWN is a gritty hard hitting story with a realism that pulls no punches.  Combining action of the FAST AND THE FURIOUS and the suspense of the ZODIAC, this film will leave you hanging on the edge of your seats.

SYNOPSIS

When ex-members of a notorious outlaw motorcycle club leave California to start over, they find that their past can never be erased when a series of bizarre events push their leader, Soleno Rosalez, beyond human limitations. Fighting to stay alive, save his marriage and four-year-old son, Soleno and Los Muertos Motorcycle Club are framed by city officials in a murderous gunfight while trying to defend their lives. Facing a possible death sentence for homicide, Los Muertos find themselves being blackmailed in an east coast steel town brought to its knees by extremely dark and gruesome serial killings. While also being pursued by the Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco and Firearms and cautiously evading a war with the rival Slayers Motorcycle Club, both of whom will go to any extremes to take them down, Los Muertos will fight in a life and death battle of survival of the fittest. In the end, six degrees of separation will bring Los Muertos, the ATF, city officials and the killings to a climatic sum of events that asks if a book can be judged by its cover. 

 

**All STEELTOWN perks will be sent once movie is completed.**

 

Update!

Thank you for your contributions.  Please continue to tell your friends about STEELTOWN!  We are working on our website and will share that soon.

story:
Logline:

“When nobody believes his encounter with a mermaid, an old sailor sets out to prove them wrong.”

 

Synopsis:

After a near-drowning experience in his youth, an old sailor named John believes he had an encounter with a deep-sea mystical creature. Disbelieved and ridiculed because of his conviction about what he saw, he lives in solitude with his family. One evening, after reading a fairy tale with his granddaughter before bed, he starts revisiting the memory that’s tormented him all these years. After his daughter, the community and even his own mind seem to mock his belief, he sets out on a mission to save his sanity. Stealing a boat in a fit of single-minded absolution, he travels out into the open water in one last attempt to prove his encounter was real. Will he finally lay this nightmare to rest and find the creature that’s consumed his mind?

 

Creative approach:

The genre of the film will most likely fall under thriller fantasy with a gloomy, darkish theme set around the main character. Inspiration for this idea can stem from being based in Portsmouth where there are lots of older sailors some bound to have bizarre stories of what they’ve seen out at sea. We can also picture our main character as typical, senior sailor with a big beard, sailors hat and a heavy jacket.

Of course with the character of the mermaid, she will most likely be seen as beautiful, exotic creature that does possess a darker side as she ultimately leads the main character to his death.

Stealing a boat in a fit of single-minded absolution, he travels out into the open water in one last attempt to prove his encounter was real. Will he finally lay this nightmare to rest and find the creature that’s consumed his mind? Creative approach:
The genre of the film will most likely fall under thriller fantasy with a gloomy, darkish theme set around the main character. Inspiration for this idea can stem from being based in Portsmouth where there are lots of older sailors some bound to have bizarre stories of what they’ve seen out at sea. We can also picture our main character as typical, senior sailor with a big beard, sailors hat and a heavy jacket.
Of course with the character of the mermaid, she will most likely be seen as beautiful, exotic creature that does possess a darker side as she ultimately leads the main character to his death.

story:
I first found out about human sex trafficking 5 years ago.  Women and children are being: exploited, abused in every which way, lied to, extorted, drugged, manipulated, blackmailed, abducted, sold, betrayed and traumatized over and over and over.  I could not forget or shake the knowledge that it is happening right now. I now deeply believe that when an evil is revealed to us it is our earthly responsibility to do all we can to stop it.  It is what makes us MOST human.  

     After selling property in N.Y.C., I prayed and really sought God's heart and then spent the last two years self funding a documentary about this subject matter.  And, of course, as life tends to do; many people involved in anti trafficking work began to show up in my life. 

      I have learned that there is a very real organized criminal industry being protected and enabled and, they must be challenged, confronted and stopped.  However, the more dangerous enemy lies within.  The seeds of this criminal industry exist on a lower level in our own everyday society and misconceptions. We all could find greater levels of freedom for ourselves and our future generations by searching our own hearts for any thoughts or misconceptions that might, inadvertently, enable the mistreatment of the voiceless.

     We are all needed for true transformation.  I think about my brother's children and young women I've know. Imagine this was your child or sister or daughter or friend? Would you be able to live with yourself knowing they were being destroyed and you did nothing? We must defend them against any force, voice, or individual that wants to rob them of their great purpose and value!!   

     My plan was to fund the documentary completely on my own steam but, as it turns out, I too need help.  We need financing  to complete the post production phase.  We can not look away!!!  Please help me fight the good fight.  Let's join together to set the captives free.

This is my radio interview about the making of my documentary, The New Abolitionists, with my good friend Laura Spaeth at BBOX Radio! If you missed it please listen here:

https://soundcloud.com/user-72558995/laura-inte...

story:
My name is Jens Ulrik Høgh. I am a Scandinavian outdoor writer based in Sweden. I have been a hunter all my life and for the last decade, I have focused more and more on the important relationship between hunting and nature conservation. This has resulted in many articles on the subject in main stream newspapers as well as hunting magazines and I am regularly called upon to explain trophy hunting on national TV (See a recent clip here).


Why is this project necessary?

Hunters know it. Hunting is nature conservation! We know that the influx of money from hunting tourism is one of the major reasons for the huge success of nature conservation in southern Africa. The actual results achieved in just a few decades are mind blowing. More than ten thousand private nature reserves are now covering an area bigger than most US states. Practically all of these areas are re-wilded livestock farms – this is probably the largest re-wilding project in the history of man!  Roughly 25 million large wild animals now thrive in these areas – four decades ago there were less than two million.

The facts are very much in favor of hunting tourism. There is plenty of peer-reviewed science supporting that claim. Respected international organizations like IUCN fully acknowledge the value of hunting tourism in relation to nature conservation. Nevertheless, hunting tourism - some call it “trophy hunting” - is under constant attack on all fronts. Politicians, celebrities, and millions of “internet experts” are working hard to ban “trophy hunting” on moral grounds. Sadly the facts of the matter are largely ignored in the debate. Few reporters in main stream media are hunters and they are typically more interested in causing moral outrage than providing in-depth information to their audience.  We live in a post-factual era and we need to get our side of the story out there!

Teddy said it more than a century ago. Let's raise the voice of the hunters again!

A simple idea!

Since hunters cannot rely on mainstream media reporters or independent movie directors to tell our story, we believe we have to do it ourselves. That is why we want to produce an honest TV documentary specifically for an audience of non-hunters about hunting tourism and nature conservation from a practical point of view. We need that input in the debate!

We are going to illustrate all the facts with clear case studies on the ground in the African bush. We will show what a hunting area looks like and we are going to show the depressing agricultural alternative. We will let the people involved tell their story. Trackers, camp staff, rangers, professional hunters, outfitters and government officials alike will put human faces and destinies on the numbers. Facts are going to weigh much heavier than emotions in this documentary! There will be no assumptions. Nobody else has ever really done this.

The nature of hunting will be a 50 minute TV documentary in English. It will be filmed on location in South Africa, Namibia, Zimbabwe and possibly Mozambique and/or Botswana.

This project will be produced in collaboration with Pace Productions and Byron Pace, who has specialized in producing documentaries on controversial subjects. With an in depth knowledge, his team is ideally placed to present this complex narrative in a way people can relate

The nature of hunting is endorsed by the Danish Hunting Association and F.A.C.E.

Production costs and administration

Producing quality film is extremely expensive.  We are able to produce this documentary on a comparatively small budget because everybody involved in the production pitches in. We have a very strong and passionate network of professionals within the hunting community to help us out. Nobody is working with this project to become rich and famous – we do it because we are passionate conservationists. Every cent collected from this campaign will be put to work to reach the end goal of this project, and that is to produce the best possible TV documentary and reach as many non-hunters through mainstream media as possible.

The funds, being raised from two fundraising campaigns, THIS international IndieGoGo campaign and one national Danish Campaign under the administration of the Danish Hunting Association are being monitored and controlled closely by an appointed steering committee. All funds collected will eventually end up in the campaign account currently held by the Danish Hunting Association for the project. The appointed committee has the following members:

Ulf Scheibye. Head of the Danish CIC delegation.

Henrik Frost. Deputy chairman of the Danish Hunting Association.

Jesper Rørbæk. Member of the Endangered Species Protection Agency senior management team

Every payment released by the steering committee for the production will be properly accounted for

Step by step

The production crew is ready and so are the locations of the planned case stories.

As soon as the funding is in place we start filming on location in Africa. We plan to wrap everything up by the end of November 2017 and start post production immediately. 

The film will be ready to launch in April 2018 and hopefully be shown on a lot of mainstream TV stations all over the world during the rest of the year and into 2019. After that, the film will be made available to the public for free online on one of the major video sharing platforms.

Stay tuned

We will keep everybody with an interest in our project updated through four different channels:

Newsletters - sign up here!

Facebook - go directly to our page!

Instagram - follow the project here!

More money = even better results!

We can produce a very good TV documentary if we reach our fundraising goals. But we can make a much bigger impact if we get more money to work with. It’s not rocket science. The more we get, the better the final results can be. With more money, we will have more production time, more sophisticated equipment, better soundtrack, sharper consultants, improved marketing capabilities, language editions, better follow-up etc. etc. We only have one chance and we want to make the best of it. In comparison, the recent films focusing mainly on the emotional side of hunting have cost hundreds of thousands of dollars to produce… Simply put, we need as much as we can get!

When the initial part of this crowdfunding campaign is over it will still be possible to donate funds to this project until the launch of the film.

story:
Have you ever wondered who is the person sitting next you? What's his or her story? How would you react if a total stranger asked you: "Are you an idiot?". Discover the stories of the people in our cafe and how they affect each other, for better or worse.

We are Sergi Cervera (actor and producer), Julio García Escames (director) and Bea Cabrera (cinematographer), drivers of this project, and we would love you to be part of our project!! 

 SERGI CERVERA (SAM)

Sergi Cervera is a well-known TV actor from Barcelona. He is currently working as a series regular in the 12-years-on-air comedy Polònia. Before that, he worked in several Spanish TV shows and a few feature films. For the past 2 years, Sergi has been living in and out of Hollywood, but is now focused on the adaptation into a new media film (and playing the lead role of SAM) the American version of the very successful Spanish play "The man at the next table", in which he was also the lead actor in Spain.

 ROBERT SISKO (BERNIE)

Robert Sisko is known for his work on Kemper (2008), Jailbait (2014) and Instant Getaway (2014).

 JULIO GARCÍA ESCAMES (DIRECTOR)

Julio has directed numerous short films, commercials and music videos. His short films have made it into a considerable amount of festivals around the globe and have won several awards along the way. One of his most recent and acclaimed projects, Klaazor, that he wrote, directed and edited, won the Platinum Award at the Fame’Us International Film Festival and has been screened in some of the most renowned festivals, including Hollyshorts Film Festival, Dances with Films, Burbank International Film Festival, Lone Star Film Festival and Savannah Film Festival, among many others.

 BEA CABRERA (CINEMATOGRAPHER)

Fulbright Scholar, Filmmaker, Engineer and Graphic Designer. Freelance problem solver with a passion for big cities & film and a weakness for the smell of freshly ground coffee. Originally from Spain, moved to Germany in 2012, and currently based in Los Angeles.

 

Budgeting for...

Renting out a location is not easy in Hollywood + permits, equipment, expenses, food... there are so many things to cover. We are extremely motivated, happy and working hard but we also know how powerful it could actually be to share our excitement with friends, colleagues, partners and people in the industry who might think "one for you, one for me". We won't disappoint you and we'll let you know how we spend every dollar you invest in us.

Here's some footage of our heroes as... heroes, obviously ^.^

 

Ready to make a contribution?

Share,

Like,

Participate,

Write us,

Invest and/or

Send us good vibes!

We will love you forever ;)

story:
Short Summary

Metal Head is a crime/thriller short that is punctuated by a tight 80's thrash metal soundtrack. The story follows Raymond, whose task is to dispose of everyone else who made a deal with the devil and didn't hold up their end of the bargain. This includes the mysterious and dangerous Kal Monte, a notorious mob boss. Raymond and his reluctant partner, Zach, team up as an unlikely duo to enter Monte's den, only to find that a hell on earth awaits them.

This is one of our first major projects as a team.  We've sent a number of shorts to various festivals and now, we're ready to make something even grander.  The film will have an entirely original score which will be heavily inspired by thrash metal bands including Megadeth, Metallica, Iron Maiden, Pantera, and many more.

With a lot of sweat, tears, blood (and your help), we'll be able to make our dreams come true. We'll use every last dollar and work tirelessly to make something we are truly, truly passionate about. Plus, we have some great rewards to everyone who takes this journey with us! Whether it's $1, $1,000,000, or even just giving this Indiegogo the time of day, we already can't thank you enough. 

Who Are We? 

Gambit Entertainment is the awesome team behind Metal Head. Here's some of our major players for this short: 

Jordan Dawson (Writer, Co-Director, Lead Actor) has had a hand in all of Gambit's work. Jordan has experience in every role on set from pre- to post-production and spends as much time as he can perfecting the craft. As well as graduating from Queen's University Film, Jordan is a Transcoder at the Toronto-based film production company, Suneeva.  He is also endlessly determined and constantly improving. 

Ryan Randall (Director of Photography) is an Associate of the Canadian Society of Cinematographers and actively shoots commercials, documentaries, and media arts projects. Graduating from OCAD in 2002; Ryan is an educator, technician, father, and part-time farmer. He is constantly collaborating, frequently fixing things, and persistently problem solving. 

Angeli Pineda (Co-director) is an artist-of-all-trades. Recently hired as an incoming associate designer at Deloitte Digital, she enjoys spending the majority of her time practicing and studying visual arts, music, dance, acting, writing, and of course, film. Having graduated from Queen's University Film, Angeli loves nothing more than exercising her creativity and determination by bringing new ideas to life. 

What We Need & What You Get

First, we'll get straight to what you need to know: what we need and where it's going. Below is the budget breakdown, for a total of $9000CAD. 

A list of our perks are included to the right, including some unique perks such as the entire original soundtrack, an exclusive Backers Behind-the-Scenes film, and Thrash Metal-inspired clothing. 

The Impact

Metal Head is an opportunity to bring the sweet sweet sound of 80's thrash metal back into the limelight.  Your contributions will make it possible for us to stretch our creative freedom as far as we need it to. We will be able to rent better locations for longer, pay our crew for their hard and honest work (yeah that would be nice),  and enhance some of the VFX/SFX of the film. 

With your help we hope to make a product that can go on to be a feature, this film serving as its own standalone origin story to a future installment.  This isn't our first rodeo, we have been at this for awhile now and only feel comfortable now asking for money because we know, without a shadow of a doubt, we will deliver on our film.

Risks & Challenges

Metal Head is an ambitious project, some of the shots we are delivering are extremely technically difficult.  Additionally, the quality promised is quite high.

We are prepared for this however, we've brought on a team of professionals and have already done most of the leg work in due diligence to make delivering a fulfilling film to you, our backers, as amazing as it can be.

Other Ways You Can Help

Make sure that when you pledge, you share the campaign so that more people can get in on the project. And that's all there is to it. Thanks so much!

story:
You'll experience a new world... You can show others how you feel without using words, facial expressions, behavior, or even having to think about it.

 

 

Product Description

"Sharinka" picks up your heart rate using a sensor and gives off a rhythm with the same of the beat of your heart, charming those around you. There are many types of light patterns of all colors of the rainbow. It is equipped with a lithium polymer battery that can be charged using a microusb (same as Android phones). The battery lasts for 2-3 continuous hours for heart rates when doing typical daily activities. It's light, easy to carry, as well as simple to put on. We minimized its functions so that it's easy to coordinate with your clothes. It uses a bright LED light that can be seen from far away.

4mode

・Rainbow LED

・Rainbow LED : Heart Rate

・Blue LED : Heart Rate

・Blue LED(Heart beats slow) →　RED LED(Heart beats fast) : Heart Rate

 

 

Communication + LED + Heart

I believe that the world continues to develop everyday, but for some reason I feel it's becoming harder to read people's emotions. Why is it harder to read people when the world is absolutely becoming more advanced? It's because people can easily lie about how they feel. However, even in this modern world where there's a large gap between what people feel and what they say, there's still a chance for you to get others to know you. "Sharinka" will help you to do it.

Fashion + LED + Heart

Fashion isn't merely what you wear - it's how your express yourself.

Sports + LED + Heart

"Sharinka" emits light according to your heart rate, meaning you can objectively check your heart beat. With this you can adjust the amount of exercise that you do and make sure that you're not pushing yourself past the limit. Once you get used to "Sharinka", you can look at the heart rate light in the mirror to determine how fast your heart is beating and adjust accordingly. Practicing controlling your pulse will help you to get fit. You'll be surprised at how at how you can control your body.

Love + LED + Heart

The heart speeds up when it's excited. You can show someone you're interested in how you feel.

Magic + LED + Heart

Tame the beast.

Party + LED + Heart

Party harder showing everyone what you're feeling.

Halloween + LED + Heart

Awesome accent piece for a Halloween costume.

Games + LED + Heart

Perfect combination with games! Your heart is honest even when you're showing your poker face. Works well when playing cards, board games, or mind games.

 

 

The heartbeat sensor of this device is not for medical use. If this device does not touch on the skin well, it lights based on the past data of heartbeat(in the case that it has the data) or lights in a constant rhythm(in the case that it does not have).

Creation Process

We gradually reduced the size of the base to make the product as small as possible so that it could work as a fashion accessory. We chose a lithium polymer battery instead of a disposable battery so users can conveniently charge it at home. For the battery, we selected the smallest one possible. We ordered dozens of types of LED and chose the brightest light that uses the least amount of power. Because the light flashes to the user's heart beat, the LED lasts longer than a device that continuously shines light, resulting in longer battery life. We are still working on the outer appearance and will update everyone frequently.

Improvement : this device measures one's heartbeat on backside of the neck. (not on the ear)　 *There is a possibility of change

The color will be black.
story_txt:
You'll experience a new world... You can show others how you feel without using words, facial expressions, behavior, or even having to think about it.  Product Description"Sharinka" picks up your heart rate using a sensor and gives off a rhythm with the same of the beat of your heart, charming those around you. There are many types of light patterns of all colors of the rainbow. It is equipped with a lithium polymer battery that can be charged using a microusb (same as Android phones). The battery lasts for 2-3 continuous hours for heart rates when doing typical daily activities. It's light, easy to carry, as well as simple to put on. We minimized its functions so that it's easy to coordinate with your clothes. It uses a bright LED light that can be seen from far away.4mode・Rainbow LED・Rainbow LED : Heart Rate・Blue LED : Heart Rate・Blue LED(Heart beats slow) →　RED LED(Heart beats fast) : Heart Rate  
Communication + LED + Heart
I believe that the world continues to develop everyday, but for some reason I feel it's becoming harder to read people's emotions. Why is it harder to read people when the world is absolutely becoming more advanced? It's because people can easily lie about how they feel. However, even in this modern world where there's a large gap between what people feel and what they say, there's still a chance for you to get others to know you. "Sharinka" will help you to do it.


Fashion + LED + Heart
Fashion isn't merely what you wear - it's how your express yourself.


Sports + LED + Heart
"Sharinka" emits light according to your heart rate, meaning you can objectively check your heart beat. With this you can adjust the amount of exercise that you do and make sure that you're not pushing yourself past the limit. Once you get used to "Sharinka", you can look at the heart rate light in the mirror to determine how fast your heart is beating and adjust accordingly. Practicing controlling your pulse will help you to get fit. You'll be surprised at how at how you can control your body.


Love + LED + Heart
The heart speeds up when it's excited. You can show someone you're interested in how you feel.


Magic + LED + Heart
Tame the beast.


Party + LED + Heart
Party harder showing everyone what you're feeling.


Halloween + LED + Heart
Awesome accent piece for a Halloween costume.


Games + LED + Heart
Perfect combination with games! Your heart is honest even when you're showing your poker face. Works well when playing cards, board games, or mind games.

  The heartbeat sensor of this device is not for medical use. If this device does not touch on the skin well, it lights based on the past data of heartbeat(in the case that it has the data) or lights in a constant rhythm(in the case that it does not have).
Creation Process
We gradually reduced the size of the base to make the product as small as possible so that it could work as a fashion accessory. We chose a lithium polymer battery instead of a disposable battery so users can conveniently charge it at home. For the battery, we selected the smallest one possible. We ordered dozens of types of LED and chose the brightest light that uses the least amount of power. Because the light flashes to the user's heart beat, the LED lasts longer than a device that continuously shines light, resulting in longer battery life. We are still working on the outer appearance and will update everyone frequently.


Improvement : this device measures one's heartbeat on backside of the neck. (not on the ear)　 *There is a possibility of change



The color will be black.

story:
Italiano più in basso

The italian feature "Three The Movie" is what you would call a low-budget production, or better, "no-budget" production, as it did not secure private financing or public funding at all.

As independent production company, we had to rely on our own strength, on the qualified support of Videe Ltd., based in Pordenone, which lent us equipment for the shooting and the "moviola", on the active help of many local companies, which provided free locations, costumes, catering services. Last but not least, regarding the availability of professionals, artists and crew members, who accepted to work for a payment not equal to their talent and abilities.

Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not [...]. Genius will not; [...]. Education will not [...]. Persistence and detemination alone are omnipotent.

Borrowing from Calvin Coolidge's phrase, we have talent (maybe!) but we have trusted in our persistence and determination.

So... the work is done!

 

 

Il lungometraggio italiano "Three The Movie" è quello che si chiama una produzione low budget, o meglio, “no budget”, dato che non ha ottenuto contributi economici pubblici né finanziamenti privati.

Come casa di produzione indipendente, abbiamo dovuto contare sulle nostre (esigue) forze, sul sostegno qualificato della Videe di Pordenone, che ha prestato le attrezzature necessarie per le riprese e la “moviola”, sul supporto attivo di numerose aziende friulane che hanno messo a disposizione location, costumi, servizio di catering... infine, ma non ultima in ordine di importanza, la disponibilità di professionisti, artisti e tecnici che hanno percepito compensi non pari al proprio talento e alle proprie abilità.

Nulla al mondo può prendere il posto della perseveranza. Non il talento [...] Non il genio [...]. Non l’istruzione [...]. Solo la perseveranza e la determinazione sono onnipotenti.

Mutuando una frase di Calvin Coolidge, se pensavamo di avere talento (forse!), ciò su cui abbiamo confidato è stata la nostra tenacia e determinazione.

Così... il lavoro è compiuto!

Brief Synopsis

3 is everything in this movie. 3 and its multiples. Archaic, spiritual, transcendent numbers. 3, 6, 9. Carriers of wisdom that lead us to the heart of theological monotheisms. 3, the Christian Trinity. 6, the points of the Star of David, the Jewish Star. 9, the Enneagram, the "face of God" in Sufi traditions.

3 boys. 3 stories intertwined in a land, Friuli, which extends along a triple border... The reconstruction of the micro(?)universe of illegal immigrants in the North-East of Italy. The life, the longing to happiness, the equality of diversity. Predestination and moral choice?
There are so many ways to see... (There is no truth. There is only perception  - Gustave Flaubert).

The plot leads to philosophical, visionary, surreal dimensions. It is a poetic disenchantment.

 

Breve Sinossi

3 è tutto in questo film. 3 e suoi multipli. Numeri arcaici, spirituali, trascendenti. 3, 6, 9. Vettori sapienzali che ci conducono al cuore teologico dei monoteismi. 3, la Trinità cristiana. 6, le punte della Stella di David, la Stella degli Ebrei. 9, il volto di Dio secondo la tradizione Sufi, per la cultura islamica.

Tre ragazzi. Tre storie s’intrecciano in una terra, il Friuli, che si estende lungo un triplice confine... La ricostruzione del micro(?)universo dell'immigrazione illegale nel Nord Est Italia. La vita, l'anelito alla felicità, l'uguaglianza delle diversità. Predestinazione o scelta morale? Ci sono tanti modi di vedere... (Non c'è verità. C'è solo percezione - Gustave Flaubert)

La trama sfocia in dimensioni filosofiche, visionarie, surreali. E' disincanto poetico.

Cinema makes its way through an amazing array of images during the opening of this film that celebrates human beings. It celebrates them on the stage of life, a concrete existence, both real and suffering, that is the theatre of secret and subtle events, proclaimed as a vibrant hymn to the spectacle of a timeless human comedy without place. [...] Angels and demons, shadows and lights, Faith and suspicion dance like elegant dreams and surreal transpositions in the evocative images of a delicate and generous film which favours the fresh air of soul searching and becomes a cinema that is silent and inquiring into the individual, the society that accepts him or her and the reality from which it is fed. ___ Dario Carta, Cinefile.biz

For more information about Cast, Troupe, Awards and Official Selections, Press Reviews... read our Press Kit on Yumpu.

The Soundtrack of this film deserves special attention. It' s original and composed for an Synphonic Orchestra of 60 elements by the international renown conductor Roberto Salvalaio.

 

Il cinema si fa subito spazio, nello splendido soffio di immagini in apertura di un film che celebra l’uomo. E lo celebra sul palcoscenico della vita, l’esistenza concreta, reale e sofferta che è teatro di vicende tanto sottili e segrete quanto proclamate nel vibrante inno di una Comèdie Humaine di ogni tempo e luogo. [...] Angeli e demoni, luci e ombre, Fede e sospetto danzano come sogni eleganti e trasposizioni surreali nelle suggestive immagini di un film delicato e generoso che privilegia il respiro aperto della ricerca interiore e si fa cinema silenzioso e indagatore sull'individuo, la società che lo accoglie e la realtà da cui è nutrito. ___ Dario Carta – Cinefile.biz

Per maggiori informazioni su Cast, Troupe, Premi, Selezioni Ufficiali, Recensioni... leggi il nostro Presskit su Yumpu.

La Colonna sonora del film merita una speciale attenzione. E' originale e composta per un'Orchestra Sinfonica di 60 elementi dal Maestro Roberto Salvalaio, direttore di fama internazionale.

"Three the Movie" have received offical mentions and awards in film festivals around the world!

"Three The Movie" has been selected in more than 30 International Film Festivals and has gained 20 awards in every creative sector: Story, Screenwriting, Editing, Performing Group and Cast, Trailer, also Award and Excellence Awards for Feature, Director and Producer, Honorary Mention, Online Viewer Choice Award, Outstanding Excellence for Sound, Music and Newcomer.

 

"Three the Movie" ha ricevuto selezioni ufficiali e premi in festival cinematografici in tutto il mondo!

"Three The Movie" è stato selezionato in più di 30 Festival Cinematografici Internazionali e ha guadagnato 20 premi in ogni comparto creativo: Soggetto, Sceneggiatura, Montaggio, Performance di Troupe e Cast, Trailer, anche Premi e Premi di eccellenza per Lungometraggio, Regista, Produttore, Menzione Onoraria, Premio del Pubblico Online, Premi di Straordinaria Eccellenza per Suono, Musica e Regista Esordiente.

25 Reasons to support this movie

1. It deals with social relevant subjects (immigration and cultural/religious conflicts);
2. It deals with cultural, psychological and spiritual topics, typical of the Western world and a possible common ground between Middle East and the Western world;
3. For the good script and a very carefully calibrated staging of a thought able to order events in an unusual, transversal and charming vision;
4. To go beyond genre, and to contain all the possible areas for a movie (love, hate, friendship, conflicts, desires, questions about life and death, fear of the unknown, yearning for something);
5. It covers profound topics lightly and light issues deeply;
6. The story speaks to the viewer's heart but also to the viewer's brain
7. Beginning with equal and antagonistic themes and concepts, it shows the equality of diversity, revealing the universality of human nature;
8. It is about a reality which is shared by all humanity: the longing for happiness;
9. It is a "cry for freedom": freedom of expression, creative freedom, freedom from the shackles of politics, freedom from constraints and moral or material debts to anyone, freedom of determination, moral, ethical and spiritual freedom...
10. It conveys an implicit message of equality, peace and tolerance;
11. It experiences an expressive language in both writing and installation, that rearranges time;
12. It allows the viewer's active involvement, reflection and freedom to consider the events as they are told;
13. The soundtrack, an original composition written for the film, makes the deepest harmonica vibrate;
14. Music, images and sounds are part of a harmonious whole;
15. The Movie and its music (the movie soundtrack composer, Roberto Salvalaio, is a real celebrity in the East and in other European countries such as Romania, Germany, Switzerland, Russia) have a bridging role between West and East;
16. For the extreme novelty of some directorial solutions, praised by critics;
17. For the absolute novelty in the history of cinema, highlighted by critics, of having put in relation the three monotheistic religions according to a fascinating vision;
18. Because Udine, a fascinating city almost unknown to the world of cinema and one of the main character of the narration, becomes the symbolic location of a story of every place;
19. The cinematographic production work (active collaboration between artists, technicians and various production sectors) is very clear;
20. Because the set was an expression of the industriousness of Friulian people and multi-ethnic integration;
21. For the assortment and the harmonious fusion of the cast;
22. Original and strong characterization;
23. It deals with inner and real angels and demons (and with those who have faced them...);
24. Because this film, which did not get government grants, is courageous and different, and for this reason alone it should be supported;
25. Because this film has the power to transport you somewhere else... in a single flutter!

25 motivi per sostenere questo film

1. Per l'attualità sociale dei temi trattati (l'immigrazione e i conflitti culturali e religiosi);
2. Per l'attualità dei temi culturali, psicologici e spirituale, propri di questo tempo nel mondo Occidentale, e dei possibili punti di incontro col mondo orientale e medio-orientale;
3. Per la solida sceneggiatura e la calibratissima messa in scena di un pensiero in grado di ordinare la storia in una visione inusuale, trasversale e affascinante;
4. Per andare oltre il genere, e contenere tutti i temi possibili di un film (amore, odio, amicizia, conflitti, desiderio, interrogativi sulla vita e sulla morte, paura dell’ignoto, anelito a qualcosa);
5. Perché tratta i temi profondi con leggerezza e con leggerezza i temi profondi;
6. Perché le vicende narrate parlano alla mente e al cuore;
7. Perché partendo da temi e concetti antagonisti e paritetici, racconta l’uguaglianza delle diversità, rivelando l’universale natura umana;
8. Perché questa storia racconta realtà condivisa dall’intera umanità: l’anelito alla felicità;
9. Perché questo film è un “grido di libertà”: libertà espressiva, libertà creativa, libertà dalle pastoie della politica, libertà dai vincoli e dai debiti morali o materiali verso chichessia, libertà di determinazione, libertà morale, etica e spirituale...;
10. Per il messaggio implicito di uguaglianza, pace e tolleranza in esso contenuto;
11. Per il linguaggio espressivo sperimentato, sia in scrittura che al montaggio, che ridisegna il tempo;
12. Perché consente la partecipazione attiva del pubblico, la riflessione e la libertà rispettata di interrogarsi sui fatti rappresentati;
13. Perché la musica, scritta appositamente, fa vibrare le armoniche più profonde;
14. Perché musica, immagini e suoni un armonioso tutt’uno;
15. Perché film e musica (l'autore della colonna sonora, Roberto Salvalaio, è un'autentica celebrità in Oriente e in altri paesi europei come Romania, Germania, Svizzera, Russia) sono ponte che collega Occidente e Oriente;
16. Per l'estrema novità di alcune soluzioni registiche riconosciute anche dalla Critica;
17. Per la novità assoluta nella storia del Cinema, messa in luce dalla critica, dell’aver messo in relazione i tre monoteismi secondo una visione affascinante;
18. Perché Udine, pressoché sconosciuta al Cinema e attraente protagonista al pari dei personaggi, diventa luogo simbolo di una storia al contempo di ogni luogo;
19. Perché nel film è evidente il lavoro di factory cinematografica (di fattiva collaborazione tra artisti, tecnici e dei diversi comparti di produzione tra loro);
20. Perché il set è stato espressione della laboriosità friulana e di integrazione multi-etnica;
21. Per l’assortimento e l’armoniosa fusione del cast;
22. Per l'originalità e la forte caratterizzazione dei personaggi;
23. Perché è una storia che parla di Angeli e Demoni, interiori e reali (e chi non li ha incontrati!);
24. Perché questo film, che non ha ottenuto contributi pubblici, è un’opera coraggiosa e controcorrente, e anche solo per questo, andrebbe sostenuta;
25. Perché questo film ha il potere di portarti altrove… in un battito d’ali!

But, we do not have the money to bring our film to festivals.

Until now, we have been able to attend only 1 festival in the United States. On 25 November we should have been in Bali to receive not 1, but 6 awards (3 outstanding exellence for categories: Newcomer, Sound, Music and 3 Excellence awards for feature film, producer, director); on 12 December we had to be in Jakarta; in January and in February 2017 we should be in Bali to receive 5 awards... then in Montreal at the Canadian Independent Film Festival... But these are only some of the important appointments with Festivals.

We should attend Film Markets, an Agent should be employed to sell our film to an international distributor. We should pay a serious press office.... We should, We should, We should! But as we are now, we can't.

Please, we need your support! We ask for 20,000 $, but actually, we need much more...

Also, spread the word about this film. Positive thoughts and actions will be positive for this movie. Thank you.

 

Ma non abbiamo i soldi per accompagnare il film ai festival.

Finora, abbiamo potuto accompagnare il film  solamente una volta in un festival negli Stati Uniti. Il 25 novembre avremmo dovuto essere a Bali per ricevere non 1, ma 6 premi (3 di straordinaria eccellenza per le categorie: Regista Esordiente, Suono, Musica; e 3 di Eccellenza per lungometraggio, produttore e regista); il 12 Dicembre dovevamo essere a Giacarta; in Gennaio e in Febbraio 2017, dovremmo essere a  Bali a riceve 5 premi... e poi a Montreal al Canada Independent Film Festival... Ma questi sono solo alcuni degli importanti appuntamenti del film con i Festival.

Dovremmo partecipare ai Film Market, dovremmo impiegare un Agente per vendere il film a un Distributore Internazionale. Dovremmo pagare un serio Ufficio Stampa.... Dovremmo, dovremmo, dovremmo! Ma come siamo ora, non possiamo.

Abbiamo bisogno del vostro supporto. Qui indichiamo una cifra complessiva di 20.000 $, ma avremmo bisogno di molto di più...

E ancora... diffondete la notizia di questo film. Pensieri positivi e azioni positive sono positive per questo film. Grazie.

Gloria Corradi, artist

About Three The Movie, I caught the beauty of the content which is essential for those who experience the world with their own personal look. The actors, the photos, the mastery of a dream... together they symbolically remind us that we are united by the spark of love, and even though apparently divided, we should not forget what can bring us back to the innocent and infinite dimension of a little child... A rich detailed, colourful and refined film, which left me the light of scenes, the people and places and an interweaving of feelings that I unroll in this harmonious sharing. A glimmer of hope in a universal mind that joins everything.
My image is deep and light and it is an invitation to go through this film with many eyes, perhaps with a beating of wings...

 

Gloria Corradi, artista

Di Three The Movie ho colto la bellezza dei contenuti essenziali per ogni essere che sperimenta il mondo con il suo sguardo personale. Gli attori, le foto, la maestria di un sogno... insieme per ricordarci che simbolicamente siamo uniti dalla scintilla dell’amore e che se pur divisi in apparenza non possiamo dimenticare quel che può riportarci nella dimensione innocente ed infinita di una bambina… Un film ricco e fine nei particolari, nei colori, che mi lascia dentro la luce delle scene, della gente e dei luoghi ed un intreccio di sensazioni che srotolo in questa armoniosa condivisione. Un lume di speranza in una mente universale che unisce.
La mia immagine è profonda e leggera ed è un invito ad attraversare questo film con molti occhi, magari con un battito di ali…

The soundtrack, an original composition written for the film, makes the deepest harmonica vibrate;14. Music, images and sounds are part of a harmonious whole;15. The Movie and its music (the movie soundtrack composer, Roberto Salvalaio, is a real celebrity in the East and in other European countries such as Romania, Germany, Switzerland, Russia) have a bridging role between West and East;16. For the extreme novelty of some directorial solutions, praised by critics;17. For the absolute novelty in the history of cinema, highlighted by critics, of having put in relation the three monotheistic religions according to a fascinating vision;18. Because Udine, a fascinating city almost unknown to the world of cinema and one of the main character of the narration, becomes the symbolic location of a story of every place;19. The cinematographic production work (active collaboration between artists, technicians and various production sectors) is very clear;20. Because the set was an expression of the industriousness of Friulian people and multi-ethnic integration;21. For the assortment and the harmonious fusion of the cast;22. Original and strong characterization;23. It deals with inner and real angels and demons (and with those who have faced them...);24. Because this film, which did not get government grants, is courageous and different, and for this reason alone it should be supported;25. Because this film has the power to transport you somewhere else... in a single flutter!
25 motivi per sostenere questo film
1. Per l'attualità sociale dei temi trattati (l'immigrazione e i conflitti culturali e religiosi);2. Per l'attualità dei temi culturali, psicologici e spirituale, propri di questo tempo nel mondo Occidentale, e dei possibili punti di incontro col mondo orientale e medio-orientale;3. Per la solida sceneggiatura e la calibratissima messa in scena di un pensiero in grado di ordinare la storia in una visione inusuale, trasversale e affascinante;4. Per andare oltre il genere, e contenere tutti i temi possibili di un film (amore, odio, amicizia, conflitti, desiderio, interrogativi sulla vita e sulla morte, paura dell’ignoto, anelito a qualcosa);5. Perché tratta i temi profondi con leggerezza e con leggerezza i temi profondi;6. Perché le vicende narrate parlano alla mente e al cuore;7. Perché partendo da temi e concetti antagonisti e paritetici, racconta l’uguaglianza delle diversità, rivelando l’universale natura umana;8. Perché questa storia racconta realtà condivisa dall’intera umanità: l’anelito alla felicità;9. Perché questo film è un “grido di libertà”: libertà espressiva, libertà creativa, libertà dalle pastoie della politica, libertà dai vincoli e dai debiti morali o materiali verso chichessia, libertà di determinazione, libertà morale, etica e spirituale...;10. Per il messaggio implicito di uguaglianza, pace e tolleranza in esso contenuto;11. Per il linguaggio espressivo sperimentato, sia in scrittura che al montaggio, che ridisegna il tempo;12. Perché consente la partecipazione attiva del pubblico, la riflessione e la libertà rispettata di interrogarsi sui fatti rappresentati;13. Perché la musica, scritta appositamente, fa vibrare le armoniche più profonde;14. Perché musica, immagini e suoni un armonioso tutt’uno;15. Perché film e musica (l'autore della colonna sonora, Roberto Salvalaio, è un'autentica celebrità in Oriente e in altri paesi europei come Romania, Germania, Svizzera, Russia) sono ponte che collega Occidente e Oriente;16. Per l'estrema novità di alcune soluzioni registiche riconosciute anche dalla Critica;17. Per la novità assoluta nella storia del Cinema, messa in luce dalla critica, dell’aver messo in relazione i tre monoteismi secondo una visione affascinante;18. Perché Udine, pressoché sconosciuta al Cinema e attraente protagonista al pari dei personaggi, diventa luogo simbolo di una storia al contempo di ogni luogo;19. Perché nel film è evidente il lavoro di factory cinematografica (di fattiva collaborazione tra artisti, tecnici e dei diversi comparti di produzione tra loro);20. Perché il set è stato espressione della laboriosità friulana e di integrazione multi-etnica;21. Per l’assortimento e l’armoniosa fusione del cast;22. Per l'originalità e la forte caratterizzazione dei personaggi;23. Perché è una storia che parla di Angeli e Demoni, interiori e reali (e chi non li ha incontrati!);24. Perché questo film, che non ha ottenuto contributi pubblici, è un’opera coraggiosa e controcorrente, e anche solo per questo, andrebbe sostenuta;25. Perché questo film ha il potere di portarti altrove… in un battito d’ali!


But, we do not have the money to bring our film to festivals.
Until now, we have been able to attend only 1 festival in the United States. On 25 November we should have been in Bali to receive not 1, but 6 awards (3 outstanding exellence for categories: Newcomer, Sound, Music and 3 Excellence awards for feature film, producer, director); on 12 December we had to be in Jakarta; in January and in February 2017 we should be in Bali to receive 5 awards... then in Montreal at the Canadian Independent Film Festival... But these are only some of the important appointments with Festivals.
We should attend Film Markets, an Agent should be employed to sell our film to an international distributor. We should pay a serious press office.... We should, We should, We should! But as we are now, we can't.
Please, we need your support! We ask for 20,000 $, but actually, we need much more...
Also, spread the word about this film. Positive thoughts and actions will be positive for this movie. Thank you.
 
Ma non abbiamo i soldi per accompagnare il film ai festival.
Finora, abbiamo potuto accompagnare il film  solamente una volta in un festival negli Stati Uniti. Il 25 novembre avremmo dovuto essere a Bali per ricevere non 1, ma 6 premi (3 di straordinaria eccellenza per le categorie: Regista Esordiente, Suono, Musica; e 3 di Eccellenza per lungometraggio, produttore e regista); il 12 Dicembre dovevamo essere a Giacarta; in Gennaio e in Febbraio 2017, dovremmo essere a  Bali a riceve 5 premi... e poi a Montreal al Canada Independent Film Festival... Ma questi sono solo alcuni degli importanti appuntamenti del film con i Festival.
Dovremmo partecipare ai Film Market, dovremmo impiegare un Agente per vendere il film a un Distributore Internazionale. Dovremmo pagare un serio Ufficio Stampa.... Dovremmo, dovremmo, dovremmo! Ma come siamo ora, non possiamo.
Abbiamo bisogno del vostro supporto. Qui indichiamo una cifra complessiva di 20.000 $, ma avremmo bisogno di molto di più...
E ancora... diffondete la notizia di questo film. Pensieri positivi e azioni positive sono positive per questo film. Grazie.

Gloria Corradi, artist
About Three The Movie, I caught the beauty of the content which is essential for those who experience the world with their own personal look. The actors, the photos, the mastery of a dream... together they symbolically remind us that we are united by the spark of love, and even though apparently divided, we should not forget what can bring us back to the innocent and infinite dimension of a little child... A rich detailed, colourful and refined film, which left me the light of scenes, the people and places and an interweaving of feelings that I unroll in this harmonious sharing. A glimmer of hope in a universal mind that joins everything.My image is deep and light and it is an invitation to go through this film with many eyes, perhaps with a beating of wings...
 
Gloria Corradi, artista
Di Three The Movie ho colto la bellezza dei contenuti essenziali per ogni essere che sperimenta il mondo con il suo sguardo personale. Gli attori, le foto, la maestria di un sogno... insieme per ricordarci che simbolicamente siamo uniti dalla scintilla dell’amore e che se pur divisi in apparenza non possiamo dimenticare quel che può riportarci nella dimensione innocente ed infinita di una bambina… Un film ricco e fine nei particolari, nei colori, che mi lascia dentro la luce delle scene, della gente e dei luoghi ed un intreccio di sensazioni che srotolo in questa armoniosa condivisione. Un lume di speranza in una mente universale che unisce.La mia immagine è profonda e leggera ed è un invito ad attraversare questo film con molti occhi, magari con un battito di ali…

story:
Our Story

Screen Working Actors Tactical Specialists, L.L.C. (S.W.A.T.S. FILMS) is an NYC film production company created by Actors and Law Enforcement Officers back in 2008. Since then, S.W.A.T.S. FILMS has produced four award-winning films.

Code Name: Operation Black Thunder - our first short film. Black Thunder received multiple awards including Best Action Picture. It achieved multiple nominations including an International Nomination for Best International Short Film.

Collateral Package - our second short film. Collateral Package was the winner of several awards including Best Dramatic Short Film. It earned multiple nominations as well. Collateral Package was 1 of 50 Finalists at the 2011 U.S.A. Film Festival, which is an OSCAR Qualifying Film Festival for the Academy of Motion Pictures in the Oscar Category for Best Short Film.

The Evil's Gate - our third production. The Evil's Gate hit the 2012 Film Festival Circuit during the last quarter of the year. The Evil's Gate was the winner of several awards including Best Cinematography Award. Overall, it achieved 16 nominations in a period of 4 months. The nominations include Best Lead Actor, Best Lead Actress, Best Supporting Actor, Best Cinematography, Best Director of Photography, Best Short Film Screenplay, Best Make-up.

Dirty Shield - our latest production and our first feature film. Dirty Shield was the winner of several awards including Best Lead Actor and Best Crime Drama. It was also another recipient of multiple nominations. Dirty Shield achieved worldwide commercial distribution by Shami Media Group and it's currently on sale at many outlets in the United States including Walmart, Barnes & Noble, Target, Best Buy, Sears, Amazon and Kmart. It is also available for streaming in Amazon Prime. 

S.W.A.T.S. FILMS is joining forces with MindBender Entertainment, P.W.G. Productions, Umana Bros. and E.V.T. Productions for the making of HELL OF A NEW YEAR. Writer Artemus Cole bring us a terrifying life-lesson that all of us shall be aware of:

WHAT GOOD IS IT FOR ANYONE TO GAIN THE WHOLE WORLD, YET FORFEIT THEIR SOUL?

We are more than ready for the filming of this project and we need your support to accomplish this goal. BE PART OF OUR STORY!!!!!

REMEMBER...we do not have the Hollywood "Big Money Machine" backing us up. THIS IS TRUE INDEPENDENT FILM-MAKING. We are financing this project with our own resources, from our own salaries, savings, etc. YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS PARAMOUNT FOR THE PRODUCTION OF THIS FILM.

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

Sincerely Yours,

Edgar Jimz, President S.W.A.T.S. FILMS

 

THE IMPACT

Our hard work has impacted many New York City actors and it has been a crucial tool to catapult them to the big screen. We are extremely proud of their achievements and we will continue our mission of hard work with passion and dedication in order to achieve even greater goals.

story:
Why hello there...

My name is Antonio Harper and I am a current senior at Cleveland State University in my last semester of college.  Film has always been my life, from my earliest memory to my current projects I have always held a passion for film in my heart.  Starting at a young age with short stories and comics to now feature length films and award winning work I have done the best to expose myself to all things film to help better my work and knowledge on the subject.  By the time I was 14 I had already directed, written, acted and edited my own feature length 007 film, in high school my exposer grew from doing an anti-bully PSA's that was distributed throughout the district to winning my first ever film festival for Best In Show and Best Comedy at the iMagine Hathaway Brown Film Festival.  I had the opportunity to work on professional studios with Scenarios USA for their short "Speechless" and had that work put into the Cleveland International Film Festival.  Also in high school I was able to acquire an internship for my senior project at the Greater Cleveland Film Commission during the filming of Captain America: the Winter Solider and Draft Day to see what exactly happened on the business side of film making and how to increase the film industry in Cleveland.   From that point on I then looked to getting into film festivals, I volunteered at the Cleveland International Film Festival and started participating the Cleveland 48 Hour Film Festival the summer after graduating high school in 2013.  Starting there and the 4 summers to follow I would receive nominations every year for my short films entered into the festival from Audience Choice, Best Us of Prop and Line and Best Choreographed Fight to Best Male Actor in a Leading Role.

 After graduating I decided to stay in Cleveland and attend Cleveland State University where starting my freshman year started CSU's very first film club called Oscar Production, made a full length action comedy film titled "The Elite", going into sophomore year I worked on a second film drama called "Fine Line", junior year I got creative and made a mockumentary web series on Youtube called "Credit Hours" which followed the daily lives of four college roommates and finally senior year I was able to (in my first semester) work on the Cavs intro video(s) for the 2016-2017 season, be hired on the Scenarios USA production of "Split Persona" and gained another internship with the Greater Cleveland Film Commission for college credit, which I was then hired on for the following semester as a part time employee.  Now I look to finish my last semester stronger than ever with this project.  With my final production class I look to do what no college student would ever think of doing...paying their classmates!  Its crazy I know but this production class is supposed to help give us insight of what real production is and the entire process that goes into it and so having the background I have I know that people get paid when they work on projects so it only seems right to do this for this class and those who are "hired" on as my cast and crew.  This funding would go to that as well as props, location permits, food and transportation need for production.  Each year that I have attended CSU I have made it my duty to one up myself in what I have done in previous years and this will be my crowing jewel at CSU.   My wish is to make this as real of a production that has ever been done by a student at CSU.

Some give and take now,

So now we have reached the question of what do I get out of the funding and what do you get out of it?  We look to raise a maximum of $8000 with a minimum amount of $4000.  This may seem like a lot but I wish to utilize all the money in how a true Hollywood production would.  The money would go towards paying the actors a crew members, gaining location permits, food for the cast and crew, transportation expenses being gas and a rental car if needed, rental equipment, theater expenses for premiering the film and also some funds for entering the short into local and international film festivals.  The money would be used to the fullest extent not leaving a dime unused.  

The return you will gain depending on your level of contribution will give you on screen credit from Special Thanks to Executive Producers.  With the level of contribution you give you shall receive perks starting at a "Thank You" video from me the Director to T-shirts, signed poster by the cast, DVD copies of the film with a  blooper reel and even a original copy of the script.

How this effects you and us

This project is made to boost film in Cleveland, I myself am looking to start a small independent film company called West 10G Productions in the heart of Downtown Cleveland.  This film will be the starting point for that dream.  I know all the raw talent that is heres and I want to expose it for everyone to see that they don't need to go to L.A or Atlanta to make it in the film industry but that they can make that dream happen right here.  I want to give those people hope and that is what I wish to start off with this project.  West 10G Productions will continue that dream with allowing college students the opportunity to create and work on film productions to further work their craft outside of school.  The company though will not just include college students but all film enthusiast from actors and directors to legal advisors and accountants.  We will look to help grow the film industry in Cleveland and it all starts with this project.

Now no production is ever perfect, there will always be obstacles and risk that go into making any film.  The first is rising enough money to do what it is that we want to do for this film to make it the best product in the end, so the first step is your help in helping us reach our goal.  Now after that the matter is in our hands and taking the resources that you have given us to make this film and we will execute this perfectly with the best quality outcome and it is because I as a filmmaker have always worked with next to nothing with my productions and yet they all have been nominated for some type of award or recognition, my anti-bully PSA was acclaimed throughout my high school district, I won my first ever film festival with a comedy called "Larry" for both Best in Show and Best Comedy at the iMagine Film Festival and every year that I entered the Cleveland 48 Hour Film Festival starting in 2013 I was nominated for multiple awards "66 Days" (2013) was the debut for the film festival, "Childs Play" (2014) was nominated for Audience Choice and Best Choreographed Fight, "The Orientation" (2015) was nominated for Best Use of Prop and Audience Choice and "Age of Chains" (2016) I was nominated for Best Male Actor in a Leading Role.  All of those short films I had no finances for and was still able to make art work to the fullest potential.  So in short I have been able to make something out of nothing and so you and I both are excited to see what I can do with a little fundraising in my corner.

Nowadays money isn't the only way to help, word of mouth is just as resourceful.  So if you're unable to give even the smallest of contribution thats okay, share our link, post it on your social media and help us get the word out.  Anything you do can help and will help us get that much closer to our goal and from there help jumpstart an even bigger project for the city of Cleveland.  We hope that we have your support for "The Jackpot" and hope you will join us on this wild ride of the most exciting family outing ever.

story:
My name is Audrey Evans and I’m the writer and director of Genesis — it will be my feature film debut as director. The bulk of my experience has been in film editing — I spent over 20 years working on features including Thelma & Louise, The Doors, Waterworld, What Women Want, and most recently, the upcoming Battle of the Sexes with Emma Stone and Steve Carell. 

The editing room is fertile ground for learning about filmmaking.  From Day One of production on a film, the editorial crew gets to watch the dailies, work on the editor’s cut, and then work closely with the director, and ultimately producers, to get the film to its Release Print.  Whether it’s a poor performance, a lack of coverage or even too much coverage, many a film has been saved by skillful editing.

I cut my teeth at New Horizons Pictures, AKA, the Roger Corman School of Film, where I learned, among other things, how to make a feature film in one weekend. My experience at New Horizons taught me how to do it fast, economically, and with style. That’s exactly how I see Genesis, a B movie with style.

 

Think Orange is the New Black meets Pulp Fiction meets Enter the Dragon.

Genesis is the story of the first woman to be giving birth by Parthenogenesis, the body’s ability to reproduce without fertilization or outside stimulus. The woman is abducted by the world powers — all men — who are studying her to see how they can save their species from extinction. She’s then liberated by a group of radical feminist lesbians led by Meredith Baxter's character, and taken to their colony which is at an abandoned Jewish resort in the Catskills. I won’t go on, I don’t want to spoil the rest!

 

We’re asking for $95,000.00 to carry us through three, six day weeks of production in Los Angeles. We’re doing it under the SAG Ultra Low Budget Agreement, which means everyone is agreeing to take a cut in pay in order to work on this project. The plan is to shoot in March subject to the availability of actors.

This production is a true collaboration that includes those of you who are kind enough to donate. We’ve designed the perks so that you can participate in the production in a variety of roles and help the actual shaping of the film itself. This is our movie!

 

Please join me, Meredith, Bob, Suzanne, and Dana in bringing this project to fruition. Thank you!

The Hollywood Reporter ran a piece about our project! Check it out:

http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/meredith-baxter-star-dystopian-dramedy-genesis-976816

Here is a link to an article in AfterEllen.com:

http://www.afterellen.com/movies/530153-genesis-future-mankind-woman

And this appeared in Curve:

http://www.curvemag.com/Curve-Magazine/TV/All-Star-Lesbian-Sci-Fi-Comedy-In-The-Works-1698
story_txt:
My name is Audrey Evans and I’m the writer and director of Genesis — it will be my feature film debut as director. The bulk of my experience has been in film editing — I spent over 20 years working on features including Thelma & Louise, The Doors, Waterworld, What Women Want, and most recently, the upcoming Battle of the Sexes with Emma Stone and Steve Carell. The editing room is fertile ground for learning about filmmaking.  From Day One of production on a film, the editorial crew gets to watch the dailies, work on the editor’s cut, and then work closely with the director, and ultimately producers, to get the film to its Release Print.  Whether it’s a poor performance, a lack of coverage or even too much coverage, many a film has been saved by skillful editing.I cut my teeth at New Horizons Pictures, AKA, the Roger Corman School of Film, where I learned, among other things, how to make a feature film in one weekend. My experience at New Horizons taught me how to do it fast, economically, and with style. That’s exactly how I see Genesis, a B movie with style.

 
Think Orange is the New Black meets Pulp Fiction meets Enter the Dragon.
Genesis is the story of the first woman to be giving birth by Parthenogenesis, the body’s ability to reproduce without fertilization or outside stimulus. The woman is abducted by the world powers — all men — who are studying her to see how they can save their species from extinction. She’s then liberated by a group of radical feminist lesbians led by Meredith Baxter's character, and taken to their colony which is at an abandoned Jewish resort in the Catskills. I won’t go on, I don’t want to spoil the rest!

 
We’re asking for $95,000.00 to carry us through three, six day weeks of production in Los Angeles. We’re doing it under the SAG Ultra Low Budget Agreement, which means everyone is agreeing to take a cut in pay in order to work on this project. The plan is to shoot in March subject to the availability of actors.This production is a true collaboration that includes those of you who are kind enough to donate. We’ve designed the perks so that you can participate in the production in a variety of roles and help the actual shaping of the film itself. This is our movie!

 
Please join me, Meredith, Bob, Suzanne, and Dana in bringing this project to fruition. Thank you!The Hollywood Reporter ran a piece about our project! Check it out:http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/meredith-baxter-star-dystopian-dramedy-genesis-976816Here is a link to an article in AfterEllen.com:http://www.afterellen.com/movies/530153-genesis-future-mankind-womanAnd this appeared in Curve:http://www.curvemag.com/Curve-Magazine/TV/All-Star-Lesbian-Sci-Fi-Comedy-In-The-Works-1698

story:
THE ESTONYANS, my first feature film, well ours. Just because I couldn't do it without amazing people working with me. But I have to say, it is really exciting to finally share this amazing story with you. 

Hello I'm Miguel de Oliveira, I'm a passionate filmmaker that, as you probably already know, want to do my first film. I'm sharing here with you all the other short films I've done. If you go to our website: www.momifilms.com, you can watch our films for free. 

It has been an amazing journey so far, so we need to take it to the next level: Make this film Happen. THE ESTONYANS.

We're asking for your donation, bur also if you know someone that has an apartment, a coffee shop, a restaurant, some interesting place, we'd love to hear about it.

I hope we can take this journey together, make things possible, make things happen, make art happen. Let's fill the world with possibilities.

Thank you.

Miguel de Oliveira

THE STORY:

Peter, Mary, Fred, Carol and Alice. This is a story about 5 people in crisis with the modern world. One thing they all know. They're not happy. Something is missing but they don't know what it is. They all live in New York, the city of inspiration, where everything is possible, but tough and challenging. They all have the ambition to to be amazing, do awesome things, but something is missing in their lives. They need to feel something new, feel again what is to do something for the first time. First kiss, a first emotion, see and experience new things. But they feel stuck, like a fish in an aquarium. In their search for happiness their lives connect and something magical comes out of that.

In a rollercoaster of emotions we'll go deep into their lives, we'll laugh together, we'll suffer together, but there is always the promise of hope, and that if you keep trying, don't give up, things we'll get better. 

While they search for the meaning of their lives, they dream about an imaginary place, where happiness is possible, here in New York.

CAST AND CREW:

This is our amazing cast, that will take us through an emotional journey, living the lives of Peter, Mary, Fred, Carol and Alice. They were selected from almost 1000 casting submissions.

CAST: PAUL BARRETT, MONICA VILELA, TIM ANDERSON, ALISON MADDREN, SAMANTHA BLAIN (all amazing)

And here is our amazing crew. 

CREW: Miguel de Oliveira ( Scriptwriter, Director, Producer), Monica Vilela ( Actress, Producer), Julia Spadaccini ( Author of theatre play and Scriptwriter), Mevlut Akkaya (co-producer), Danny Smight ( Co- producer), Alejandro Mejia (Director of Photography), Celina Arslanian (Production Designer), Bruno Tore (Editor), Gabriel Dib ( Music Composer), Maíra Senise (Costume Designer)

Why Donate?

It is like planting a seed and putting water and seeing it grow. We have the seed and need your water. Then we can watch together that beautiful flower grow. Is there anything more beautiful than that? By donating we do it together, you get informed about what we're doing.

You get to see how a work of art comes together. Amazing things have been built by donations, amazing things have been done. 

And also when you donate we'll give you something in return. Just check the perks section. Depending on the amount you donate you get a PERK.

So Thank you.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for our campaign in to reach the minimum of US$70.000 in 30 days. 

Why 30 days? Well, we want to start filming pretty soon, and the availabilities of cast and crew and totally synchronized. Basically we've been rehearsing, and we're ready do go. So we need to start getting everything ready as soon as possible.

US$70.000 is the minimum we need to film, with more we can make it smoother, easier and make upgraded choices. And you know there's always unpredictable things that can happen. We'll be ready for them! We're ready to do this film.

So, where is the money going?

  • Renting Camera gear/lighting gear/ and other equipment.
  • Locations Locations Locations. We need to secure them + permits to film outside.
  • Insurance ( people and equipment). But safety first. Always.
  • Transportation equipment and crew.
  • Happy Cast and Crew? Yes, of course. We need to feed our team. Healthy and nutritious food!
  • Crew we need the best professionals to be available, and we need to pay fair wages. They really deserve it!
  • Cast they are after all, the ones that will perform what is written, and will makes us laugh and cry with their performances.
  • Have I told you about our perks? They're really awesome. The way it works is, for every amount that you donate, you'll get something in return. It's our appreciation for your help.

And remember, any contribution is really important, big or small. 

Other Ways You Can Help

So many ways you can help!!! 

  • Word of mouth. Tell your friends, family, people you just met on the train, a politician, an investor, a wall street guy, a tall or a short person. We value your effort!!! 
  • Another way is Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, email, our website, then you don't have to explain anything, just whisper: "THE ESTONYANS, you should really check it out"!!! 
  • You know an Investor, or you want to invest yourself? Like big time? Then you should definitely send us an email: production@momifilms.com
  • Or you can share directly through indiegogo.

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you.

story:
About Misfortune 

  • Misfortune is our graduate film for university, a project we have all been passionately developing since 2016. 
  • With your help we can bring our film to the screen, and to our audiences! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

As you can imagine, making a film is never cheap! No matter if it is a Hollywood Blockbuster, or a 10 minute short dark comedy like Misofrtune. All of us working on this film are current students at QUT in Brisbane so to us $5000 is quite a big ask... this is where you come in. We are hoping the majority of our funds to go towards our art department (costumes and props) to make this film look amazing! As everyone working on this film will be generously volunteering their time for free we will need to provide on set meals and accommodation. 

Don't worry, your generous donations will not go unnoticed! With every donation, you will receive an invitation to our exclusive, invite-only pre-production party where there will be drinks, music and prizes to give away! 

 

The Impact

If we reach our goal and manage to create this film we would be forever grateful! Misfortune has been a passion project for us for over a year and we would do anything to be able to see it created to the best quality it could be, not only for us but for our audiences too. You will be helping to support our local film community, and have a chance to get to know Brisbane's up and coming filmmakers. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you can't spare some money, you can still help us by sharing the word! 
  • Share this link on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or by letter - anything helps! 

Thank-you so much, from the Misfortune team.

story: Your donations will help us make a better film.
story_txt: Your donations will help us make a better film.

story:
WHAT'S THE SCORE?

We are three MA Acting For Screen students at The Royal Central School of Speech and Drama doing a graduation project to write and produce a film about an ethereal love, which transcends dimensions and the confines of the human mind.  

WHAT'S IT FOR?

We are making this film on a shoestring budget and have already raised some money ourselves, but in the month running up to production, we still need your help funding costumes, props, set design, locations, sound, lighting, post production, food and transportation for the entire cast and crew.  

SOME AMAZING PEOPLE  

We have had some fantastic support from our talented and enthusiastic crew, many of whom are working for free (because they believe in the project and us), but we would really love to be able to pay them something for their hard work and enthusiasm as well as cover other costs. 

JUST A LITTLE BIT MORE

This last push could make all the difference to our production, so if you can support us in any way we would be eternally grateful and have some great rewards on offer in return for your generosity.

Of course, not everyone may be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help. We are so grateful to anyone who shares this page, as with every person who finds out about us, we are one step closer to reaching our goal.

Thank you so much.

story:
Set in the context of a communally sensitive early 1993, Prasun Chatterjee’s film Dharmik (The Religious) has two distinct trajectories. In the first trajectory, he takes us through the nuances of an unconditional friendship between two kids of two different religious communities and how it grows stronger against all odds. 

In the second half, when the friendship is hit with an irreparable tragedy, we experience the transformation of a relationship between two individuals into a larger human truth.

Replete with rich cinematic moments, intricately sketched emotional catharsis and driven by a strong but subtle sense of social empathy, ‘Dharmik’ revisits the trouble torn past and digs out a perspective that would help us to read the present and future better.

Prasun started his theatre career in 2010 and was associated with renowned thespian Sohag Sen’s Ensemble. He acted in major roles in Ensemble’s 2011 production ‘Lal Baksho’ and delivered critically acclaimed performances for two and a half years.

He also acted in Ranjan Ghosh’s   2014 feature film ‘Hridmajhare’ in the role of a promising painter.

However Prasun’s heart always lied in directing Feature Films. In 2017 he made his first Short Feature Film ‘Shades’ that was officially selected in the prestigious ‘International Documentary and Short Film Festival of Kerala, 2017’

Prasun has been working on Dharmik for the past three years. To get a sense of local living, he has stayed in the village Bhagirathpur for over a period of one year.

After registering the script at FWA (Film Writers Association, Mumbai), Prasun started meeting mainstream producers, but hardly anyone came forward to produce a film that had very little scope for big stars, gala opening day figures, and hyper realistic gloss.

But this time Prasun is hopeful that with the help of people, he will finally be able to make the film in the way he wants to make it.

Sharing the Profit with the People

 

If the film gets made with the amount raised, 20 percent of its profits will be used for sponsoring books and relevant study materials for 20 underprivileged children.

The sponsorship will start from Class V and will continue up to Class XII

The entire process will be operated through a trust/society to be set up by the makers of the film
