story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Peter Slucock and I am the writer and creator of a brand new story called, "The Seeing". I have been writing for over 30 years, mainly short stories, that have appeared in various magazines and newspapers. I have also written, produced and directed 6 new plays and two musicals raising over £10,000 for various Cancer related charities.

The Seeing represents my first "commercial" venture. I have developed the idea over a period of 4 years and now feel ready to be able to pitch the premise to the various t.v and broadcasting "giants".

This campaign is to raise money to produce a fully funded "sizzle reel" to be the corner stone of our pitch. In order to fully highlight the show's potential we have experienced film makers and actors as well as quality post production services involving some CGI skills. They all believe in the project and have discounted for their services, but they need to eat

We are asking that if everyone that sees this campaign donates £5 then we are confident we will reach our target. Our dream is to get our show out to the widest audience possible. We have worked so hard for this, now all we need is a little help from you guys......PLEASE 

We know that this is only one of many challenges we face. After this we still need to successfully pitch the completed treatment and that is by no means a "given".  We can only be confident in what we know and that is we have a quality product that we are passionate about.

story:
Listen to documentary theme song: LOVE TRUST FAITH (it's going to be alright) { CLICK HERE! }

5 key points you will discover to enrich your life in this film documentary:

  • Discover the "Truth" to Achieve Happiness and Abundance.
  • Master the Gift Working Inside You to Make a Difference in the World.
  • Unravel the Secrets to Living a Purposeful Life.
  • Do what is Valuable that Leads You to Your Success and a Fulfilling Life.
  • Have a Winning Mindset to Fully Serve at the Highest Level with Less Effort.

Learn more about Keith Hoang

 

Keith believes that true change comes when someone loves you in your brokenness. In this film, he will share how 3 words: Love, Trust, and Faith can radically transform your life to achieve true happiness and abundance. It exposes your true character but can make life more interesting and meaningful. This hopeful documentary will inspire you to open up your heart and take a leap of faith to see what is possible and the Greatness that comes knocking on your door. It will set you on your own personal Path to Greatness.

After the 7 years of uncertainty, the restoration and abundance of God suddenly came pouring back in Keith's life with little or no effort. You will get to witness how miracles can show up in your own life and discover your purpose to live a more fulfilling life. 

We are asking for your help to be part of this epic movement so we can bring it to the big screen.  This film will help shine light where there is darkness.  Give hope where there seem to be no hope and will let people know that "It's Going To Be Alright" no matter what the circumstances.  It will deliver the love we need so desperately in a world where the road needs light in the wake of tragedy.

Please help us raise $40,000 by contributing to the initial cost of the film. The actual cost to complete the film will be significantly higher, therefore, it is our prayer and with your support we can triple our goal with this single campaign. We depend on the community and shared vision of stories like this to be heard in the world.  Join the award winning executive producer Evan Money and director Jeff Roldan as they capture this Entrepreneur’s bigger than life faith and the fulfilling prophecy Keith received that unfolded in his life.

He believes when your dreams begin to create real value for others, you are fulfilling your purpose.  You become the best version of yourself and a gift to the world. It requires no motivation, but keeps you activated to always want to give and never expect to receive. You begin to love those to whom you give instead of only giving to those whom you love. 

We were all created to “love” and by expressing “love” as our main vehicle of communication, nations can come together as ONE HUMAN RACE, regardless of our religions, different languages, and different skin color.  It is when we are filled with this “love” we truly experience happiness and abundance. 

Today, Keith speaks at business conferences to help top leaders unleash their inner power for purposeful living. His entrepreneurial tenacity and faith has encircled him with both Western and Eastern spiritual leaders, Archbishop Emeritus Sylvain Lavoie OMI, St. Albert, Alberta, Canada and Derek Lin, Award-winning, Bestselling Author in the Tao Genre. Both leaders of Western and Eastern spirituality endorsed his book, “Path To Greatness” that empower readers to experience greater joy and quality of life.

With a powerful documentary as this, the timing is vital to get his story out to the world. Don’t miss your chance to play a part in bringing this wonderful and inspirational story to life! We need to share stories like this more than ever in a world of great change. Please support us and contribute now to this very worthwhile film documentary project. Have the satisfaction of knowing that you helped bring hope and love to the world.

 

Executive Producer: Evan Money

Producer Evan Money is a visionary, best-selling author, global entrepreneur and award winning filmmaker. Evan’s passion for making movies began in 1989 with a group of critically acclaimed short films. Over the past 25 years, Evan has built a global extreme sports enterprise, written bestselling blockbuster books and produced world class personal growth seminars. His feature films included ” Words of Art “ and "Miracles in Action".

WORDS OF ART: Documentary staring Joel Osteen, Darren Hardy, Tom & Zig Ziglar, Mark Batterson and many more.“Words have tremendous meaning and impact. This ‘Words of Art Movement’ is the next Chicken Soup series on film which will impact the masses through its influencer support and powerful message.” ~ Mark Victor Hansen


 

 

MIRACLES IN ACTION: “Miracles in Action is a transparent and beautiful story that will move you out of your comfort zone and into your divine destiny. No matter who you are, you find yourself within these pages.”

~ Lisa Nichols, NY Times Best Selling Author of “No Matter What”

 

 

 

 

Director/Filmmaker: Jeff Roldan

Founder of Creative Realm Entertainment, an award-winning production company. He believes the level of craftsmanship is as much a science as it is an art form. For over 15 years, Jeff helped people create video products that tell a compelling story, create powerful, profitable results, and are undergirded with exceptional production quality.

 

Rewards at a Glance:

 

Valued Supporter {$12}
As a valued backer we will list your name on our website as a sign of our gratitude. Please share this campaign with your family and friends on your social media platform. We depend on the community and a shared vision of stories like "Love Trust Faith" in action to be heard in the world.

 

Thank you Credit in Film {$21}
As a valued supporter we will list your name at the end of the movie credits as a sign of our gratitude. Thank you for helping us bring this film documentary to life. We value your support. 

 

Digital Copy of Book {$33}

Get a copy of the digital book, Path To Greatness. 

Meeting Keith Hoang is itself a spiritual experience given his contagious energy and enthusiasm. His book, Path to Greatness, reflects that same enthusiasm. With great creativity, diligent research, hard work and dedication, he has done the world a favour in bringing together two great faith traditions and the spiritual and personal treasures that each offers. A special feature of the book is linking the text of the Tao Te Ching with passages from the Bible that explores themes common to both books. This book is a journey into the spiritual life that will empower readers to find greater joy and quality of life. — Archbishop Emeritus Sylvain Lavoie OMI, St. Albert, Alberta, Canada

“This book is Keith Hoang’s personal journey to the spiritual common ground between East and West—an important quest for humanity and a worthy goal for all of us.” —Derek Lin, author of Tao Te Ching: Annotated & Explained

 

 

Thank you Post Card {$40}

You'll receive a postcard of the movie to frame it or send it to a friend! And you'll be added to our ever growing special thanks list online showing your support.

 

Digital Download + All Perks Above {$77}
Be one of the first backers to receive a Digital Download of the film documentary, "Love Trust Faith".


 

 

Red Carpet Premiere {$97}
You will receive a ticket to "Love Trust Faith" World Premiere in California.

 

 

 

Signed Copy of Book {$144}
God has worked many miracles in bringing this book to fruition, and writing it has truly been a labor of love on my part, as it nearly consumed my normal life. I pray that in reading it, you too will be drawn closer to God—for when we are One with God in Spirit, we are living a Path to Greatness. Amen! ~ Keith Hoang

 


Ticket to After Party {$247}
1 Ticket to After Party + 1 Premiere Ticket. Dinner and Drinks Included.

 

 

 

 

Meet & Greet VIP Tickets {$497}
1 Red Carpet Premiere Tickets + 1 ticket to after party. Special meet and greet with Keith, Evan (Producer), and Jeff (Director).

Premiere Sponsorship Package {$796} 
2 Red Carpet Premiere Tickets + 2 tickets to after party. Includes dinner & drinks.

Bronze Sponsorship Package {$997} 
4 Red Carpet Premiere Tickets + 4 tickets to after party. Includes dinner & drinks.

Silver Sponsorship Package {$1497} 
6 Red Carpet Premiere Tickets + 6 tickets to after party. Includes dinner & drinks.

Gold Sponsorship Package {$1997} 
8 Red Carpet Premiere Tickets + 8 tickets to after party. Includes dinner & drinks.

Platinum Sponsorship Package {$2997} 
10 Red Carpet Premiere Tickets + 10 tickets to after party. Includes dinner & drinks.

Diamond Sponsorship Package {$4997} 
12 Red Carpet Premiere Tickets + Private table for 12 tickets to after party. Includes dinner & drinks.

 

Co-Executive Producer {$12,000}
You are officially a Co-Executive Producer of "Love Trust Faith in Action" feature film, with your name near the top of the credits! Walk the Red Carpet with us and attend the after parties, PLUS an invitation to any future screenings.

 

 

Private Screening at your Event {$20,000}
Get Keith, Evan, and Jeff to come do a private screening at your event.
story_txt:
Listen to documentary theme song: LOVE TRUST FAITH (it's going to be alright) { CLICK HERE! }5 key points you will discover to enrich your life in this film documentary:
Discover the "Truth" to Achieve Happiness and Abundance.
Master the Gift Working Inside You to Make a Difference in the World.
Unravel the Secrets to Living a Purposeful Life.
Do what is Valuable that Leads You to Your Success and a Fulfilling Life.
Have a Winning Mindset to Fully Serve at the Highest Level with Less Effort.
Learn more about Keith Hoang Keith believes that true change comes when someone loves you in your brokenness. In this film, he will share how 3 words: Love, Trust, and Faith can radically transform your life to achieve true happiness and abundance. It exposes your true character but can make life more interesting and meaningful. This hopeful documentary will inspire you to open up your heart and take a leap of faith to see what is possible and the Greatness that comes knocking on your door. It will set you on your own personal Path to Greatness.After the 7 years of uncertainty, the restoration and abundance of God suddenly came pouring back in Keith's life with little or no effort. You will get to witness how miracles can show up in your own life and discover your purpose to live a more fulfilling life. We are asking for your help to be part of this epic movement so we can bring it to the big screen.  This film will help shine light where there is darkness.  Give hope where there seem to be no hope and will let people know that "It's Going To Be Alright" no matter what the circumstances.  It will deliver the love we need so desperately in a world where the road needs light in the wake of tragedy.Please help us raise $40,000 by contributing to the initial cost of the film. The actual cost to complete the film will be significantly higher, therefore, it is our prayer and with your support we can triple our goal with this single campaign. We depend on the community and shared vision of stories like this to be heard in the world.  Join the award winning executive producer Evan Money and director Jeff Roldan as they capture this Entrepreneur’s bigger than life faith and the fulfilling prophecy Keith received that unfolded in his life.He believes when your dreams begin to create real value for others, you are fulfilling your purpose.  You become the best version of yourself and a gift to the world. It requires no motivation, but keeps you activated to always want to give and never expect to receive. You begin to love those to whom you give instead of only giving to those whom you love. We were all created to “love” and by expressing “love” as our main vehicle of communication, nations can come together as ONE HUMAN RACE, regardless of our religions, different languages, and different skin color.  It is when we are filled with this “love” we truly experience happiness and abundance. Today, Keith speaks at business conferences to help top leaders unleash their inner power for purposeful living. His entrepreneurial tenacity and faith has encircled him with both Western and Eastern spiritual leaders, Archbishop Emeritus Sylvain Lavoie OMI, St. Albert, Alberta, Canada and Derek Lin, Award-winning, Bestselling Author in the Tao Genre. Both leaders of Western and Eastern spirituality endorsed his book, “Path To Greatness” that empower readers to experience greater joy and quality of life. With a powerful documentary as this, the timing is vital to get his story out to the world. Don’t miss your chance to play a part in bringing this wonderful and inspirational story to life! We need to share stories like this more than ever in a world of great change. Please support us and contribute now to this very worthwhile film documentary project. Have the satisfaction of knowing that you helped bring hope and love to the world. Executive Producer: Evan MoneyProducer Evan Money is a visionary, best-selling author, global entrepreneur and award winning filmmaker. Evan’s passion for making movies began in 1989 with a group of critically acclaimed short films. Over the past 25 years, Evan has built a global extreme sports enterprise, written bestselling blockbuster books and produced world class personal growth seminars. His feature films included ” Words of Art “ and "Miracles in Action".WORDS OF ART: Documentary staring Joel Osteen, Darren Hardy, Tom & Zig Ziglar, Mark Batterson and many more.“Words have tremendous meaning and impact. This ‘Words of Art Movement’ is the next Chicken Soup series on film which will impact the masses through its influencer support and powerful message.” ~ Mark Victor Hansen  MIRACLES IN ACTION: “Miracles in Action is a transparent and beautiful story that will move you out of your comfort zone and into your divine destiny. No matter who you are, you find yourself within these pages.”~ Lisa Nichols, NY Times Best Selling Author of “No Matter What”    Director/Filmmaker: Jeff RoldanFounder of Creative Realm Entertainment, an award-winning production company. He believes the level of craftsmanship is as much a science as it is an art form. For over 15 years, Jeff helped people create video products that tell a compelling story, create powerful, profitable results, and are undergirded with exceptional production quality. Rewards at a Glance: Valued Supporter {$12}As a valued backer we will list your name on our website as a sign of our gratitude. Please share this campaign with your family and friends on your social media platform. We depend on the community and a shared vision of stories like "Love Trust Faith" in action to be heard in the world. Thank you Credit in Film {$21}As a valued supporter we will list your name at the end of the movie credits as a sign of our gratitude. Thank you for helping us bring this film documentary to life. We value your support.  Digital Copy of Book {$33}Get a copy of the digital book, Path To Greatness. Meeting Keith Hoang is itself a spiritual experience given his contagious energy and enthusiasm. A special feature of the book is linking the text of the Tao Te Ching with passages from the Bible that explores themes common to both books. story:
2 Girls Club Members

2 Weeks in New York City 

1 Documentary Film to Discover and Share The Secret to Self Love


Help us take the first steps to start a revolution in self-love —an unprecedented movement to inspire everyone in the world to Pure Love Themselves! 

[n.b. definition:]
"(You) pure love yourself"
   PHRASE 
Scottish, UK, informal; sarcastic
To be conceited or vain. To have an overinflated opinion of oneself. 


This summer, 2 of us Glasgow Girls Club members are heading back to NYC to find out all we can about self-love in the Big Apple! We will interview native New Yorkers and expat Scots to discover what they think when they hear the phrase “You pure love yourself”. We want to find out about their journeys to self-love – the highs and the lows. How do they bring their best selves in New York City!?

We want to document and share stories / advice on self love, in turn kick starting a movement, so we can all Pure Love Ourselves! This is a film. This is a movement. By us. For you.

 

A FILM. A MOVEMENT. INSPIRING SELF LOVE & HARMONY

Who? We are Toni (17) and Alex (19) of the Glasgow Girls Club
What? Supported by staff, we are making a short documentary interviewing people of myriad backgrounds and experiences
Where? New York City
When? July, 2017
How? Credit to YOU: We will be including your questions; you are the catalysts of this movement!

Yeah, we know we have a lot of work to do to inspire everyone in the world to Pure Love Themselves... But if we collect 10 stories this summer (guaranteed with your help!), and each interviewee goes home and interviews 10 more and those 10 interview another 10 and on it goes, I think we could safely say that a movement is underway!!

Our big vision is that this documentary can be used as a public health resource and educational tool within schools and beyond to help raise awareness and tackle stigma around mental health, and to promote wellbeing and self-care.


MEET THE FILMMAKERS

We are 2 young people from Royston and Possil Park—2 neighbourhoods of Glasgow that are usually depicted as some of Glasgow's "roughest" or most "economically disadvantaged." The good news is that our past-times include defying the odds and showing the world that anything is possible! Hurray to that!!

Since joining Girls Club, we have discovered that we share a huge passion for Film Making and Community Activism. Now, supported by Girls Club staff and resources, we want to share these passions with our first visit to New York, with the world and with you, through this film to show the world, that when you have a purpose, you can move mountains!

When we started to think about the ‘well kent’ sarcastic Scottish phrase
“You Pure Love Yourself”, and how it could have such an opposite meaning outside of Scotland, we thought Wouldn’t you like to know - what would happen if we all started to Pure Love Ourselves?!

We would too!! Imagine that!? A world where self-love triumphs over fear, self-doubt and envy!
Well, we figured, as a wise person once said – “Be the change you wish to see in the world”. It starts with you and me! Loving ourselves and sharing how we do that, to encourage others to love themselves! Creating a culture of caring about our communities is the only thing that can transform the world.

And what better place to start than NYC – the city of dreams--where there’s NOTHING you can’t do? Don’t worry we know that only one single documentary won’t realistically inspire the whole world to love itself.

But what we can do is make a film [If we can make it there… you know the rest] that becomes the first step in an incredible, movement to inspire others to record and share their own stories and top tips for self-love. #pureloveyourself #pureloveyourselfie

Starting with our social media campaign and this film, Pure Love Yourself will launch a legacy, a movement to inspire a revolution in self-love across the globe. 

 

FUNNY (AFFIRMING, INSPIRING, GLORIOUS, AWESOME) YOU SHOULD ASK - AND YOU SHOULD!

Because, in our usual format, this documentary film project is all about collaboration and co-creation, we want to offer as much access as possible to people—all ages, across genders, cities, languages— on both sides of the camera.

We want to hear from you! Everyone who donates at least £5 will be credited in the film (note: a film credit is usually only for the posh, pricey rewards), so what a special gift. Everyone who donates at least £15 gets to submit a question for consideration.

So consider yourself our co-director, co-reporter, co-producer and co-creator of this impact documentary. And we expect great things from our collaborators ; ) so start thinking up some original Pure Love questions for the people of New York, like:

  • What do you think when you hear the phrase “you pure love yourself”?
  • Do you think there is a link between beauty and self-love?
  • What does beauty mean to you?
  • A time that you loved yourself the most?
  • Tell us about a time that you found it harder to love yourself? And how did you overcome?
  • How would the world be if every one knew their true value?

 

GLASGOW TO NYC: GET IN ON THE GLOBAL REVOLUTION OF SELF-LOVE.

We are awe-inspired by our partners and kind supporters - the Lower Eastside Girls Club of NYC (without whom none of Glasgow Girls Club trips to NYC would be possible), and we're proud members of Girls Club Worldwide. In our life-changing trip to New York this summer, we get to connect in real life with our international sister clubs at the annual Global Girls meet-up, perhaps collecting the self-love stories of girls we meet there too. Lower Eastside Girls Club and their amazing girls have been our biggest inspiration when it comes to believing in ourselves and self esteem!


TONI & ALEX: WHY ARE WE THE ONES FOR THE JOB?

TONI (17): Adventure is my middle name and I’m a curious kinda gal so I bring just the right kind of drive and energy to the project.  Oh, and I love exploring new places, cultures and perspectives as well as meeting new people. Did I mention America is my dream destination and Michelle Obama is my mum!!

I love all kinds of film, drama and acting so making a documentary is right up my street and I'll be a natural on both sides of the camera - as interviewer or interviewee!

I think in making this film, I hope that not only myself but those who are taking part and watching it can be inspired to take important steps in pure loving themselves. By incorporating tips as well as personal experiences, I think this will show everyone that they’re not alone in their insecurities and that the best way forward for the world is for everyone to pure love themselves, as well as others for who they are.
 

ALEX (19): Thinking about how the sarcasm around the phrase 'You Pure Love Yourself' is such a Scottish thing got me to wondering -- what if we could turn the phrase into a positive, to inspire each other, boost self esteem -- to support rather than try to stop others from getting "too big for their boots'.  Since starting our plans to make this film, the way I now think about the phrase has changed a bit: I don't think of arrogance and selfishness as much in relation to it. I think that personal self esteem and wellbeing for every single person are at the heart of building a better world for everyone. Having experienced homelessness from the age of 16 and having come through my own personal wellbeing related challenges of accepting who I am and having the confidence to stand up for who I want to be - I know how important it is to share experiences with others so we don't feel alone.   


 

WHAT WILL YOU SEE IN THE ACTUAL FILM?

The film will feature: our own story around  Pure Loving Ourselves, as told by us; 10 interviews of native New Yorkers and Expat Scots; and impromptu, well-observed outtakes, experiences and maybe even some embarrassments (if we think they'll make you laugh) from our trip to NYC.

In the interviews we will find out as much as we can about bringing your best self in NYC—discovering as best we can how our interviewees practice self love and acceptance. We will interview anyone who wants to share their story and advice with us, and the inspiring folks you  find for us.
 

WHAT'S THE BIGGER PICTURE? 

At Glasgow Girls Club we believe that self-love and self-esteem are at the heart of building a more harmonious world for everyone. BE THE CHANGE!! We believe that if we accept and love ourselves then it becomes easier to accept and love each other, no matter our wonderfully diverse opinions, cultures, religions, ideas, beliefs. When our own cups are full, we can give unconditionally without prejudice (and without getting tired)!! Inspiring self-love across classes, generations, genders and cultures can only be an awesome thing!
 

We human beings, for the most part, are thriving on a global scale. We live longer. In the west, we are more empowered, educated and socially plugged-in than ever. But at what cost?

Challenges surrounding self-esteem and body image alongside stigmas of mental wellbeing are a critical issue worldwide and ultimately hindering us from being our best selves.

Here are some statistics that we dug out on self-esteem and wellbeing:

  • Only 13% of people report living with high levels of good mental health
  • 7 in 10 girls stop themselves from eating
  • More than 4 in 10 people say they have experienced depression
  • 9 in 10 girls say they are unhappy with their body
  • Nearly two thirds of people say that they have had a mental health problem
  • 6 in 10 women believe social media pressures people to look a certain way
  • 70% of 18-24 year olds would consider having a cosmetic surgical procedure
  • 7 in 10 women and girls believe media and advertising set an unrealistic standard of beauty most women can never achieve
  • Rates of anxiety and depression in young people have risen 70% in the past 25 years
  • 8 in 10 women and girls feel under pressure to never make mistakes
  • Male suicide accounts for more than three quarter the total number in the UK
  • 7 in 10 women and 8 in 10 girls report feeling more confident or positive when they invest time in caring for themselves.
  • 8 in 10 women and girls want to look their personal best rather than follow an accepted definition of beauty

 

Obviously, Pure Love Yourself can't resolve these issues for the world. But it sure can serve as a call to action: a way for dozens, then hundreds, then thousands—then hundreds of thousands of people to share their advice and stories to inspire each other, starting a revolution in self-love. 

 

BUDGET BREAKDOWN - HOW ARE WE INVESTING YOUR MONEY?

We are donating our time, our passion, and our pure love to this project for free! (As are our behind-the-scenes, professional advisors and mentors, who are, uh, slightly past their adolescent years.) Our generous partner organisations: Lower Eastside Girls Club and YPeople are sponsoring some elements of the trip (also we get to go to Camp while we are NYC--thanks to LESGC & Camp Fowler!).  The remainder—where we turn to you—will completely cover the travel and basic expenses for the whole team.

So basically, you pick up what's left of making sure we land and live and eat and sleep in NYC for two weeks, and the film’s on us. Truly, with pure love, purpose and gratitude.

 

WHAT ELSE CAN I DO TO HELP?

Share the link (and the love), tell everyone you know about Pure Love Yourself!

We will pure love your forever if you tell your family and friends, your teachers, your neighbours, the woman at the post office. We humbly appreciate any and all support and every penny donated to help kickstart a revolution in self-love.

For starters, you will always have 5 friends in Glasgow.


'WEAR IS THE LOVE' TEES & TOTES




 

Risks and challenges

Nothing will stop us from creating Pure Love Yourself once we're funded!

And we promise to keep you bang up-to-date all through post-production, and you will know exactly when to mark your calendars for our premiere screenings.

We're committed to working with our backers to together generate the most entertaining, compelling content for our film—and represent the deepest range of the incredible lives of inspiring people around the world

We will interview anyone who wants to share their story and advice with us, and the inspiring folks you  find for us. WHAT'S THE BIGGER PICTURE? At Glasgow Girls Club we believe that self-love and self-esteem are at the heart of building a more harmonious world for everyone. BE THE CHANGE!! We believe that if we accept and love ourselves then it becomes easier to accept and love each other, no matter our wonderfully diverse opinions, cultures, religions, ideas, beliefs. When our own cups are full, we can give unconditionally without prejudice (and without getting tired)!! Inspiring self-love across classes, generations, genders and cultures can only be an awesome thing! We human beings, for the most part, are thriving on a global scale. We live longer. In the west, we are more empowered, educated and socially plugged-in than ever. But at what cost?Challenges surrounding self-esteem and body image alongside stigmas of mental wellbeing are a critical issue worldwide and ultimately hindering us from being our best selves.Here are some statistics that we dug out on self-esteem and wellbeing:
Only 13% of people report living with high levels of good mental health
7 in 10 girls stop themselves from eating
More than 4 in 10 people say they have experienced depression
9 in 10 girls say they are unhappy with their body
Nearly two thirds of people say that they have had a mental health problem
6 in 10 women believe social media pressures people to look a certain way
70% of 18-24 year olds would consider having a cosmetic surgical procedure
7 in 10 women and girls believe media and advertising set an unrealistic standard of beauty most women can never achieve
Rates of anxiety and depression in young people have risen 70% in the past 25 years
8 in 10 women and girls feel under pressure to never make mistakes
Male suicide accounts for more than three quarter the total number in the UK
7 in 10 women and 8 in 10 girls report feeling more confident or positive when they invest time in caring for themselves.
8 in 10 women and girls want to look their personal best rather than follow an accepted definition of beauty
 Obviously, Pure Love Yourself can't resolve these issues for the world. But it sure can serve as a call to action: a way for dozens, then hundreds, then thousands—then hundreds of thousands of people to share their advice and stories to inspire each other, starting a revolution in self-love.  BUDGET BREAKDOWN - HOW ARE WE INVESTING YOUR MONEY?We are donating our time, our passion, and our pure love to this project for free! (As are our behind-the-scenes, professional advisors and mentors, who are, uh, slightly past their adolescent years.) Our generous partner organisations: Lower Eastside Girls Club and YPeople are sponsoring some elements of the trip (also we get to go to Camp while we are NYC--thanks to LESGC & Camp Fowler!).  The remainder—where we turn to you—will completely cover the travel and basic expenses for the whole team.So basically, you pick up what's left of making sure we land and live and eat and sleep in NYC for two weeks, and the film’s on us. Truly, with pure love, purpose and gratitude. WHAT ELSE CAN I DO TO HELP?Share the link (and the love), tell everyone you know about Pure Love Yourself!We will pure love your forever if you tell your family and friends, your teachers, your neighbours, the woman at the post office. We humbly appreciate any and all support and every penny donated to help kickstart a revolution in self-love.For starters, you will always have 5 friends in Glasgow.'WEAR IS THE LOVE' TEES & TOTES Risks and challengesNothing will stop us from creating Pure Love Yourself once we're funded!And we promise to keep you bang up-to-date all through post-production, and you will know exactly when to mark your calendars for our premiere screenings.We're committed to working with our backers to together generate the most entertaining, compelling content for our film—and represent the deepest range of the incredible lives of inspiring people around the world

story:
REVELATION, Dawn of Global Government

Chuck ( director ) and Anita Untersee ( producer ) worked for over twenty years in the film business while in LA. As Christians, we felt it critical in the dark days of looming world government to be "watchmen on the wall" and illustrate through REVELATION the issues at hand which will destroy The Republic, while creating a "Hunger Games" like environment for those who remain. 

With a theatrical test release in Houston April 15 we were seventh in the nation for opening weekend box office. Through eight other national theatrical screenings we quickly found REVELATION moves people and can change hearts and minds so that they might become "Paul Reveres" in this challenge to a New World Order.

We now are releasing the film nationally through the theatrical distribution system known as Tugg which was established for independent film releases.

Please see our web site:  http://revelationthemovie.info   and go to the TICKETS page. This allows you to book a local screening in your town anywhere in America, or, you can buy DVDs through our site on Amazon. 

We hope to create a movement which can enlighten those countless people who know nothing of those who would create a global prison planet. Your contribution can help defray the huge costs involved in releasing and promoting this film. This film which in fact is not a film...but a cause.

We have set a goal of $100,000 which allows us to build the grass roots awareness on social media and through patriot advertising such as http://infowars.com. Should we not reach the entire goal, still we will apply what there is to continuing to promote and release the film, 

Our issues have a long shelf life beyond the election, however, pre election momentum can help us jump start the vast interest which is potentially there for us. 

Each of us can make a difference by becoming aware of the dire urgency and threat. Banding together we can, as American patriots and Christians, find a national voice and change the direction of those who would destroy our sovereignty, liberty and faith.

We have met many challenges and risks were high throughout our five year odyessy in producing this film. We drove thousands of miles from Maine to California and Montana to Texas, filming some forty rock stars of the patriot movement. Always, as doors closed others would open. It has been an long and arduous journey, but filled with great reward in now seeing it come to fruition on the big screen. 

Please contribute to REVELATION, Dawn of Global Government in this final push of promotion and advertising. Help us find the voice it deserves so that those with eyes to see and ears to hear can be made to see. If  you are with us in our cause of stopping The New World Order and preserving American nationalism please donate. Should you be unable, please help us by spreading the word. 

THE REPUBLIC WEEPS, LISTEN TO HER CRY!

story:
What is The Mug?

The Mug is a dark comedy that follows John Barnes, middle aged accountant, as he seeks to end his life. He's decided he has seen all he needs to seen in this world, but he didn't account for Susan.

What We Need & What You Get

As a student run production, The Mug has virtually no budget. Our team has been working tirelessly around the clock to find out what we need, how much we need, and just how much it will cost to realize the full potential of this project. 

With little to no budget, we hope to gain funding from YOU, the community, to make this dream a reality. Currently, our main goal is to raise $1000. What we need and how much it will cost us is detailed below:

Breakdown of Budget

Locations: 23% of our budget

Hair and Makeup:  9% of our budget

Costumes : 16% of  our budget

Cast and Crew Costs : 29% of our budget

Equipment: 11% of our budget

Set Design and Props: 12% of our budget

 Every dollar counts on this project, and any help provided is immensely appreciated. BUT you just don't also get our appreciation with your donation, you get our wonderful PERKS to!

PERKS!

A signed original copy of the script by the cast and crew!

A digital download of the film!

Professional stills of the set and filming!

Drawn and signed  pieces of our storyboard by our very own Storyboard Artist!

And many more!

Risks & Challenges

As a class project with an incredibly small budget there are some challenges that may arise if we do not meet our funding goal. As The Mug is a script with an amazing amount of description and emotion, we have a very particular location, as well as several set pieces we need. As such, without the funding, there is a high possibility that we will not be able to truly express the depths of our passionate script without meeting our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute directly to the campaign. That's alright! You can help us just by sharing this page on places like Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and Tumblr. By just doing the simple act of sharing this page, you're already providing us with an immense amount of help by spreading the word!

story:
We live in a time of enormous global prosperity. Our technology is so advanced it seems we almost live in the future. This should be a golden age; instead rising numbers of young people in the UK are turning to food-banks, sub-par housing, and underemployment is rife. 

We are unable to pay rent let alone get into the housing market as UK property prices have risen by more than 300% in 20 years. 

28 million children and young people have been driven from their homes by violence and conflict within and across borders, according to UNICEF. And some warn this is just the beginning as terrifying predictions on climate change challenge and overshadow us. 

Water is cited as one of the next causes of major conflict and migration as it becomes ever scarcer. 

Our generation is denied the right to a secure career, and as automation makes many jobs potentially redundant, will the workplace in 30 years be run for the benefit of people or the 1%?

If you have children and grandchildren you are probably watching them struggling to gain their economic independence. With your help we can begin to do something about this.

So what are we going to do about it?

We're newsPeeks; a new independent media organisation, partnered with the Centre for Investigative Journalism based at Goldsmiths University. Our team is made up of investigative journalists, filmmakers and young people who care about these issues. 

For each basic need we will conduct an original investigation, and from that we will produce written articles, short-documentaries, features profiling young people who are being affected, solution-focused analysis and education packs.

These will be published online through newsPeeks.com, our social media channels and in collaboration with other media outlets. Our work will be shown all over the country at screenings in cinemas, festivals, youth clubs and schools. We’ll also work with other like minded groups to bolster efforts for positive change.

The whole project will be powered by young people, giving a fresh new perspective on what we can do.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Investigative journalism takes time and money, which is why so few newsrooms invest resources in this today. Yet it's critical for a healthy democracy because it uncovers information which can offer solutions.

It's also critical to be able to speak with people who are on the front-line facing down these challenges. We've seen global media coverage of Standing Rock, but these issues are being fought across the world and often go under-reported. By funding this campaign we'll work with people internationally to produce these original reports.

We need to raise at least £25,000 from this campaign to make this project possible; and we'll be raising more than double this from grant-making institutions. 

You can help us raise this money by buying into the project or joining our movement. Purchase some of our brilliant products:

- A DVD featuring all of the investigative films we produce, full interviews, behind the scenes footage and analysis videos.

- Tickets to a film screening

- An education pack filled with in-depth research and practical information and exercises for schools or community groups to have genuine positive impact.

Spread the word:

Regardless how much you can contribute - please share this with friends and colleagues. Join our newsletter and stay in touch for future events, screenings and public actions. You can send us an email if you want to collaborate.

Whoever you are, join us and become part of this growing team that is finding out the facts behind why our generation is struggling so hard to gain control of our own lives.

story:
Already for 2 years director Aren Malakyan is working on his  documentary about a very extraordinary old man , who lives in Yerevan . His name is Voldemar . 
You can always see him among the guests of film screenings and theatrical premieres ,exhibitions and concerts. He always holds the plastic bag filled with books, newspapers and pieces of bread. Voldemar is dreaming about visiting Paris, walking down the Champs Elysees and enjoying one peacful morning on the banks of Seine. To shoot the final episode of the film, crew intends to bring Voldemar to Paris to end the film with the episode of walking around the city of his dreams.

 80 % of the film was shot  with the initial bugdet that director managed to find and now we need finiacial support to shoot the final episode of the film and cover the post-production costs.

Besides helping the shootings of the film, in case of donation you will help realizing a dream of a very deep and sensible man , who is now in the final stage of his life.

Big thank you on behalf of the whole crew and Voldemar !

story:
My name is Susan Kranyik and I am a costume, hair, and makeup designer for independent films. I also have experience as a teaching assistant working with students of varying abilities and conditions, including Autism.  My favorite students have always been those on the Autism spectrum disorder. I don't know why but I just "get" them.

       Rachard McIntyre and his mother Carrie have a dynamic, arduous, and encouraging story to tell. For right now Rachard is in a good place in life; he lives with his mother and stepfather in a beautiful home; he works part-time and he drives; he continues to be inspired to make art.  But like many adults on the spectrum who live with a family member, the reality is this---one day when relatives are no longer around to provide care, the future for these people is terrifying.  

        Rachard wants to inspire others like him to never give up. For that reason alone, this documentary will be a compelling message to people with all different types of abilities.

     However, I have another reason to do this documentary--- his mother's fortitude, unending love, and  personal sacrifices allowed Rachard to develop into the person he is today--gentle and  perceptive, with a desire to relate to society through the lens of his artwork.

     I am raising $25,000 to make this documentary. I plan on entering this film in no less than 25 independent film festivals. I want to pitch this to PBS because I want millions of people to know about Rachard.

     The perks are simply awesome!!! You will own some of his art!!! Considering the fact that his cards sell for $6.00 each and his prints sell between $115. and $150., this is a generous campaign!

     I am doing Flexible funding. If there are any funds left after post-production, making posters and cards for film festivals, entry fees for festivals, and other expenses, then myself, Rachard and his mom Carrie are going to decide what organization these excess funds go to. All of this will be updated on this IndieGogo page. 

      Will you help me make this documentary? Rachard and his mother are so excited about this. I am honored that they are letting me tell their story.

     Thank you so much for your time.

Love,  Susan Kranyik

PLEASE NOTE!!!! When you contribute to this campaign you can email me with your card and print choices! At the end of the campaign I cannot change your perks because I am having the printing done right when the campaign closes. You will get your perks as soon as I get the cards and prints. Thank you for your understanding. xo

story:
The Story

Matt is a young musician in a band on the verge of breaking up as his singer Julia prepares to move across the country to pursue her career aspirations. Instead of accepting defeat and moving on, Matt hatches a last-ditch scheme to keep her in the band. The plan: buy Julia a case of her favorite beer for her going away party hoping she'll drop everything and stay. The only problem is that Matt is underage, so he must enlist the help of a stranger to buy the beer for him. This stranger ends up being Bert, an oddball, washed-up musician that seeks to help out Matt. However, Bert quickly begins to ruin Matt’s plans trying to relive his glory days by hanging out with Matt’s band.

 

Director's Note

Hey everyone, my name’s Patrick! I’m a graduating senior studying Mass Media Arts at the University of Georgia. I’ve been making fun videos ever since I figured out how to hit record and upload to YouTube ten years ago when I was in middle-school. Since I’ve been at UGA though, I think (or at least hope) my filmmaking skills have drastically improved after working on a number of my friends’ short films. This will be my first project over a minute long that I’ve written and directed, and boy am I excited to tell this story.


The recurring theme of Hey Mister centers on the each of the characters’ unique ways of handling adulthood in their relation to music. While having fun making movies and music as a kid, I slowly grew anxious thinking I’d need to give them up in pursuit of a safer and more conservative career path. While I luckily have a great support system that keeps me confident about my path, some of my peers aren’t so lucky, being told to “grow up and get a real job.” My goal is to tell that the transition to independent adulthood isn't always smooth for everyone, and you don't need to abandon doing what you love in exchange for it . Being both a filmmaker and a musician, I’m looking forward to telling a story of a young creative refusing to let go of the outlet he loves, but still learning to “grow up” in the meantime.

What We Need & What You Get

A wise man once told me that nothing is ever free, and neither is making a movie. Even though the University of Georgia gives us access to some equipment, we will still need to raise money for certain camera and lens rentals. Our crew consists of a group of students volunteering their time for free, so we got to keep them fed on more than just ramen and their dreams of stardom. And your help won't go unnoticed, as you'll receive a plethora of perks based on your donation.

Where Your Money Goes

 

The Impact

Hey Mister is a story about growing up, and it is also a vital part of the growing-up process for many of the crew involved. For many of our crew, this film will serve as the final film project before graduation, and making it will undoubtedly be an invaluable life experience. For many of you, this will shape up to be a fun and exciting story to watch, which will also undoubtedly be an invaluable life experience.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The most important thing any fresh film needs are eyes to watch it- so help us spread the word! We will begin filming in mid-February and have lots of news on our Facebook page before, during, and after our shoots. And if you're unable to donate, feel free to share our page with any friends or family. And just remember, you rock.

The recurring theme of Hey Mister centers on the each of the characters’ unique ways of handling adulthood in their relation to music. While having fun making movies and music as a kid, I slowly grew anxious thinking I’d need to give them up in pursuit of a safer and more conservative career path. While I luckily have a great support system that keeps me confident about my path, some of my peers aren’t so lucky, being told to “grow up and get a real job.” My goal is to tell that the transition to independent adulthood isn't always smooth for everyone, and you don't need to abandon doing what you love in exchange for it . Being both a filmmaker and a musician, I’m looking forward to telling a story of a young creative refusing to let go of the outlet he loves, but still learning to “grow up” in the meantime.

What We Need & What You Get
A wise man once told me that nothing is ever free, and neither is making a movie. Even though the University of Georgia gives us access to some equipment, we will still need to raise money for certain camera and lens rentals. Our crew consists of a group of students volunteering their time for free, so we got to keep them fed on more than just ramen and their dreams of stardom. And your help won't go unnoticed, as you'll receive a plethora of perks based on your donation.
Where Your Money Goes


 
The Impact
Hey Mister is a story about growing up, and it is also a vital part of the growing-up process for many of the crew involved. For many of our crew, this film will serve as the final film project before graduation, and making it will undoubtedly be an invaluable life experience. For many of you, this will shape up to be a fun and exciting story to watch, which will also undoubtedly be an invaluable life experience.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
The most important thing any fresh film needs are eyes to watch it- so help us spread the word! We will begin filming in mid-February and have lots of news on our Facebook page before, during, and after our shoots. And if you're unable to donate, feel free to share our page with any friends or family. And just remember, you rock.

story:
Hello! 

We're a collective of third year students from Southampton Solent University studying Television Production. This is our final major project, a short documentary detailing OLD SPIKE,  a roastery in Peckham, London who's key intention is to provide their staff with a leg up as well as distribute their self-roasted coffee beans! We are incredibly keen on filming this project and bringing their stories to life, but we need your help! 

Since film making itself is incredibly expensive with several factors covering a total cost, we cannot do this alone out of our own pocket. Our project is all based in London so it is difficult for us to fund the travel up there,we already have some funding in place, but we just need a little bit more to make this documentary a success. We would very much appreciate your support in helping us fund this project and making this film come to life. 

Please help us in making this film amazing! Thank you, every donation counts.

(If we have any money left from our budget we will donate anything remaining to The House of St Barnabas homeless charity, who we will be working with as well on this project).

 

Meet the Crew 

DIRECTOR - Lucy Terry

Lucy has a passion for studio production at University and can lead a crew through any daunting situation, whatever challenges might face them. It would have been a missed opportunity for anyone else to be the director of this project, as she's directed several short productions before.

PRODUCER - Helena Hawkins

Helena is the definition of organised. If you want something done and done quickly, you can trust in Helena to do just that. She too studies studio production at Solent and is currently working on the popular show 'Pound Pints and Student Nights' in a productive role. This project wouldn't have held together without her support.

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY - Kieran Bartlett

Kieran is definitely a keen bean for cinematography as well as having an extremely creative mindset. He's also a camera operator on the project as well as design every shot we film down to the T. We can assure you that our documentary won't look like the standard plain format with Kieran on the team. 

EDITOR & CAMERA OP. - Sam Instone

An avid editor, Sam self-taught himself editing from a young age and gained a huge interest for putting images together. With experiences in making dozens of short films, his ultimate understanding of the dark art of editing as a whole and his charismatic and interesting personality, Sam is definitely an exciting presence to behold on this team. 

FINANCE & RESEARCH - Debbie Pearce

Without Debbie, contact between us and our contributors would have never been made. The brains behind the organisation of this project, Debbie studies Post Production at the University too and will be assistant editing throughout the post-production stage. With being incredibly organised, on-top of things and portraying an 'all or nothing' attitude, the wisest member of the team definitely adds as a bonus.

 

Credentials

Special thanks to Old Spike Roastery for collaborating with us and giving us access to film.

Special thanks to AKdaBAOUS, one of my best friends and an amazing graphic designer that has been supplying such amazing pieces of work to help give our campaign an image.

Finally, but not at least, thank you to YOU for all your support. If you've donated, you're amazing. If you can't donate, but still would like to help us, please feel free to spread this campaign around and get word around for filming this documentary. You're great too!

story:
Immersed

A groundbreaking approach to filmmaking that will create an extreme emotional connection between the story and the viewer. "Taste and see that the Lord is good!"~Psalms 34:8

“This can be one of the most impactful ministry tools created in our generation. Please prayerfully consider contributing to it and sharing it with your friends.”
~Herman DeBoard

Imagine if you were there...in the upper room during the last supper. Or if you were standing on the shores watching as Jesus fed the 5000. Or what if you were standing in Garden of Eden as Eve takes her first bite of the forbidden fruit. And what if you could watch as the stone rolls away revealing the empty tomb announcing that the King of Kings has risen?
This groundbreaking virtual reality project will take you there.
But we need your help!

"For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart." Hebrews 4:12

Immersed will be a series of short films using Virtual Reality specially designed to immerse the viewer into the stories of the Holy Bible.

Using Virtual Reality Glasses, users will be immersed in everything taking place because they will be able to “Look Around” in 180HD as if they were actually in the movie.

This will not be a computer generated traditional VR film!
We will be shooting live footage of actors, acting out the stories directly from the Bible itself.
The VR Goggles will allow you a 180-degree view left to right and top to bottom, so you can physically look around as the film plays out (as if you were actually there).

The first 7 short films are slated to be:

  1. Mary Magdalene washing the feet of Jesus with oils,
  2. In the Garden the night before the crucifixion,
  3. In the upper room during the last supper,
  4. The Original Sin in the Garden of Eden,
  5. Jesus washing the feet of the Disciples,
  6. Jesus heals the blind man,
  7. At the tomb shortly after the stone is rolled away.

Note: Our goal is to create a library of short films that chronicle the Old and New Testaments. These first 7 short films listed here will get us started down that path.

Whether you are a mature Christian, a new believer or are curious about who Christ is, this project is meant to deepen your experience and relationship with Jesus.

And the best part is, you can take it with you on your travels and share it with anyone you want, right from your mobile phone and a portable headset.

”He said to them, "Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.” ~Mark 16:15

What We Need & How You Can Help

Please prayerfully consider donating to the project and sharing this project with your friends and family:

  • We are raising the 1st $100,000 of this project to get production underway. Funds will be used to:
    • Create the first 3 episodes.
    • Begin distributing the episodes.
    • Raise additional funding for more stories and films in the series.
  • From credits on the website to the official "immersed" t-shirt, to the chance to win a cool VR Headset, we have some amazing perks!
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will approach a select group of investors who have agreed to look at matching funds from this campaign. In our eyes, this project must be funded as it is far bigger than any of us could have dreamed.

The Impact

As a believer in Christ, your commission is to share the Word of God with others. This project will give you an amazing tool to do just that! You get to be a big part of a Kingdom impacting project.

  • You will be able to immerse anyone into the life of Jesus Christ and into the stories of the Bible like never before.
  • You will personally be able to experience these stories over and over from the convenience of your mobile device or tablet or in VR theater rooms we are working to roll out in churches around the United States.
  • These films will bring the Bible to life. The reality of who Christ was and is will be further understood by being immersed into each film.

”Jesus answered, "I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.” ~John 14:6

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any crowdfunding project or film production, there are always risks and challenges that the producers face. However, we are moving forward on the understanding that all prayers and donations for this project will help reach and overcome any of the standard risks and challenges we are showing below. And even if these happen, we are dedicated to fighting and pressing on towards the goal. "I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus."~ Philippians 3:14

  • After this crowdfunding campaign is complete, we may not achieve our full funding for the project (please pray for this and share this campaign with everyone you know).
  • Technology can change on a weekly basis, and we may need to seek additional funding. (please pray for this as well).
  • We are moving forward on the understanding that this is God's Project and He will remove all obstacles, as we are being obedient.

”Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding;” ~Proverbs 3:5

 

Kingdom Impact

In our meetings with multiple leaders, from multiple denominations, we are getting feedback that these films could possibly be one of the most impactful ministry tools for our generation. Imagine if your church could have a few sets of VR goggles and few mobile tablets or iPads, where anyone in the church could put them on and have a truly life-changing experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute cash, even as low as $20, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We need Prayer! A project of this magnitude will need a strong base of prayer warriors in order to get it successfully completed. Please add this project to your prayer list.
  • We need Ambassadors to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Simply use the Indiegogo share tools to share the campaign with your social media friends, or send it in an email to your close contacts!

We need as many people seeing this campaign as humanly possible. So please share it a few times and talk to your friends about it. This project can truly impact millions of lives if you help.

Our Team

Herman DeBoard - Former Pastor and author of multiple self-help studies on the Bible. Herman has been a successful entrepreneur and technology consultant for more than 25 years. He was given the vision for this project in early 2017 and will be leading the production and distribution efforts.

Robert Pafundi - Hollywood Entertainment Attorney and author of Safe Stardom has signed on to bring decades of entertainment experience to the project.

Fabrizio Talavera Hentschel - Videographer/Editor/Visual FX Artist has signed on to be the producer of the first set of films being created. He brings a wealth of knowledge from the NY Film Academy as well as an amazing resume of production work.

BoxOffice Pitch - BOXOFFICE PITCH, INC. is a film production company whose sole purpose is to create entertainment that inspires and transverses international and cultural boundaries.

The Future

Our desire for the future is to create a full series of Virtual reality videos that immerse watchers into the entire Bible, from the Old Testament to the New. To get to that point, we need to fund the first group of films and get them distributed. With your help, we can do that.

Our current plans are create short films for stories such as:

  • The original sin
  • The miracles performed by Jesus
  • Jesus and Samaritan Woman
  • David and Goliath
  • Samson and Delilah
  • Mary washes the feet of Jesus
  • The Upper Room
  • and many, many more

Please Donate, Pray for the Project, and Share it with your Friends!

Note: If you are interested in getting involved with this project as an investor, please contact us directly.

story:
INTRODUCTION

Seahorse is an independent drama film budgeted at $150,000, shot in the neorealistic style of such movies as Wendy and Lucy and Manchester by the Sea. This drama tells the story of young mother who works part time as a cam girl to fund her heroin addiction.

Our goal is to enter the film into reputable film festivals, raise awareness for the film, and then work with a domestic distribution company that can launch a successful theatrical release. We anticipate that the film will be ready to screen for distributors not more than a year after the completion of financing.

THE TEAM

Seahorse is a joint effort from producers Charles Mulford, Gretchen Lynch, Cailen Hollins, director Rommel Eclarinal, and actor and co-author Natalie Houchins.

Charles Mulford, producer, will head this team. He is an award-winning producer and has had films show at Sundance and SXSW film festivals among others. As a production manager he has collaborated with Academy-Award-Nominated director Spike Jonze and the Grammy-winning band Arcade Fire. He has also produced virtual reality content and commercials resulting in 6 Austin Addy Awards and 2 National Addy Awards in 2016. He will use his extensive  contacts in the industry to assemble a first-rate team to fully realize the considerable potential of this project.

Rommel Eclarinal is a Filipino filmmaker based in Austin, Texas whose primary interests are stories from developing countries, particularly the Philippines. His films explore the lives of the marginalized and the displaced. These films have screened in film festivals around the world. His film North of Ojinaga, described by Film School Rejects as “a beautiful meditation on immigration,” tackles the intricate relationship between global capitalism and illegal immigration in the US. Shot entirely in Texas, North of Ojinaga serves as a stylistic precursor to his latest endeavor – Seahorse project. Rommel’s script Honkytonk- East of Manila was selected for consideration in the second round of the 2017 January Sundance Screenwriters Lab. Currently a film instructor, Rommel created and developed the rigorous filmmaking and film studies program at St. Andrew’s Episcopal School. Rommel holds a Masters of Fine Arts in Film Production from the University of Texas at Austin.

Natalie Houchins is a writer and actress from Austin, and has degrees in Acting,  Playwriting, and Gender & Sexuality Studies from Northwestern University. In addition to her acting credits, she has written several short films, two feature films, including co-writing Seahorse with director Rommel Eclarinal, and a web series entitled Kahla and Natalie Reach Enlightenment, which can be found on YouTube. Her work largely explores the complexities of identity, specifically as it relates to gender and sexuality, and she is currently writing a one woman play based on William Faulkner’s The Sound and the Fury, mining these topics. Seahorse is her first feature film to be produced. She currently splits time between Austin and Los Angeles.

FILM DESCRIPTION

Seahorse is a film about the complexities of being a modern woman and a young mother. It brings women to the forefront and addresses important topics like addiction, mental health, the pressure of parenting, and immigration. Seahorse also bring light to the topic of ‘Cam Girls’ a rapidly growing form of prostitution that needs to be talked about. In the vein of films like Wendy and Lucy, Distant, Manchester by the Sea, and Fishtank, Seahorse will have a neorealist aesthetic and an understated tone. In recent years audience have responded very well to films offering a look into the realistic harder parts of life depicted by less than perfect characters. Being both an authentic narrative about hard topics and a women driven film, we are convinced that it is time for a film like Seahorse in the market.

SOCIAL IMPACT

Seahorse tackles the universal themes of overcoming addiction, non-traditional families, the struggles of modern American existence, and immigration. These are issues that affect Americans all over the country, and we aim to elevate the dialogue surrounding these ideas. As of 2015, 20.5 million Americans 12 years or older have had a substance disorder involving opioids, and 591,000 had a substance use disorder involving heroin. There were 12,990 overdose deaths related to heroin in 2015. Most users become addicted to opioids from painkillers that are prescribed by doctors, and because of the complexity of this issue, it is difficult for legislators to find appropriate solutions to this problem. In 2017, President Trump declared the opioid epidemic a public health emergency. It is in the midst of this perplexing epidemic that Seahorse takes place. In Seahorse, we allow our audience to watch the story of just one abuser unfold in the sea of millions. While Emily’s story is fictional, it is based off of issues that addicts experience every day. We hope that Emily’s story will shed light on this epidemic and push audiences to call for further regulation and recovery services for individuals suffering from this problem.

DISTRIBUTION

The domestic theatrical release is the single most important event in determining the the future revenue stream of a motion picture. For this reason, Seahorse will place the utmost importance on submitting to reputable film festivals that will establish the most audience awareness for the film. With this awareness built up from film festivals, we will seek a North American theatrical distributor whose marketing plan and release strategy will launch the film into the mainstream audience. Two of the most important factors influencing a distributor's decision to acquire a film is the exploitability of genre or market segment and the originality of the story. Seahorse meets this criteria. In addition, the ability to market the film in such a way that emphasizes addiction and recovery gives distributors an easy marketing appeal. Distributors will not have a difficult time finding an audience for this film.

FUNDING

Here is where YOU can help! We currently need $50,000 to fund our pre-production budget which includes casting SAG actors, securing and scouting locations, hiring crew, acquiring insurance and other pre-production costs.

Every contribution is a step closer to our goal! Please consider backing us and being a part of the creation of this compelling motion picture.

Thank you for supporting us!

Charles Mulford, Rommel Eclarinal, Natalie Houchins, Gretchen Lynch, Cailen Hollins, Jim Houchins, Kelly Walton and TC Waugh

 

 

If you are interested in being part of the producing team with rights to potential profits, we have investor packages starting at $6,000, allowing you to hold points in this project. For inquiries, please contact seahorsethemovie@gmail.com.

In the vein of films like Wendy and Lucy, Distant, Manchester by the Sea, and Fishtank, Seahorse will have a neorealist aesthetic and an understated tone. In recent years audience have responded very well to films offering a look into the realistic harder parts of life depicted by less than perfect characters. Being both an authentic narrative about hard topics and a women driven film, we are convinced that it is time for a film like Seahorse in the market.SOCIAL IMPACTSeahorse tackles the universal themes of overcoming addiction, non-traditional families, the struggles of modern American existence, and immigration. These are issues that affect Americans all over the country, and we aim to elevate the dialogue surrounding these ideas. As of 2015, 20.5 million Americans 12 years or older have had a substance disorder involving opioids, and 591,000 had a substance use disorder involving heroin. There were 12,990 overdose deaths related to heroin in 2015. Most users become addicted to opioids from painkillers that are prescribed by doctors, and because of the complexity of this issue, it is difficult for legislators to find appropriate solutions to this problem. In 2017, President Trump declared the opioid epidemic a public health emergency. It is in the midst of this perplexing epidemic that Seahorse takes place. In Seahorse, we allow our audience to watch the story of just one abuser unfold in the sea of millions. While Emily’s story is fictional, it is based off of issues that addicts experience every day. We hope that Emily’s story will shed light on this epidemic and push audiences to call for further regulation and recovery services for individuals suffering from this problem.DISTRIBUTIONThe domestic theatrical release is the single most important event in determining the the future revenue stream of a motion picture. For this reason, Seahorse will place the utmost importance on submitting to reputable film festivals that will establish the most audience awareness for the film. With this awareness built up from film festivals, we will seek a North American theatrical distributor whose marketing plan and release strategy will launch the film into the mainstream audience. Two of the most important factors influencing a distributor's decision to acquire a film is the exploitability of genre or market segment and the originality of the story. Seahorse meets this criteria. In addition, the ability to market the film in such a way that emphasizes addiction and recovery gives distributors an easy marketing appeal. Distributors will not have a difficult time finding an audience for this film.FUNDINGHere is where YOU can help! We currently need $50,000 to fund our pre-production budget which includes casting SAG actors, securing and scouting locations, hiring crew, acquiring insurance and other pre-production costs.Every contribution is a step closer to our goal! Please consider backing us and being a part of the creation of this compelling motion picture.Thank you for supporting us!Charles Mulford, Rommel Eclarinal, Natalie Houchins, Gretchen Lynch, Cailen Hollins, Jim Houchins, Kelly Walton and TC Waugh  If you are interested in being part of the producing team with rights to potential profits, we have investor packages starting at $6,000, allowing you to hold points in this project. For inquiries, please contact seahorsethemovie@gmail.com.

story:
My name is Nicole Williams. I am starting this fundraiser to ask if you would be willing to support my efforts to create a documentary on a full hair sourcing trip in Cambodia. This will help bring awareness to how we can use beauty as a service in other countries.

What simply started as a love for beauty quickly turned in a business model that help address the needs of economic opportunities for the women who sell and manufacture hair extensions. Traveling overseas to source hair turned out to be some of the most life changing experiences. Im never ready to process half of what I see. Furthermore it is very difficult to capture much behind my personal lens. Most times I'm left with a few photos that doesn't capture the full adventure. 

Being hands on from sourcing, collecting, sanitation, manufacturing and distribution is something to be proud of though the work is far from easy. Day and night on the back of motorbikes, traveling to the countryside looking for donors to pay for their tresses. Sleeping in hammocks in the safest place we can find. Taking malaria pills daily to prevent contracting the disease. Seeing children the same age as my children without diapers, clean water,and bet yet shelter. My purpose was birthed, and I've committed myself to cultivating opportunities for self, family, and our global community. 

Helping with this documentary is one of the first steps to bring awareness to ways to use beauty to help end social problems both internationally and in the US.

This is my first fundraising attempt in efforts to making this goal a reality. I'm starting this campaign off with 10k for travel, equipment, director, and videographer. I plan to stay for 2 weeks documenting life behind hair. For everyone who participates, I will personally select you a gift from Cambodia.

 

If you cant make a contribution, I ask that you share!

story:
Short Summary

I am a graduating Film Production & Cinema Studies senior at Loyola Marymount University. 

As a senior, this is my last opportunity to make a film with the benefits of a campus, professors, and student-discounts. I am hoping to make this the greatest possible film I can, and I need your support to do so! 

  • With your support, I can make the most professional and creative film possible. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5000, in addition to my personal finances! 

  • Lighting & Grip Rentals: $1,000
    • Renting equipment from off of the LMU campus is expensive, but necessary. With dozens of projects being produced this semester, the distribution of equipment is less than ideal for a lighting & grip team. If you donate, you can help me acquire the materials and tools necessary to make a professional film.  
  • Food & Gas Compensation for Crew: $500
    • I'm lucky enough to have my parents donating a large amount of craft services and meals.
    • However, feeding a crew is one of the first priorities of any filmmaker. Making sure that I can provide a full meal, constant crafty, and plentiful water & coffee is one of my main concerns. 
    • Secondly, making sure that those individuals who help carpool & transport are repaid for their gas mileage is a priority of mine as well. 
  • Locations: $1,500
    • Location, location, location. Locations are rarely cheap, and renting locations in Los Angeles is especially not cheap. Your donation would go to paying for locations, as well as ensuring I can buy the supplies and materials to protect the house from production accidents. 
  • Production Design: $1000
    • A location with no production design is a plate without food, all of the potential for something delicious, with no actual flavors. If you contribute, I will be renting and purchasing production design elements for the locations of the film. 
  • Post Production: $500
    • Hard-drives, sound-mixers, and post production effects are all often-forgot parts of making a film. I am hoping to prepare myself and my crew for a smooth post-production. 
    • Meals for the people who are working my post-production are also going to be paid for with this money! 
  • Submissions to Festivals: $500
    • My film, after it has been graded and screened at Loyola Marymount University, will be submitted to film festivals. Festival submissions are often between $50 and $60 per entry. I hope to be able to give my film a wide "release" to festivals, and can only do so with your help.

For every donation to the film there will be a special thanks in the credits at the end of the film. 

  • For every donation of $25+ there will be an early release of the film through link. 
  • For every donation of $50+ there will be an early release of the film through link, as well as a copy of the film on DVD if requested. 
  • For every donation of $200+ there will be an early release of the film through link, a copy of the film on DVD if requested, as well as a producer credit. 

The Impact

Your contribution will directly impact my production and my future:

  • My last film, "Blue Dream," was partially financed through Indiegogo, and every donation had a big impact! Every donor was included in the end credits as a "Special Thanks."
  • Each dollar donated adds to the production value of the film as well as the comfort of the cast and crew. 
  • This film will be entered into film festivals after completion and will help me, as a filmmaker, enter into the working world. 
  • I hope to move audiences and showcase the abilities of myself and my fellow filmmakers.

Risks & Challenges

Although your donation will help me to produce the film, there are risks and challenges with any production:

  • Your donation will help me overcome the challenges of self-financing, but I cannot guarantee the success of the film after completion.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, your support as a friend/peer is always accepted. Kind words and sharing the link are just as valuable to me as a financed film!

& 

Help the fellow creatives in your life achieve their goals!
