story:
This Film and Us

 

  • About six years ago I was sitting in the audience at my first DragonCon. The panelist mentioned how much he appreciated the fandom on twitter. I started following a lot of people and the next year when I went back to DragonCon I was meeting a few of those people for the first time in real life. Meeting people in person that you have talked to every day is a weird experience that is hard to describe. It is wonderful and amazing, but also awkward all at once. Those friends are the ones that encouraged me to apply to grad school and pursue film. They have supported me through so much in the last few years and become like family. The stories that exist about people you meet on the internet have not reflected my experience.  I want to create a story that celebrates what the internet can do in it’s best moments.
  • In the journey of bringing this film to life, I met one of my internet friends for the first time while she was auditioning for a role in this film. After casting her (because she is an amazing actress) I was talking to her about some of the things I was struggling with to bring the film to life. I still didn't have a producer and I needed help. She is a producer and has a small production company that she runs with her husband. I immediately realized how dumb I had been for not asking her sooner to help me produce this film. What a perfect representation of WHY I am making this film in the first place! The friendships I have made on the internet have helped me and given me so much and I want to make something that represents that love. 

 

Our Cast

 

What We Need & What You Get

The details:

  • The total budget of the film is 5k. I am using some of my student loan money that I have saved and then will cover with personal funds as needed. 
  • One of the things I am most excited about is the poster artwork that was commissioned! It is in the style of a comic book cover, and I am beyond excited to share it with contributors! Check out the full list of perks for more info!
  • Even if we do not receive the full goal, every cent will go into the film. If we exceed the goal, every cent will go into the film. The film is happening, how much we can do and how great we can make it, is up to you!

 

The Impact

I want to bring the love these characters share into your life, from my little  fictional internet family to my big internet family out there. Especially right now, I think it is a small slice of love that everyone needs. 

Risks & Challenges

There are tons of risks and challenges when making a film. As a thesis project, I am now at the end of the Film and TV program at SCAD. I have worked on various projects and run into a variety of issues, and have become an excellent problem solver.  The show must go on, after all. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially there are still other ways to help:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family on social media!
  • If you are able to offer a service in kind or at a discounted rate please reach out to us!

story:
FLOWERS 2 is the third feature film from writer/director Phil Stevens.

Following directly after the events of the first film. FLOWERS 2 explores the final days of the serial killer known as ‘THE EXILE’ through a macabre birthday party held by his past murder victims. We are shown this monster’s violent past life through the eyes of his dead.

Like my previous films FLOWERS, LUNG (both available through UNEARTHED FILMS ), this is a movie that tells it's story in silence in a nightmare landscape. Without any spoken dialog and painted in dark visual atmosphere, FLOWERS 2 is a film that builds on the journey and drops you in the passenger seat. You'll find yourself unable to look away as we take you on this artistic ride through the savage mind of a rampage killer.

As an artist of various mediums, like Illustration, paint, and film - this movie is a DREAM PROJECT! It's better than Christmas for a lad like me. I've been an artist all my life. I live and love by art and to make this movie would mean absolutely world to me. I am an extremely driven filmmaker by nature and have successfully completed two feature films which are available through various media retailers for sale or rental. I NEVER stop moving and currently, FLOWERS 2 is my new favorite obsession. My work has been seen all around the world and it's an absolute honor to bring this third installment to the fans and get to go round 3 in this beautiful world of underground horror! Anything goes. JOIN US!

HOW INDIEGOGO FUNDS HELP US

In my experience. More money = more options = a much GRANDER movie!!! FLOWERS 2 is completely off the walls and should lick the appetites of some of the most hardcore horror fans out there. Let's make this happen. HELP ME make this happen!

With the additional funds we raise on IndieGoGo, this project will be able to launch into production come June without delay. Any and all donations, no matter how big or small would be greatly appreciated. Your donation will cover additional make-up and effects, props and sets, crafts and services as well as covering the actual release of the film. I want to build and involve our audience from the very beginning to the very end. So I invite you, be apart of this project with us, broh!


LIKE us on Facebook and grab the latest updates!
www.facebook.com/flowers02themovie

story:
Short Summary

Imagine going to a movie theather or sit in front of your screen at home and whatch the Gospel of Mark as an animation movie with the same visual level of a Disney or Dreamworks movie? 

We have been, and will continue using animation artists that have worked on Oscar winning productions to make sure we get a visually state of the art film. Further, it's verse by verse, so we don't emphasize certain parts whilst toning down others. 

- But to make it happen, we need your help!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 300.000USD to make a standalone short movie. This will also function as a pilot to engage even larger investors for a full feature animation film of the whole Gospel of Mark. Word by Word / Verse by verse.

A breakdown of the funding will look something like this:

- 7-10% goes to fees to Indiegogo, Visa, Mastercard etc

- 4-6% will be spent on legal aspects; rights, consultancy etc.

- 10% Will be spent on music and voice recording*

The rest will go directly into paing the CG/Animation artists. No fancy salaries or fees to executive producers and so on. 

*The voices will be a combination of actors and known profiled Christian leaders/artists.

 

As a thank you for your support, we have made some perks we hope you will enjoy. Please check them out!

It is a pretty large amount we're asking for, but we think the most important person in history deserves to be presented in a film with a high focus on visual animation quality and not look like something made on a computer 20 years ago. If we do not reach the entire amount we are asking for, see under the heading “What if we don’t manage to raise the amount?” Further down on this page.

 

The Challenge and the Impact

 

Reading in general is going down in most countries. And even though a lot of people have the bible, they dont read it. It’s more or less laying on a shelf, collecting dust. 

Globally, at least 750 million youth and adults still cannot read and write and 250 million children are failing to acquire basic literacy skills. So, even if they were handed a bible, they would not be able to read it. That’s why we aim to present the gospel in a medium and form that people will engage in and hopefully encourage to further reading. We can’t just print the bible or put it in an app when hundreds of millions can’t or won’t read. 

 

What is so unique with this production?

 

A Disney or Dreamworks animation easily cost everything from 100 to 200 million dollars. Obviously an impossible amount to raise. Even though are quality will be very close,  this production will only cost a fraction of that. There are many reasons for that, but some of the most obvious are:

- We’re not paying Hollywood actors millions of dollars.

- It’s a much smaller team (Big animation films usually have hundreds working on it)

- We will be using software that makes the animation process much more effective to do.

 

On the teaser presented here (check out the video on top of page), we have used animation studios and talents who have worked on Oscar and other award winning and nominated films and shows, like Life of Pi, The Golden Compass, Game of Thrones, Black Panther and several projects for Disney and Fox and other major studios.

 

The idea is to make it so visually engaging that a kid would want to see it just as much as any other animation film. And of course, churches could use it in Sunday school class or in youth groups. 

 

 

Just as important, we are aiming at dubbing this production to as many languages as possible. Whe have already teamed up with a missions organzation that broadcast in over 60 countries. And we are constantly working on partnering with more. 

 

 

Has this been done before?

 

There has been done animation or cartoons based on events from the gospel but not like this. Both in terms of the visual level, but also that  it will be done word by word / Verse by verse.

 

In this way, it won’t be to conservative or to liberal. Or that we are focusing on some parts of the gospel and the story of Jesus, and toning down others, or introducing fictional characters, scenes and additional dialogue.  

 

But to pull this off, we need your help. The major film studios won’t do it. Which is actually very understandable. They are targeting a broad audience, and therefore can’t and will not produce a version of the gospel unless it is somewhat fictional and with additional characters and scenes. We know this, because we have actually been in touch with some of the executives of major studios. 

 

What if we don’t manage to raise the amount?

 

If we don’t manage to raise the amount, we’ll continue contacting investors and supporters tirelessly, making it chapter by chapter until whe have all 16 of them.  - Another cool thing is that if we manage to make a whole movie, we have already made a lot of the environments and characters in an extensive 3D library, making the road shorter to possibly do the other gospels as well somewhere down the road. So what you are giving here, might actually realize more films in the future. 

 

Again, it is a lot of money?

Honestly I don’t like presenting myself as I have done on the video here. But I believe in the cause, and that cause is more important than my comfort zone.  Asking for other peoples money, is also something I'm not to comfortable with, especially if I don’t give into it myself. That would only make me a salesman for a random product I’m told to sell. For this project, besides having used most of my time the last several months on this project without getting paid,(which I’ll also continue to do for months to come), I’ve also spent close to 80.000 dollars of my own money on it. So this is something I’m really passionate about and therefore hope you will join in and perhaps be part of some movie history.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

So again, please help us! It will be impossible to pull this of without your help. Even if it is just for a dollar it helps, and if you don’t have a dollar, sharing this Indiegogo campain on social media so perhaps some of your friends will consider supporting also helps a lot. 

Thank you for taking your time to read this presentation and watch the presentation video, and God bless. 

 

For Sorthvit 

Harald,

Chairman

 

 

 

Who we are

Having made films on global health and human trafficking (funded by the Norwegian Ministry of Justice and Public security), interviewed people ranging from Bill Gates, former WHO Director-General, the founder of MTV International, HRH the princess of Spain and several others, Sorthvit is now focusing on childrens content for Film and TV. Founded in 2001, we were for several years the largest Christian Youth and student magazine in Norway.

It is a pretty large amount we're asking for, but we think the most important person in history deserves to be presented in a film with a high focus on visual animation quality and not look like something made on a computer 20 years ago. If we do not reach the entire amount we are asking for, see under the heading “What if we don’t manage to raise the amount?” Further down on this page.
 
The Challenge and the Impact
 
Reading in general is going down in most countries. And even though a lot of people have the bible, they dont read it. It’s more or less laying on a shelf, collecting dust. 
Globally, at least 750 million youth and adults still cannot read and write and 250 million children are failing to acquire basic literacy skills. So, even if they were handed a bible, they would not be able to read it. That’s why we aim to present the gospel in a medium and form that people will engage in and hopefully encourage to further reading. We can’t just print the bible or put it in an app when hundreds of millions can’t or won’t read. 
 
What is so unique with this production?
 
A Disney or Dreamworks animation easily cost everything from 100 to 200 million dollars. Obviously an impossible amount to raise. Even though are quality will be very close,  this production will only cost a fraction of that. There are many reasons for that, but some of the most obvious are:
- We’re not paying Hollywood actors millions of dollars.
- It’s a much smaller team (Big animation films usually have hundreds working on it)
- We will be using software that makes the animation process much more effective to do.
 
On the teaser presented here (check out the video on top of page), we have used animation studios and talents who have worked on Oscar and other award winning and nominated films and shows, like Life of Pi, The Golden Compass, Game of Thrones, Black Panther and several projects for Disney and Fox and other major studios.
 
The idea is to make it so visually engaging that a kid would want to see it just as much as any other animation film. And of course, churches could use it in Sunday school class or in youth groups. 
 
 
Just as important, we are aiming at dubbing this production to as many languages as possible. Whe have already teamed up with a missions organzation that broadcast in over 60 countries. And we are constantly working on partnering with more. 
 
 
Has this been done before?
 
There has been done animation or cartoons based on events from the gospel but not like this. Both in terms of the visual level, but also that  it will be done word by word / Verse by verse.
 
In this way, it won’t be to conservative or to liberal. Or that we are focusing on some parts of the gospel and the story of Jesus, and toning down others, or introducing fictional characters, scenes and additional dialogue.  
 
But to pull this off, we need your help. The major film studios won’t do it. Which is actually very understandable. They are targeting a broad audience, and therefore can’t and will not produce a version of the gospel unless it is somewhat fictional and with additional characters and scenes. We know this, because we have actually been in touch with some of the executives of major studios. 
 
What if we don’t manage to raise the amount?
 
If we don’t manage to raise the amount, we’ll continue contacting investors and supporters tirelessly, making it chapter by chapter until whe have all 16 of them.  - Another cool thing is that if we manage to make a whole movie, we have already made a lot of the environments and characters in an extensive 3D library, making the road shorter to possibly do the other gospels as well somewhere down the road. So what you are giving here, might actually realize more films in the future. 
 
Again, it is a lot of money?
Honestly I don’t like presenting myself as I have done on the video here. But I believe in the cause, and that cause is more important than my comfort zone.  Asking for other peoples money, is also something I'm not to comfortable with, especially if I don’t give into it myself. That would only make me a salesman for a random product I’m told to sell. For this project, besides having used most of my time the last several months on this project without getting paid,(which I’ll also continue to do for months to come), I’ve also spent close to 80.000 dollars of my own money on it. So this is something I’m really passionate about and therefore hope you will join in and perhaps be part of some movie history.  
 
Other Ways You Can Help
So again, please help us! It will be impossible to pull this of without your help. Even if it is just for a dollar it helps, and if you don’t have a dollar, sharing this Indiegogo campain on social media so perhaps some of your friends will consider supporting also helps a lot. 
Thank you for taking your time to read this presentation and watch the presentation video, and God bless. 
 
For Sorthvit 
Harald,
Chairman
 
 
 
Who we are
Having made films on global health and human trafficking (funded by the Norwegian Ministry of Justice and Public security), interviewed people ranging from Bill Gates, former WHO Director-General, the founder of MTV International, HRH the princess of Spain and several others, Sorthvit is now focusing on childrens content for Film and TV. Founded in 2001, we were for several years the largest Christian Youth and student magazine in Norway.

story:
INTRODUCTION

Hello! My name is Erica Mann and I coming to you to help fund my short documentary. As a woman of color,  I feel that there are so many stories that are not being represented in many facets of entertainment (which I find very frustrating).  State of Independence encapsulates what I hope to showcase in my work -  women defying the status quo and pursuing unique ventures in a male-dominated society.

THE FILM

State of Independence will take a glimpse into Gabrielle Kwarteng’s world as a black woman in music, and how her culture and form of artistic expression has influenced her journey. Following her from gig to gig, the film will show what it's like to work as a DJ in New York's liveliest venues. 

To cover production costs, licensing, and editing, our goal is around $6,500. If we match and/or exceed that goal, it will go towards a continuation of shorts that will hopefully turn this project into a series of new and exciting stories. Also, a percentage of the funding will be donated to Fast for Ghana a charity to support efforts to provide a healthy, sustainable land grown food for the Angels of Hope orphanage in Twarka, Ghana.

Thank you so much for your support!

Gabrielle Kwarteng

A first-generation Ghanaian-American, New York City native, Gabrielle Kwarteng has always taken the role as a music curator for as long as she can remember. As a child, she began building her sonic taste buds with her parents' cassette collection of Ghanaian highlife, Nigerian Afrobeat, American disco, soul, and jazz just to name a few. She enjoyed controlling the room through these musical waves, which eventually transpired into her DJ career. Having also lived in two other artistic capitals, London and Paris, and traveled to a lot more, Gabrielle has amassed a music collection – vinyl and digitally – that stems from every continent – probably with the exception of Antarctica. Her DJ sets are rarely one note, as she seamlessly weaves in the most obscure genres, including Japanese disco, Brazilian funk, Ethiopian jazz, with music's most recognizable disco, funk, and soul hits. 

Erica Mann - Director/Producer

Erica is a writer and producer based in New York. She attended Hofstra University where she received a B.A. in Film Studies and Production with a concentration in Media and Public Relations. Erica has interned for companies such as Viacom, Untitled Entertainment, and PMK.BNC and was the publicity coordinator for film campaigns such as The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Pt. 2 and Divergent: Allegiant. When she is not writing film reviews, she freelances as a production coordinator.

Mike Cicchetti - Producer/Editor

Mike’s career in filmmaking started with a screenwriting class in high school and has excelled through his time at Hofstra University, where he was awarded for his filmmaking skills and creative drive, gaining recognition as early as his Sophomore year and amassing over 15 film credits before graduation. He continues his passions as a professional freelancer, shooting and producing various projects from conception to post-production through his business, transforming CMM into a production powerhouse. Mike’s most recent projects include the short film “Innocence” and the music documentary “Braverman”.

Gabrielle's Interview from "Views From the Chixx Podcast"

 

Gabrielle's Soundcloud

story:
A Quick Summary

I am currently studying towards a Master’s degree in Producing Film & Television and am going to create this short film. The film is not just my graduation film, it is a story that the writer has been working on for a while. The writer also happens to be my best friend so it is an amazing opportunity for us to work together on a project we love. We want the film to be more than a student graduation film and would also like to enter it into film festivals meaning we have to create a quality film, and that’s where you can help.

In order to make this short film, I am asking for some help from my family & friends and anyone that likes the sound of the idea to help fund the film and spread the word.  

What We Need & What You Get

We would love to get £3,000. This money would go towards all aspects of the production such as: transport for cast and crew to the location, feeding everyone, costumes, prosthetics / SFX makeup, editing, props etc etc etc. 

If (sadly) we don’t reach our goal, the funds we do get will go towards the travel expenses for cast & crew and making sure they are fed on set!

Other Ways You Can Help

I realise donating money is a lot to ask - I would also highly appreciate it if you could spread the word on your social media accounts by using the Indiegogo share tools on this page.  

Thank you!!

story:
DYSTOPIA - THE STORY

Faith, a teenage war survivor, finds herself in trouble when her search for the safe and resourceful Eden is interrupted by a young girl that claims to know the way to it. This is a story about friendship, loss, and redemption in a world where no one can be trusted. How far would you go in order to survive?

 

More about the story!

DYSTOPIA is set in a post-apocalyptic world, right after the events of a brand new world war. Nobody is safe. There are almost no humans left. And every action provokes a consequence. The story revolves around Faith, a teenage war survivor, who’s desperate to find the Eden; a safe and resourceful area where everybody is safe. However, her path is altered when Ellie, a young girl, interrupts her path and claims to be from the Eden. Thus, Faith’s only hope is to trust that Ellie will bring her to the Eden…

The main source of inspiration for this short film has come straight out of movies like The Road and Book of Eli, which are iconic contemporary dystopian-theme pieces. Additionally, the music, characters, and visual aspects from The Last of Us have also a significant impact on the film’s style. Our main aim is to recapture the essence from this works with motivation and focused ambition.

The Creators

The original idea was created by Max Mir and Joan Payà, two film students pushing their comfort zone to its limits by developing their first Sci-Fi short film with only 5 minutes to share their story.

Born in Barcelona, Max Mir has been has been creating short films since he was 7 years old. He has a strong passion for directing and he ultimately aims to share his ideas all around the world. Meanwhile, Joan Payà discovered he had a talent for screenwriting almost 3 years ago when he started writing an Extended Essay on J.J. Abrams.

 

How can you be involved?

We want to involve you as much as possible during the production of the film. Dystopia is also YOUR story, and we want to tell it as best as possible. As students, we are trying to achieve our dreams of sharing our stories with the world and communicating our ideas internationally. This campaign is important to us since we aim to develop as storytellers as well as become better artists. 

We would love you to be involved in this film as much as you can. We need your help to make this world come alive and to make this story your story too. Being students we take any and all opportunities to develop as storytellers and bring our stories out into the world. We would love for you to help us achieve out dreams and help us to become better storytellers and artists.

 

Why is it important?

It is of maximum significance that you are willing to contribute to the project. We are the future of storytelling and you might as well choose who tells your story! We want to expand our craft and learn as much as we can throughout these years, so we hope you can help us out and help us improve your stories!

 

Where are we now?

We are reaching the final draft of the script while we organize and plan the shoot in two weeks. Now we are in need of money to pay for locations and all the elements the Art Department will need to create a truly iconic post-apocalyptic aesthetic.

 

What we need and what you get:

We need 1000 pounds that will be employed for actors, location financing, permits, props, costumes, art, setting, festival expenses, and extras such as transport and food.

And that's exactly why we need your help! Without you this project cannot be realized!

You can help us out even by sharing the page with your friends! However, if you decide to donate, you'll be eligible for many rewards such as a unique digital still, a greet and meet with the cast and crew, an IMDB credit, perhaps participating in the shoot, the script, and more!

 

Risks & Challenges

We are an ambitious group with an ambitious project: we are going to use amazing interior and exterior locations, such as a forest and abandoned building in Ealing.

The booking and the usage of these kind of locations is a challenge and a risk for us. Because of that, the production team has hired specialized and certified people to guarantee the safety of the actors and crew as well as the correct functioning of the equipment.

Also, if we don't reach our target, there is a chance you won't obtain your reward. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't invest but are willing to help us out, please share the campaign and spread the word! It will be of massive help for us!

Use Indiegogo's social media sharing tools, and let's share our story!

The booking and the usage of these kind of locations is a challenge and a risk for us. Because of that, the production team has hired specialized and certified people to guarantee the safety of the actors and crew as well as the correct functioning of the equipment.
Also, if we don't reach our target, there is a chance you won't obtain your reward.

If you can't invest but are willing to help us out, please share the campaign and spread the word! It will be of massive help for us!
Use Indiegogo's social media sharing tools, and let's share our story!

story:
About The Film & Director

My name is Heather Harris and am the director of Crush. I am a USC MFA candidate from the very small and sunny country of the Cayman Islands. Mental illness is a very important topic to me and an issue I try to discuss in all of my art. Likewise, LGBTQ issues and rights have always been important to me. Growing up, I was president of Gay Straight Alliance at Trinity College School and an ambassador to the LGBTQ Center at NYU when I was an undergraduate student there. 

Crush is a psychological thriller that approaches both of these topics. When writing this film, I knew I wanted to showcase a lesbian relationship as LGBTQ narratives only take up 4.8% of all media programming, and out of that 4.8% only 23% depict lesbian characters, according to GLAAD in their 2016 report. I find these statistics to be very disheartening, and I believe that representation in Hollywood matters and needs to change. 

Crush is about much more than this, however. This film goes to very dark places and delves into the mind of someone with a mental illness who gradually descends into a state of depression and psychosis. The story centers on a well known writer named Greyson Michaelson who is trying to move forward from her past suicide attempt. When the American Suicide Survivors Association asks Greyson to write a speech about her past struggles, Greyson uses the opportunity to try to move beyond what happened to her. However, while doing so, she begins to be tormented by the allure of her suicidal tendencies. As Greyson becomes consumed with her writing, she discovers a new, darker side to her girlfriend and, ultimately, herself.



I wrote this story while consulting with a psychologist and have done my best to depict an accurate portrayal of what it is like to suffer from depression, psychosis, and suicidal thoughts.

Our crew will shoot scenes underwater and create black voids in order to go inside the mind of our character who is challenged by these thoughts.

In addition, we intend to donate a portion of the profits we make to suicide prevention organizations, so you can feel good knowing that your money will be going to a good cause, while also helping a group of students pursue their passions.


Meet The Team

Because this is a global issue, we created a global team. Our crew members come from across the world, from South America to Asia, with a shared goal of telling a story we believe should be told. 
 






What We Need 

To make this story come to life we are trying to raise $25,000 USD in 30 days. This is no small feat and I realize that this is a lot to ask for!

Here is where the money is going towards: 

  • First of all, as this is a thesis film, it is going to be significantly longer in length (about 15 minutes), thus more shooting days are required. We will have a crew and cast of about 25-30 people and plan to shoot for 6-8 days, for 12 hours each day. Making sure all our crew and cast members are taken care of, fed, and have transportation, significantly contributes to this budget.
     
  • We need a good camera: We are hoping to shoot on a nice camera that will create the highest quality image possible, which will improve our chances of getting into film festivals and for our film to be seen by as many people as possible, thus we are hoping to use an Alexa Mini or a RED camera. The average rental price of a camera package in Los Angeles with a student discount for a RED (the cheaper of the two cameras) body with lenses and monitors for 6-8 days comes to around $4,000 USD. 
     
  • We need grip, electric and underwater equipment: We will be using some USC equipment which will save some money however we also need a lot of various other items that the school does not provide, such as sliders, dollies, steadicams and underwater housing. For 6-8 days, with a student discount, we expect to pay around $2,000 USD for the basic equipment. Shooting underwater and getting underwater camera equipment will cost additional money that we are still negotiating. We will also need to rent a truck to transport this equipment. In addition, insurance for both camera and equipment will also be an additional $800 - $1,000. 
     
  • Safety & Stunts: Shooting underwater is risky for both our cinematographer, camera operator and our actor. In addition this film features fight scenes within the movie. Legally, to shoot this film we will need lifeguards, stunt coordinators, first aid and medical services, and a fire marshall to be present on set. these people must all be professionals and must be paid the industry standard salary for their 12 hours of work.  
     
  • Locations: This film only requires 3 locations. We will be renting a house or apartment, soundstages and a public pool for 6-8 days. For safety we have budgeted $4,500 USD. The price of the production will go up or down depending on what type and cost of locations we are able to find.
     
  • Production Design, Art Department, Makeup, Wardrobe and Costume: In order to make the locations and set look as realistic and believable as possible we need our production designers and art department. They will be renting props, painting, and decorating the set. In addition, the protagonist of this film has significant scars from her past suicide attempt so we will need a SFX makeup artist to create these effects. For these groups we have budgeted: $500 for wardrobe for the actors, $1,200 for makeup and hairdressing. $800 for set dressing, $1,000 for props, $1,500 for the art department and $500 for set construction. The price for production design will also go up or down depending on what locations we are able to find.
     
  • Sound and Score: We intend to get sound equipment for free from USC however as this film is going to have an original score, we will also need to rent recording stages and pay a sound mixer. 
     
  • Color-grading: After the film is complete it must be color-graded to make sure the images and scenes all match and look as good as possible. A professional color-grader in Los Angeles, will cost around $1,500 USD. 
     
  • Finally, we have publicity and film festivals. Film festivals cost around $20-70 each to apply to, so we have also budgeted for applications after the film is finished. We also have a 10% contingency just in case anything goes wrong. 

All editing, foley, sound dubbing and final mixing stages will be provided by USC.

Each donation no matter how small is important and we will give you a shout-out thank you on social media. Any donations of $25 and above will receive a personal thank you letter from the director.

In addition if you donate a large sum of money we will give you the title of being an associate, or executive producer on the film, credits and on IMDb. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that's fine too! We would love and appreciate if you could share our campaign on social media or to your friends and family. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this.

The average rental price of a camera package in Los Angeles with a student discount for a RED (the cheaper of the two cameras) body with lenses and monitors for 6-8 days comes to around $4,000 USD.  
We need grip, electric and underwater equipment: We will be using some USC equipment which will save some money however we also need a lot of various other items that the school does not provide, such as sliders, dollies, steadicams and underwater housing. For 6-8 days, with a student discount, we expect to pay around $2,000 USD for the basic equipment. Shooting underwater and getting underwater camera equipment will cost additional money that we are still negotiating. We will also need to rent a truck to transport this equipment. In addition, insurance for both camera and equipment will also be an additional $800 - $1,000.  
Safety & Stunts: Shooting underwater is risky for both our cinematographer, camera operator and our actor. In addition this film features fight scenes within the movie. Legally, to shoot this film we will need lifeguards, stunt coordinators, first aid and medical services, and a fire marshall to be present on set. these people must all be professionals and must be paid the industry standard salary for their 12 hours of work.   
Locations: This film only requires 3 locations. We will be renting a house or apartment, soundstages and a public pool for 6-8 days. For safety we have budgeted $4,500 USD. The price of the production will go up or down depending on what type and cost of locations we are able to find. 
Production Design, Art Department, Makeup, Wardrobe and Costume: In order to make the locations and set look as realistic and believable as possible we need our production designers and art department. They will be renting props, painting, and decorating the set. In addition, the protagonist of this film has significant scars from her past suicide attempt so we will need a SFX makeup artist to create these effects. For these groups we have budgeted: $500 for wardrobe for the actors, $1,200 for makeup and hairdressing. $800 for set dressing, $1,000 for props, $1,500 for the art department and $500 for set construction. The price for production design will also go up or down depending on what locations we are able to find. 
Sound and Score: We intend to get sound equipment for free from USC however as this film is going to have an original score, we will also need to rent recording stages and pay a sound mixer.  
Color-grading: After the film is complete it must be color-graded to make sure the images and scenes all match and look as good as possible. A professional color-grader in Los Angeles, will cost around $1,500 USD.  
Finally, we have publicity and film festivals. Film festivals cost around $20-70 each to apply to, so we have also budgeted for applications after the film is finished. We also have a 10% contingency just in case anything goes wrong. 

All editing, foley, sound dubbing and final mixing stages will be provided by USC.
Each donation no matter how small is important and we will give you a shout-out thank you on social media. Any donations of $25 and above will receive a personal thank you letter from the director.
In addition if you donate a large sum of money we will give you the title of being an associate, or executive producer on the film, credits and on IMDb. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute that's fine too! We would love and appreciate if you could share our campaign on social media or to your friends and family. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this.

story:
The Story

"Nowhere, Forever" is a short film about two dynamic female characters, told by a female-driven crew. It is a story that is not only deeply personal to myself and co-writer Libby Torres, but to any member of our generation.

We are at an extremely important cultural turning point where women's stories are finally getting the chance to be heard. We want to contribute to this new movement by making a film from a uniquely female point of view.

The Characters

Violet - A fiery young narcissist driven by her passion for Mitchell. Her outward fervor and confidence masks a deeper, fundamental insecurity that she will never be capable of having a relationship. 

Mitchell - An unbelievably charming and talented writer whose ability to manipulate is matched by an inflated ego. For Mitchell, freedom and personal satisfaction come first, but he cannot deny a sense of possession he feels over Violet.   

Petra - A compassionate protector with a tendency to invite toxic people into her life. Although she is experiencing a painful breakup, she puts aside her heartache in order to help her best friend through a difficult situation. Her limits are tested when Violet chooses Mitchell over her. 

The Crew

Anike Niemeyer (Director/ Co-Writer)

Anike has been dedicated to filmmaking and its various mediums throughout her life. After taking her first film production course at age seven, she decided to pursue a career in visual and creative arts. She is currently in her fourth year at NYU Tisch, and is dedicated to telling female-centric stories with a unique and unconventional flair. She has interned on several TV shows and features for HBO, CNN, and Showtime.

Libby Torres (Co-Writer)

Libby is a creative writing minor and comparative literature major, with a focus on latinx literature and culture. She currently writes for Bedford + Bowery and NYU Local and formerly wrote for Gothamist. This is her third time collaborating with Anike; they have previously written three other screenplays for Tisch projects. She aspires to be a journalist and cultural critic after graduation

L Dan Nguyen Phan (Director of Photography)

Dan is a cinematographer from Hanoi, Vietnam.  Dan grew up in between the Vietnamese and French culture, at home and at school, and now resides in New York City. Art for her is the emergency exit to freedom in the political context of her home country. As a filmmaker and aspiring pilot, she aims for her work to be the B-52 of her revolution. In her time at NYU, she has D.P'd over a dozen student films and has worked professionally in New York and Vietnam directing and shooting music videos. 

Sam Stulin (Producer)

Sam is a director, producer and editor from Boston, Massachusetts. He has worked on a wide range of narrative, commercial and documentary films for companies including National Geographic, PBS Nova, Amazon and CBS Sports.

Costanza Reiser (Associate Producer and 2nd Assistant Director)

Coco grew up in Miami, Florida and is studying in her last semester as a Communication Design major at Parsons School of Design. This is her second collaboration with NYU Tisch film, and she is very excited to bring this script to life.

Sophia Huebschman (Assistant Director)

Since moving to NYC two years ago, Sophia has produced and AD’d on a multitude of film, entertainment, and theater projects in the student, independent, and commercial worlds. On top of that, she is also currently working at Astronauts Wanted and APA Agency doing content development. She is passionate about bringing female centric stories such as this one from script to screen.

Bailey Elaine (Concept Artist)

Self taught artist since 2009. Originally from the suburbs of D.C., Bethesda Maryland, and now based in NYC. She attends Parsons the New School for Design and is receiving a BBA in strategic design and management.  

Saki Kanomata (Sound Mixer)

Saki is a native from Queens and a senior at NYU Tisch. She has been production mixer and boom operator on multiple student films for the past three years and has also had the pleasure of working with freelance mixers on independent and commercial productions. In addition to production sound she dabbles in foley, and AD-ing.

Cha Patra-Yanan (Sound Mixer)

Cha moved to New York from Thailand to pursue a film education at NYU. Now in her senior year, Cha has worked on countless student films and commercials doing production sound in both NYC and Bangkok. She currently works as a part time animator and a freelance sound mixer in the city. 

What We Need 

We've carefully planned our budget to make sure that every dollar is being spent on what matters. On top of our thesis allotment from NYU, we still need to raise additional funds to cover crucial production costs such as transportation, location rentals, production design, and food for our amazing cast and crew.  

Principal photography for the film runs March 23-25 and we have 30 days to reach our target amount of $8,000.

How You Can Help

Join our team, and help this film happen by donating to the cause! Not able to donate right now? It would be extremely helpful if you could share our campaign, tag us in the posts, and spread the word. One click can make all the difference for our production, so help us get the word out.

Impact

On our film, every dollar counts. We have the dedication, the passion, and the opportunity to make this film great. With great resources surrounding us and a phenomenal story backing us, the sky's the limit. We are ready for this project, but rely on the help of people like you to make it a reality. We need your help.

We need your help.

story:
A New Way To Tell Moving On

To us the story of Jonny is such a personal one. It's one of love and decisions. Something we all have been through, and will go through eventually. When your heart guides you in multiple directions and you have to choose. Being able to tell such a bittersweet story is something we would both love to put on a screen, and with such wonderful music to accompany it we couldn't find any better way to execute it.

The Makers?

The Director and Co-Writer - Andrew "Ducky" Dutkiewicz

  • I have always found the type of stories I want to tell are the ones closest to me. The ones that make me smile, cry, laugh, reminisce, The ones I can connect too. When I heard Matt's music to an EP he made I told him within minutes of the first song that we were going to make this into a film musical. Luckily he didn't find me weird and told me he loved the idea.

The Composer and Co-Writer - Matt Sperrazza

  • I originally wrote the EP "Camp Ohana" as an ode to my family and the feeling of leaving home for the first time. When Andrew came to me with the idea of making the album into a film I loved the idea of bringing the project full circle. 

The Producer - Miguel McSongwe 

  • I've produced many short films before, most every one of Andrew's and when he came to me with Matt's EP I knew just as he did that this needed to be made into a film. A very short time later Matt, Andrew, and I were sitting around a table breaking down everything as we fully committed to putting this beautiful story on the big screen.

So Why The 5000 Dollars?

We've budgeted the film to be around $5000, this money is going to:

  • Recording, Mixing, and Mastering
  • Choreography
  • Cast and Crew 
  • Food
  • Transportation
  • Production Design
  • Equipment Rentals

​For our perks we chose what we think are the best ways to thank you as a help to our production. From some simple karma to the music both original and new to even an Executive Producer credit our team carefully and strategically picked out how we could give back to such fantastic people!

If we aren't able to reach the entire goal the funds will still go to the film and help as much as they can!

The Big Picture

At the end of the day we hope Ohana can be made to it's ultimate potential with the help from you. And at the end of the week when the film is made we hope to be able to inspire and entertain as many people as possible. The theme of the film is so universal I think most people can look at their past, present, or even future and relate it to Jonny. They can use him to reminisce or to cope or to get ready for letting go and moving on into their next step in life.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways you could help us is to get our project out to your friends and family. Share it with everyone you know, scream Ohana from the highest rooftop.

Ohana means family, and no one gets left behind... don't leave your friends and family out of this!

Thank you so much!

story:
In Russian - По-русски

BY SUPPORTING OUR FILM YOU HELP EVERY BABY WITH DOWN SYNDROME TO HAVE A CHANCE FOR A FULL LIFE!

HELP OUR TROUPE TO HAVE THE JOURNEY OF THEIR LIVES AND US TO MAKE A MOVIE ABOUT IT!

We believe that with the help of cinematography, through the emotional immersion -  the adventure to your dream, we can reach someone's heart  and influence the acceptance of “special” people in society.

 “Eating An Elephant” - is not a movie of “compassion” for people with disabilities, it's an entertainment movie, which emotionally immerse the viewer despite characters' specialties.

Filmed in crossing genres, «competition» and «road movie» it will gather the whole family in front of the screen.

Meet one of our actors

This is Stas.
He's 21 and he's been officially claimed as ineducable.
He spent almost all his life socially isolated.
Nowadays he stars at «InterAction» theatre with his friends and they dream about an international tour to Australia.

We want to make their dream come true and to shoot a movie about it!

HELP US TO CHANGE LIVES OF PEOPLE WITH DOWN SYNDROME IN RUSSIA AND IN THE WORLD THROUGH OUR MOVIE!

What if some people with mental or phisical disorders do not require ‘special needs’?

What if we are yet to understand what role in our life they play and through that lack of understanding, we can’t use that gift which they brought into the world?

Unfortunately Russian society treats people with Down syndrome very cautiously, ignoring them or just pretending that they do not exist. There is no place for them at a playground, at school, at college and at work.

Most people with Down syndrome stay closed at orphanages and mental institutions during all their life because the society doesn't want them to be involved.

Families which are raising kids with Down syndrome are suffering from a lack of educative and social help and the negative attitude of society towards Down syndrome.

Facts

In Russia - 85% of the families reject their baby with Down Syndrome in maternity hospital. Sometimes, mothers are even encouraged to do that by hospital staff.

In Europe and USA - rejection of children with Down Syndrome is not higher than 5%. In Scandinavian countries there are no abandoned children with Down Syndrome.

In USA - 250 families are on a waiting list to adopt them.

Our goal is to change this stereotype situation!

We have no doubt that a lot of people with Down syndrome can be wonderful, extremely talented and demanded actors. We are sure that their participation in plays and movies can change the viewers perspective forever.

Help us to share the happiness of interaction with people with Down syndrome!

Like any of us, people with Down syndrome have their own strengths and weaknesses, habits and preferences, hobbies and interests.

Сhildren with Down syndrome are much better in opening their potential if they live at home with an atmosphere of love, have access to specialised early educational programs, are able to have the right medical help and are able to go to kindergarten and school, enabling them to build friendships and be comfortable within the society.

The story

Our documentary comedy is about lifechanging events that are happening to our inclusive theater actors:

  • Along with the troupe we will start from first moments of the new show. Our heroes and us will walk a path of successes and failures, hopes and regrets ending at the show premiere
  • With tremble in our hearts we will anticipate our first international festival application approval
  • If it is declined we will witness what drives our troupe to fight on
  • In case of success we’ll follow them in their great adventure

The style

In storytelling we use a positive approach which does not place any emphasis on “specialness” of the characters, instead it focuses only on their charismatic nature.

  • An audience is not a detached observer - it will become a part of our characters lives
  • A documentary is not a report  - it is a fascinating story 
  • Rehearsals, shows, internal and external struggle - all to be filmed in an intimate and emotional connection with the characters 
  • A documentary - in contemporary visual style, allowing audience to feel truly involved

Why should we make this film?

WE WANT:

  • Share our knowledge of abilities of people with Down syndrome
  • Break all stereotypes about people with Down syndrome
  • Actors with Down syndrome to be employed
  • Change audience attitude to social movie and theater –> creating positive art 
  • Attract new audience and actors in our inclusive theater 
  • Popularize inclusive and volunteer projects

What do we need?

We're now at the production stage and we really need your support to make this lifechanging movie!

Our production budget is 29 300$, including equipment costs in the amount of 9 244$, film crew in the amount of 14 619$  and other accounting and supporting expenditures in the amount of 5 437$.

WE NEED YOUR HELP to complete production this autumn and begin post production to have a premiere at 21 March 2018 in World Down Syndrome Day! 

TOGETHER WE WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE!

How can you help?

  1. BACK THE PROJECT: you can donate any sum you want or choose any of our perks created for you with love.
  2. SPREAD THE WORLD: Even if you can't donate, there are other important ways you can help:

2.1. send this Indiegogo link to your friends and colleagues 
2.2. join our Facebook page and Facebook InterAction page
2.3. follow us on  Instagram 
2.4. see our Website 
2.5. talk about the project to everyone you know!

Sharing the link with your family and friends does a world of difference in getting more people to contribute!

  1. CONNECT WITH US: If you have any questions or proposals, send us an e-mail to interaction.theatre@gmail.com

Through this special film, we're excited to be able to change hearts and minds!

We hope you'll join us as we move forward towards the finish line.

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

По-русски

ПОДДЕРЖИВАЯ НАШ ФИЛЬМ, ВЫ ПОМОГАЕТЕ КАЖДОМУ РЕБЕНКУ С СИНДРОМОМ ДАУНА ИМЕТЬ ШАНС НА СЧАСТЛИВУЮ ЖИЗНЬ!

ПОМОГИТЕ НАШЕМУ ТЕАТРУ ОТПРАВИТЬСЯ В СУДЬБОНОСНОЕ ПУТЕШЕСТВИЕ, А НАМ СНЯТЬ ОБ ЭТОМ ФИЛЬМ!

Мы считаем, что именно с помощью кинематографа, через эмоциональное погружение, путешествие к мечте, мы сможем достучаться до зрительских сердец и повлиять на принятие «особенных» людей в обществе.

 “Съесть СЛОНА” – это не фильм о сочувствии к людям с ограниченными возможностями здоровья, это развлекательное кино, которое эмоционально вовлекает зрителя несмотря на особенности героев.

Наш фильм снимается на пересечении жанров фильма-соревнования и “роад-муви”, он соберет всю Вашу семью перед экранами.

Познакомьтесь с одним из наших актеров

Это Стас.
Ему 21 год и всю его жизнь до театра он был официально признан необучаемым.
Он провел большую часть своей жизни в социальной изоляции.
Сейчас Стас играет в театре “ВзаимоДействие” со своими друзьями и они мечтают отправиться на международные гастроли в Австралию.

Мы хотим исполнить их мечту и снять об этом фильм!

ПОМОГИТЕ НАМ ИЗМЕНИТЬ ЖИЗНИ ЛЮДЕЙ С СИНДРОМОМ ДАУНА В РОССИИ И ВО ВСЕМ МИРЕ!

Что если не все люди с ментальными или физическими особенностями требуют «специального отношения»?

Что если нам еще только предстоит осознать, какую роль они играют в нашей жизни, и в отсутствие такого понимания мы не можем принять тот дар, который они приносят в наш мир?

К сожалению, наше общество относится к людям с синдромом Дауна очень настроженно, игнорируя, не принимая их и притворяясь, что они не существуют. Им нет места ни на игровой площадке, ни в школе, ни в университе, ни на работе.

Большинство людей с синдромом Дауна остаются в детских домах и в психологических лечебницах всю свою жизнь, потому что общество не принимает их.

Семьи, в которых растут дети с синдромом Дауна, страдают от отсутствия образовательной, социальной помощи, а также от негативного отношения общества к людям с синдромом.

Факты

В России 85% семей отказываются от новорожденного с синдромом Дауна в роддоме. Часто именно медицинский персонал уговаривает матерей решиться на этот шаг.

В Европе и США случаи отказов от малышей с синдромом не превышают 5%. В Скандинавских странах не зарегистрировано ни одного случая отказа от новорожденного с синдромом Дауна.

В США 250 семей стоят в очереди на усыновление ребенка с синдромом Дауна.

Наша цель – изменить эту ситуацию!

Мы уверены, что большинство людей с синдромом Дауна могут быть замечательными, невероятно талантливыми актерами театра и кино, а их игра способна полностью перевернуть сознание зрителя.

Помогите нам поделиться с миром счастьем взаимодействия с людьми с синдромом Дауна!

Как у любого из нас, у людей с синдромом Дауна есть свои сильные и слабые стороны, особенности характера, привычки, хобби и интересы.

Потенциал детей с синдромом Дауна гораздо лучше раскрывается, когда они живут в атмосфере любви и понимания, имеют доступ к специализированным ранним образовательным программам, имеют возможность получить необходимую медицинскую помощь, пойти в детский сад и школу, завести друзей и вести активную социальную жизнь.

История

Наша документальная комедия о судьбоносных событиях, которые происходят с актерами инклюзивного театра:

  • Вместе  с труппой театра мы начнем с самых первых репетиций нового спектакля. Через успехи и неудачи, надежды и отчаяния героев мы вместе с ними дойдем до премьеры
  • С замиранием сердца будем ждать результатов подачи заявки на театральный фестиваль
  • В случае неудачи мы  увидим, что поддержало героев и помогло им не опускать руки
  • А в случае победы - мы отправимся вместе с ними навстречу приключениям

Стиль

В повествовании используется позитивный подход, который не делает акцента на “особенности” героев, вместо этого фокусируется на их харизматичной натуре.

  • Это не наблюдение за жизнью героев – зритель станет частью их жизни
  • Документальный фильм не как репортаж – а как увлекательная история
  • Репетиции, выступления, преодоление героями внутренних и внешних препятствий – все это будет снято в самом интимном эмоциональном контакте с героями
  • Документальный фильм – в современном художественном стиле, позволяющем зрителю почувствовать себя по-настоящему сопричастным

Почему мы должны снять этот фильм?

МЫ ХОТИМ:

  • Распространить информацию о возможностях людей с синдромом Дауна
  • Сломать стереотипы о людях с синдромом Дауна и их способностях
  • Способствовать трудоустройству актеров с синдромом Дауна
  • Поменять отношение к социальному кино и театру –> создавая позитивное искусство
  • Привлечь зрителей и новых актеров в инклюзивный театр
  • Популяризировать инклюзивные и волонтерские проекты

Что нам нужно?

Мы сейчас находимся в стадии продакшна и нам очень нужна Ваша поддержка, чтобы завершить наш фильм!

Наш производственный бюджет = 29 300$, включая расходы на оборудование в размере 9 244$, расходы на съемочную группу = 14 619$ и прочие бухгалтерские и сопутствующие расходы в размере 5 437$.

НАМ НУЖНА ВАША ПОМОЩЬ, чтобы закончить производство этой осенью, начать пост-продакшн и показать наш фильм 21 марта 2018 года в Международный день людей с синдромом Дауна! 

ВМЕСТЕ МЫ СМОЖЕМ ИЗМЕНИТЬ ЭТОТ МИР!

Как Вы можете помочь?

  1. МАТЕРИАЛЬНО: Вы можете пожертвовать любую сумму или выбрать один из подарков, которые мы с любовью придумали для Вас.
  2. РАССКАЖИТЕ МИРУ О НАС: Даже если Вы не можете помочь материально, ниже другие важные пути, как Вы можете помочь:

2.1. отправьте ссылку на Indiegogo Вашим друзьям и коллегам
2.2. подписывайтесь на нашу страницу в Facebook и страницу проекта ВзаимоДействие в Facebook
2.3. подписывайтесь на наш Instagram 
2.4. посетите наш сайт 
2.5. расскажите о нас всем, кого Вы знаете!

Делясь ссылкой с Вашей семьей и друзьями, Вы действительно помогаете привлечь больше средств на наш фильм!

  1. СВЯЖИТЕСЬ С НАМИ: Если у Вас есть вопросы или предложения, пожалуйста, пишите нам: interaction.theatre@gmail.com

С помощью нашего фильма мы проникнем в сердца зрителей и изменим их стереотипы!

Мы надеемся, что Вы присоединитесь к нам в этом волшебном приключении.

Мы безмерно благодарны Вам за участие и любовь!
story_txt:
In Russian - По-русскиBY SUPPORTING OUR FILM YOU HELP EVERY BABY WITH DOWN SYNDROME TO HAVE A CHANCE FOR A FULL LIFE!HELP OUR TROUPE TO HAVE THE JOURNEY OF THEIR LIVES AND US TO MAKE A MOVIE ABOUT IT!We believe that with the help of cinematography, through the emotional immersion -  the adventure to your dream, we can reach someone's heart  and influence the acceptance of “special” people in society. “Eating An Elephant” - is not a movie of “compassion” for people with disabilities, it's an entertainment movie, which emotionally immerse the viewer despite characters' specialties.Filmed in crossing genres, «competition» and «road movie» it will gather the whole family in front of the screen.Meet one of our actorsThis is Stas.He's 21 and he's been officially claimed as ineducable.He spent almost all his life socially isolated.Nowadays he stars at «InterAction» theatre with his friends and they dream about an international tour to Australia.We want to make their dream come true and to shoot a movie about it!HELP US TO CHANGE LIVES OF PEOPLE WITH DOWN SYNDROME IN RUSSIA AND IN THE WORLD THROUGH OUR MOVIE!What if some people with mental or phisical disorders do not require ‘special needs’?What if we are yet to understand what role in our life they play and through that lack of understanding, we can’t use that gift which they brought into the world?Unfortunately Russian society treats people with Down syndrome very cautiously, ignoring them or just pretending that they do not exist. There is no place for them at a playground, at school, at college and at work.Most people with Down syndrome stay closed at orphanages and mental institutions during all their life because the society doesn't want them to be involved.Families which are raising kids with Down syndrome are suffering from a lack of educative and social help and the negative attitude of society towards Down syndrome.FactsIn Russia - 85% of the families reject their baby with Down Syndrome in maternity hospital. Sometimes, mothers are even encouraged to do that by hospital staff.In Europe and USA - rejection of children with Down Syndrome is not higher than 5%. In Scandinavian countries there are no abandoned children with Down Syndrome.In USA - 250 families are on a waiting list to adopt them.Our goal is to change this stereotype situation!We have no doubt that a lot of people with Down syndrome can be wonderful, extremely talented and demanded actors. We are sure that their participation in plays and movies can change the viewers perspective forever.Help us to share the happiness of interaction with people with Down syndrome! Like any of us, people with Down syndrome have their own strengths and weaknesses, habits and preferences, hobbies and interests.Сhildren with Down syndrome are much better in opening their potential if they live at home with an atmosphere of love, have access to specialised early educational programs, are able to have the right medical help and are able to go to kindergarten and school, enabling them to build friendships and be comfortable within the society.The storyOur documentary comedy is about lifechanging events that are happening to our inclusive theater actors:
Along with the troupe we will start from first moments of the new show. Our heroes and us will walk a path of successes and failures, hopes and regrets ending at the show premiere
With tremble in our hearts we will anticipate our first international festival application approval
If it is declined we will witness what drives our troupe to fight on
In case of success we’ll follow them in their great adventure
The styleIn storytelling we use a positive approach which does not place any emphasis on “specialness” of the characters, instead it focuses only on their charismatic nature.
An audience is not a detached observer - it will become a part of our characters lives
A documentary is not a report  - it is a fascinating story 
Rehearsals, shows, internal and external struggle - all to be filmed in an intimate and emotional connection with the characters 
A documentary - in contemporary visual style, allowing audience to feel truly involved
Why should we make this film? WE WANT:

Share our knowledge of abilities of people with Down syndrome

Break all stereotypes about people with Down syndrome
Actors with Down syndrome to be employed

Change audience attitude to social movie and theater –> creating positive art 

Attract new audience and actors in our inclusive theater 

Popularize inclusive and volunteer projects
What do we need?We're now at the production stage and we really need your support to make this lifechanging movie!Our production budget is 29 300$, including equipment costs in the amount of 9 244$, film crew in the amount of 14 619$  and other accounting and supporting expenditures in the amount of 5 437$.WE NEED YOUR HELP to complete production this autumn and begin post production to have a premiere at 21 March 2018 in World Down Syndrome Day! TOGETHER WE WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE!How can you help?
BACK THE PROJECT: you can donate any sum you want or choose any of our perks created for you with love.

SPREAD THE WORLD: Even if you can't donate, there are other important ways you can help:
2.1. send this Indiegogo link to your friends and colleagues 2.2. join our Facebook page and Facebook InterAction page2.3. follow us on  Instagram 2.4. see our Website 2.5. talk about the project to everyone you know!Sharing the link with your family and friends does a world of difference in getting more people to contribute!
CONNECT WITH US: If you have any questions or proposals, send us an e-mail to interaction.theatre@gmail.com
Through this special film, we're excited to be able to change hearts and minds!We hope you'll join us as we move forward towards the finish line. 
Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------По-русскиПОДДЕРЖИВАЯ НАШ ФИЛЬМ, ВЫ ПОМОГАЕТЕ КАЖДОМУ РЕБЕНКУ С СИНДРОМОМ ДАУНА ИМЕТЬ ШАНС НА СЧАСТЛИВУЮ ЖИЗНЬ!ПОМОГИТЕ НАШЕМУ ТЕАТРУ ОТПРАВИТЬСЯ В СУДЬБОНОСНОЕ ПУТЕШЕСТВИЕ, А НАМ СНЯТЬ ОБ ЭТОМ ФИЛЬМ!Мы считаем, что именно с помощью кинематографа, через эмоциональное погружение, путешествие к мечте, мы сможем достучаться до зрительских сердец и повлиять на принятие «особенных» людей в обществе. “Съесть СЛОНА” – это не фильм о сочувствии к людям с ограниченными возможностями здоровья, это развлекательное кино, которое эмоционально вовлекает зрителя несмотря на особенности героев.Наш фильм снимается на пересечении жанров фильма-соревнования и “роад-муви”, он соберет всю Вашу семью перед экранами.Познакомьтесь с одним из наших актеровЭто Стас.Ему 21 год и всю его жизнь до театра он был официально признан необучаемым.Он провел большую часть своей жизни в социальной изоляции.Сейчас Стас играет в театре “ВзаимоДействие” со своими друзьями и они мечтают отправиться на международные гастроли в Австралию.Мы хотим исполнить их мечту и снять об этом фильм!ПОМОГИТЕ НАМ ИЗМЕНИТЬ ЖИЗНИ ЛЮДЕЙ С СИНДРОМОМ ДАУНА В РОССИИ И ВО ВСЕМ МИРЕ!Что если не все люди с ментальными или физическими особенностями требуют «специального отношения»?Что если нам еще только предстоит осознать, какую роль они играют в нашей жизни, и в отсутствие такого понимания мы не можем принять тот дар, который они приносят в наш мир?К сожалению, наше общество относится к людям с синдромом Дауна очень настроженно, игнорируя, не принимая их и притворяясь, что они не существуют. Им нет места ни на игровой площадке, ни в школе, ни в университе, ни на работе.Большинство людей с синдромом Дауна остаются в детских домах и в психологических лечебницах всю свою жизнь, потому что общество не принимает их.Семьи, в которых растут дети с синдромом Дауна, страдают от отсутствия образовательной, социальной помощи, а также от негативного отношения общества к людям с синдромом.ФактыВ России 85% семей отказываются от новорожденного с синдромом Дауна в роддоме. Часто именно медицинский персонал уговаривает матерей решиться на этот шаг.В Европе и США случаи отказов от малышей с синдромом не превышают 5%. В Скандинавских странах не зарегистрировано ни одного случая отказа от новорожденного с синдромом Дауна.В США 250 семей стоят в очереди на усыновление ребенка с синдромом Дауна.
Наша цель – изменить эту ситуацию!
Мы уверены, что большинство людей с синдромом Дауна могут быть замечательными, невероятно талантливыми актерами театра и кино, а их игра способна полностью перевернуть сознание зрителя.Помогите нам поделиться с миром счастьем взаимодействия с людьми с синдромом Дауна! Как у любого из нас, у людей с синдромом Дауна есть свои сильные и слабые стороны, особенности характера, привычки, хобби и интересы.Потенциал детей с синдромом Дауна гораздо лучше раскрывается, когда они живут в атмосфере любви и понимания, имеют доступ к специализированным ранним образовательным программам, имеют возможность получить необходимую медицинскую помощь, пойти в детский сад и школу, завести друзей и вести активную социальную жизнь.ИсторияНаша документальная комедия о судьбоносных событиях, которые происходят с актерами инклюзивного театра:
Вместе  с труппой театра мы начнем с самых первых репетиций нового спектакля. Через успехи и неудачи, надежды и отчаяния героев мы вместе с ними дойдем до премьеры
С замиранием сердца будем ждать результатов подачи заявки на театральный фестиваль
В случае неудачи мы  увидим, что поддержало героев и помогло им не опускать руки
А в случае победы - мы отправимся вместе с ними навстречу приключениям
СтильВ повествовании используется позитивный подход, который не делает акцента на “особенности” героев, вместо этого фокусируется на их харизматичной натуре.
Это не наблюдение за жизнью героев – зритель станет частью их жизни
Документальный фильм не как репортаж – а как увлекательная история
Репетиции, выступления, преодоление героями внутренних и внешних препятствий – все это будет снято в самом интимном эмоциональном контакте с героями
Документальный фильм – в современном художественном стиле, позволяющем зрителю почувствовать себя по-настоящему сопричастным
Почему мы должны снять этот фильм? МЫ ХОТИМ:

Распространить информацию о возможностях людей с синдромом Дауна

Сломать стереотипы о людях с синдромом Дауна и их способностях
Способствовать трудоустройству актеров с синдромом Дауна

Поменять отношение к социальному кино и театру –> создавая позитивное искусство

Привлечь зрителей и новых актеров в инклюзивный театр
Популяризировать инклюзивные и волонтерские проекты

Что нам нужно?
Мы сейчас находимся в стадии продакшна и нам очень нужна Ваша поддержка, чтобы завершить наш фильм!Наш производственный бюджет = 29 300$, включая расходы на оборудование в размере 9 244$, расходы на съемочную группу = 14 619$ и прочие бухгалтерские и сопутствующие расходы в размере 5 437$.НАМ НУЖНА ВАША ПОМОЩЬ, чтобы закончить производство этой осенью, начать пост-продакшн и показать наш фильм 21 марта 2018 года в Международный день людей с синдромом Дауна! ВМЕСТЕ МЫ СМОЖЕМ ИЗМЕНИТЬ ЭТОТ МИР!Как Вы можете помочь?

2.1. отправьте ссылку на Indiegogo Вашим друзьям и коллегам2.2. подписывайтесь на нашу страницу в Facebook и страницу проекта ВзаимоДействие в Facebook2.3. подписывайтесь на наш Instagram 2.4. посетите наш сайт 2.5. расскажите о нас всем, кого Вы знаете!Делясь ссылкой с Вашей семьей и друзьями, Вы действительно помогаете привлечь больше средств на наш фильм! 
СВЯЖИТЕСЬ С НАМИ: Если у Вас есть вопросы или предложения, пожалуйста, пишите нам: interaction.theatre@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hidden Light marks the feature film debut of Aaron Kamp and his fledgling production company, Small Voice Films.  Having studied Film and Television at Curtin University, Aaron worked in the corporate & event video production arena for more than a decade, as well as freelancing as a Camera Assistant / Cinematographer on a number of TV Commercials and films. In 2013, Aaron embarked on his career as a director, and since that time has written, produced & directed 4 award winning short films that have screened at over 30 international film festivals.

In late 2016, Aaron assembled a team of experienced and highly talented individuals to help bring the film, Hidden Light, to life. Some of these people include:

Co-Executive Producer / Lead Actor: Jack Jovcic
Lead Actor: Jeremy Levi
Lead Actor: Troy Coward
Supporting Actress: Sharyna Thomson
Supporting Actor: Liam Graham
Supporting Actor: James Helm
Co-Producer: Roslyn Park
Cinematographer: Joel Crane
Production Designer: Dan Ampuero
Costume Designer: Steph Davis
Sound Designer: Wendi Graham
Colourist / VFX Artist: Noah Norton
 

Together we have created a fantastic film that will have a great impact on audiences around the world! It's a high-end, professional film - but we need your help to put the final touches on it! 


              

The cast & crew on our final night shoot!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve already shot the film. That's right - it's done, which means the riskiest part is over! So your support will be going towards finessing and finishing an already high-quality product. 

Right now, we're in post-production - doing the sound design, music, colour grading and so on. And then we'll be arranging all of our marketing materials in order to get this film onto the world stage, at the American Film Market in November. And that's what we need your help for.

The minimum budget for this final bit is:

  • Sound Design / Colouring / VFX - $6000
  • Music Composition - $3000
  • Poster Design / Press Kit Production - $4000
  • Deliverables (closed captioning, dialogue list) - $2000
  • Film Festival Entry Fees - $2000
  • American Film Market registration & attendance - $8000
  • TOTAL: $25,000

We already privately raised the money to cover the cost of production, and we have $10,000 remaining - which leaves us $15,000 short.
Of course, if we are able to raise more than the required $15,000 - all of the additional funds will be used to further our marketing efforts to get this film on screens around the world.

We have some great 'rewards' on offer, from simply getting your own copy of the film, right up to becoming an Executive Producer on the film! And you've got nothing to lose - this film is going to be finished, so you're guaranteed to see the fruit of your contribution!

               

A snapshot of the film in the editing room.

 

The Impact

At Small Voice Films, we create films that inspire and entertain. And that's exactly what this film will do. We need your help to finish this film in the best possible way so we can get it seen by as many people as possible. And we don't want this simply because we've made it - the film also carries a great message that can impact lives. As Jovan says in the film - "The light always shines in the darkness". No matter what you're going through, or how much darkness seems to be surrounding you, the light is always there!

We have a proven track record of creating quality films that resonate with audiences around the world and we want you to be a part of our first feature length film! You can help us bring this film to the widest audience possible!

And remember - the film is already shot! So you've got nothing to lose. All we're asking is that you pre-order your own copy of the film, which will allow us to have the funds now to finish the film off in the best way possible!

So get on board and partner with us today!!

 

Want to help, but can't donate?... 

We know that times are tough and you may not be able to financially contribute to the film - but there are still several ways you could still support Hidden Light:

Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, via email, or any other network you have access to! And use #hiddenlightfilm

Like us here on Facebook! 

Sign up for the Small Voice Films newsletter here: www.smallvoicefilms.com

Follow our director here on Twitter! 

Thank you for your support!!! 

 

              

Jacob (Jeremy Levi)

 

 

Father Radovan (Angelino) is a mentor to Jovan (Jack Jovcic)

 

Sarah (Vivienne Marshall) and Drago (Troy Coward)

What We Need & What You Get
We’ve already shot the film. That's right - it's done, which means the riskiest part is over! So your support will be going towards finessing and finishing an already high-quality product. 
Right now, we're in post-production - doing the sound design, music, colour grading and so on. And then we'll be arranging all of our marketing materials in order to get this film onto the world stage, at the American Film Market in November. And that's what we need your help for.The minimum budget for this final bit is:

Sound Design / Colouring / VFX - $6000
Music Composition - $3000
Poster Design / Press Kit Production - $4000
Deliverables (closed captioning, dialogue list) - $2000
Film Festival Entry Fees - $2000
American Film Market registration & attendance - $8000
TOTAL: $25,000

We already privately raised the money to cover the cost of production, and we have $10,000 remaining - which leaves us $15,000 short.Of course, if we are able to raise more than the required $15,000 - all of the additional funds will be used to further our marketing efforts to get this film on screens around the world.
We have some great 'rewards' on offer, from simply getting your own copy of the film, right up to becoming an Executive Producer on the film! And you've got nothing to lose - this film is going to be finished, so you're guaranteed to see the fruit of your contribution!
               
A snapshot of the film in the editing room.
 

The Impact
At Small Voice Films, we create films that inspire and entertain. And that's exactly what this film will do. We need your help to finish this film in the best possible way so we can get it seen by as many people as possible. And we don't want this simply because we've made it - the film also carries a great message that can impact lives. As Jovan says in the film - "The light always shines in the darkness". No matter what you're going through, or how much darkness seems to be surrounding you, the light is always there!
We have a proven track record of creating quality films that resonate with audiences around the world and we want you to be a part of our first feature length film! You can help us bring this film to the widest audience possible!
And remember - the film is already shot! So you've got nothing to lose. All we're asking is that you pre-order your own copy of the film, which will allow us to have the funds now to finish the film off in the best way possible!
So get on board and partner with us today!!
 
Want to help, but can't donate?... 
We know that times are tough and you may not be able to financially contribute to the film - but there are still several ways you could still support Hidden Light:
Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, via email, or any other network you have access to! And use #hiddenlightfilm
Like us here on Facebook! 
Sign up for the Small Voice Films newsletter here: www.smallvoicefilms.com
Follow our director here on Twitter! 
Thank you for your support!!! 
 
              
Jacob (Jeremy Levi)
 
 

Father Radovan (Angelino) is a mentor to Jovan (Jack Jovcic)
 

Sarah (Vivienne Marshall) and Drago (Troy Coward)

story:
Short Summary

Funds for 3 days of editing to assure the film can bet to the composer and color correction before film festival deadlines.

What We Need & What You Get

We need 3 days of editing at $400 a day. Any contribution will give you a sneak peek of a scene from the movie!

The Impact

The difficulty and frustration of scheduling with my editor and having him stolen away by a paying customer will be erased! I will be able to actually BOOK his time and get this thing done!

Risks & Challenges

Um... I don't really know about this one...let's just say it's risk-free!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know anyone who might have an interest in helping a fledgling film maker then you can pass this information on!
