story:
Hello all,

First off, thanks so much for visiting my page and considering helping ya girl out with this project. I'm going to be a senior at Liberty University this fall and that's the time of the year where our Cinematic Arts Program works hard to create over 50 thesis films! This is going to be my first short film where I am writing the script, directing the set and eventually editing the actual video content. I'm really looking forward to working with my fellow students and creating something amazing to share with all of you!

I really hope you get the chance to contribute to this project, so please sit back, relax, make yourself at home here! Check out the perks available on the right, and feel free to read the information below and ask questions, I'll be here all week. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

If you're wondering what the crew could possibly need this money for, here's the short answer.

  • Locations - This is one of the biggest components as far as cost goes, because often times it needs to be reserved in advance. 
  • Craft Services (aka food!) - Our long days leave little time for rest, but when we do, WE EAT. Our cast and crew could use some nutritional substance other than coffee. 
  • Hair, Makeup, and Wardrobe - This will help keep our cast looking authentic and consistent for your viewing pleasure. 
  • Props - *spoiler alert* let's just say that we hope to break some bottles...
  • Transportation - To put it bluntly, we need gas money to get from place to place. 

The Impact

By backing this project, you're not only giving a chance to its creators, but giving an opportunity to its audience. Film is a fantastic medium to connect with people, to bring people together and to have them feel understood, even if its just for 10-15 minutes. We as filmmakers are looking forward to creating content that makes people ponder ideas, and maybe even think about the story after they walk away. As a crew, we're practicing and honing our skills, and it's not always easy (or free). We're so excited to work on this project in the upcoming year and to work hard mastering the thing we love most; storytelling. 

Risks & Challenges

Of course with filmmaking there are going to be some obstacles throughout the production. Our professor has said, "If something isn't going wrong, you're not making a great film". Hurdles are practically guaranteed in this industry, but as young creators we are learning to be prepared and adapt to sudden changes and problems; thats the point of this project. With your help in aiding this project financially, it makes the mountains of problems look like ant hills. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If now isn't the time for you to help out financially, there are a multitude of others things that you can do to help out. Some of them being:

  • Go like and share the Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/switchbladeshortfilm to get updates on the project, as well as connect with others who are also looking forward to the film
  • Follow the film's twitter account for some exclusive content and stay up to date on the film's progress at https://twitter.com/Switchblade2018
  • Even if you'd like to pray for the cast and crew, [that we remain safe, on track and meet our goals] it will help us tremendously knowing that we have your support

Last but not least, thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to learn more about this short film! Again, if you have any questions or concerns, do not hesitate to ask by clicking on the link above.

story:
Presentation

My name is Gabriela Concha. I’m a Peruvian photographer currently working on a movie and photobook project of a mining camp in southern Peru. I have been invited for a summer artist residency at The Hollows Art Space located in Brooklyn, New York, USA from June 1, 2017 until October 1, 2017 during which I’ll be editing the projects and will also have the opportunity to participate in their exhibitions and programming events.

 ‘Open Pit’, in Spanish ‘Tajo Abierto’, refers to an open wound on the surface of a terrain. The company that temporarily owns the place is engaged in the extraction of copper using open pit mining.

The main characters of this story are the eldest women, including my mother, who have lived there for over thirty years. Most of them don’t work for the company and cannot professionally develop freely since it’s a secluded little place, thus having to assume the role of housewives. 

It is also a personal story since I was born and lived there for seventeen years. After a long time I return to confirm that something blocks my recognition of this place, unleashing a desire of claim and reconciliation. From this event I sought to understand the notion of time and distance that is experienced in a place that, because of its size and isolation, has other characteristics. I unfold a territory with big gardens that have a beautiful view of the mountains, but the ideal landscape between its cuts ends up giving away. The texts that complete the landscape speak of distance, of mirages and of dreams, with the intention of filling its void or integrating it.

You can see a selection of pictures from the photobook here:

http://gabrielaconchafotos.blogspot.pe/search/l...

 

Finance

The budget is $4000 for covering the fee for a room and a studio space in The Hollows Art Space, which is $1200 per month.

 

 

If your contributions go over the goal, you will help in the production cost of printing the photo book for 2018!

 

Impact

 

I believe this project is important to my generation, to my mother’s generation and to all women that are victims of symbolic violence. It is also an important story about motherhood, emotional distance, and reconciliation.

The photographs have been shown in a Collective exhibition in Casa Fugaz gallery, Callao, Peru in 2016. For the photobook in process, I was also granted the opportunity to get my portfolio viewed during Transatlántica PhotoEspaña festival in Centro Cultural España, Lima.

Taking the project to New York will be a big step for its editing and finalization. The Hollows Artist Residency's goal is to create a multicultural and multidisciplinary art space in Brooklyn where  I will get to share my lasts steps of the editing process with other artists and the residency's curators.

 

Other ways you can help

 

If you like the project but can't collaborate, that doesn't mean you can't help. You can use Indiegogo's tools to share it with your contacts and friends!

story:
https://www.timetravelinginbitspieces.com

Campaign, Film & All That Jazz!

Hi! Hello! I can see you there, you know. Oh, did I get your attention? Great! My name is Rimute Budreviciute, but I really just go by Terra - it's better for everyone. You may wonder why I summoned you here today. Well, let me tell you...It's a very long story, but I'll try to keep it brief. 

A few years ago, I had a dream, and in that dream I saw a boy, a girl, and a blue wall of energy. I woke up the next morning, wrote it down, and that's how the Time Traveling in Bits & Pieces universe was born. From that moment on, creation never stopped. I wrote, I destroyed the pages, I broke my computer and destroyed a few lovely notebooks, but never gave up! And here I am, a few years later doing this wonderful campaign for a short film that's based upon that same universe! 

The story of Memory is not complicated. It follows a fallen hero, Alex, as she gets stuck in an astral projection and has to navigate her way out by facing her memories. Sounds simple, right? Not so fast, cowboy. All of her memories are a collection of events ("scenes") taken from season 1 of Time Traveling in Bits & Pieces, and they feature the most amazing characters that you could ever imagine! 

Which brings us to this next part...

What do you get and why should you help us?

As much as we would like to, we can't make this project alone - and we need your help! So c'mon, jump into one of our spaceships and let's fly into orbit around planet Money for a bit.

Our target goal is 25,000$. Here's the break down on where your money will be going: 

  1. The Studio. In order to film this piece, we will need to rent a studio for at least 5 days. We are not only filming the short, but also the full scenes, so you can enjoy it, and we can have great footage to show once we start pitching our series!
  2. The Set. The set is very elaborate. I mean, it's a crazy set. We have Victorian corridors, spaceships, command rooms, castles - all kinds of places! And most of them will have to be built. Yeah, you can already imagine how much is that going to cost. 
  3. Costumes & Props. We're aiming for quality entertainment, not just some third-rate-short. We want to give you the best we've got, therefore we want every detail to be perfect. Costumes are very important to this story! 
  4. Commercials & Festival Fees. Beyond pitching, we also want this short to circle around in festivals. It's a great story on its own and it should be told on big screens too!

You want to know what you get out of it, don't you? Well, I can say that our perk list is pretty impressive. We have posters, stickers, shoutouts, official 'thank you' credits, CDs, DVDs and much much more. We also have an array of hidden perks - you will have to scavenge through our social media to find those, but I can guarantee, you won't be disappointed. 

In the unlikely event that we don't raise the amount we need, we will work with what we've got. the entire team is dedicated to the project and we won't let this just pass. So even if we don't raise the amount, don't worry, we won't let it waste. Also, did I mention that entire cast & crew works for free? Yes, that's how dedicated we are. And on that note...

Meet the Team!

You already know me, but what about the rest of my wonderful crew? Well, here's just some of them. 

Bessy Adut, Co-director

Hey! This is Bessy. I have a BA degree in Film & Television from Istanbul; MFA degree in Film Directing from CalArts and a professional screenwriting certificate from UCLA! I've been working on film sets for over 10 years now. I wrote, directed, produced several short films and promo videos. I've also worked on movies, commercials and television projects wearing several different hats. I aspire to become an accomplished international writer/director and send good messages to the world. My most recent passion project was a short film I wrote and directed "That Cake" for the 2nd Act Film Festival. Fun strange fact about me: I feel like my cats are my adopted kids and when people find that strange, I find them strange.

Jake Lefkowitz, the Composer

Hey everyone! I'm Jake Lefkowitz and I am a  film composer, musician, and audio engineer with influences and inspirations from composers such as John Williams and Alan Silvestri to Gustav Holst. I have studied at SAE NYC, where I was able to develop my audio engineering and production skills and I am currently studying film scoring and video game scoring at Berklee College of Music. I love to work with filmmakers and connect with people. Music isn't just notes on a page to me; music is a language capable of connecting emotions and telling a story, and that is what I aim to do.

Jeremiah Goldston, Production Designer

What's up world?! My name is Jeremiah Goldston. I am a freelance conceptual design and storyboard artist, living and working in Albuquerque, NM. I recently graduated from the Southwest University of Visual Arts, here in Albuquerque. I have a BA in Illustration, with a minor in Graphic Design. My specialty is tech, vehicle, and weapon designs with some environment and costume work, primarily within the sci-fi genre, but I will also work in fantasy design as well.

 

Meet the Cast!

 

Or some of it. They are all cool people, I promise. 

Jamie Yun, Anna

Hello my name is Jamie Yun and I'm currently getting a bachelors in acting for film at New York Film Academy! I've been acting since the beginning of my freshman year in high school. I've always been interested in the arts (music, painting, etc).  I wanted to broaden my hobbies, so I tried out taking 'drama' as an elective at school- not having a clue that I would fall madly in love with it for life. I immediately became a theatre nerd and I have absolutely no regrets. My most recent project is an original comedy play that I got to be a part of in the beginning of June where I got to originate a character for the first time on stage!

Mikki Hernandez, Alex

Hey! I graduated from UCLA and worked in the corporate side of entertainment before pursuing acting. I decided the office life is not for me, started acting classes, and have been training at the Don Bloomfield Acting Studio for the past two and a half years. I also do voiceover, improv and have a background in dance. 

Nicola George, Sidero

Hey guys! I started theatre at the age of 10 and had my first lead role in a musical at the age of 14. I attended the prestigious Newtown High School of the performing arts and completed my high Diploma in Music, Dance and Drama with top marks and received and award for highest achievement in performing arts. Outside of acting I sing, play piano and love to do martial arts. Fun fact: I'm also a bellydancer. 

Patricia Mizen, Keket

Hello everyone! I am Patricia Mizen. I was raised in North Carolina and come from a military family.  I started on stage and my biggest passion is storytelling;  to bring characters to life and tell their story. My first professional training was in Boston at the Actors Theatre Institute.  I have worked on network shows such as Passions, NCIS, House of Cards and other independent films. I was also selected into UCLA's Professional Program and will receive a certificate of completion in September 2017.  I am looking forward in being the character of Keket and to be a part of this thrilling Sci-fi series. 

Katlin Clark, Natara

Hey! I am Kaitlin Clark, native to Boston, MA. I am trained in both theatre and film acting.  After falling in love with stage performance within my own community, I was driven to enter the Dramatic Arts program in New York’s Hofstra University. The Big Apple was the perfect place to feed my curiosities of the arts, culture and the world. The bustling, creative atmosphere gave me a chance to truly experiment, expand, study and explore my craft.  It was here that I began honing my art for film, getting cast in both supporting and lead roles of numerous productions. Since graduating, I moved to the City of Angels and continuously work in film, television, theatre and award-winning web series, with no signs of slowing down.  

Garrett Edell, Joshua Corbin

Hey! My name is Garrett. I  originally studied engineering in college and after graduation spend a lot of time doing automotive design until I realized that my true passion is acting. I have been acting for a little less than a year now. I have been in multiple short films and I am currently a lead in a play.

Dylan George, Radin Corbin

Hello everyone! My name is Dylan George and I originally wanted to be a video game designer, but fell in love with acting when a teacher at my elementary school asked me to be Velveteen Rabbit. Now I am studying at the Groundlings. I also produce my own short youtube videos! 

Final Words

So here you have it! You know me, you know what we need and why we need it, and you know the team! Now it's up to you to help us make this project happen! 

So thank you so much for stopping by and looking at our campaign! It means the world to us! If you can't donate, you can contribute in other ways! Share our campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, distant relatives - anyone! Help us tell the world our story and we will be forever thankful!

My most recent project is an original comedy play that I got to be a part of in the beginning of June where I got to originate a character for the first time on stage!
Mikki Hernandez, Alex
Hey! I graduated from UCLA and worked in the corporate side of entertainment before pursuing acting. I decided the office life is not for me, started acting classes, and have been training at the Don Bloomfield Acting Studio for the past two and a half years. I also do voiceover, improv and have a background in dance. 
Nicola George, Sidero
Hey guys! I started theatre at the age of 10 and had my first lead role in a musical at the age of 14. I attended the prestigious Newtown High School of the performing arts and completed my high Diploma in Music, Dance and Drama with top marks and received and award for highest achievement in performing arts. Outside of acting I sing, play piano and love to do martial arts. Fun fact: I'm also a bellydancer. 
Patricia Mizen, Keket
Hello everyone! I am Patricia Mizen. I was raised in North Carolina and come from a military family.  I started on stage and my biggest passion is storytelling;  to bring characters to life and tell their story. My first professional training was in Boston at the Actors Theatre Institute.  I have worked on network shows such as Passions, NCIS, House of Cards and other independent films. I was also selected into UCLA's Professional Program and will receive a certificate of completion in September 2017.  I am looking forward in being the character of Keket and to be a part of this thrilling Sci-fi series. 
Katlin Clark, Natara
Hey! I am Kaitlin Clark, native to Boston, MA. I am trained in both theatre and film acting.  After falling in love with stage performance within my own community, I was driven to enter the Dramatic Arts program in New York’s Hofstra University. The Big Apple was the perfect place to feed my curiosities of the arts, culture and the world. The bustling, creative atmosphere gave me a chance to truly experiment, expand, study and explore my craft.  It was here that I began honing my art for film, getting cast in both supporting and lead roles of numerous productions. Since graduating, I moved to the City of Angels and continuously work in film, television, theatre and award-winning web series, with no signs of slowing down.  
Garrett Edell, Joshua Corbin
Hey! My name is Garrett. I  originally studied engineering in college and after graduation spend a lot of time doing automotive design until I realized that my true passion is acting. I have been acting for a little less than a year now. I have been in multiple short films and I am currently a lead in a play.
Dylan George, Radin Corbin
Hello everyone! My name is Dylan George and I originally wanted to be a video game designer, but fell in love with acting when a teacher at my elementary school asked me to be Velveteen Rabbit. Now I am studying at the Groundlings. I also produce my own short youtube videos! 
Final Words

So here you have it! You know me, you know what we need and why we need it, and you know the team! Now it's up to you to help us make this project happen! 

So thank you so much for stopping by and looking at our campaign! It means the world to us! If you can't donate, you can contribute in other ways! Share our campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, distant relatives - anyone! Help us tell the world our story and we will be forever thankful!

story:
We the directors, Peter T.Breen and Sarah-Stephanie Skjoldevik were brought together whilst growing through our own painful experiences. Filmmaking was a joint passion and we realized there was a message that had to be shared, a message of hope.

Peter has his background in fashion and the arts. Through his lens, every shot looks like a painting on a wall or a page from Vogue. Sarah-Stephanie spent most of  her years in politics, diplomacy and business, but her heart is in storytelling and with her words she has written a script so raw and heartwarming it has amazed everyone involved.

We are both committed to Lighter full-time, and with a team of over 40 people our passion is becoming reality. Still there are certain costs involved in filmmaking and we simply can't afford them on our own. 

 

We are dividing 44 filming days over a  5 month period. Moving towards editing in October and music composition in the final months of the year. The final cut of Lighter will be done 1st of January 2018.

Below is a breakdown of the costs: 

  • Food on set: 1320,-
  • Costumes: 1240,-*
  • Props: 350,*
  • Locations: 1168,-
  • Travel for cast and crew: 1016,-
  • Accommodation: 330,-
  • Sound Recordist: 1460,-
  • 3 days Studio hire for Voice Over in Post Production: 900,-

Total: 7784,-

We are  grateful to anyone who wants to be part of our journey. Whether it be by sharing our campaign and liking our pages on social media, bringing food to cast and crew on set,  putting us in touch with someone you know who might be able to help (sound recordist, sound recording studio, accommodation in London), or simply giving us encouraging words when all seems to fail.

*We buy all our costumes second hand, to keep the production as sustainable as possible. Costumes will be donated to actors and charity shops when we finish filming. 

*Examples of props we buy are herbal cigarettes, they are between 15-20 pounds per pack on Amazon. We dont want our actors smoking real cigarettes on set, when they have managed to quit the habit in real life. 

 

Sharing raw stories based on real people, facing the challenges each and every human face, we hope to help those watching face their own personal struggles. Hopefully shifting their minds so that some struggles can be viewed as opportunities for growth and change.

Touching on  difficult topics like mental health, addiction, domestic violence, poverty, abuse and grief. We draw on true experiences and offer an insight into how one can overcome these. This way of living has given us a new freedom and happiness and we hope many more can benefit from it after watching Lighter.

 

This is our first feature film and we are learning something new each and everyday. It is a steep growth and learning curve, but we are enjoying every moment and it intuitively feels right.

Because we are a small team, we are working very hard. Peter and Sarah-Stephanie are basically doing the job of  20 people in a normal production team. We forgot that weekends exist and one week in production feels like a month in real life. 

Our asset is: we both have an eclectic skills background, and they suplement each other. 

 

If you go to our gallery you can see some of the cast and crew on Lighter. We feel so blessed to be working with each and every individual. It feels like a big family!

story:
Why "Hands Down - An Arm Wrestling Docu-Journey"? 

My name is Christopher Bruce, owner of Bruce Productions.  My passion is in bringing life to my own and others stories through video and film projects.  We all have a story to tell and there is an audience for every story.

When a good friend and client, Jamie Pagliei from US Masonry and Chimney, came to me with an idea of supporting this young guy suffering from Spina Bifida he met at a recent Arm Wrestling Tournament in Philadelphia I was immediately interested to learn more.  My first thought was this needs to be a documentary and people would love to hear this story.  Other than the popular 80's Stallone hit "Over The Top" there really hasn't been anything significant done to shine a light on the world of Arm Wrestling let alone involving a guy overcoming incredible odds and competing with Spina Bifida.  

The more we dug into the potential of the story, the more it was clear it needed to happen and that we could deliver a truly unique experience to the viewer.  

A Journey to a Foreign Land...CHECK 

Compelling and Inspirational Characters...CHECK 

Conflict and Adversity...CHECK 

Insight Into a New and Exciting World...CHECK 

Contributors to this project can feel great that they are supporting TEAM USA and their mission to compete in the World Championships in Budapest as a portion of the proceeds are going to cover transportation and housing costs.  Funds collected through this campaign will also go towards the filming and completion of the documentary capturing the whole journey while offering us all an opportunity to get lost in the world of Arm Wrestling far beyond our lunchroom tables in grade school.

What We Need & What You Get

Our Tiered Goals Broken Down:

  • We need $10,000 to cover the transportation and housing cost to travel and compete at the World Championships in Budapest while representing Team USA. This initial level will ensure we are there to capture the meat of the journey and story following Eric Komar and his Coach/Fellow Competitor Chris Myers from Chittenango, NY where they live and train to Budapest, Hungary and back.  
  • If we hit $25,000 in this campaign, it will ensure we have money to set up additional interviews with key people in the sport, capture local arm wrestling tournaments and spend more time with our main subjects to dig further into their backgrounds and personal stories.
  • If we are fortunate enough to reach our $50,000 goal, it will allow us to smoothly roll into to post production and give us the best chance to position "HANDS DOWN" into various Film Festivals gaining invaluable exposure and feedback.  

ABOUT THE PERKS: Our perks are designed to get you involved at whatever level you are able while feeling like you are a real part of making this project happen.  Please review the perks and let us know if you think we are missing something.  Whether we give you a virtual HIGH FIVE or you jump on as an EXECUTIVE PRODUCER, you matter to us and we cannot thank you enough for your trust and support! 

  • We are determined to finish what we have started and are committed to fulfilling our promise.  "Hands Down - An Arm Wrestling Documentary Journey" will be completed and any supporters who have generously given to our campaign will be awarded the perks they signed up for no matter what.  

Risks & Challenges

With any film project there are hurdles to cross and obstacles to overcome but we are a determined and hard working group dedicated to finishing what we start and delivering on our promises.  We have already secured a number of opportunities to capture local Arm Wrestling Tournaments and are working closely with Eric and Chris along the way.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Everyone can help simply by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.

Hands Down...We Can Not Do It Without You! 

Thank You

Chris and Jamie

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

Come Back is an Indie/Drama about Mara, a 24 year old woman, who has decided to leave a 2 year relationship. She and Jason (26) met through online dating and their whirlwind courtship has led them to be living together and engaged by their 1st anniversary. However, getting together too quickly may have caused them to overlook some serious flaws in their relationship and communication, which has caused much fighting and distress on both sides.  Now, two years on, Mara can’t take it anymore and has decided to leave.  On her way out she begins to reminisce on the good and bad times they had together, and a plea from Jason to return has Mara second-guessing her decision.  Will she continue on to start a new life elsewhere, or will she return to try to patch things up with Jason?

 

   

CREATIVE STATEMENT

Come Back is a story about a young woman who is trying to decide where she wants to be in life.  She has made a number of somewhat rash decisions, which have led her to this point in her life, so she reflects on the events that had brought her there.  The complexity of her emotions will provide us with an opportunity to explore unique cinematic styles that will take the viewer on a journey with Mara, through her relationship with Jason and through her struggle to figure out if she is making the right decision to abandon her relationship.  

   


MEET THE CREW

Aimee Cheung - Producer/Director/Writer


Aimee is an up-and-coming Producer/Director/Writer from Melbourne, Australia.  She has already produced a number of projects, including her Martini Award nominated Postcard ‘Connection’.  She has a background in Psychological Sciences, which drives her to find a deeper understanding of the human condition through film and writing.    

 https://vimeo.com/218258745     

https://vimeo.com/232644647


Jachin Dahlitz - Cinematographer


Jachin is a young Cinematographer whose works shows the skill and maturity of someone well beyond his years.  His unique visual style will elevate this production to a standard well beyond that of a regular student film.  His production ‘Awake’ won Best Digital Postcard at the 2017 JMC Academy Martini Awards.     

https://vimeo.com/230533897     

https://vimeo.com/234158815

 

STYLE

The film will be told very much through Mara’s perspective.  Almost everything that is shown will have been something that she has observed.  The film is told in present day and flashbacks, which will utilise different camera styles to represent the different time periods and characters emotions.


WHAT WE NEED

The overall production’s budget is $1000 and primarily focused on the following elements:

Location - $400 - Location is critical to a film’s believability and success.  A film’s location is the most important and active aspect of the film.


Catering - $300 - Catering is one of the most important aspects of the film.  As we will be unable to pay anyone for their time in helping the production, we will need to ensure that they are well fed to keep their energies alive.

Make-up/Wardrobe - $100 -

Transport - $100 -

Promotional - $100 -

Production design and props will be donate by crew and friends.

story:
Before Queen Elizabeth II. Before Queen Victoria. Before Henry VIII. Wolves roamed the UK wilderness. 500 years after the last wolf was hunted and killed in Britain, efforts are now being made to reintroduce them to the Scottish Isles.

What is the film about?

Return of the Wolves will be a 1 x 1 hour long documentary investigating the reintroduction of wolves to the UK. Interviewing experts, the documentary aims to inform the audience about the ecological impact wolves could have on the landscape, and include personal accounts from those affected by the presence of the animals. Now that beavers have been successfully re-introduced, could wolves be the next logical step towards re-wilding Britain?

Return of the Wolves is an ambitious project which aims to film in multiple locations across the UK and overseas in Europe. With your investment, we will travel to Rome to film wolves in the wild, as well as interview well-known wolf conservationist, Luigi Boitani. In the height of discussions surrounding global ecological changes, we believe this film is an exciting and engaging project for you to become a part of.

"Rewilding is the most important issue facing humanity today, with the potential to reduce the costs and burdens on future generations, allowing them to thrive on our planet. Creating a Britain that could welcome and sustain the wolves return is perhaps the most relevant sign that we have accepted the responsibility to hand our planet on to future generations and accept the challenges of creating land use efficiency and environmental sustainability.  Creating a vivid documentary that showcases the challenges and benefits of bringing wolves back to the UK, and how that will cause a cascade of benefits for all our wildlife is the most pressing issue in nature conservation today. Such a documentary is vital to engaging and inspiring the next generation of nature conservationists." Peter Smith, co-founder and director at The Wildwood Trust.

“Return of the Wolves will examine a very controversial issue which has been in discussion at many rewilding talks for several years now. Just what would happen is the wolf returned to the UK, can it return and how could it adapt in our modern Britain? I am very supportive of this crowdfunder, as I believe that it is a documentary that needs to be made and a topic needing to be discussed. How likely will the wolf be returned to Great Britain  and could it survive in our modern world of agriculture and farming or do other things need to happen first? Well if you help sponsor this crowdfunder, you just may find out the answer” Anneka Svenska – Wildlife Presenter, Wolf Expert and Conservationist

What do we need?

In order to make Return of the Wolves  the highest standard production we can, we are going to need your help. Producing a film can quickly become a very expensive undertaking, especially when there are plans to film in multiple locations. So, should you choose to support us, here is a breakdown of where your money will go: 

Travel and Accommodation - The main bulk of our production costs will go towards travel. With your investment we plan to travel to Rome, Scotland, Reading, and Devon (among other places) and therefore will need to cover travel and accommodation costs to each location.

Hiring a Cinematographer - We want to work with the best crew we can. To increase the visual quality of our production, we aspire to hire in a professional wildlife cinematographer to capture our wild wolf footage.

Music Production - Similarly, music is key in holding together a documentary production and we want an original soundtrack composed and produced for our documentary.

All of this costs money and that is where you come in! Please donate anything you can to help us make this project a reality. In return for your pledges, we have some exclusive perks up for grabs. These include: 

  • Having your name credited in the film
  • Digital downloads and BTS footage
  • Physical DVD copies of the film
  • Invitations to our film premiere

This is an amazing opportunity for us to produce a film that could kick start our careers in the creative industries. We cannot wait for you to get involved!

Meet the Team 

G. Tuffen - Director. It was G's passion for wolves that led us down the route of investigating their reintroduction to the UK. She has previously worked as an ambitious and effective leader and director on both film and television productions. Other than her love for the four-legged animals she is a focused and hardworking individual that has a drive like no other. 

Shannon Devine - Producer. As someone with a substantial appreciation for the arts, Shannon has always been interested in exploring creative ideas. After first falling in love with cinematography, she has more recently branched into producing and project management with documentary and factual programming at the core of her interests.

Ben Stockdale - Editor. Ben has always been interested in film making and has recently worked with independent film companies to create feature-length films. He is also a photographer and green-screen editor for a party company, and recently produced his dad’s wedding video!

We are delighted to now be working with wildlife camera operator, Leanne Gater, from Wild Films Ltd. Leanne is an award-winning photographer and filmmaker who's work has been exhibited all over the world. Her most recent film, The Tigers of Scotland, explores the fragile existence of Scottish Wildcats and their conservation.

Working In Partnership With

Peter Smith - Co-founder and Director at The Wildwood Trust. Peter has been a leading proponent of rewilding since the start of his career over 20 years ago. He has been at the forefront of efforts to reintroduce animals such as the beaver, wild horses, lynx and wolves for ecological restoration. 

Mike Collins - Site Manager and Wolf Keeper at the UK Wolf Conservation Trust. Mike is a trained animal behaviourist who has worked alongside wolves as both keeper and photographer for many years. He cares for 10 grey wolves, 9 of which have been hand raised and socialised to human interaction, working with the UKWCT to dispell myths of the big bad wolf.

Luigi Boitani - Co-author of "Biology and Conservation of the Wolf" and Professor at the Sapienza Universita Di Roma. Luigi attended his first conference on the reintroduction of wolves to Scotland in 1978. Since then has attended several events on similar topics believing reintroduction would be a trivial experiment from a biological viewpoint but also a fantastically complicated experiment in human dimension.

Philip Stevens - our Mentor and Executive Producer. Phil is a film and theatre director, writer and producer. His work has been selected for festivals around the world and has won numerous international awards. He also produces and directs documentaries, the most recent of which include 'Bank's Endeavour' a short documentary on the life of Sir Joseph Banks, featuring Sir David Attenborough. 

The Impact

Return of the Wolves aims to educate you on the reintroduction of large predators to the UK, with the intention of reducing the stigma surrounding the animals. We are going into the project open to change depending on which way the evidence takes us, but are personally in support of re-wilding Britain. This shall not, however, affect the way the documentary is made. We will interview a range of people who support and are against the reintroduction. As this documentary is investigating whether the proposal would work in the UK, it is vital that people are educated on the positive and negative consequences in a way that is both engaging and entertaining. 

“When they hear about us talking about reintroducing wolves they
immediately imagine packs of wolves ravishing all the sheep in the uplands,
running amok and rushing down the precinct to tear down a grandmother or two!” 

Chris Packham, Rewilding Britain

Risks and Challenges:

What could go wrong?

We plan to shoot interviews with experts, those who have more personal, first-hand experiences with wolves, as well as those who could be negatively affected by the return of the animals. Intercut with these interviews will be shots of wolves, deer, and sweeping landscapes - if it's likely to contribute positively to a nature documentary it'll be there. Unfortunately, nature is never  predictable. If we are unable to get the natural footage we desire, we have a back up plan to film wolves in a more controlled environment. If this also doesn't go to plan, we intend to purchase the highest quality stock footage to make up for lost images. 

At all times, Iris Productions will be following extensive shooting plans, adhering to health and safety protocols and making sure you're money is being put to its best possible use. If there are ever any serious setbacks relating to the production of the film, we will be sure to keep you updated via our social media sites and via the hashtag #ROTWFilm. 

What else can you do?

We realise that not everyone will feel they are able to financially support this campaign and that's fine! We really appreciate you taking the time to get excited about the project. If you would like to help out in other ways, you can: 

  • Share this campaign on your social media accounts - use the hashtag #ROTWFilm so we can see it and we'll be sure to thank you personally!
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to keep up to date with what's going on at all stages of the production. 
  • Spread the word about the film and help get others to get as excited as we are. Tell your friends, your family, your boss, shout it from the rooftops! 

Thank you! 

Once again, we'd like to say a final thank you for showing your interest in our ambitious project and campaign. This is such an amazing opportunity for us to kick start our careers. Research and pre-production are well underway but we cannot wait to get started on production to make a nature documentary that you'll be proud to be a part of. 

The Iris Production Team.
story_txt:
Before Queen Elizabeth II. Before Queen Victoria. Before Henry VIII. Wolves roamed the UK wilderness. 500 years after the last wolf was hunted and killed in Britain, efforts are now being made to reintroduce them to the Scottish Isles.

What is the film about?
Return of the Wolves will be a 1 x 1 hour long documentary investigating the reintroduction of wolves to the UK. Interviewing experts, the documentary aims to inform the audience about the ecological impact wolves could have on the landscape, and include personal accounts from those affected by the presence of the animals. Now that beavers have been successfully re-introduced, could wolves be the next logical step towards re-wilding Britain?
Return of the Wolves is an ambitious project which aims to film in multiple locations across the UK and overseas in Europe. With your investment, we will travel to Rome to film wolves in the wild, as well as interview well-known wolf conservationist, Luigi Boitani. In the height of discussions surrounding global ecological changes, we believe this film is an exciting and engaging project for you to become a part of.
"Rewilding is the most important issue facing humanity today, with the potential to reduce the costs and burdens on future generations, allowing them to thrive on our planet. Creating a Britain that could welcome and sustain the wolves return is perhaps the most relevant sign that we have accepted the responsibility to hand our planet on to future generations and accept the challenges of creating land use efficiency and environmental sustainability.  Creating a vivid documentary that showcases the challenges and benefits of bringing wolves back to the UK, and how that will cause a cascade of benefits for all our wildlife is the most pressing issue in nature conservation today. Such a documentary is vital to engaging and inspiring the next generation of nature conservationists." Peter Smith, co-founder and director at The Wildwood Trust.
“Return of the Wolves will examine a very controversial issue which has been in discussion at many rewilding talks for several years now. Just what would happen is the wolf returned to the UK, can it return and how could it adapt in our modern Britain? I am very supportive of this crowdfunder, as I believe that it is a documentary that needs to be made and a topic needing to be discussed. How likely will the wolf be returned to Great Britain  and could it survive in our modern world of agriculture and farming or do other things need to happen first? Well if you help sponsor this crowdfunder, you just may find out the answer” Anneka Svenska – Wildlife Presenter, Wolf Expert and Conservationist

What do we need?
In order to make Return of the Wolves  the highest standard production we can, we are going to need your help. Producing a film can quickly become a very expensive undertaking, especially when there are plans to film in multiple locations. So, should you choose to support us, here is a breakdown of where your money will go: 
Travel and Accommodation - The main bulk of our production costs will go towards travel. With your investment we plan to travel to Rome, Scotland, Reading, and Devon (among other places) and therefore will need to cover travel and accommodation costs to each location.
Hiring a Cinematographer - We want to work with the best crew we can. To increase the visual quality of our production, we aspire to hire in a professional wildlife cinematographer to capture our wild wolf footage.
Music Production - Similarly, music is key in holding together a documentary production and we want an original soundtrack composed and produced for our documentary.
All of this costs money and that is where you come in! Please donate anything you can to help us make this project a reality. In return for your pledges, we have some exclusive perks up for grabs. These include: 

Having your name credited in the film
Digital downloads and BTS footage
Physical DVD copies of the film
Invitations to our film premiere

This is an amazing opportunity for us to produce a film that could kick start our careers in the creative industries. We cannot wait for you to get involved!
Meet the Team 


G. Tuffen - Director. It was G's passion for wolves that led us down the route of investigating their reintroduction to the UK. She has previously worked as an ambitious and effective leader and director on both film and television productions. Other than her love for the four-legged animals she is a focused and hardworking individual that has a drive like no other. 
Shannon Devine - Producer. As someone with a substantial appreciation for the arts, Shannon has always been interested in exploring creative ideas. After first falling in love with cinematography, she has more recently branched into producing and project management with documentary and factual programming at the core of her interests.
Ben Stockdale - Editor. Ben has always been interested in film making and has recently worked with independent film companies to create feature-length films. He is also a photographer and green-screen editor for a party company, and recently produced his dad’s wedding video!

We are delighted to now be working with wildlife camera operator, Leanne Gater, from Wild Films Ltd. Leanne is an award-winning photographer and filmmaker who's work has been exhibited all over the world. Her most recent film, The Tigers of Scotland, explores the fragile existence of Scottish Wildcats and their conservation.
Working In Partnership With
Peter Smith - Co-founder and Director at The Wildwood Trust. Peter has been a leading proponent of rewilding since the start of his career over 20 years ago. He has been at the forefront of efforts to reintroduce animals such as the beaver, wild horses, lynx and wolves for ecological restoration. 

Mike Collins - Site Manager and Wolf Keeper at the UK Wolf Conservation Trust. Mike is a trained animal behaviourist who has worked alongside wolves as both keeper and photographer for many years. He cares for 10 grey wolves, 9 of which have been hand raised and socialised to human interaction, working with the UKWCT to dispell myths of the big bad wolf.

Luigi Boitani - Co-author of "Biology and Conservation of the Wolf" and Professor at the Sapienza Universita Di Roma. Luigi attended his first conference on the reintroduction of wolves to Scotland in 1978. Since then has attended several events on similar topics believing reintroduction would be a trivial experiment from a biological viewpoint but also a fantastically complicated experiment in human dimension.

Philip Stevens - our Mentor and Executive Producer. Phil is a film and theatre director, writer and producer. His work has been selected for festivals around the world and has won numerous international awards. He also produces and directs documentaries, the most recent of which include 'Bank's Endeavour' a short documentary on the life of Sir Joseph Banks, featuring Sir David Attenborough. 


The Impact
Return of the Wolves aims to educate you on the reintroduction of large predators to the UK, with the intention of reducing the stigma surrounding the animals. We are going into the project open to change depending on which way the evidence takes us, but are personally in support of re-wilding Britain. This shall not, however, affect the way the documentary is made. We will interview a range of people who support and are against the reintroduction. As this documentary is investigating whether the proposal would work in the UK, it is vital that people are educated on the positive and negative consequences in a way that is both engaging and entertaining. 
“When they hear about us talking about reintroducing wolves theyimmediately imagine packs of wolves ravishing all the sheep in the uplands,running amok and rushing down the precinct to tear down a grandmother or two!” 
Chris Packham, Rewilding Britain


Risks and Challenges:
What could go wrong?
We plan to shoot interviews with experts, those who have more personal, first-hand experiences with wolves, as well as those who could be negatively affected by the return of the animals. Intercut with these interviews will be shots of wolves, deer, and sweeping landscapes - if it's likely to contribute positively to a nature documentary it'll be there. Unfortunately, nature is never  predictable. If we are unable to get the natural footage we desire, we have a back up plan to film wolves in a more controlled environment. If this also doesn't go to plan, we intend to purchase the highest quality stock footage to make up for lost images. 
At all times, Iris Productions will be following extensive shooting plans, adhering to health and safety protocols and making sure you're money is being put to its best possible use. If there are ever any serious setbacks relating to the production of the film, we will be sure to keep you updated via our social media sites and via the hashtag #ROTWFilm. 

What else can you do?
We realise that not everyone will feel they are able to financially support this campaign and that's fine! We really appreciate you taking the time to get excited about the project. If you would like to help out in other ways, you can: 

Share this campaign on your social media accounts - use the hashtag #ROTWFilm so we can see it and we'll be sure to thank you personally!
Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to keep up to date with what's going on at all stages of the production. 
Spread the word about the film and help get others to get as excited as we are. Tell your friends, your family, your boss, shout it from the rooftops! 

Thank you! 
Once again, we'd like to say a final thank you for showing your interest in our ambitious project and campaign. This is such an amazing opportunity for us to kick start our careers. Research and pre-production are well underway but we cannot wait to get started on production to make a nature documentary that you'll be proud to be a part of. 
The Iris Production Team.

story:
Phoenix Tears: The Rick Simpson Story

 

Hello!
My name is Mike Wise and I am an independent filmmaker. I was a Producer on 'The Best Democracy Money Can Buy' (2016) and a Director on 'Illegally Alive' (2017) which can be seen here for free: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CQEV5O7tfVY.

 

When I was researching my last film, I came across a gentleman by the name of Rick Simpson. I had heard many things, but nobody really knew anything about him. We all know that he rediscovered nature's cure for cancer by healing himself, and then began giving the oil out to patients; but we do not know much else. I have been dealing with crohns disease, arthritis, and a host of anxiety issues my entire life; so when I heard about this oil it really peaked my interest, both as a filmmaker and as a cannabis patient. I immediately thought, if this oil could work for cancer; imagine what else it could work for!?! I eventually ingested 90 grams of this oil over a 120 day period and cured my crohns disease!! So I flew out to meet the man himself over in Europe in November 2016. We had many coffees together and shot an interview. We also traveled to Ljubljana, Slovenia to record at a patients event there. His passion and dedication to the cause immediately inspired me to shoot this project. However,  a year into production I realized that I can not do this alone, and desperately need your help. Getting this information out there will save thousands of lives, and with your help we will make an epic film that will be remembered for generations to come!! Let's do this together.
- Mike W. 

Director, Phoenix Tears Movie 

 

We have filmed in the United States, Greece, Morocco, Spain, Germany, Holland, Slovenia, and Croatia. I would like to get interviews with all the patients who were featured in Run From The Cure, Rick's first film, which came out over 20 years ago. They are all still with us today! 

 

I would also like to get interviews with some of the other leading researchers around the world, particularly from Spain and Israel. We will interview other patients who cured their terminal diseases using cannabis oil in an effort to make the fact that cannabis is medicine undeniable worldwide!

 

What We Need

Here is a breakdown of where the funds will go:

 

Rewards/Perks

We are looking for Producers and Co-Producers to help finish our film.

Full details can be found in the sidebar:

 

The Impact

This film will have a huge impact in our global fight against the pharmaceutical industry. So many people are dying every single day because of their reliance on pharmaceuticals. This film will help raise awareness around the world about natural, safe healing practices that will literally save the lives of hundreds of thousands around the globe, possibly millions!! The Director of Rick's first film has not been seen in over 3 years. Nobody knows where he is and many speculate that he was bought off by the pharmaceutical industry. I have a proven track record of fighting the establishment, and I pledge to you that nothing can force me to back down from this project if we get the funding needed to complete this film! We both know about the healing properties of this oil, now help me share this message with the world!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that many of you would like to help the cause but can not financially contribute at this time. That is totally okay because you can still help us by sharing our campaign across your various social media platforms! It all helps us reach our goal. Thank You!!

story:
SINOPSIS

La discriminación de género es un hecho en nuestra sociedad. Muchas mujeres son continuamente tratadas de manera vejatoria sin que a veces ni siquiera ellas mismas se den cuenta. El machismo está tan arraigado a nuestro alrededor que para muchas personas es poco más que una leyenda urbana.

Para concienciar al público de esta realidad es necesario mostrarles historias reales en primera persona y apelar a su empatía. Si esas historias proceden de personas a quienes conocen, admiran, referentes con quienes se puedan identificar, tendrán una fuerza mayor. La importancia del deporte desde la infancia hace de las mujeres deportistas personajes propicios para hacer precisamente eso: contar su historia. Al hacerlo, irán saliendo a la luz los diferentes matices de la desigualdad de género, que serán subrayados por intervenciones de otras personas vinculadas en diferentes grados con el mundo del deporte.

Lo que ocurre en nuestro deporte no es más que un reflejo de la sociedad en la que vivimos. Poner de manifiesto la situación de discriminación de género en el deporte y proponer ideas para su erradicación, puede ayudar a cambiar una sociedad anclada en valores que han quedado obsoletos.

¿TE ANIMAS A SER PARTE DEL CAMBIO?

 

“Mis padres y hermanos fueron reyes de Esparta. Yo, Cynisca, vencedora con un carro de veloces corceles, erijo esta estatua. Y afirmo que, de todas las mujeres de Grecia, soy la única en haber ganado esta corona.”

 

 

EL DOCUMENTAL

En los últimos años y, sobre todo, a raíz de los Juegos Olímpicos de Río se ha puesto de manifiesto el diferente trato que las deportistas reciben en medios de comunicación con respecto a los hombres. Una discriminación que es sólo un reflejo público de lo que estas mujeres viven en su día a día al realizar su actividad profesional.

Lo que ocurre en el deporte no es sino una manifestación de un problema global. Pero gracias a su gran repercusión mediática, cualquier paso que se dé en el mundo del deporte para deshacerse de esta lacra se convertiría inmediatamente en un ejemplo a seguir en el resto de nuestra sociedad.

Este documental pretende mostrar la situación actual de discriminación que se interpone en el día a día de las mujeres deportistas. Queremos mostrar cuánto se ha avanzado y cuánto queda aún por conseguir, en el convencimiento de que cualquier paso dado en la dirección correcta tendrá consecuencias mucho más allá del mundo del deporte.

Para lograr la concienciación del espectador es necesario ofrecerle historias y personas reales con las cuales empatizar. Para ello contamos con el testimonio de varias deportistas de élite tanto retiradas como en activo, y otras personas más o menos relacionadas con el mundo del deporte, quienes nos contarán sus experiencias a lo largo de su carrera.

A través de las entrevistas profundizaremos en las diferentes maneras en que la discriminación de género se manifiesta: sexualización del deporte en la infancia; vulneración de los derechos de las mujeres en el deporte; diferencia en los sueldos, presupuestos e incentivos económicos; falta de visibilidad en los medios de comunicación, titulares machistas y fotografías ofensivas publicados en diferentes medios; menor reconocimiento a pesar de los logros obtenidos; dificultades para encontrar patrocinios; falta de apoyo a la profesionalización; ausencia de mujeres en cuerpos técnicos y/o federaciones; excesiva atención sobre la apariencia física de una deportista e incluso utilización de su cuerpo como espectáculo; uso sexista del lenguaje…

A partir de esta información y de los datos recogidos previa investigación al rodaje y contrastados por expertos en la materia, mostraremos propuestas para combatir esta desigualdad. Cualquier avance en la lucha por la igualdad de género en el deporte podría convertirse en el origen de un cambio global que beneficie a las mujeres de todos los sectores sociales.

 

 

NUESTRAS PROTAGONISTAS

Deportistas de élite, entrenadoras, periodista deportiva. Mujeres a las que conocemos y admiramos, grandes referentes que lo han dado todo por el deporte de nuestro país.

Son historia y son sus historias las que vamos a conocer con este documental.

Ellas son nuestras Hijas de Cynisca.

Si quieres conocerlas más a fondo visita nuestra web:

 

 

A QUÉ DESTINAREMOS VUESTRAS APORTACIONES

Te necesitamos para llevar a cabo esta película. Hacer un largometraje documental conlleva un esfuerzo humano y económico muy importante. Gracias a vuestro apoyo podremos hacer frente a la realización de este proyecto.

Las aportaciones obtenidas con el crowdfunding las utilizaremos para:

-Gastos generados en el Rodaje (grabación de entrevistas y recursos en Madrid, Alicante, Guadalajara y Barcelona).

  • Remuneración del equipo técnico.
  • Transporte, comida y alojamiento.
  • Altas y seguros de rodaje.
  • Material de rodaje.
  • Localizaciones.

-Montaje y Postproducción:

  • Montaje del documental.
  • Postproducción de imagen y grafismo.
  • Etalonaje.
  • Adquisición de material de archivo.
  • Ilustraciones y animación.
  • Diseño, postproducción y mezcla de sonido.
  • Composición y grabación de música original.
  • Masters.

-Distribución, Promoción, Marketing, Comunicación:

  • Realización de trailers y teasers.
  • Diseño de poster, carátula y galleta.
  • Diseño de página web.
  • Distribución: pago a distribuidora, fees, copias, envíos, proyecciones.
  • Marketing y Comunicación.
  • Estreno.
  • Recompensas del crowdfunding.
  • Etc.

Si queréis información más detallada, podéis escribirnos a info@hijasdecynisca.com

Y si no podéis ayudarnos económicamente con el crowdfunding:

  • Hablad del proyecto a amigos/as, familiares, compañeros/as de trabajo.
  • Compartid y dad me gusta a nuestros vídeos y publicaciones en redes sociales.
  • Haced que lleguemos al máximo de gente con nuestro proyecto.
  • Compartid el enlace de indiegogo con el mayor número posible de personas.

¡Necesitamos la mayor difusión posible y toda la colaboración que se pueda!

¡FORMA PARTE DE ESTE DOCUMENTAL PARA CONSEGUIR UN FUTURO MEJOR!

 

QUIÉNES SOMOS

Detrás de Hijas De Cynisca hay un equipo de personas comprometidas, con un gran talento y que comparten el deseo común de vivir en un mundo más justo, en el que no exista la desigualdad de género.

Puedes ver fotos del equipo, biofilmografías y enlaces en nuestra página web:

Capitaneando este equipo se encuentra nuestra Cynisca jefa, Beatriz Carretero. Productora incansable, directora y coguionista del documental. Apasionada, luchadora y soñadora empedernida, Bea es amante y fiel seguidora del deporte femenino desde que tiene uso de razón. Inconformista nata y defensora acérrima de la mujer y de sus derechos, se ha dejado la piel en este proyecto, ha dado el 100% y mucho más, poniendo su granito de arena en esta lucha, con lo que es su profesión y su motor, el cine.

Hace años, tras asistir a los Juegos Olímpicos de Londres 2012, empezó a rondarle la idea de que había que contar esta historia, de lo injusto e indignante que era el trato hacia las mujeres deportistas, y la falta de repercusión, de visibilidad y de reconocimiento a pesar de todos los logros obtenidos.

Su gran sueño con el documental es conseguir una igualdad de género real en el deporte y en todos los ámbitos de nuestra sociedad, y que Hijas de Cynisca llegue a todos los niveles sociales, a primera división y a tercera, a tu barrio, a la escuela, a las grandes empresas, a todas las profesiones, a todas las edades, a un patio de un recreo y a una pantalla de cine, en nuestro país y en el resto del mundo.

Podéis conocerla mejor leyendo su biofilmografía.

BEATRIZ CARRETERO
PRODUCCIÓN / DIRECCIÓN / GUIÓN / COMUNICACIÓN Y MARKETING

Beatriz Carretero es productora, directora, guionista y docente.

Estudió Realización de Audiovisuales y Espectáculos, y ha trabajado durante casi veinte años en departamentos de producción, dirección, guión y montaje; en cine, televisión, publicidad, eventos y artes escénicas. 

Se ha especializado en la producción y dirección, planificando y desarrollando todo tipo de proyectos, tanto suyos como ajenos, en todas sus fases: largometrajes y cortometrajes de ficción, documentales, spots publicitarios, videoclips, vídeos corporativos, institucionales, etc.

Ha compatibilizado su trabajo en el cine con la realización de vídeos y making of para el departamento de marketing on-line de los musicales EL REY LEÓN, LOS MISERABLES, LA BELLA Y LA BESTIA Y MY FAIR LADY de la productora de musicales Stage Entertainment España.

Desde el año 2011 ha ejercido la docencia audiovisual en la Escuela Superior de Comunicación, Imagen y Sonido CEV y en la Escuela Superior de Imagen y Sonido CES donde además durante un curso fue coordinadora de prácticas, trabajo que ha repetido en el último año en la Escuela Internacional de Medios Audiovisuales EIMA.

Forma parte de las cineastas incluidas en el libro 59 DIRECTORAS DE CORTOMETRAJES de Miguel Ángel Escudero.

Cuenta en su filmografía con ocho cortometrajes de ficción, entre los que destaca FRAMES. Próximamente comenzará la preproducción de su nuevo cortometraje VIOLENCIA.

HIJAS DE CYNISCA es su segundo largometraje documental tras DIVERSIDAD.

FILMOGRAFÍA DESTACADA - PRODUCTORA / DIRECTORA / GUIONISTA

2018. HIJAS DE CYNISCA (Documental).

2018. VIOLENCIA (Cortometraje en preproducción).

2010. DIVERSIDAD (Documental).
Selecciones: FESTIVAL INTERNACIONAL DE CINE DEL MEDIO AMBIENTE – FICMA. MONTERREY. 2013 (Monterrey, México), VI EDICIÓN ISLANTILLA CINEFÓRUM. CICLO NEW YORK, NEW YORK. 2013 (Huelva, España), ATLANTIDOC. FESTIVAL INTERNACIONAL DE CINE DOCUMENTAL DEL URUGUAY. 2012 (Uruguay), 7º FESTIVAL INTERNACIONAL DE CINE DE LOS DERECHOS HUMANOS DE BOLIVIA “EL SÉPTIMO OJO ES TUYO”. SECCIÓN OFICIAL. 2011 (Sucre, Bolivia), IV EDICIÓN ISLANTILLA CINEFÓRUM. SECCIÓN OFICIAL. 2011 (Huelva, España), 18º FESTIVAL INTERNACIONAL DE CINE DEL MEDIO AMBIENTE – FICMA. SECCIÓN OFICIAL. 2011 (Barcelona, España), 5º FESTIVAL INTERNACIONAL DE CINE DOCUMENTAL – CINESTRAT.
SECCIÓN PANTALLA SOLIDARIA. 2011(Alicante, España), 11º EDICIÓN DEL FESTIVAL DE CINE DE MARTIL. SECCIÓN OFICIAL. 2011 (Martil, Marruecos), FESTIVAL INTERNACIONAL DE CINE SOCIAL DE CONCORDIA. SECCIÓN IDENTIDAD. 2011 (Concordia, Argentina), II EDICIÓN MUFEST. FESTIVAL DE CINE FEITO POR MULLERES. SECCIÓN OFICIAL. 2011 (Santiago de Compostela, España).

2010. ESPERE VERDE (Cortometraje). 

2009. FRAMES (Cortometraje). 
Premios: CORTO DEL MES EN FILMIN (España), PICTURE THIS… – CANADA’S INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL (Canadá). MENCIÓN ESPECIAL DEL JURADO (HONOURABLE MENTION FOR DRAMA), II FESTIVAL INTERNACIONAL DE CINE SOBRE DISCAPACIDAD. FUNDACIÓN ANADE (España). PREMIO A LA MEJOR ACTRIZ (MARIAN ÁLVAREZ), VIII MUESTRA DE CORTOMETRAJES DE TRES CANTOS (España). PREMIO JOVEN AL MEJOR CORTOMETRAJE.
Selecciones:
VAM FEST – VERCELLI ART MOVIE FESTIVAL (Italia), X EDICIÓN DE CORTOMIERES. SECCIÓN ASGAYA (España), FESTIVAL DE CORTOMETRAJES RODINIA (España), XIII CONCURS NACIONAL DE CINEMA CIUTAT DE CORNELLÁ (España), REDECURTAS-Mr MISTO SHORTS (España), CERTAMEN DE CORTOMETRAJES CINEMOBILE (España), FESTIVAL DE CORTOMETRAJES “LA TACITA DE PLATA” (España), FESTIVAL DE CORTOMETRAJES DE ALCAÑIZ “Las Ranetas” (España), I FESTIVAL DE CINE FEITO POR MULLERES “MUFEST 09” (España), III FESTIVAL INTERNACIONAL DE CORTOMETRAJES ALOCORTICO (España), 6-TH INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL KIN (Armenia), CERTAMEN DE CORTOMETRAJES NADA SOBRE NÓS SEN NÓS (España), KO DIGITAL (España), XIV MUESTRA DE CORTOMETRAJES VÉRTIGO (España), 28ª EDICIÓN CERTAMEN DE CORTOMETRAJES ENKARZINE (España), MUESTRA DE CORTOMETRAJES MODA H – IMAGEN SOCIAL DE LA DISCAPACIDAD (España), FESTIVAL DE CINE DE ASTORGA (España), II FESTIVAL ISLANTILLA CINEFORUM (España), II FESTIVAL DE CORTOS X MUJERES (España), XI SEMANA DEL CORTOMETRAJE. MADRID EN CORTO (España).

2005. SOÑÉ SER UNA PEGATINA (Cortometraje).

Por formar parte del mundo de HIJAS DE CYNISCA te recompensaremos con una serie de diversos productos y acciones que podrás elegir de acuerdo a lo que más desees.

Algunas de las recompensas son: mención en agradecimientos, entradas para el estreno, DVD, visionado online, merchandising diseñado para Hijas de Cynisca, bocetos originales, posters, producciones asociadas o regalos exclusivos muy especiales de nuestras protagonistas.

story_txt:
SINOPSIS
La discriminación de género es un hecho en nuestra sociedad. Muchas mujeres son continuamente tratadas de manera vejatoria sin que a veces ni siquiera ellas mismas se den cuenta. El machismo está tan arraigado a nuestro alrededor que para muchas personas es poco más que una leyenda urbana.
Para concienciar al público de esta realidad es necesario mostrarles historias reales en primera persona y apelar a su empatía. Si esas historias proceden de personas a quienes conocen, admiran, referentes con quienes se puedan identificar, tendrán una fuerza mayor. La importancia del deporte desde la infancia hace de las mujeres deportistas personajes propicios para hacer precisamente eso: contar su historia. Al hacerlo, irán saliendo a la luz los diferentes matices de la desigualdad de género, que serán subrayados por intervenciones de otras personas vinculadas en diferentes grados con el mundo del deporte.
Lo que ocurre en nuestro deporte no es más que un reflejo de la sociedad en la que vivimos. Poner de manifiesto la situación de discriminación de género en el deporte y proponer ideas para su erradicación, puede ayudar a cambiar una sociedad anclada en valores que han quedado obsoletos.
¿TE ANIMAS A SER PARTE DEL CAMBIO?

 
“Mis padres y hermanos fueron reyes de Esparta. Yo, Cynisca, vencedora con un carro de veloces corceles, erijo esta estatua. Y afirmo que, de todas las mujeres de Grecia, soy la única en haber ganado esta corona.”
 

 
EL DOCUMENTAL
En los últimos años y, sobre todo, a raíz de los Juegos Olímpicos de Río se ha puesto de manifiesto el diferente trato que las deportistas reciben en medios de comunicación con respecto a los hombres. Una discriminación que es sólo un reflejo público de lo que estas mujeres viven en su día a día al realizar su actividad profesional.
Lo que ocurre en el deporte no es sino una manifestación de un problema global. Pero gracias a su gran repercusión mediática, cualquier paso que se dé en el mundo del deporte para deshacerse de esta lacra se convertiría inmediatamente en un ejemplo a seguir en el resto de nuestra sociedad.
Este documental pretende mostrar la situación actual de discriminación que se interpone en el día a día de las mujeres deportistas. Queremos mostrar cuánto se ha avanzado y cuánto queda aún por conseguir, en el convencimiento de que cualquier paso dado en la dirección correcta tendrá consecuencias mucho más allá del mundo del deporte.
Para lograr la concienciación del espectador es necesario ofrecerle historias y personas reales con las cuales empatizar. Para ello contamos con el testimonio de varias deportistas de élite tanto retiradas como en activo, y otras personas más o menos relacionadas con el mundo del deporte, quienes nos contarán sus experiencias a lo largo de su carrera.
A través de las entrevistas profundizaremos en las diferentes maneras en que la discriminación de género se manifiesta: sexualización del deporte en la infancia; vulneración de los derechos de las mujeres en el deporte; diferencia en los sueldos, presupuestos e incentivos económicos; falta de visibilidad en los medios de comunicación, titulares machistas y fotografías ofensivas publicados en diferentes medios; menor reconocimiento a pesar de los logros obtenidos; dificultades para encontrar patrocinios; falta de apoyo a la profesionalización; ausencia de mujeres en cuerpos técnicos y/o federaciones; excesiva atención sobre la apariencia física de una deportista e incluso utilización de su cuerpo como espectáculo; uso sexista del lenguaje…
A partir de esta información y de los datos recogidos previa investigación al rodaje y contrastados por expertos en la materia, mostraremos propuestas para combatir esta desigualdad. Cualquier avance en la lucha por la igualdad de género en el deporte podría convertirse en el origen de un cambio global que beneficie a las mujeres de todos los sectores sociales.
 

 

NUESTRAS PROTAGONISTAS
Deportistas de élite, entrenadoras, periodista deportiva. Mujeres a las que conocemos y admiramos, grandes referentes que lo han dado todo por el deporte de nuestro país.
Son historia y son sus historias las que vamos a conocer con este documental.
Ellas son nuestras Hijas de Cynisca.
Si quieres conocerlas más a fondo visita nuestra web:
 

 


A QUÉ DESTINAREMOS VUESTRAS APORTACIONES 
Te necesitamos para llevar a cabo esta película. Hacer un largometraje documental conlleva un esfuerzo humano y económico muy importante. Gracias a vuestro apoyo podremos hacer frente a la realización de este proyecto.
Las aportaciones obtenidas con el crowdfunding las utilizaremos para:
-Gastos generados en el Rodaje (grabación de entrevistas y recursos en Madrid, Alicante, Guadalajara y Barcelona).

Remuneración del equipo técnico.
Transporte, comida y alojamiento.
Altas y seguros de rodaje.
Material de rodaje.
Localizaciones.

-Montaje y Postproducción:

Montaje del documental.
Postproducción de imagen y grafismo.
Etalonaje.
Adquisición de material de archivo.
Ilustraciones y animación.
Diseño, postproducción y mezcla de sonido.
Composición y grabación de música original.
Masters.

-Distribución, Promoción, Marketing, Comunicación:

Realización de trailers y teasers.
Diseño de poster, carátula y galleta.
Diseño de página web.
Distribución: pago a distribuidora, fees, copias, envíos, proyecciones.
Marketing y Comunicación.
Estreno.
Recompensas del crowdfunding.
Etc.

Si queréis información más detallada, podéis escribirnos a info@hijasdecynisca.com
Y si no podéis ayudarnos económicamente con el crowdfunding:

Hablad del proyecto a amigos/as, familiares, compañeros/as de trabajo.
Compartid y dad me gusta a nuestros vídeos y publicaciones en redes sociales.
Haced que lleguemos al máximo de gente con nuestro proyecto.
Compartid el enlace de indiegogo con el mayor número posible de personas.

¡Necesitamos la mayor difusión posible y toda la colaboración que se pueda!
¡FORMA PARTE DE ESTE DOCUMENTAL PARA CONSEGUIR UN FUTURO MEJOR!

 
QUIÉNES SOMOS 
Detrás de Hijas De Cynisca hay un equipo de personas comprometidas, con un gran talento y que comparten el deseo común de vivir en un mundo más justo, en el que no exista la desigualdad de género.
Puedes ver fotos del equipo, biofilmografías y enlaces en nuestra página web:


Capitaneando este equipo se encuentra nuestra Cynisca jefa, Beatriz Carretero. Productora incansable, directora y coguionista del documental. Apasionada, luchadora y soñadora empedernida, Bea es amante y fiel seguidora del deporte femenino desde que tiene uso de razón. Inconformista nata y defensora acérrima de la mujer y de sus derechos, se ha dejado la piel en este proyecto, ha dado el 100% y mucho más, poniendo su granito de arena en esta lucha, con lo que es su profesión y su motor, el cine.
Hace años, tras asistir a los Juegos Olímpicos de Londres 2012, empezó a rondarle la idea de que había que contar esta historia, de lo injusto e indignante que era el trato hacia las mujeres deportistas, y la falta de repercusión, de visibilidad y de reconocimiento a pesar de todos los logros obtenidos.
Su gran sueño con el documental es conseguir una igualdad de género real en el deporte y en todos los ámbitos de nuestra sociedad, y que Hijas de Cynisca llegue a todos los niveles sociales, a primera división y a tercera, a tu barrio, a la escuela, a las grandes empresas, a todas las profesiones, a todas las edades, a un patio de un recreo y a una pantalla de cine, en nuestro país y en el resto del mundo.
Podéis conocerla mejor leyendo su biofilmografía.
BEATRIZ CARRETEROPRODUCCIÓN / DIRECCIÓN / GUIÓN / COMUNICACIÓN Y MARKETING

Beatriz Carretero es productora, directora, guionista y docente.
Estudió Realización de Audiovisuales y Espectáculos, y ha trabajado durante casi veinte años en departamentos de producción, dirección, guión y montaje; en cine, televisión, publicidad, eventos y artes escénicas. 
Se ha especializado en la producción y dirección, planificando y desarrollando todo tipo de proyectos, tanto suyos como ajenos, en todas sus fases: largometrajes y cortometrajes de ficción, documentales, spots publicitarios, videoclips, vídeos corporativos, institucionales, etc.
Ha compatibilizado su trabajo en el cine con la realización de vídeos y making of para el departamento de marketing on-line de los musicales EL REY LEÓN, LOS MISERABLES, LA BELLA Y LA BESTIA Y MY FAIR LADY de la productora de musicales Stage Entertainment España.
Desde el año 2011 ha ejercido la docencia audiovisual en la Escuela Superior de Comunicación, Imagen y Sonido CEV y en la Escuela Superior de Imagen y Sonido CES donde además durante un curso fue coordinadora de prácticas, trabajo que ha repetido en el último año en la Escuela Internacional de Medios Audiovisuales EIMA.
Forma parte de las cineastas incluidas en el libro 59 DIRECTORAS DE CORTOMETRAJES de Miguel Ángel Escudero.
Cuenta en su filmografía con ocho cortometrajes de ficción, entre los que destaca FRAMES. Próximamente comenzará la preproducción de su nuevo cortometraje VIOLENCIA.
HIJAS DE CYNISCA es su segundo largometraje documental tras DIVERSIDAD.
