story:
What Are We Gaining and Losing Through 'Legalization' in Canada

Change is coming in Canada, and in our opinion it is long overdue. But, when you look a little bit closer things might not be happening in the right way. Educating ourselves is the best way to make sure things can happen in ways that are best for all involved, particularly medical users of cannabis.

From HamiltonSeen's award-winning documentary filming team of Cody Lanktree and Zena Hagerty comes this important, timely new project (that part was written by our publicist) : 

'Dispensed With' will be a compelling look into today's battle over cannabis dispensaries, featuring conversations with the advocates who brought us to this point, the store owners and the budtenders, the people they serve, the medical patients that count on them - and the ongoing police raids attempting to crush this growing industry. 

There's a lot the public doesn't know. While mainstream media occasionally reports on raids on cannabis dispensaries, they rarely look beyond the police press release.  'Dispensed With' tells the stories that have not been told.

  • Your help in this is huge. This is a film that can and will help make change to Canada's perspective on cannabis.

We're making a film to keep folks informed of how this is all happening, and how to make sure you are protected during this important time of change.

How Are We Pulling This Off?

As of right now, we are already in production on the film, and about a quarter of the way into interviews. 

Ultimately, the largest cost in a the making of a film is promoting it, and this campaign will take us some very large steps forward in raising awareness and in making the connections we need to get nation-wide distribution and have maximum impact as legalization takes place.

  • We're shooting for 15 grand, which is about half of our production budget, the rest being covered by personal investment and sponsorship from some of the good folks we're meeting along the way.
  • We've been feeling very lucky in having the support of some integral folks in the cannabis community across Canada. Their support and yours means the world to us and means the success of this project.
  • Ultimately, we are on track to complete this film by July and this crowd-funding support allows us to make a stronger film that is professionally colorized and has a big impact.

The Impact

The path to Canada having a healthy relationship with cannabis and with cannabis users is through education and impactful information.

  • Our largest goal is to help medical users understand how to protect themselves and have access to quality medication that works for them.
  • In the past few years we have made three impactful and important films, including 'Harperman: A Dissident Serenade', about the impact of the Harperman protest song before the last Canadian election. We feel proud to have contributed to keeping the electorate informed about an important slice of Canadian politics.  
  • We are currently in pre-production of a long-term project called 'Women's Work', which is a historical documentary about the vast contributions of women in computer programming.

Who are we?

We’re an award winning three-person team that creates films intended to create positive change through information, art and maybe a little bit of humour. This will be our fourth feature-length documentary, and we have a combined number of years in media creation that would be embarrassing to state, as we all look young and gorgeous (except Cody).

Director Cody Lanktree is most inspired by dialogue created by the connection between time, beauty, and our personal truths. In the eight years since HamiltonSeen’s inception, Cody has guided the company from small commercial production to whiteboxing partnerships with major marketing firms, and finally to the creation of documentaries focused on community and larger social issues. His vision is one that will not stop at less than fundamentally changing and challenging perspectives and the world.

Producer Zena Hagerty has a long history of community engagement and involvement in the arts scenes of Hamilton and San Francisco and seeks to further strengthen the human spirit with her work. Zena has broad experience in media, including recording albums, performing her own music, radio broadcasting, graphic design, and many others. As director of Sublimatus as a band, an art gallery, and an entity that inspires the creative spirit within all, Zena has honed a skillset that includes the ability to drive and complete large projects with expansive intentions.

Executive Producer Tracy Lamourie is our connection to the world of cannabis and the world of promotion. Tracy is primarily a publicist, but is a brilliant generalist who brings a lot to the table.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Get the word out about your feelings about cannabis. Folks are starting to understand that we weren't told the truth when we were kids. Also, tell a friend or two about what we're doing and why. Spreading the word about this film is what will make it a success.

story:
A mystery solved, Government lies exposed!

This feature film will help drive interest and solve a 52 year old mystery.  The US government has refused to tell the truth, even to the Clintons.  What is so secret that even they can't know?  But to expose the truth, we can't just depend on traditional film financing, we need your help.

  • I'm Cody Knotts, an award-winning producer (Most Anticipated Horror Film of 2015 from Horror Society) who has worked with famed actors Roddy Piper, Doug Bradley and Kurt Angle, among others.  
  • The public deserves to know the truth about Kecksburg. Our government has no right to continue to hide the truth.  Even Hillary Clinton can't get the records, but this feature film can help keep Kecksburg in the public eye.  Even more important, this film can help drive tourism to the Pittsburgh region and Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania. Roswell gets $95 million annually and Kecksburg nearly nothing.  
  • Are you tired of your government lying to you?  Then join our fight, help us make this film.  Help us expose the truth.  
  • Do you care about Pittsburgh?  Would you like to help change a region for the better?  
  • Films are forever.  They last beyond our lifetimes.  This is our chance to tell a story that has fascinated the public for decades.  Bryant Gumble, Ancient Aliens, Unsolved Mysteries and the History Channel  have all investigated Kecksburg but no one has brought the legend to life, until now.  We need your help and we want you to be a part of the legend.

Pittsburgh Roswell

Roswell generates $95 million annually, Kecksburg nearly nothing.  Although Kecksburg has more documentation, more witnesses and more mystery... it has never been commercialized.  This film is the key element in changing that dynamic, both shedding a light on the truth and jump starting the local economy of Pittsburgh, the Laurel Highlands, Westmoreland, Somerset and Fayette Counties.

As part of these efforts, we are working with local political leaders to bring this film to life. In addition, local Pittsburgh stars like Curt Wootton (Pittsburgh Dad), Shane Douglas (5 time world wrestling champion) and Richard John Walters (My Bloody Valentine 3D) are all part of the cast.

We have agreed to donate props and the spaceship designed by former CMU graduate Dr. Fuzzy Mauldin to the Kecksburg Fire Department for the creation of a museum dedicated to Kecksburg.

Pittsburgh Dad https://www.youtube.com/user/pittsburghdad

Shane Douglas https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tuharvftBpc&t=9s

Richard John Walters https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E6dC8TiVzgs&amp...

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding from you to ensure artistic integrity.  With a film that threatens to expose the truth about our Government's lies, we need you more than ever.  Every level of donation to this film includes cool rewards.  Our goal was to give you stuff that we would want if we were donating.

  • Films need money, period pieces need even more.  Our lead actors are all working for the same day rate (other than some specific cameos).  Why? Because everyone in this film is dedicated to revealing the truth about Kecksburg.  But for the film to work, we need to be able to film for at least a month.  The more money we raise, the more time to film to make the story incredible.  
  • Our Aliens and Spaceship designs are being made by Morgantown, WV High School Art students from designs by famed founder of Lycos Michael "Fuzzy" Mauldin, one of the inventors of the Search Engine.  Not only do you get the coolest spaceship sculpture but you help inspire young people in rural West Virginia to become artists. 
  • You can be listed as an Abductee in the film, get cool alien statues and even be in the film.  Even better you could have a movie poster with YOU on it!  If you can make it to the premiere, you can hang with the cast, walk the red carpet and help shed light on a 52 year old mystery.
  • These funds will supplement what we raise from private investors.  We have already received our first investors.  We will make this film, but we need to make it now,while the remaining eyewitnesses are still alive.  They deserve to see the truth revealed.

Quality First!

We have built a first class team.  Our Director of Photography, Ellie Ann Fenton, is one of the best female cinematographers in the US.  She was chosen for her dedication, skill and creative vision. 

Just watch this short film of her work: https://vimeo.com/141050536

You will be blown away.  This is the quality necessary to make this film work.

But the quality doesn't stop at the camera, it continues with the Musical team.  Pulitzer nominated composer Luke Mayernik, a Pittsburgh native, will score the film.  

Hear his music at: https://www.lukemmusic.com/

But that is not all.  Famed songwriter Sandy Pickard will be writing the "Ballad of John Murphy." He has written songs for Cher, John Anderson, Tanya Tucker, Glen Campbell and Clint Eastwood.

http://www.pinkardandbowden.com/

We also have the incredible actress and singer Remington Moses, granddaughter of famed singer Ricky Nelson.  Remington will play Anne LeMaster, a radio station employee, who helps solve the mystery of Kecksburg.  

https://www.facebook.com/remingtonmoses/

The Impact

We can change an entire region and show our government that it cannot and should not lie to its citizens.  We also have a strong story of racial equality in the film.  Even Hillary Clinton could not get the government to tell the truth.   This film matters and our team has dedicated its time and money to bring it to life, but we need your help.

  • Our team has made successful films in the past like Pro Wrestlers vs. Zombies., but this film is not just about entertaining.  It is about bringing tourism to a region and shedding light on the truth. 
  • Our Director Cody Knotts owned a newspaper for a decade that helped three wrongly-accused men get off death row.  He will not compromise on the story and he is not afraid.  But our entire team needs your help.  
  • We will donate the spaceship to the Kecksburg Fire Department to help drive tourism to the region.

Risks & Challenges

What if we don't have enough money?  The quality will suffer, the impact will be lessened, and the government will be able to continue to hide the truth.  But we will make this film!

  • How will we overcome the obstacles for the film? By hard work, focus and dedication.  We have worked for a year without pay to make this film a reality.  We need your help in exchange for cool shirts, spaceships and great experiences to make this happen.  

Money well spent

As part of the commitment to quality, we have enlisted quality people at every level.  Most importantly, the money raised for the film must be handled properly.  That falls on our Line Producer, Tom Flickinger.  His background and reputation in finance is impeccable. 

You can find his background at: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tflickinger/

In the news

Pittsburgh Tribune-Review

http://triblive.com/aande/movies/12155121-74/western-pa-company-plans-film-on-kecksburg-ufo-incident

Horror Society

https://www.horrorsociety.com/2017/09/25/michae...

Why West Virginia?  Why Preston County?

West Virginia has a highly competitive film tax credit at 31%. That tax credit will help your money be more effective.  Northern West Virginia is part of the Pittsburgh Metro area and both areas benefit from this project.  

Preston County was chosen for two reasons.  1. It is extremely close to the Mt. Pleasant/Kecksburg area.  We wanted to be as close as possible so that people from the Kecksburg community could participate easily.  2. Our director comes from the first settlers of Preston County.  His family lived there from the 1740 to the 1930s.  He wanted to give back to a region that gave so much to this family and himself.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this campaign, spread the word, ask your friends to donate.  This campaign is built to make the rewards hard to pass up.  Is the truth worth $100?  To solve a mystery forever?  To make a film that will change lives in a region?  $100 to change lives, to reveal the truth and to tell the government QUIT LYING.  

  • This is a marathon, not a sprint.  We need 30 days of sharing, donating early, and getting friends to be part of this.  
  • Share on FB, Instagram, Twitter. Contact the local media.  Make this happen.

FAQ

What is the budget for the film? 

Our projected budget is $420,000.  $126,900 is above the line, actors, travel, hotels and food.  Nearly 20% is for one actor to play President LBJ, who cannot name at this time.  LBJ is an important part of the story.  The other actors, men and women leads, are all being paid the same.  We are committed to equality amongst actors.

Why are the rewards so late?

Our plan is to send the majority of the rewards before filming, but those tied to the DVD will be later.  We don't believe in overpromising and under delivering, just the opposite.  Our plan is to send the T-Shirts and cool items (including statues) as soon as possible and before filming. 

What is different about your film?

We built it on community support.  We have went to the public, met with them in person and sought to inspire them.  The arts should not be confined with LA and New York.  Rural Appalachia has a long history of art and culture.  We want to make that accessible to the residents of these communities.  

I have sent to crowd funding before but never received anything, why is this different?

Bluntly, this is not our first film.  We have built a team of filmmakers and community activists to make this film come alive.  High quality individuals from all walks of life dedicated to keeping our word to you.  

How long have you been working on this?

A year without pay or reward.  We wanted this film to be as complete as possible before bringing it to you and investors.  Why should you support a half-baked idea?  You shouldn't.  

For you to support our efforts, we knew it would take an army and a project worth supporting.  From Museums, community activists and high school students at Morgantown High, we have built that army.  But it needs your support.

How can I see this film?

The film will premiere in September of 2019 at the Palace in Greensburg, Pa. (right outside Pittsburgh) where John Murphy lived and worked.  The film will then release in Pittsburgh Metro area theaters.  Yes, this film will have a real theatrical release.  

How accurate is the film?

We believe, very.  Every effort has been made to insure that the science behind the film works.  Dr. Mauldin and Dr. Morehouse helped create the rationale for our decisions and design.  Gerry Kissell brought them to life with his drawings and our writing team created the story.  

We have met with famed UFO investigator Stan Gordon and others including members of MUFON (Mutual UFO Network) to learn as much as possible about Kecskburg and the militaries involvement.

Where did the idea come from?

My Master project was based upon the power of independent legends that can be brought to film.  This film is the culmination of that study and the budget is based on Hollywood's per capita spend in Pittsburgh. In other words, we built this film to be successful in the market.  

Any surprises?

It wouldn't be fair if I told you, right?  But we have included many historic figures from Lady Bird Johnson to Senator Robert Byrd.  This is a film that will take you back to the moment that innocence was lost.  Just like the Kennedy assassination, this incident destroyed our belief in American insititutions.
story_txt:
A mystery solved, Government lies exposed!
This feature film will help drive interest and solve a 52 year old mystery.  The US government has refused to tell the truth, even to the Clintons.  What is so secret that even they can't know?  But to expose the truth, we can't just depend on traditional film financing, we need your help.

I'm Cody Knotts, an award-winning producer (Most Anticipated Horror Film of 2015 from Horror Society) who has worked with famed actors Roddy Piper, Doug Bradley and Kurt Angle, among others.  
The public deserves to know the truth about Kecksburg. Our government has no right to continue to hide the truth.  Even Hillary Clinton can't get the records, but this feature film can help keep Kecksburg in the public eye.  Even more important, this film can help drive tourism to the Pittsburgh region and Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania. Roswell gets $95 million annually and Kecksburg nearly nothing.  
Are you tired of your government lying to you?  Then join our fight, help us make this film.  Help us expose the truth.  
Do you care about Pittsburgh?  Would you like to help change a region for the better?  
Films are forever.  They last beyond our lifetimes.  This is our chance to tell a story that has fascinated the public for decades.  Bryant Gumble, Ancient Aliens, Unsolved Mysteries and the History Channel  have all investigated Kecksburg but no one has brought the legend to life, until now.  We need your help and we want you to be a part of the legend.

Pittsburgh Roswell
Roswell generates $95 million annually, Kecksburg nearly nothing.  Although Kecksburg has more documentation, more witnesses and more mystery... it has never been commercialized.  This film is the key element in changing that dynamic, both shedding a light on the truth and jump starting the local economy of Pittsburgh, the Laurel Highlands, Westmoreland, Somerset and Fayette Counties.
As part of these efforts, we are working with local political leaders to bring this film to life. In addition, local Pittsburgh stars like Curt Wootton (Pittsburgh Dad), Shane Douglas (5 time world wrestling champion) and Richard John Walters (My Bloody Valentine 3D) are all part of the cast.
We have agreed to donate props and the spaceship designed by former CMU graduate Dr. Fuzzy Mauldin to the Kecksburg Fire Department for the creation of a museum dedicated to Kecksburg.

Pittsburgh Dad https://www.youtube.com/user/pittsburghdad

Shane Douglas https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tuharvftBpc&t=9s

Richard John Walters https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E6dC8TiVzgs&amp...

What We Need & What You Get
We need funding from you to ensure artistic integrity.  With a film that threatens to expose the truth about our Government's lies, we need you more than ever.  Every level of donation to this film includes cool rewards.  Our goal was to give you stuff that we would want if we were donating.

Films need money, period pieces need even more.  Our lead actors are all working for the same day rate (other than some specific cameos).  Why? Because everyone in this film is dedicated to revealing the truth about Kecksburg.  But for the film to work, we need to be able to film for at least a month.  The more money we raise, the more time to film to make the story incredible.  
Our Aliens and Spaceship designs are being made by Morgantown, WV High School Art students from designs by famed founder of Lycos Michael "Fuzzy" Mauldin, one of the inventors of the Search Engine.  Not only do you get the coolest spaceship sculpture but you help inspire young people in rural West Virginia to become artists. 

You can be listed as an Abductee in the film, get cool alien statues and even be in the film.  Even better you could have a movie poster with YOU on it!  If you can make it to the premiere, you can hang with the cast, walk the red carpet and help shed light on a 52 year old mystery.
These funds will supplement what we raise from private investors.  We have already received our first investors.  We will make this film, but we need to make it now,while the remaining eyewitnesses are still alive.  They deserve to see the truth revealed.

Quality First!
We have built a first class team.  Our Director of Photography, Ellie Ann Fenton, is one of the best female cinematographers in the US.  She was chosen for her dedication, skill and creative vision. 
Just watch this short film of her work: https://vimeo.com/141050536
You will be blown away.  This is the quality necessary to make this film work.
But the quality doesn't stop at the camera, it continues with the Musical team.  Pulitzer nominated composer Luke Mayernik, a Pittsburgh native, will score the film.  
Hear his music at: https://www.lukemmusic.com/
But that is not all.  Famed songwriter Sandy Pickard will be writing the "Ballad of John Murphy." He has written songs for Cher, John Anderson, Tanya Tucker, Glen Campbell and Clint Eastwood.
http://www.pinkardandbowden.com/
We also have the incredible actress and singer Remington Moses, granddaughter of famed singer Ricky Nelson.  Remington will play Anne LeMaster, a radio station employee, who helps solve the mystery of Kecksburg.  
https://www.facebook.com/remingtonmoses/

The Impact
We can change an entire region and show our government that it cannot and should not lie to its citizens.  We also have a strong story of racial equality in the film.  Even Hillary Clinton could not get the government to tell the truth.   This film matters and our team has dedicated its time and money to bring it to life, but we need your help.

Our team has made successful films in the past like Pro Wrestlers vs. Zombies., but this film is not just about entertaining.  It is about bringing tourism to a region and shedding light on the truth. 
Our Director Cody Knotts owned a newspaper for a decade that helped three wrongly-accused men get off death row.  He will not compromise on the story and he is not afraid.  But our entire team needs your help.  
We will donate the spaceship to the Kecksburg Fire Department to help drive tourism to the region.


Risks & Challenges
What if we don't have enough money?  The quality will suffer, the impact will be lessened, and the government will be able to continue to hide the truth.  But we will make this film!
How will we overcome the obstacles for the film? By hard work, focus and dedication.  We have worked for a year without pay to make this film a reality.  We need your help in exchange for cool shirts, spaceships and great experiences to make this happen.  
Money well spent
As part of the commitment to quality, we have enlisted quality people at every level.  Most importantly, the money raised for the film must be handled properly.  That falls on our Line Producer, Tom Flickinger.  His background and reputation in finance is impeccable. 
You can find his background at: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tflickinger/

story:
Who Am I

A law enforcement officer who is a student who makes films and I'm shooting my thesis film which will be the best (I promise) project I've directed to date. I also love basketball and "Game of Thrones"

 

What Will We Use The Money For

Our expenses will include:

  • 3 Locations (1 location is booked it cost us $675)
  • Feeding the cast and crew $700
  • Rental equipment, lights, camera, camera accessories $1000
  • 2 Police cars $2000
  • Sound mixer and boom operator $600

The Impact

If this film is not made Mc Donalds, Burger King and Wendy's will simultaneously go out of business.

Risks & Challenges

Meeting our funding goal will ensure that we maintain a high production value and give the world one more short film out of thousands, that help you to appreciate where you are and what you have.

Other Ways You Can Help

Smile it really helps us know that everything will be ok and if you are a gazillionaire, ok if you have a lot of money donating equipment will definitely help. Lights, film cameras...a Red Epic would be nice or some EF mount lenses.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
After 50 Shades of Grey, Yin started getting phone calls.

As a professional dominatrix in New York City who was avidly blogging about BDSM, spirituality, and her intersecting identities as a queer Chinese-American woman, Yin was a quick target for TV networks who saw a market and wanted "more of that."

But Yin was firm: "My story is not for sale. I am only interested if I can write it myself, in my own words."

And so she did: a full pilot episode and an entire pitch for a season. People got excited. But soon it became clear that mainstream TV didn't want the intersectional, vulnerable, nuanced story; they wanted the whitewashed, cleaned up, easily digestable version.

So Yin said no. That chapter was closed. Until now...

Because now, with the backing of an all femme production team committed to art activism, MERCY MISTRESS is finally being born.

MERCY MISTRESS is a webseries based on the memoirs of a Chinese-American professional and lifestyle dominatrix living in New York City.

 

MERCY MISTRESS is...

- intended to tantalize, to teach, and to destigmatize the shame that shrouds kink sexuality

- a story about a woman's work, written by a woman, and made by women

- a story that represents diversity, strong Asian-American characters, female empowerment, and sex positive activism

THE WEB SERIES

www.MercyMistressWebseries.com

MERCY MISTRESS is comprised of two worlds.

The first world is Mistress Yin’s BDSM studio, "The Dojo", a serene space where sexuality, identity, pain, and pleasure coexist. A space that represents both the extremes of a leather dungeon and also the gentle nuances of sensuality, respect and care.

To some this space is a temple, where they go for rituals of transcendence. To others it is a therapist's’ office, where they tap into their hidden identities. To others it is an addiction, their secret thrill ride.

The parallel world in MERCY MISTRESS is the outer world of Yin's and the clients’ lives, where each character struggles to maintain their secrets. Power dynamics are often confusing; pain and humiliation are non-consensual; control is an illusion.

Each episode focuses on a particular kink participant and their slice of life: Where their proclivities developed from and how they balance (or don’t balance) their kinks with their every day realities.

Every relationship calls into question: Who is in control?

 

We believe in creating beautiful stories and We believe in paying our artists.

 

Your contributions will be going towards:

  • Production costs (gear, lighting, camera rentals, transportation etc)
  • Marketing (website, PR team, design)
  • Paying the artists and crew
  • The $75K from this campaign will go towards creating the pilot episode which we are scheduled to shoot in January 2018. The pilot will subsequently be used to gain momentum and secure production to continue the series.

Who we are:

Yin Q is the writer/creator of Mercy Mistress. She has been a BDSM practitioner, educator, and writer for over 20 years. 

Collective Sex is a feminist production team committed to destigmatizing and ending shame around our stories about sex, body, intimacy and identity.

 

www.MercyMistressWebseries.com
